name: Turf War: Unicorn City
description: In Turf War: Unicorn City, you role play as the prospective leader of a gang of adorably cute unicorns (if I don't say so myself), must recruit them from the deck into your squad, and then engage in "rumbles" against other players to decide who ultimately wins the turf war.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Jagdpanzer (38t) Hertzer Expansion
description:
More commonly known as the Hetzer, this pocket sized tank destroyer provides a low cost option for the points conscious commander. If you have points to spare though then there are plenty of options to customise it’s performance on the battlefield.

The Jagdpanzer 38(T) Hetzer is a crowd favourite. It combines a solid set of stats, a deceptively small size and a relatively low cost that makes it an affordable Tank Destroyer for a platoon commander on a budget. Left alone at the back of the battlefield sniping enemies it will quickly earn it’s keep, but with a few small upgrades you can really enhance the ability of the Hetzer to be a threat on the table as well as improving it’s chances of surviving. First up an Improved Rotation Mechanism will give your tank a nice improvement to its initiative, increasing your chances of being in the right place to get your shots off. Adding Wilhelm Lindemann to your crew will also improve your initiative in the movement phase whilst also increasing your chances of avoiding critical hits. Last but not least, a crew member with the Concealment ability will stack with the inherent Tank Destroyer special rule and keep your tank safe whilst in cover.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: HEXXED
description:
Hexxed is a shedding or discarding game for 2-6 players. Players can shed more cards -- and force other players to take cards, by making combinations of six using the colors and numbers on the cards. Hexxed is fast moving and easy to learn. The deck features six colors in nine suits of eight cards each, or 72 cards in a Standard Deck.

Each Hexxed card has two colors and two numbers from 1-6. To play, match either of the colors on one of your cards with a color on the discard. Zero cards let you change the color for the next play.

Special combos of six let you play again, or hex another player and make them take three cards. But, be careful. Your curse can come right back to you! The first player to empty their hand wins.

The Spectrum Back design adds color and variety to the deck without revealing your cards. Try a Hexxed deck for your original games, magic tricks, and cardistry.
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Lose a Turn

name: Fluxx: More Surprises
description: More Surprises is an expansion pack for any standalone Fluxx game, with this pack containing the four original surprise cards, four rarer surprise cards, and two new surprises.

name: Armada: Magic Deck
description: These optional rules and cards for Armada will add a sparkle of magic to your flee with a new Magic Phase and a new layer of tactics and excitement. Contains spell-books for Basilean, Orc, Dwarf, Empire of Dust and Kingdoms of Men Fleets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Nautical

name: Star Charter
description:
The First Sovereignty spread humanity to every corner of the galaxy, but eons have passed since its fall, and the countless worlds once under its thumb became no more than whispered legends to one another. Now, a potent new FTL advancement, which rumors say emerged from the cryptic galactic core, grants humanity the hope of travel to the farthest stars in a single lifetime. You are one of the few with the mettle to give up your planet-bound life and become a STAR CHARTER.

Star Charter is a card-driven solitaire game where you play a star charter, striking out from your home planet to travel the space lanes and the vast void, discovering long-lost worlds of a densely inhabited galaxy. When you have discovered three new worlds, you have won the game, but it is possible to become adrift in space and lose. Whether you win or lose, the known galaxy has the potential to grow with each new game.

This is a “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that the game starts with a few materials (a map, paper, index cards, and colored cubes) and the remaining components will be generated as needed during play. Each game will see the addition of new cards, which represent the worlds in the galaxy.

The game rules include tables and guidelines for making new cards as needed, and this makes every copy of Star Charter an evolving galaxy. In addition, it means that each game inherits all components added or changed in the previous games. The galaxy’s worlds can grow endlessly over a connected campaign as players return to see what each new era holds for the future of humanity.

—description from the designer
categories: Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Vigilante: Hidden Motives
description:
In Hidden Motives, your super hero teams will gain a new secret hideout. The new "Lair" mechanic adds asymmetric abilities for each player including unique new actions that each player can take.

In addition to a variety of lairs, Hidden Motives adds a ton of new content to further increase variability, including Scenarios, Heroes, Villains, Identities, Equipment, and more! New abilities add a new dimension to the game, without increasing complexity.

This is an expansion, that requires Vigilante to play.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Hunt A Killer: Ghastly Manor
description:
Your expert team of ghost hunters has been called in to investigate an old inn that is being haunted by five ghosts. But this job may be more than what you bargained for and if you’re not careful you’ll be joining their ranks! Explore the manor, uncover their weaknesses, and banish them to the beyond!

In this all-in-one box, you will need to keep nerves and wits in order to survive the night.

You will have to channel your inner paranormal investigator. Find each ghost, discover what keeps them tethered to the physical plane, and answer their riddles to rid the manor of its infestation!

You will need to use items to interact with ghosts, decipher hidden codes, and make decisions that are life or death!

Difficulty: 1/5 - Easy

name: Postcard Mortain
description:
An operational level game in postcard size/format, of the August 7-13 1944 German counter-offensive trying to break through Mortain and neighboring towns (down in "Normandy's Switzerland") to get westward to Avranches on the sea to cut off supplies and units to Patton's 3rd Army pouring through it into Brittany and the rest of France.

6 divisions on each side, plus the heroic 2nd Battalion, 120th Infantry Regiment, 30th (Old Hickory, National Guard) Division which successfully held out surrounded atop Hill 317 above Mortain for 6 days. 7 one-day turns, as historically.

50% strategic possibility of treacherously patriotic anti-Hitler conspirator General der Panzertruppen Gerhard Graf von Schwerin as historically - and he survived the SS and the war! - holding back 116.PzDiv for the crucial first 2 days, in which case victory for the German player is instead just cutting 1st Army's nearer north-south route to get units down and around to the east to form the southern flank of the Falaise Pocket which decimated the German Army in the West, historically.

Factor differential plus press-your-luck Pressed Attack and/or Desperate Defense - Special Factor - combat mechanics which make it excellent for solitaire play.
U.S. infantry division Deployment doubling their strengths for both artillery-supported defense *and attack*.

Allied RAF 84 Group Typhoons and 303rd Wing P-47 Thunderbolts to aerially torment the Germans.
Subtle Disruption Recovery phase variation to simulate veteran German units' operational resilience.

Anyone is free to print off as many copies as they like in A5/5x8 or A6/4x6 postcard format, to mail/give to family and friends, as long as they keep my copyright statement and the Dedication.

For your one own personal copy, you will want to photo-copy enlarge the units to A4/8.5x11 and the map to A3/11x17 ... or larger, if you want. Anyone wanting to *publish* a (boxed?) large format edition of the game must license that right from me.

FIENDISH little game.

-description from designer
categories: Educational, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Hostel After Dark
description: A NSFW edition of Hostile Hoarders where players battle each other with modified adult toys and collect carnal cards for points.

name: Galactic Conquest
description:
1-4 player lite strategy game. Collect resources, build ships, and attack the opponent's base in a 1v1 or 2v2 team battle. Play against human or bot players.

Each turn, players will choose 2 cards from their order deck and play them face-down. After all cards have been played, reveal the order cards and each player will execute their cards in order specified by the number on the card with the lowest order card starting first.

When the same order card is played, the player or team with their initiative token takes their turn first. If the game has teams, matching order cards are executed in alternating team order starting with the team that has the initiative token.

The game ends when a player or team's base has reached 0 health. The other player or team wins the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Zone of Control

name: The EVA Engine
description:
Due to a malfunction in your spaceship engine, you need to make an emergency landing on an asteroid. However, upon landing, your navigation system alerts you to lethal levels of radiation from the asteroid's soil. Your spaceship's shields are not strong enough to protect you for long: you must leave the asteroid before the radiation poisoning overwhelms you. The main frame calculates that you just need 51% of your «EVA Engine» power to take off from the asteroid and save yourself.
In order to achieve that, you will have to install 4 engine components in the correct order. If you succeed, you will be able to leave the asteroid and win the game. Unfortunately, the components are damaged. Before reassembling the engine, you will need to fix the pieces and put them back in the right order before it's too late!
And despite the nonnrequired opinions of those who judge a game before it is even released, this game uses "time track" mechanics.
mechanics: Chaining, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Squadron Leader
description:
Squadron Leader is a fast pace World War 1 (loosely) themed aerial combat game that is easy to learn and quick to play, with multifaceted strategy built in that can be enjoyed by all ages!

The modular nature of the rules allows for players to customise their game and add entirely new layers of strategy.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Chaining, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement, Kill Steal, Line of Sight, Movement Template, Player Elimination, Re-rolling and Locking, Relative Movement, Resource to Move

name: Thornraver: Battle of Solus
description: Thornraver: Battle for Solus is a two player (3 or 4 if you own two sets) game that expands the world out to the continent of Solus. Where Master of Wills was a cross between Tug-O-War and Chess, Thornraver is a cross between Risk and War (and of course, Master of Wills). This is an area control game in which both players begin with an HQ and two capitals. The objective is to gain control of the Population, Resources, Regions, Leaders and Districts. You can win by majority control or eliminating your opposition.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Tug of War

name: Schuldig!?: Der Absturz
description:
The police find a crashed car that has run off the road and hit a tree. What at first looks like a clear-cut accident develops more and more into a complicated case. Of all things, this serves as an examination task for a young team of prosecutors who have to prove their skills by preparing a court case.

The players take on the role of lawyers. In five exciting sections, evidence is sifted through, investigations are carried out and, above all, information is analyzed and evaluated as a team. Together, they decide who seems suspicious and why they should be brought to justice - or whether there are good reasons to prevent exactly that.

There are no dice rolls, pawns or playing cards, players will draw their conclusions through discussions and reasoning with one another.

name: Schuldig!?: Vollgas
description:
A pregnant woman is knocked down while crossing a street in broad daylight - but the at-fault car doesn't stop. The police quickly identify a suspect who turns to your law firm for help. Your goal is clear: you want an acquittal for your client.

The players take on the role of lawyers. In five exciting sections, evidence is sifted through, investigations are carried out and, above all, information is analyzed and evaluated as a team. Together, they decide who seems suspicious and why they should be brought to justice - or whether there are good reasons to prevent exactly that.

There are no dice rolls, pawns or playing cards, players will draw their conclusions through discussions and reasoning with one another.

—description from the publisher

name: Puzzle-Rätsel-Adventskalender:  Das Dunkle Geheimnis der Geschenkefabrik
description:
The puzzle Advent calendar is about GenialGeschenk GmbH. This company has only one goal: to make its customers happy. Since the worst case scenario occurs on the first of December and the production machine displays several defects, you set out as an emergency repair team to get the machine up and running again in time. You quickly get the feeling that something is wrong. You get on the track of a dark secret...

Will you be able to save not only Christmas, but also the carefree future of the recipients? In addition to the 24 detailed puzzles and the magnifying glass, there is also an instruction booklet with a mysterious story and exciting puzzles.

name: Balancing Act
description:
Balancing Act is a quick playing card game where players are creating Circus Acts by playing a card from their hand and taking all the cards in the center row that are either higher valued or lower valued than that card they played. Those cards either go in their Acts creating sequential runs of cards or into their hands to be played later. Beware though you can only have so many Acts that score positive points and every card in your hand scores you negative points!

There are some special cards in the game:

The Elephant when played allows to you play a card from your hand to one of your Acts. This is the only way you can play a card from your hand.
The Zebra is a wild card and worth +1 point in your Acts, but prevents you from playing cards after it.
The Giraffe is wild as well, however it is -2 points.


The game ends when the deck of 54 cards runs out and whoever has the most points is the winner!

—description from the designer

name: Il gioco di Cattivik
description: Cattivik and the rats have to go through the maze of the sewers in search of a loot, made up of different objects. But our characters get in the way of each other and the labyrinth changes its appearance at every turn and so it is not easy to find everything, get rid of the bad luck and return to the starting point: whoever succeeds first wins!

name: Stratego WWE
description:
Stratego WWE RAW SMACKDOWN, is a Diset tabletop game with a mix of wrestling and strategy from the year 2008.

Keep your Champion status and on the attack! Stratego WWE is a game full of adventures and surprises. You are the Trainer of Superstars and Divas of different value and your mission is to maintain your status as Champion and capture the title of your opponent. Place your Superstars and Divas in secret, your opponent must not know the tactic you are going to use!

name: Goblin Firework Fight: Fumbus Promo Card
description:
Originally released as a promotional card for Pathfinder Goblin Firework Fight, Fumbus is an additional Advanced Goblin to help discourage others stealing from you!

This card was included in Game Trade Magazine # 268 (June 2022) or can be purchased directly from Paizo.

name: Dungeon (squared)
description:
Long ago the Gems of Power were weilded by Heroes and Wizards. Commanding and combining them to subdue the powers of evil, and drive them from the land. Over time the heroes vanished and the Wizards aged, and retired. The evil returned, hiding in the dark depths and causing havok among the lands above.

The Gems have been found again... it is time to purge the evil once again.

In Dungeon (squared) take on the role of one of four characters and face the challenges of a randomly created dungeon.

Brave heroes prepare yourselves for adventure....

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Map Addition, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Starter Set
description:
The DC Comics HeroClix: Batman The Animated Series Starter Set includes two iconic superheroes from the Bat Family and four of Batman’s most notorious enemies with all-new dials! This Starter Set features the namesake of the set, Batman, as well as his always trusty sidekick, Robin, both ready to take down crime in Gotham! Their malevolent counterparts include Catwoman, Harley Quinn, Poison Ivy, and the ever-sinister The Joker!

Along with these six fantastic figures, this Starter Set includes everything a player needs to learn and start playing HeroClix today! From the figures, to a HeroClix Rulebook, two double-sided Maps, a Powers and Abilities Card (PAC), Object Tokens, Terrain Tokens, Dice, and Character Cards. Get this unbelievable Starter Set today to start playing HeroClix or bolster your ever-growing collection!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hush: Titan's Bend
description:
May 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

Map postcard: Titan's Bend
Character card: Thine Barhelm
Nocturnal Creature card: Remont
Spirit card: Bat Spirit

name: Quella Notte nel Bosco
description:
Chiariamo subito una cosa: questo gioco non sarà divertente! Vi troverete al buio (sì, avete capito bene, proprio al buio!), nel bel mezzo di un bosco fittissimo, dove si aggira qualcosa di mostruoso! Io non vorrei essere nei vostri panni!

Let's get one thing straight out of the way: this game isn't going to be fun! You will find yourself in the dark (yes, you got it right, right in the dark!), in the middle of a dense forest, where something monstrous is wandering around! I don't want to be in your shoes!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Children's Game, Horror

name: The Missed Flight
description:
Lucy Kingston has been on a conference tour of Europe, but after speaking some uncomfortable truths to a journalist, she’s found herself caught up in a story of lies and corruption. She’s in way over her head.

She was supposed to deliver your message, but has had to cut her trip short and go into hiding. She was scared the message would be intercepted and so has stashed it in our online vault and put 7 puzzles together from items she’s picked up along the way.

Includes: 10 puzzle pieces + introduction letter

name: Hová bújtál, Boribon?
description:
The competitive version is based on the children's game hide and seek. One player controls Annipanni and tries to find Boribon. The other player controls Boribon, Szuszi and Hapci. The character tiles are face down so Annipanni has to investigate them to find the one with the bear. Annipanni rolls the die and decides which direction she wants to go. The other player also rolls and decides the direction and which of their tiles they want to move. This way vou jump from card to card and flip one in each round. If Annipanni finds Boribon she wins. If there are no more cards face up Boribon wins.

In the cooperative version you all control together the animals and try to protect Boribon from Annipanni catching him. You start with the cards face down and if you can name the card you jump to with any character you can flip it. If you flip all the cards you win. You can use the dog and cat to stop Annipanni in her round and help Boribon to get away. If Annipanni catches Boribon you loose.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles

name: The Castle of Sanguine Blight
description:
The Castle of Sanguine Blight is a fast, simple, dark, solo-adventure, dungeon card game. It is created as a love letter to the Castlevania and Shadowgate videogames, Cthulhu by Gaslight RPG, and classic Gothic horror.

Choose between 4 doomed characters, and face 30 eerie rooms and 30 blood-dripping events. Acquire 12 weird items that may help you on the way to defeat the vampire and its 9 horrible attacks.

Replay and experience a different castle the next time. Or why not use the cards as inspiration when you need a fateful turn of events for your regular RPG session.

To play the game, you need a couple of six-sided dice, plenty of luck, and the courage to withstand the fear.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Horror, Video Game Theme

name: Wikoti
description:
In the memory game Wikoti, children from 5 years old help the Sioux to reach their teepee before the end of the night. Cooperation, memory, and cleverness will be their best allies to win! A game that grows with the children, with rule levels for all ages. The game contains information on how the Sioux lived.

—description from the publisher

name: QTDEN: The game where you have to fill in the gaps
description:
QTDEN is the game where you have to choose the funniest combinations.

Twelve answer cards are given to each player and one of them reads the question card. This card has a gap and the players will have to choose from their answers which one can be the funniest.

The player who wins 5 rounds is proclaimed the winner.

name: Ice Cream Truck Wars
description:
Ice Cream Truck Wars is a roll & write print and play game where both players own Ice Cream Trucks and are throwing ice cream at each other. You're throwing ice cream left and right, often 4 or more ice cream in one turn, trying to hit goats, people, trucks, bridges, trees, dogs, and more...

It is a roll & write game that uses worker placement for competitive action selection, triple use cards, asymmetric abilities, dice manipulation, card drafting and a bit of hidden movement.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Recollect: The Memory Challenge Game
description:
Boost your brain power and improve your memory while having hours of fun with Recollect, the addictive memory challenge game by Pikkii.

Quick to learn and play, this brilliant family friendly game is great fun for both adults and kids.

Challenge your opponents’ memory, collect brain cells for correctly recalling the icons and gamble your brain cells to up the ante.

Packaged in a portable plastic-free box making it perfect for travelling, this addictive brain training game is both entertaining and brain boosting - what a great way to spend time with friends and family!

—description from the publisher

name: Il Concerto
description:
A strategy and memory game in which the player must find all the instrument cards listed on their ensemble card during the same turn.

Before you start shuffle the 36 game cards in the middle of the table, in a grid.

Shuffle the ensemble cards and deal out 3 to each player. Each player chooses one.

Players take turns.
The player turns over a card randomly chosen from the 36 on the table. If this is an instrument card shown on their ensemble card, they continue playing.
The player then turns over another card and repeats the process until they have found all the instrument cards shown on their ensemble card.
When that happens, the player has completed the ensemble card and it is theirs to keep.

Shuffled, there are especial cards and jokers that can help you.

When the game has finished, the players add up the points on the completed ensemble cards.
The player with the most points is the winner.

name: Ave, Leo!
description:
A quick family-friendly game for 2-6 players, where gladiators compete with each other (and a hungry lion) for gold and glory.

Players take turns to draw from a common pool of dice to move their meeple, or the lion (an obstacle), or to distribute gold coins over the game arena.

Getting first to 7 coins collected crowns you the winner.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Panzer Waffe: Battle for Kursk
description:
An extension kit for Panzer Waffe: Eastern Front 1944. Added new units, new events, and new tactical cards.

The box includes 26 new cards:
4 Event card(2 for each side)
17 tactical card (9 for Red Army, 8 for German Army)
5 unit card (3 for Red Army, 2 for German Army)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Catch it!
description: On the table, you scatter some round tokens with different animal/color/pattern. Three dice are thrown to define the animal/color/pattern to search for. Everyone searches for it and the first that founds it keeps the token. The one who gets the most tokens, wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Star Realms: Castle Promo Card
description:
Name: Castle
Type: Kingdom Base
Cost: 7
Defense: 6 Outpost
4 Attack. When you acquire this card, gain 5 Attack.

Promotional card from Gen Con 2022.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander 2020: Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths Commander – Ruthless Regiment
description:
Recruit a fierce and disciplined Human army to battle against the behemoths of Ikoria with the Ruthless Regiment deck—inspire more soldiers to join your ranks with Jirina Kudro, grow stronger every time you defeat an enemy with Kelsien the Plague, or sacrifice your growing army in exchange for an indestructable nightmare creature with Trynn, Champion of Freedom and Silvar, Devourer of the Free.

Ruthless Regiment is one of five Commander Decks from Ikoria Lair of Behemoths (IKO). Each includes exclusive cards tailored to that deck—pick your favorite mechanics and dive in to battle!

Battle your way through the plane of Ikoria with monster-themed mechanics that grow your creatures build your bond and crush your opponents.

Contents: one (1) foil oversized Commander card one hundred (100) card deck ten (10) double-sided tokens one (1) deck box one (1) Life Wheel one (1) punchout keyword counter card.
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Pentwall
description:
Pentwall is an abstract strategy game using pentominoes.

Two players take turns choosing one of 12 different pentomino shapes to fill a shared 10x10 playing area with that shape of their color.

Pentomino shapes can be rotated and flipped. Once a pentomino shape is used, it may not be used by either player again.

The game ends when no more pentominoes can be placed or when all pentominoes have been used.

The player gains the territory of any area not occupied by pentominoes that has more squares of his/her own color in contact with it than his/her opponent. The player with the largest total territory size wins.

This game is distributed for free as a PnP game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: New Phone, Who Dis?: Bad Advice NSFW Expansion Pack
description: Add this expansion pack to your New Phone, Who Dis? core game for extra fun. Shuffle the cards together for risqué surprises, or keep them separate for a designated risky pick pile. Players draw the given number of Reply Cards, and try to create the funniest text conversations by matching them with that round's Inbox Card! The judge then picks the funniest combo and the game plays on.

name: Snakes & Letters
description:
Snakes and Letters is a light word-building game in which players try to make high-scoring words using the letter cards in their hand and on the board. If they need some extra help they can also play a vowel or consonant snake card to represent any letter of that type. When a player makes or modifies a word they gain control of that word. Control a word for a whole round to capture it and score points.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Spelling

name: Magic: The Gathering – Throne of Eldraine Brawl Deck: Savage Hunger
description:
Brawl Decks are 60-card ready-to-play decks, all Standard-legal, and designed specifically for the Brawl format. Each has seven Standard-legal cards not available in Throne of Eldraine Draft booster packs.

The Savage Hunger deck takes advantage of effects that sacrifice your creatures or other permanents for profit and has Korvold, Fae-Cursed King as its commander.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Magic: The Gathering – Throne of Eldraine Brawl Deck: Wild Bounty
description:
Brawl Decks are 60-card ready-to-play decks, all Standard-legal, and designed specifically for the Brawl format. Each has seven Standard-legal cards not available in Throne of Eldraine Draft booster packs.

Wild Bounty is a deck that is simply about accelerating your mana production so you can play big haymakers and has Chulane, Teller of Tales as its commander.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Throw Octopus
description:
Embark on a wild undersea adventure with this fast-paced tile placement/puzzle game. Use clever strategies to place your tiles correctly in a colourful and growing seascape of creatures that includes the Yellow Submarine Slug and Jellyfish. Be the first to play all your tiles to win the game.

Throw Octopus! Play a tile with a special octopus icon and you'll earn an Action card that can help or hurt you. A 'Throw Octopus' card allows you to throw the Octopus Plushie at your opponent then they have to draw 2 tiles and lose their next turn!

name: Magic: The Gathering – Throne of Eldraine Brawl Deck: Faerie Schemes
description:
Brawl Decks are 60-card ready-to-play decks, all Standard-legal, and designed specifically for the Brawl format. Each has seven Standard-legal cards not available in Throne of Eldraine Draft booster packs.

Faerie Schemes is a deck that employs and empowers flying creatures, takes advantage of artifact and enchantment synergies and has Alela, Artful Provocateur as its commander.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Yinzi: Ming
description:
Yinzi: Ming is a new version of the game Yinzi (2019). New design, new artwork, new advancement capacities, and new balanced thank hundreds of feedback. Live a new experience of the first global economy in the world.

China experienced the greatest economic expansion in its history during the Ming dynasty (1368–1644). The silver trade between the Americas and Europe and onward to China had a profound effect on the world economy – it may be considered the beginning of a global economy.

In China, social mobility led to the growing of cities, especially in the lower Yangtze area, which was at that time responsible for the main production of wheat for the whole country. In addition to wheat and rice, other crops like tea, fruits, and sugarcane were grown on a large scale. Immigrating peasants changed their profession to become merchants and artisans. Many people from the countryside were employed in private or state run factories, producing commodities like paper, porcelain, refined sugar, or silk textiles.

Trade and commerce thrived in this liberalized economy and was aided by the construction of canals, roads, and bridges by the Ming government. Ming China saw the rise of several merchant clans, who owned large amounts of wealth.

In Yinzi — "yínzi" meaning "silver" — the players represent merchant clans developing parts of China in the late Ming period in the early 17th century along the last 200 km of the Yangtze river before it reaches the China Sea.

The players plant crops, sell goods to the rural or urban markets, develop raw materials, build and upgrade factories, and sell their goods to ships already waiting in the port. In order to reach the port, the players need to improve their river transport capabilities along the Yangtze.
mechanics: Action Points, Contracts, Programmed Movement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Sherlock Holmes: Ténèbres sur Londres
description:
Dark crimes, perpetrated by The Black Blade, have thrown London into terror. Scotland Yard has failed to find the murderer, but you can help identify him.

Play as Detective Holmes or Dr. Watson, tracking down clues, interviewing witnesses and using your deductive skills. Make the right choices to solve these three investigations, because you are the hero!

Sherlock Holmes: Ténèbres sur Londres is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

-description from the publisher's website

name: Mesto zločina
description:
Solve a case of a stolen chair or ball or something else. You have witnesses with statements. When? Where? Who?
Find and connect a clues. Be the best detective.

Set up a location board. The board is modular so no two maps have to be the same. Players in a turn have 12 action points that they use to perform actions. Such as moving around, investigating the scene, questioning another detective and questioning a witness. Each action costs a certain number of action points. During setup, a solution is randomly selected according to the set locations.
Winner is the player who discovers the correct combination for the solution by announcing in her/his turn that have the solution and says it. But be careful, if you make a mistake, you are out of the game. Then player in secret look to see if it was right. If so, show everyone and win the game. If not, return the solution back and is out of the game.

name: Mostri in fuga!
description:
The famous game of the goose, reinvented and declined in the fun style of monsters! In fact, hanging from the package there is also the beautiful monster pendant, which drives away fear!
Even the traditional game of the goose finally speaks the language of monsters!
Roll the dice and run along the swirling road without ever stopping!
But watch out for the pitfalls of the Boccalarga monster present on many squares of the board ...
Play a timeless classic game with monster friends!
Contains the beautiful three-dimensional monster, dice and plastic seat markers! And all proudly produced in Italy. Hurray!
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Racing

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2020 Planeswalker Deck: Mu Yanling, Celestial Wind
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Mu Yanling relies on her quick wits and elemental magic to travel safely through strange, dangerous worlds. Disrupt your opponents with spells as your creatures fly over their defenses.

Contents: 1 ready-to-play 60-card deck featuring a foil Planeswalker card, 1 Core Set 2020 booster pack, 1 strategy insert, 1 Magic reference guide, 1 MTG Arena code card, 1 tuck box

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander 2020: Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths Commander – Timeless Wisdom
description:
The Timeless Wisdom deck lets you do something every MTG player loves: draw tons of cards! Create tokens when you draw extra cards with Gavi, Nest Warden; strike twice with your army of tokens with Akim, the Soaring Wind; or gain life and power up for a unexpected flying attack with Brallin, Skyshark Rider and Shabraz, the Skyshark.

Timeless Wisdom is one of five Commander Decks from Ikoria Lair of Behemoths (IKO). Each includes exclusive cards tailored to that deck—pick your favorite mechanics and dive in to battle.

Battle your way through the plane of Ikoria with monster-themed mechanics that grow your creatures build your bond and crush your opponents.

Contents one: (1) foil oversized Commander card, one hundred (100) card deck, ten (10) double-sided tokens, one (1) deck box, one (1) Life Wheel.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Cartzzle: Brocéliande
description:
Cartzzle is a new concept of board game containing a game, a work of art and puzzles. Compose this graphic interpretation of Pauline Détraz, then redo it by taking up challenges.

The box holds a single Cartzzle, an endless one you can make with both sides of the 50 cards. Cartzzles are pictures you must first piece together by laying cards on top of each other (with or without the template, depending on your dedication). Then, start again, using challenges this time! Removing cards, flipping them, and laying them elsewhere will change the picture and also allow you to meet some challenges (as example: Compose a scene that features entirely and at the same time the Dragon and the Fisher King).

name: Slovanský Opijáš
description:
Slovanský Opijáš is party board game for 4-12 players, where nobody will be sober after this game.
You move your figure on the board by rolling dice and try to get the figure to the square marked with its color and the arrow pointing to castle. Whoever gets there first wins the game.
But this will not be so easy. There are several squares on the board in different places where you have to draw a card. The card describes some task that you need to do. If you successfully complete the task, you do not need to drink, otherwise you must drink one shot. You must drink one shot even if the other player moves his figure to the square where your piece is already standing.

The game includes:
- 1 board game
- 6 figures
- 74 cards
- 1 dice
- 6 plastic shot glasses
mechanics: Acting, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Philosophy: Sage Expansion
description: This expansion adds a sage-colored set of tiles to enable Philosophy to be played with three players.

name: Rankulum: Im Garten der Wilden Ranken
description:
In the wild garden of Rankulum, a laying game with countless possibilities awaits you. Create the longest possible tendrils by branching and crossing and find your way through a wild network of tendrils. Cross the paths of your fellow players, let tendrils wither and try to rebuild blocked fields. If you succeed in laying the longest and most diverse tendrils, you will emerge as the winner.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

name: Wild Cards: Panda
description: A mini-expansion to Wild Cards. It consists of 1 new leader card: the Panda leader. The Panda adds new tactics and some extra cuteness to Wild Cards.

name: Elevenses: The Guilty Party
description:
Mrs. Lansdowne has been murdered! And at her very own morning tea party, too! One of the players around the table must be the guilty one!

Elevenses: The Guilty Party is a 2-5 player card game that has each player setting their tea table with delicious foods, all the while casting suspicion cubes on other players in efforts to assist the constable in their arrest for murder!

With each turn, players will choose to either snack on a card and get its special ability, adding it to their tableaux, or rearrange their tableaux to set up for future turns. The player with the best meal when the game ends gets the most suspicion cast on their fellow guests. The least suspicious innocent guest wins the game… unless the murderer got away with it, then the murderer is victorious.

name: Quantum Party
description:
The board has 4 rows w/10 spaces each representing a player’s lab bench. Each player places their cat standee at the start of their bench then conducts one of 4 classic modern physics experiments by drawing a card for the experiment and resolving it. Most cards move your cat and cats move a different way for each experiment. If you reach the end of a bench, take a party hat. First to get 4 hats wins.

Blackbody Radiation Experiment. Includes die with faces 0/black, 2 red/1, 2 green/2, and 1 blue/3. Roll the dice to see what color photon comes out of the blackbody oven. The rarer the photon, the more your cat advances.

Rutherford Gold Foil Experiment. Includes spinner w/4 spaces: red/1 (takes up half of circumference), 2 gold/2 spaces (each takes up 1/6 of the circumference), and blue/3 (takes up 1/6 of the circumference). Spin the spinner to see in what direction your alpha particle scattered. The rarer the outcome, the farther you can advance.

Double-Slit experiment. Includes 2 dice each w/3 white (0/1/2) and 3 black (0/1/2) faces. Roll both to see if your electron ends up in a region of constructive or destructive interference. If faces are same color (constructive interference), add them. If different, subtract the smaller from the larger.

Photoelectric Effect. Includes 3 dice w/faces: red/1000 Kelvin (move 1 space), green/3000K (move 2 spaces), and blue/200k (move 3 spaces). Roll the dice to see what color lamp your can has chosen. Some colors of light will eject electrons from the metal at higher velocity, meaning your cat can advance further.

Each deck consists of 10 “Run the Experiment” cards (if you draw one, run the experiment as above) plus a number of special cards. If you draw the Wolfgang Pauli card, Pauli shows up to observe and breaks your experiment. “Save this Card” allows you to place a note on the door to direct auli to another room. “Ummm???” – someone measure the momentum of your cat so precisely that its position is uncertain. Roll 1 double-slit die and move forward if you roll white and backward if you roll black. “Rawr!” – you encounter a potential energy barrier and have a 50% chance to quantum tunnel through it (by rolling double-slit die as above). “Yikes!”: your cat ruins the experiment so you don’t move. “Hooray”: your cat did something to help you – move again.

name: MAD Motion Attack Defense
description: MAD Motion Attack Defense is a two-player game.

name: Bluey's Hopscotch Race
description:
Join Bluey and her family in a fun game of Hopscotch with Bluey's Hopscotch Race Card Game. Build a Hopscotch path using the cards, then spin the spinner to match the color and be the first to the finish line!

includes 44 colorful picture cards, a color spinner and 4 character movers depicting Bluey's family members.

name: Magic Enforcers Orthrus
description:
Tokyo, 2034 AD. After the "regeneration phenomenon" happened ten years, 1 out of 1,000 people in this gigantic Far Eastern city has acquired magic. Worried about the frequent occurrence of "magic crimes", the authorities selected "wizards" who manipulate particularly powerful magic as special police officers. In view of the public opinion that magic is dangerous, they are called two-headed demon dogs that guard the gates of hell. "Magic Police Orthros" ― ― It was the birth of the Metropolitan Police Department Criminal Division Magical Crimes Section.

Every player chooses two characters as his enforcer pair, and mix the cards from that two character as their deck. During the game, players simutaneously choose cards from their hand to make corresponding actions, cast magic, and deal damage to criminals. Who makes the criminal strengthless arrests the criminal and earns credits. Players race to get 12 credits and whoever has the most credits is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Superclub: Arsenal Player Cards 2022/23
description: Player cards pack containing the entire up-to-date Arsenal first team squad – hot off the press. Perfect for passionate Arsenal fans, as well as Superclub fans who just want more player cards but not necessarily all club manager folders. This is a real bargain on the transfer market!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Action Drafting, Auction/Bidding, Command Cards, Income, Investment, Open Drafting, Ownership, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Superclub: Manchester City Player Cards 2022/23
description: Player cards pack containing the entire up-to-date Manchester City first team squad – hot off the press. Perfect for passionate Manchester City fans, as well as Superclub fans who just want more player cards but not necessarily all club manager folders. This is a real bargain on the transfer market!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Action Drafting, Auction/Bidding, Command Cards, Income, Investment, Open Drafting, Ownership, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Superclub: AC Milan Player Cards 2022/23
description: Player cards pack containing the entire up-to-date AC Milan first team squad – hot off the press. Perfect for passionate AC Milan fans, as well as Superclub fans who just want more player cards but not necessarily all club manager folders. This is a real bargain on the transfer market!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Superclub: FC Bayern München Player Cards 2022/23
description: Player cards pack containing the entire up-to-date FC Bayern München first team squad – hot off the press. Perfect for passionate FC Bayern München fans, as well as Superclub fans who just want more player cards but not necessarily all club manager folders. This is a real bargain on the transfer market!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Superclub: FC Porto Player Cards 2022/23
description: Player cards pack containing the entire up-to-date FC Porto first team squad – hot off the press. Perfect for passionate FC Porto fans, as well as Superclub fans who just want more player cards but not necessarily all club manager folders. This is a real bargain on the transfer market!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Conclusion
description:
Conclusion is a reimagining of David Parlett's Collusion for exactly three players.

In Conclusion, a trick-taking game, players will try to win the same number of tricks as exactly 1 other player. While the game only has three human players, there is a set up face up cards which will come into play once someone has won three tricks; that player will choose which card the virtual player adds to each trick.

In addition to potential points from winning the same number of tricks as another player, points are acquired from winning tricks and hitting your bid. Additional scenarios are possible if three players win the same number of tricks or no players win the same number of tricks.

The person with the most points when someone reaches 30 points wins.

name: Set & Attack
description:
Volley back and forth with your opponent and score the most points to win.

Set & Attack was voted best 2 or more player game, most innovative mechanic, best rulebook, best card-only game, and took 3rd place overall in the 2022 1-Card PnP Design Contest on BoardGameGeek.

GAMEPLAY
After an initial SERVE and RECEIVE, each turn you may SET (pass the ball within your court) or send the ball to the opponent’s court with an ATTACK or SPIKE (strong attack). But be careful – SETS can be misplayed,and SPIKES can be BLOCKED!

For each action you will:

draw an arrow or other symbol in an empty ball, and
flip the card. (You may NOT look at the back of the card before flipping) The card is flipped vertically for a SET, RECEIVE or BLOCK, and horizontally for a SERVE, ATTACK, or SPIKE.


You score a point when:

There are no empty balls in the path of your ATTACK, SPIKE or BLOCK. (Successful ATTACK, SPIKE, or BLOCK)
There are no empty balls in the path of your opponent's RECEIVE, SET, or BLOCK. (Failed RECEIVE, SET, or BLOCK)


The game ends when there are no empty balls in the back court to serve from.

The BASIC GAME is played with just two actions: RECEIVE & ATTACK.

THE ADVANCED GAME is played with all six actions.

—description from the designer

name: Witch Way: A Game of Twists and Turns
description:
Encounter various rewards and challenges as you gather ingredients and compete to brew your potion. A fun family game for 2-5 players.

Roll a die to move around the board, spend tokens to make wishes, and collect mementos. Action cards can help or hinder you along the way. Once all mementos are collected, head to the center to brew your potion. The first player to complete their potion wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Area Movement, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Lose a Turn, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: The Last Word (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
This fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories is set in 1926 in St. Paul, Minnesota, USA. The disappearance of architect Frank Lloyd Wright has disrupted the time stream. To find him your team will have to gain access to private parties and drawing rooms of roaring 20's high society, and explore the city's hidden gangster underbelly.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Mafia, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Trivionary
description:
In Trivionary you have to draw, mimic or define a word for your mate/s to guess it. Played in teams of 2, 3 of 4 players, each team rolls a dice in its turn to advance in the board. The opponents take a card from the pile with 4 words and their definitions. They chose one word that has to be guess by the other team. Each tile has a sign (D for drawing, M for mimic and d for definition) indicating how the player have to explain the word. If the team guesses the word (just one try is available) they take a new turn rolling the dice again and trying to guess, etc. The first tea reaching the top of the board wins.

The game (language dependent) tries to take the best from Pictionary and other party games.

—user summary

name: Bosnian War: 1992-1995
description:
Bosnian War: 1992-1995 is a two-player Strategic level board-wargame of the brutal conflict that took place in Bosnia and Herzegovina in 1992-1995. There are two players: the Bosnian government (BiH) player and the Bosnian Serb (VRS) player. The Bosnian Government player controls the units of the Croatian Defense Council (HVO) although certain game events allow the Serb player to control the HVO units. The Serb player can also control the units of the Krajina Serb Army (SKV) through random events or NATO intervention. The Bosnian Government player can also control units of the Croatian Army (HV) under certain conditions. In this game, the enemy population is not a victim of collateral damage, rather it is a target, so conquering towns and cities is a key aspect of the game.

Each game turn represents three months of time. Each hex represents 12 km (7.5 miles). Each combat unit represents a task force ranging in size from a regiment to a division.

22 x 34-inch game map, 176 5/8-inch counters
Included in Strategy & Tactics #351, January 2025.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points

name: Les 4 Vallées
description:
The snow has amply covered the mountains of the ski area ‘The 4 VALLEYS’ and the resort is about to welcome the first skiers! This season promises to be amazing.

Your goal: to become the champion of the 4 VALLEYS. To do this, you must have collected the highest number of victory points after completing challenges in the ski area. The game ends when a player has exceeded the level ‘Étoile d’Or’ (Gold Star). The winner is the
skier who has won the most points.

-description from developer

name: Suitability
description:
A trick-taking card game in which each suit is allocated a specific role to play (trump, penalty, reverse strength and plain). Must-follow trick-taking rules apply and Aces are normally the highest card in a suit. Try to win as many tricks as possible, but as few penalty cards as possible. The game ends after either four rounds, or when someone reaches 250 points. The game is best at 4 players, but also includes variations for 2, 3, and 5 player counts.

SCORING:

Scoring occurs at the end of each 13-trick round. You score 10 points per trick divided by the number of penalty cards you took, rounding down to the nearest whole number. If you took no penalty cards, instead of dividing you add a bonus of 10 points. For taking no tricks, you score a flat 25 points.

The fourth player cannot get the 10 point bonus, and instead chooses one of the three scoring "privileges" or conditions under which to play:
Immunity - You will score a flat 5 points per trick, regardless of any penalty cards they contain.
Warranty - You will score a flat 25 points regardless of how many tricks or penalty cards you win.
Poverty - Instead of scoring for the number of tricks you win, you will score for the number you win less than five - in other words, 1 trick counts as 4, 2 as 3, and so on

name: コロペンクエスト (Coropenquest)
description:
Coropenquest is a roll-and-write game where the area you can mark in will depend upon physically rolling the pencil onto the gameboard and checking the space above which your color points.

The game uses a 2-sided pencil, with each player taking on the color of a different end. The center of the pencil is also used as a die, determining how many warriors or wizards a player will add to the map on their turn.

The game comes with 2 methods of play, short and long. In the short scenario, the first player to capture 3 forts wins. In the long scenario, the first player to 10 stars wins - which are achieved in various ways, such as killing sets of monsters.

name: La Maldición: Héroes de Lorthar – Luz y Oscuridad: Mazo de Expansión II
description:
Luz y Oscuridad is the last expansion of the game La Maldición: Héroes de Lorthar.

In this expansion, we have a new game mode, The Final Battle, as well as a variety of cards that implement new mechanics.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Dixit: Richness Puzzle Promo Card
description:
Promo card from the Dixit Puzzle called "Richness"

The Dixit Puzzle Collection contains 14 different Puzzles with Dixit artworks, 6 with 500 Parts and 8 with 1000 part.

Each puzzle contains a unique promo card different from the artwork on the puzzle.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: アリスと3つの鍵 (Alice and the 3 Keys)
description:
アリスと3つの鍵 ("Alice and the 3 Keys") is a free PnP game from Japan.

Alice is lost in a mysterious world, and it's up to you to help her escape through the power of playing cards!

This is a cooperative game in which you must help Alice, who is trapped in a mysterious world, get the three keys to return to her world. Alice will have the help of the card players because she can't stop until she runs into something. But don't let the wary Queen find you.

If Alice can obtain the three keys on the board before all the cards in her hand have been used up. Alice will escape from the Queen and return home with her sister.
categories: Card Game, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil
publishers: Syoppai Games (しょっぱいゲームズ)

name: Komorebi Parade
description:
Komorebi Parade is played over 2 phases, each consisting of a variable number of rounds, depending upon the player count. On a turn, a player drafts a tile from a public selection and places it on their player board. The player then can move some tiles on their board depending upon the tile's movement rules.

At the end of the first phase, each player scores for the three public goals which were chosen during setup. At the end of the second phase, the players again score for the three public goals, but also their private goal.

The player with the most points wins.

name: ミスト (Mist)
description:
Mist is a trick-taking game for exactly 4 players using a standard deck of 52 cards, but for which you can see the suits on the rear of the cards.

Each player's hand begins face down in front of them with a chip on it. During the game, players can remove chips from their cards, 2 at a time, to look at their values; however, they must remember not to forget the value, as they cannot look at it again. The chips which are removed in this way will be used as a player's bid.

Chips remaining on cards which are played to tricks form a pool which is given to the player who wins a trick. Chips acquired in this way are used to convert a player's unplayed card to a trump card.

The player with the most points after 4 rounds wins.

name: Ciadèl
description:
Five hordes of wild boars are fighting to conquer "La Granda" (the province of Cuneo)

Blagheur, Viton, Bojanen, Patachin & Baròt: which of them will occupy all eight zones and give preminence to its recipe for "bagna caoda"?

Game elements include cards, dice, secret objectives.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: おだんごびんご (Dango Bingo)
description:
Story
The dumplings made by the master are excellent. You are in charge of skewering as an apprentice! Make beautiful skewered dumplings and earn praise from your master!

Game Outline
(1) Preparation
Players place the first two dumpling cards (hereafter referred to as “cards”) in their work area.

(2) Round
Players gain one card per round and place it in their work area.
After 6 rounds, 8 cards are finally placed on the work area so that the number of dumplings is 4 x 5 (regardless of the length or width).

(3) Skewering
Players skewer 3 or 4 connected dumplings in their work area to make dumplings.

(4) Score calculation
The scores of the skewered dumplings are added up for each player. The player with the highest score is the winner of the game.
publishers: natriumlamp games (ナトリウムランプゲームス)

name: Socksy Monster
description:
Socksy Monster is a game of cooperation. Players will need to work together to find at least 3 triplets of socks before the holey sock drawer is full.

More socks are added during each round of the game - first they are placed face up, then turned face down in the washing machine. After the machine has spun 3 times, players will need to pick out the right socks to complete the triplets.

-description from designer

name: Débats Débiles
description:
Ask questions of which the answer is YES or NO to "rule and divide". The question must be built with two words out of four on your card. Everyone shows with his/her thumb up or down his/her opinion. You will get point according the minority votes.

—user summary

name: Color Connect
description:
TEAM CONNECT GAME
A mentalist is in town to perform their new show for you.
Bring all your friends!

What colour is the grape? Blue, grey, red, green...
There are 6 possible colours, but in this team game, you need to connect to your partner’s mind and both imagine the same thing!

If two players from the same team choose the same colour, they win the card. The first team to have 10 cards wins the game.

The stronger you’re in sync, the sweeter the victory!

+++ Being able to explain your choices and understand the ones your partner makes will be crucial for building a better connection!

-description from publisher

name: Dark City
description:
Dark City is a game for two to four players in which each player takes the role of an investigator trying to solve his case before other investigators. Through his contacts, he must manage to obtain the right suspect to be the one with the most progress in his case.

The game is fast and dynamic and uses card control and player choices to advance your case. The object of the game is at the last turn to compare the symbol on the card remaining in the player's hand with the symbols on the player's case card. The player whose symbol has the most points is considered the winner. Another way to win is to be the only player left during the round, some cards allow this.

The game has mechanics similar to other pocket games like Love Letter and Lost Legacy. Players accustomed to this type of game will feel familiar with the rules. Not so experienced players will be able to quickly learn the rules of the game.

name: Calisota Football Cup
description:
LET'S GET INTO THE FIELD!
Here comes the new Mickey Mouse board game!
Calisota Football Cup is a simulation game of soccer starring the Mice and Ducks who face each other with cards by shooting, saving, dribbling, feinting!
And you are the coaches!
There is a super game board (57×57 cm!), with areas delimited by orange lines on which several players and the ball can stand; those with colored dots are the Shooting Zones.
The Action Track can be used according to how long you want the game to last: 3 for Short Game, 4 Medium, 5 Long.
The Goal Track instead… well, it's used to keep track of the goals!
Then there are the cards: 20 Action Cards for each team (+ 20 Highlights and 3+3 Star Players in Expansions)
And finally the players: there are 10 per team with relative pawn + drawn goalkeeper (+ 3 possible Star Players in the Expansions).
The set also comes in a handy storage box to keep it safe between games.
Ready for kick-off?

—description from the publisher (translated)

SI SCENDE IN CAMPO!
Arriva il nuovo gioco da tavolo di Topolino!
Calisota Football Cup è un gioco simulativo di strategia con protagonisti i Topi e i Paperi che con le carte si affrontano a colpi di tiri, parate, dribbling, finte!
E gli allenatori siete voi!
C’è una super plancia di gioco (57×57 cm!), con zone delimitate dalle righe arancioni su cui possono stare più giocatori e il pallone; quelle con i pallini colorati sono le Zone di Tiro.
Il Tracciato Azioni può essere utilizzato in base a quanto volete far durare la partita: 3 per Partita Corta, 4 Media, 5 Lunga.
Il Tracciato dei Gol invece… beh, serve a tenere il conto delle reti!
Poi ci sono le carte: 20 Carte Azione per ciascuna squadra (+ 20 Highlights e 3+3 Star Player nelle Espansioni)
E infine i giocatori: sono 10 per squadra con relativa pedina + portiere disegnato (+ 3 eventuali Star Player nelle Espansioni).
Per il Topolinia: Atomino, Basettoni, Dottor Enigm, Eta Beta, Manetta, Minni, Pippo, Tip, Tap, Topolino; star player SuperPippo, Macchia Nera, Gambadilegno; in porta Zapotec
Per il Paperopoli: Battista, Gastone, Paperina, Paperino, Paperoga, Qua, Qui, Quo, Rockerduck, Paperone; star player Paperinik, Archimede, Amelia; in porta Nonno Bassotto.
Il set ha anche una comodissima scatola per tenerlo al sicuro tra una partita e l’altra.
Pronti per il fischio d’inizio?
Il board game è disponibile in tre uscite su Topolino 3496, 3497 e 3498, e con le espansioni su Paperino 510 e Paperinik 72.

—description from the publisher (Italian)
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Target
description:
Make math fun for the whole family with Target: a fast-paced, teacher-recommended mental math game that is great for kids ages 8 and up, teachers, tutors, and even adults! Perfect for remote learning, homeschool math, family game nights, and more!

How to Play:
Each round a black card is flipped over with a number on it. Players use their white cards to make an equation to equal the number on the black card. Players shout "Target!" and explain their equation! If correct, they collect the black card. The first player to collect 5 cards wins!

name: Merenda sinoira
description:
If you prefer bagna caoda to bland aperitif nibbles and you've always thought that the farmers of the Granda (the province of Cuneo) knew a lot about food, this is the game for your foodie soul.

Merenda sinoira is a quick and simple card game that brings with it a long culinary knowledge to have fun with friends and family and rediscover the traditional recipes of the Granda.
Take advantage of your innate talents and combine the best wine to enhance the flavors and outperform the competition.
Taste the simplicity of tradition!

The game lasts about half an hour, so you can take another round right away.
Shuffle the 110 illustrated playing cards and collect the right cards to compose the "battuta al coltello", the "vitello tonnato" and many other dishes. Play at home and match the best wine.
The aim of this game of cards and recipes is to get the highest score by combining the ingredient cards to get the best dishes. Match them with drinks to get more points.

name: どっちぼーい (DOCCHI BOY)
description:
どっちぼーい (DOCCHI BOY) is a communication party game from Japan. One player is the leader and answers questions (for example, "Have you ever been hit by bird droppings?", "What do you like about the deep sea and space?"). Players try to understand how the leader will respond, whether they will say Yes or No.

The set of 15 question cards for the round are laid out in a pyramid, 1 to 5 wide, and each card points down to the left or right, Yes/No. Players bet on which way the leader will answer and progress down the pyramid. The more they understand about the leader, the easier they can win bets and risk betting higher stakes.

Once all the players have been leader, the winner is the player with the most money, being the best at understanding other people.

Y/Nの質問チャートで遊ぶギャンブルっぽいパーティゲームです。
レースの基準となる｢親｣を決め、5段計15問のピラミッドを作ります。
子は親がどこのカードに乗るのか。はたまた、その最後の質問の答えはYESかNOのどっちなのかを予想し、親は予想を当ててくれそうな人に賭けます。
予想が終わったら出走。YESなら左、NOなら右に落ちていきます。
予想した場所に親が着地したら、大当たり！倍率がかかってゲーム内の通貨が戻ってきます！
最後にチップを一番多く持っていた人が勝利します。
user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Bids As Wagers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2021 Planeswalker Deck: Teferi, Timeless Voyager
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

A master of time magic, Teferi wields the lessons of the past to forge a better future. Clean your opponent's clock with an overwhelming number of resources.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: eyeSpectro
description: Play colorful triangular pieces trying to match the colors (numbers relate to colors), but if the numbers don't quite match your opponents get points. If you can complete certain shapes, though you can win the day.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Hour of Devastation Planeswalker Deck: Nissa, Genesis Mage
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

The elf Planeswalker Nissa Revane draws power from her connection to the natural world. Enlist her aid to harness primal elemental forces and summon massive creatures as you overrun your enemies' defenses.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Clue: Friends
description: Just remember, “They don't know that we know they know we know." There’s even more to love about your favorite New Yorkers in this hilarious version of the classic mystery game! Based on the unforgettable 90s sitcom, CLUE: Friends is “The One with the Secrets” as one of the crew is keeping a personal revelation under wraps that is bound to be revealed! Take on the roles of Rachel, Monica, Phoebe, Chandler, Joey, and Ross to get to the bottom of WHICH secret is being kept, WHO reveals it, and WHERE in New York City it’s found out!

name: ひよころ (Hiyokoro)
description:
ひよころ (Hiyokoro) is a dexterity game from Japan. Hiyokoro means 'chick', and in the game, the players are manipulating glass marbles in the open palms of their hands, is if they were newly hatched chicks.

The game has a set of marbles, 8 yellow and 8 blue marbles, and 4 red and 4 green marbles. There is a deck on cards showing how the player must arrange the marbles, at the start and the finish.

For example, on a turn, a player will have three yellow marbles in their right palm and two yellow and one blue marble in their left palm. The goal is to finish with all the marbles in their left palm, with the yellow marbles surrounding the blue marble in the centre, like a flower. The opposing player would do the same, but surrounding a yellow marble with five blue marbles.

Players can only manipulate the marbles by cupping, flexing and turning their open palms and fingers. A player cannot trap a marble in one finger by curling the finger over the marble, not between two fingers, and so on. Only by freely flowing the marbles around, can they complete each challenge.

When a player completes the challenge successfully, they call out 'Hiyokoro!'. The player who completes the most challenges first is the winner. But the designer emphasises the benefit of play for children and for rehabilitation.

The game can be played solo as the player is trying to beat each challenge.
user summary

name: Captain Nature
description:
Can you pick up all the rubbish floating in the sea? That's your challenge in Captain Nature.

To set up, transform your table or floor into the sea. Set up the buoys to determine the limits of play, then scatter the trash and animal tokens on the "water". Whoever is captain on a turn wears the blindfold (or keeps their eyes closed), and moves the ship by pushing it across the sea, trying to scoop up only trash. Trips that collect only trash are rewarded, while collected fish and other sea creatures result in pollution on the beach. This must be avoided at all costs because the only way to win is to collect all of the trash while placing all the sea creatures back in the bay.

name: Trick Party
description:
Story
Halloween night. The ghosts spent their time competing to see who could surprise people the most. The scariest ghost is forced to give a "trick" or "treat". However, when he becomes the last winner, he ends up in the morning and is eliminated. Basically, try not to be the winner, but only get sweets at the right time!

Overview
Each player will choose one Play card from their hand to play
faceup to the table. If you have a card that matches the suit of the lead card, you must play it. The player who played the strongest Play card wins the trick and gets the score card. The score cards have positive and negative scores!
Also, there are special cards within the Play cards that reverse the strength of the numbers on the card. Be wary of special cards and think carefully before issuing Play cards!

A "DEATH" card is placed at the bottom of the score card deck, and the player who has taken the "DEATH" card will not be eligible to score for the game regardless of the points obtained so far. After the "DEATH" is taken (meaning all tricks are taken), calculate your points and the player with the most points wins!

name: Magic: The Gathering – Amonkhet Planeswalker Deck: Gideon, Martial Paragon
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Get started playing Magic right away! Use your courage and passion to assemble a massive army, then empower it with the strength to drive your foes into the ground. Stand alongside the Planeswalker Gideon Jura--with a card unique to the deck--to lead your allies to glory.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Full Sauna
description:
Welcome to Full Sauna. A game about the struggle to relax. Meet 12 colorful characters who are trying to spend the best time inside. Chill, sweat, flirt, nap, chat, fight, or even fart to make people leave and clear space inside the sauna.

Outscore your opponents by inserting the right character at the right time in order to get the most “Feel Good” points. Or you can always enter the sauna’s black market and sell second-hand bathrobes, aromas and water buckets.

Get yourself a pair of thermodynamic slippers, which will give you additional points at the end of each turn based on the sauna temperature. Tons of strategies and combos await to be explored in a game, which is easy to learn and fast to play.

Full Sauna is a light mix between a card game, a resource management strategy and tableau building.

A turn starts by players paying for turn order. The first player picks up a card from 4 face up cards which form the sauna queue, and plays a character from their hand inside the sauna.

Characters can score chat or feel good tokens (worth different VPs in the end of the game), change the temperature inside the sauna, or collect and sell loot to other visitors. They have different scoring preferences: some need the sauna hot, others cold, some want it full of people so they can chat or flirt, others like it empty, so they can meditate.

Players have to manipulate the tableau to maximize the conditions for the characters they own, and mix different cards, skills and resources to make the most of each moment.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Command Cards, Hand Management, Market

name: The Cheese was in its Place
description:
You make only four moves in The Cheese was in its Place, so make them count!

Each player receives four mouse cards at random from a deck numbered 5-13; the remaining card is set aside face down. In the first round, lay out in a 3x3 grid nine bait cards, which are numbered 1-6 and depict food: acorns, strawberries, and cheese. Each player in turn places a card face down next to one of the rows or columns in the grid, then they reveal them, then they do this again. Whichever mouse is smallest takes food first, but it can grab cards only up to its size, e.g., the 5 mouse takes bait cards from the end of the row or column where it's located, stopping if a card would make the sum of the bait more than 5.

After resolving all four mice, refill the grid with bait cards, then play another round with the remaining two mouse cards in hand. Each trio of acorns or strawberries you collect is worth 1 point, while a trio of cheese is worth 2 points. Whoever scores the most wins.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Market, Victory Points as a Resource

name: オアシスの旅人 (Oasis Traveler)
description:
Water is important when traveling in the desert!
However, as the oasis began to dry up, the fellow travelers began to fight with each other. Collect more water than anyone else by winning a strategy game of puzzles, foresight, and interference!

You move the traveler piece and acquire the oasis cards scattered on the board, but the movement method is like a puzzle and it is a game that uses your head.
The pattern on the card indicates the position of the next card that can be moved, and the cards can be rotated, so the players plan their movement route.
As you move more and more, the number of cards on the board decreases and it becomes difficult to move, so the key to strategy is how long you can keep moving.
A cooperative rule instead of a tutorial and a battle rule with two different difficulty levels are prepared, and in the battle, players compete for the number of cards acquired and the survival of pieces while hindering each other's movement.
You can choose the difficulty level according to the friends you play with, and it's a simple puzzle game that you can play quickly in a short time.
mechanics: Area Movement, Movement Template, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: Quiznödig: På festen
description:
Quiznödig - At the party is a fun party booster with a fun mix of tricky questions, humor and unnecessary knowledge. 165 crazy and insanely fun questions that are guaranteed to lift the mood at the party. Be prepared for lots of laughs and quirky answers!

The perfect game for a fun night with friends.

name: Planepita: 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
An expansion for Planepita that was released in two different colors (pink and purple), each allowing for an additional player.

Note: The six-player game is only supported in the Team Play Variant.

name: Dream Dragon Dream
description:
Cooperate and frantically search treasure of the Sleeping Dragon!
You are a group of adventurers, searching for objects hidden within the treasure of a golden dragon. Each round, players will need to work together to find the objects they need. The dragon's slumber is disturbed by every mistake you make or objects you forget! Loot the treasure for 3 rounds without waking him up, and you win the game! Be careful though, because if you make too many mistakes, the dragon will wake up... and he's always hungry after his nap!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Exploration, Memory
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Memory, Speed Matching

name: Undermined! Pairadice City
description:
Welcome to Pairadice City, where the ground is overflowing with treasure ready to be found. You're racing to be the first to uncover as many treasures as possible all while avoiding any perils and dealing with the antics of your fellow miners!

Will you sell treasures you've found to fund future expeditions and stall your race to the finish? Or will you keep them, push on deeper into the mines and risk losing it all to secure your victory?

—description from the designer
