A monster will come to kidnap you for a week starting tomorrow night. If you hide an important red object as a talisman, monsters will not come near you. If they see you, the monsters will catch you and take you away. Be careful…

Secret Red is a trick-taking game whose flavor is one of the monster legends passed down in medieval Europe. Although it is simple, it seems to have high replayability. Blue 13 and yellow 7 are in play, and it's your turn. The cards that can be played are the must-follow Blue 11, Blue 5, and the trump card Red 8. Which one would you like to serve?
If you are aiming for a red 8 and the winner of the round, if the 4th player has a red 10, it will be painful if it is played. (Get 10+8+2=20 points. Each non-red card gets 1 point.) The fact that there is something to think about in each round is probably the reason why it is interesting and highly replayable.

name: Mamie Kung Fu
description: Fight the hungry seagulls and be the first granny who can eat! Acquire the eight (8) kung fu maneuvers to foil the tricks of the seagulls and launch attacks at your opponents in order to finish your sandwich first.

name: Forbidden Jungle: Three Card Promo Pack
description:
A set of three promos cards to add to the board game Forbidden Jungle: one spaceport and two equipment cards.

SPACEPORT:
- Station 8 (Level 1 difficulty) / The Traverse (Level 2 difficult)

EQUIPMENT:
- Grapnel & Spindle: This turn, you may move through webs. Return any webs you move thorough to the supply.
- Anbaric Carapace: Protects owner from up to 3 stings from a single threat card.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Map Reduction, Variable Player Powers

name: Suspects: Le Mans 1963
description: A demo scenario for the investigation game "Suspects".
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Kingdom Rush: Elemental Uprising – Elemenace Chest
description:
All Kingdom Rush: Elemental Uprising game content is available in the Elemenace box, with its deluxe components and GameTrayz storage! The Elemenace Hoard counterpart offers the Elemenace box set with all the GameTrayz and base game items, as well as all the expansion content pre-packaged for you:

Kingdom Rush: Elemental Uprising - base game
The Slaughtering Elf Expansion
N’imp Garden Extension
Beyond the Shadows Expansion
Elemental Uprising Box (Elemental Uprising Storage Solution)
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Caida Libre
description: Card game, from 2 to 16 players, with different questions categories, where you will have to get the answers right to avoid losing points and prove that you are the one with the most general culture knowledge.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Toko Maja
description:
Toko Maja is a simple, fun, strategic, family and addictive card game. It combines card collection, winning the majority and taking risks.

During the game, you will have to accumulate three of a kind (3 identical cards) to score points and win bonuses. But be careful, the cards that remain in your hand at the end will cause you to lose precious points!

Collect the right cards
Build your hand round after round and place your sets to score points.

Win majorities
Maintain or recover majorities to earn bonuses.

Take risks
Keep the minimum number of cards at the end of the round, they cause you to lose valuable points.

Contents of the game box:
- 81 cards (57x89mm) + 3 rules/variant summary cards
- 5 majority tokens
- 1 rule book
- 1 scorebook

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Math, Number
mechanics: Advantage Token, Catch the Leader, End Game Bonuses, Movement Points, Score-and-Reset Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Sarandonga
description:
At a glance

A game with almost 200 musical tests that will make you sing, dance, recite, hum and... have a great time!
Roll the dice and read the card from one of its six different categories, let the show begin!
Enjoying mythical melodies and dances from songs between the 60s and today is a very original gift.
A game that will bring out the best in a dinner, a few drinks or any celebration and will disconnect you from your phone for a while
If you are looking for a different type of board game, check out all our games here


The original gift for music lovers, for the most dancers, in fact... for everyone!

What does it consist of?

The most famous and popular language in the world is music, do you know which famous singer said these words? Don't worry, this game is not going to be a musical encyclopedia. Sarandonga is a party in the form of a board game. Its mechanics are very simple: one dice, six categories, two teams eager to enjoy and a single winning team. Do you want to know what challenges you will have to face if you give this very original gift? These are the six categories:
Parole, parole... If we propose a word, for example, love, how many songs can you sing that contain it?


Imitate the choreo! Scan the QR, remember the mythical dance of the song, get your asses up, everyone on the team and... let's dance!

Hum Do you think your team will be able to guess the title of a song if you just hum it? put yourself to the test
The verbatim! If we stop any great song at the end of the first minute, would you know how to continue singing it?
Who gives more? If we propose a theme, for example, tunes from Spanish series, how many do you think you can sing?
From singers to poets Read aloud a fragment of the song's lyrics as if it were a poem, will your rivals guess it?


Y* ou can find anything! From Flying Free by Pont Aeri, Danza kuduro by Don Omar, Déjame by Los Secretos or Imagine by John Lennon to the famous Malamente by Rosalía, every time you pass a test you will keep the card. The first team to get a card from each category will be the winner. What if he doesn't know enough about us? Play without limits, until the fun wears off... or the cards run out! By the way, the phrase is from South Korean artist PSY, Opa Gangnam style!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Aposta a Pipoca
description:
This is the ideal game to test the knowledge and creativity of all those who enjoy the best in entertainment.

Talent for mime or real actors on the rise? Encyclopedic knowledge about films and series? Voice always in tune and ready to sing any song or soundtrack? Perfect stroke to draw any 7th Art theme? Then it's time to shine!

Go play and bet your popcorn, answering questions about films and series, singing soundtracks, drawing and representing through gestures the unforgettable scenes from the most epic content ever.

name: Evacuation: Spielbox Promo Card
description:
A new Action Card, available in Spielbox issue 1/2024.

Actions :

Gain one resource.
Settle a site.

name: Warriors & Writings: Fury of the Wild
description:
A print-and-play game of daring adventurers in dangerous dungeons.

You play as a brave adventurer in a fantasy world of magic and monsters.

You explore a map, fighting enemies as you go, searching for treasure in every corner.

After a limited number of rounds, each player that has defeated the dangerous boss enemy compares their collected loot. The player with the most gold is the winner!

Each hero has their own advantages and special abilities. Each map presents a different set of challenges. By playing different combinations of heroes and maps, the game provides a variety of experiences and stays fresh through many plays.

Fury of the Wild is a standalone expansion to Warriors & Writings. It adds two new heroes and three new maps to the game. This content can be played on its own or combined with content from other sets.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: iQLANDIA: Společenská hra
description:
In this game, each player will create an iQLANDIE exposition using Tetris exposition pieces. However, in order to get the right pieces, you must first solve one of the 4 themed mini-games as quickly as possible.

Optics, in which you use lasers to connect 2 points. Biology, where you try to correctly arrange cells in a grid. Space Cards, which you use to form clusters of planets, and Programming, where you use your robot to follow instructions to the finish line.

The order in which you complete the tasks will determine your chances of getting the pieces you need. You then place the pieces in different exposures, in which they earn you points.

name: Harry Potter: The Magic Tournament
description:
Test your skills as a magician with the extraordinary Harry Potter The Magic Tournament Board Game for witches and wizards! Use the magical cards to cast spells with each duel you face. Each card features an iconic character with a different score that will depend on the roll of your magic dice. This unique, high quality board game is full of magic and will delight any Harry Potter fan!

—description from the publisher

name: Mini Rogue: The Council
description:
The fallen king and the servants of the Old Gods await you in the city.
If you own the base game, play up to three in co-operative. You may even defy three other players with the Overlord module included.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Quiltable: Paper Quilts
description:
Quiltable: Paper Quilts is a thinky game where players simultaneously compete in a grand quilting challenge to design the highest scoring quilt! Points are scored for completing quilt patterns, quickly finishing your quilt, and designing a symmetrical quilt. Completing rows and columns in a quilt unlock Beeline Bonuses that grant players special abilities and enable valuable dice mitigation. Will you focus on filling your quilt, claiming valuable patterns, or racing for the most valuable bonuses?

As all players use the same dice rolls to take each action, you cannot rely on luck to help you win.

The game is a PDF file that can be printed on a standard sheet of paper, either A4 or Letter size. Rules are available on a second page so that each copy of the game can be printed double sided with the game on one side and the instructions on the other. All you need to play is a pencil or pen and two standard dice! For players without a printer, the game can also be played digitally on a computer or tablet using a JPG file.

The game can be played with one or more players, and is infinitely scalable.

The solo game comes with three levels of difficulty as you face off against master quilters with increasing levels of skill.

How will you ensure that the quilt you plan is the most Quiltable?

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Number, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Points, Dice Rolling, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Random Production, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Warriors & Writings: The Labyrinth
description:
This stone maze is rumored to contain untold riches, but only the bravest heroes dare to delve here, for it is guarded by the dreaded minotaur. Navigate the twisting corridors. Evade the labyrinth’s traps and guardian. Gather what treasure you can. Employ all of your cunning and you may survive to see the other side.

Encounters are single maps for Warriors & Writings. They can be played with any hero from across the Warriors & Writings line. This is not a stand-alone product. A core set of Warriors & Writings is required to play.

Encounters are intended to break the mold of what you might expect from Warriors & Writings. Encounter 1: The Labyrinth features an alternate qualifying condition. Instead of having a boss enemy that must be defeated, in order to qualify for scoring on this map you must end a round on the space marked “End”. When you do so, you have finished playing, even if there are rounds remaining. In addition, The Labyrinth features a roving enemy that will pursue you through the maze.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Geomundo
description:
Embark on this game and discover the most incredible places in our world!

Take a card and try to find out what territory that location is in. If you get it right, you will be able to answer a question on the different topics related to geography and culture in general that the letter contains. If you get it right, you get the letter that serves as a stamp in your passport.

In an intelligent and enjoyable way, participants discover and recognize cities, great monuments and important landscapes as if they were traveling the world and experiencing all the culture it offers us.

Discover the world in 90 photos!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Embarque neste jogo e descubra os lugares mais incríveis do nosso mundo!

Pegue uma carta e tente descobrir em que território aquele local está. Se acertar, poderá responder uma pergunta dos diversos temas ligados à geografia e cultura em geral que a carta contém. Acertando, você ganha a carta que serve como carimbo em seu passaporte.

De uma maneira inteligente e gostosa os participantes vão descobrindo e reconhecendo cidades, grandes monumentos e paisagens importantes como se estivessem viajando pelo mundo e experimentando toda a cultura que ele nos oferece.

Conheça o mundo em 90 fotos!

—description from the publisher

name: Marvel Dice Masters: The Dark Phoenix Saga
description:
Dice Masters brings Collectible Dice Building to the tabletop with this award-winning competitive game set in the Marvel universe! Dice Masters is a global hit from WizKids. It uses the same proprietary Dice Building Game platform designed by Mike Elliott and Eric M. Lang. Each Countertop Display Contains 8 Draft Packs. Draft Packs contain cards and dice that can be added to your collection as normal but are ALSO optimized for draft.

Brand new teams will make their Dice Masters debut! Players will get to collect Xavier’s students, intergalactic allies, and cosmic enemies in all new ways! Even if they’re already in your Dice Masters collection – these heroes will play like you’ve never seen them before.

With over 150 different cards (and their dice!) to collect, this set will help you bring some Uncanny excitement to the tabletop.

name: Enquadrados
description:
No one can notice that the museum's most valuable paintings are gone!
Reproduce them with the utmost speed and perfection, because in a few hours the gates will open and the first to save the exhibition from embarrassment will be named the best replicator in the world!

Each player has the same set of hand cards showing abstract patterns.
In the basic game, each round a card showing one of the exhibition's missing paintings is revealed and players must combine their own hand cards to try and reproduce the pattern shown. The first player to succeed receives 1 point and the game ends after any player has scored 5 points.
In the advanced game, each player competes for a different painting, from 3 different difficulties. The easiest are worth fewer points and the most difficult are worth more points. The last player to finish their board, however, receives no points, so choosing a difficult board, which can bring more points, can be risky if you don't finish it in time.
There is also an expert game mode, in which extremely complex challenge cards are added, but with consistently higher rewards.

name: Rebel Princess: 2nd Edition
description:
Snow White, The Little Mermaid, Cinderella, and many other fairy tale princesses are celebrating a five-day party. The prince charmings, who have not been invited, will try to infiltrate the ball to propose marriage to the girls. As a princess, you have to avoid marriage proposals and remain single and independent after the celebrations.

Rebel Princess takes place over five rounds, representing the five days of a party, and each round has a special rule that makes each game totally different. The general mechanisms are those of trick-taking games, in which each player plays a numbered card into each trick, following one of the four suits in the game. The player with the highest number of the suit that started the trick takes all the cards of that trick — but that's not necessarily good as players want to avoid taking cards with prince charmings, who each bring one marriage proposal, aside from the enchanted frog who brings five proposals. The player with the fewest marriage proposals after five rounds wins.

Importantly, each player assumes the role of a different fairy tale princess and has a special ability that they can use once per round.

Compared to the 1st (2023) edition, Rebel Princess Second Edition features:
Balance tweaks to existing rules, rounds, and princesses
A new "Rebel of the Ball" mechanism to allow players to catch up if they are falling too far behind
Changes to the suited cards, adding an additional number in the lower right of each card
(all of these changes are also included in the Deluxe Edition)

name: Arquilínea 2: desde siglo XX
description: Arquilínea is a game that challenges observation, knowledge, strategy and memory with competitive and collaborative variants. The objective in all its ways of playing is to chronologically organize the works from different periods in the history of architecture.

name: Merchant's Quest
description:
Winter is fast approaching and you only have 20 days to earn as much money as possible before the mountain range becomes unpassable. This new, unknown kingdom is full of exciting opportunities, but you won't be alone. You'll be accompanied by up to 5 other merchants all trying to take advantage of the wealth within these lands.

The board is divided into 3 separate regions, all offering unique opportunities. It's your job to discover what they have to offer as well as the threats lurking within them. The randomness of the board makes every play-through a unique adventure.

Throughout your voyage, you will travel back and forth between the different regions trading resources from village to village, as well as visiting the grand castle to the north, seeking its riches.

Your journey will take you through a treacherous mountain range that will be sure to slow you down. However, if you scour the land with a keen eye, you might find hidden wonders and valuable gems.

The merchant who accumulates the most wealth by the end of the last day will be crowned victorious.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Market, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Post Office: Card Game
description:
Post Office. Card Game is a game in which you will need to place cards covering some parts of the other cards in a way that helps you score the most victory points.

Every player has a starting Package card placed in front of them face up. Each round you take 2 Package cards, pass one to the player on your left and receive one from the player on your right. Then you place one of your cards on top of the already placed card(s) on the table, covering some parts, but not all of it. Your aim is to cover as many mice as you can, creating rows and columns with different types of packages.

At the end of the game, you gain Victory Points for rows and columns containing 3 or 4 different types of packages (one type cannot be repeated within a row/column) and lose Victory Points for each uncovered slot with a mouse. Whoever gains the most Victory Points — wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Grid Coverage, Set Collection

name: Disparition à Paris: Le jeu
description:
The Mona Lisa has disappeared! Who could have stolen the most famous painting in the world? Detectives, it’s up to you to find the culprit!
Investigate using the clues given by your information. Chase down suspects and arrest them before other players. Decode the testimonies to find the real culprit!

Use your clue cards to determine the profile of the suspects spotted by the informers, locate them on the map and interrogate them before the other players by moving around the board: the first to have interrogated a suspect from each of the 3 clans wins the game! But it's not over: a cooperative phase allows you to decode the information left by the 3 suspects to unmask the real culprit together!

name: Robby Solo
description:
In Robby Solo, you have been inspired by the eponymous thief to rob banks on your own for as much money as possible.

To set up, lay out as many colored bank cards as the number of players, plus one. Each player takes heist cards matching these banks.

The leader for the round lays out one face-up loot card on each bank, with loot showing an item or a value from $1-9,000. Each player places a heist card face down matching the bank they want to rob, then the leader names either the color of the bank they will rob or a color that they won't rob. All other players can then change their heist card if they wish. Finally, reveal all the heist cards. If a color has been chosen only once, that player takes all of the cards from that bank. Everyone takes back their heist cards.

Pass the loot deck, and start a new round. If at the end of a round, four cards remain in a bank, the police arrive, returning all of these cards to the bottom of the deck. Additionally, whoever has the most cards must return their most valuable card to the bottom of the deck.

When not enough loot cards remain to place a card in every bank, the game ends. Players tally their holdings, with items varying depending on how many you have; a single item is worth only $1,000, while two are $10,000 and five are $60,000. Whoever has the highest sum wins.

name: Mosquito
description: Mosquito is a game of speed. You must kill the mosquitoes by covering the correct card with your hand. By doing so, you take that card and all the ones below it. At the end of the game, whoever has the most cards will win.

name: Dinger Fingers
description:
Dinger Fingers, a fun party finger experience, wait what? In this game you’ll be fighting alone or aided by your team in a finger olympic rumble for 2 to 12 players. A funny set of mini games featuring ability, agility, memory, deduction and many other different game mechanics that have to do with your fingers!

This game will be coming out of the shelf whether you are with your family, kids or friends. Choose between the many challenges and win each of them to earn medals for you or your team. Tangle up your fingers, be the last one “standing” or trick your opponents using the fruits and colors in this all new finger-party concept. Put your hands to the test and have a comical evening with Dinger Fingers!

—description from the publihser
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game

name: No Problemot
description:
Each player starts with 5 letter cards and chooses one to play openly in their reserve. On their turn they can:


play, where they must 1) play a letter card into the common area (as a first, somewhere in the middle, or last letter of a word), and 2) choose one card to place in their personal reserve. Optionally, they can replace a card from their reserve with a card from the common area. The letter put into the common area can go anywhere in the word.



pass. If a player chooses to pass, they place all their cards from their reserve into their face down points pile.


Players end their turn by drawing letter cards until they have 4 in hand. The player who passes first takes the first player card. Once a single player who has not passed remains, that player must announce a possible word made up of the letters in the common area with the letters in the order they were placed. If the word is valid, they place one card from their hand into their reserve, and then place all cards in their reserve into their points pile. If the word is not valid, they must discard all the cards in their reserve. For example, if the cards in the common area are OTAN a valid word could be mountain. At the end of a round the cards in the common area are discarded. Once a player has reached at least 12 cards in their points pile, the game ends. Whoever has the highest total points wins.

name: Heartcatchers
description:
Heartcatchers is a casual, competitive, two-player bluffing card game. Players take turns "catching" stacks of cards using a rock-paper-scissors mechanism, moving them back and forth across the playing field to increase their end scores. They can also play Secrets (or bluff the playing of Secrets) that affect final scoring.

This portable, fast-paced game (only 20 cards and playable in under 10 minutes) is a great way to break the ice with new friends and potential love interests.

name: Smiles & Daggers
description:
Smiles & Daggers is based on one of the most famous dilemmas of game theory. The term counter-competition, a neologism invented by the authors, describes the main mechanism of the game. It is a competitive game in which victory is more achievable through co-operation, but there can be only one winner. In other words, keep your friends close, but your enemies closer!

The Lady kills the Knight, the Lord kills the Lady but gets killed by Knights. You have to choose one card to put face down in front of you. Your opponent will do the same, whilst other players are betting on the outcome. Each card has two sides: one smiling that gives you money, the other kills (if possible) the opponent.

Which side will you choose? And most importantly, which side is under your opponent's card?
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Prisoner's Dilemma, Rock-Paper-Scissors
publishers: Giochi Uniti, Sir Chester Cobblepot, Stratelibri

name: Garbage Day: Dice Tower Promo Pack
description:
A pack of new cards from Dice Tower Season 13 Indiegogo campaign

This expansion includes 11 gamer-themed garbage cards.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Let's Drink
description:
The "Let's Drink" coffee shop opens today!! Let's visit the host bunny and drink together! There's always special milk foam and ingredients for each cup of drink. Which one you want? Let's drink it!

When a player reveals a card from the drink deck in Let's Drink, everyone needs to distinguish the correct drink. There are many combinations of cup, taste, milk foam, and tablecloth. If you find the right one, you can get the card. If there's no appropriate drink, just remind the host bunny! Don't be too late to remind her, or you'll get nothing!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Enigma: Beyond Code – Additional Characters Promo
description:
The Soul Devourer, Analyst, and Inspector are additional Characters you may include when playing Enigma: Beyond Code.

• The Inspector has been sent by the UK government to secretly investigate how the Agency works. His intention is to demonstrate that the Enigma Machine has no response to a person with a grain of Chaos. A lack of response will prove that the Agency is a gang of charlatans.

• The Analyst was born with a congenital disease depriving her of the ability to walk, but it allowed her to develop extraordinary analytical skills. She loves to solve puzzles of any kind and is ready to aid any specialist invited by the Agency, no matter what the cost is to her or the world.

• The Soul Devourer is an ethereal creature pretending to be a human. He strives to consume the mind of Dark Messiah or Decrypter to activate the Enigma code and return back to his homeworld.

Enigma: Beyond Code - Additional Characters is a promo mini-expansion packed in a zip-bag separate from the base game. It is not normally available in retail.

•••FULL OFFICIAL PNP AVAILABLE IN THE FILES SECTION•••
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents, World War II
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Memory, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Football Express
description:
A spin-off from the regular Subbuteo game of football. This was a Five-A-Side version, with an enclosed pitch so that the ball didn't always fly of the table. The mechanic of finger flicking the players remains the same.

Subbuteo is a classic finger-flicking soccer-simulation action game. It is played on a large cloth playing field called a "pitch", with teams of players that are represented by miniature men mounted on smooth round bases. The men are made to kick the ball by flicking their bases, which causes the men to slide around on the pitch, hitting the ball. The rules simulate nearly all details of a soccer game including ball possession and passing, throw-ins, goal kicks and corner kicks. There is even a large section in the rules devoted to fouling.

Two editions were produced. One with a folding pitch, the other with a solid pitch. Obviously, the solid pitch edition was in a box twice the size of the folding pitch edition.

Re-implements:

Subbuteo

name: Duel in the North: The Leningrad Campaign, Jun-Sep 1941
description:
Duel in the North: The Leningrad Campaign, Jun-Sep 1941 simulates fighting between Soviet and German forces in the Leningrad region from 22 June to 27 Sep, 1941.

This design covers the campaign of Germany's Army Group North, from the border to Leningrad, during the first year of the war in the east. This game uses the same rules system as Sedan: The Decisive Battle for France, May 1940 (W24), Tobruk: Operation Crusader, Nov-Dec, 1941 (ST278) and Duel on the Steppe (ST285), albeit with some occasional modifications appropriate to the scale and theater portrayed.

The map area portrays the Leningrad region of the Soviet Union, encompassing about 600 miles from east to west; each hexagon is about 12.5 miles. The various game pieces represent the historic combat units, as well as all necessary chits to facilitate game play. Soviet combat units are primarily divisions, the German units are divisions and Kampfgruppen and are color-coded by nationality and command affiliation. Combat units may represent from 2,000 to 14,000 men, and 50-400 armored vehicles.

World at War #48 April-May 2016

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 6 days
Hex: 12.5 miles / 20 kilometers
Units: Kampgruppe to Army

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15

This counter set includes one errata counter (the blue 4-6-6 mechanized division) for the game Red Tide West (Modern War #15).

name: Mary Engelbreit Loonacy
description: Mary Engelbreit Loonacy is a rapid fire card game in which players race to be the first to empty their hand by matching one of two images on each card in their hand with the images on the face-up piles in front of them. The number of piles varies depending on the number of players, and if players ever reach a moment in which no one can play, everyone draws a card and adds it to their hand at the same time, then the game play resumes.

name: The American Revolution in the South: The Battles for North & South Carolina, 1776-81
description:
The American Revolution in the South is a single map game that simulates ten historic campaigns in North and South Carolina during the American Revolutionary War (from 1776 to 1781). The game system emphasizes the importance of individual leaders, and especially historical leaders from the time period, and highlights the relative skills, circumstances, and luck that could vary considerably, often within short periods of time. Throughout the game, leader skills will be tested as their unit’s maneuver and fight, and every leader has the capacity to prove himself as either inept, capable, or in some cases, exceptional, during various incidents throughout the game.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters

S&T #304, March-April 2017
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: Peek & Push
description:
Peek & Push is a 2-player strategy game that puts your memory to the test. Create a set or run before your opponent does, and you win! The game begins with all of the tiles face down. Peek to see the contents of a tile, or Push a row or column to shift the board. But be careful, don't lose track of tiles you’ve already uncovered! It’s your move, will you Peek or Push?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Zéro à 1000
description:
Zero to 1000 is THE knowledge game for those who (still) don't have one! Aim for the target and find the question with the closest answer. The principle is the same as Zero to 100 with new questions cards even wackier and ever more surprising answers! No need Zero to 100 to play Zero to 1000.

—description from the publisher

name: Gosix
description:
Gosix is an abstract strategy game played on a 7 hexagons board. You're trying to control 4 of the 7 hexagons. The trick is: whenever you get control over a hexagon, you lose some of the pawns that made you win.

Players take turns placing a pawn on the board. You must discover how to win while losing as few pawns as possible, or "help" your opponent to win and have him lose as many pawns as possible.

name: Apropos: Of Board Games
description:
Think you’re an expert in board games? Work together to find titles that match an ever-growing list of restrictions and find out if you really know as much as you think!

Apropos: Of Board Games is a standalone wallet game that tests your knowledge of board games.

To win, players must think of board games that fit increasingly restrictive categories. With each newly flipped card, alternating between Must Have and But No requirements, players must cooperatively find a single example that fits every criteria so far. Get X correct answers for the right to call yourself a true expert!


Released during 2023 Board Game of the Month Club packages:

April 2023
Wallet
Rulesheet
Cards
2 Category cards
Must Have
But No

7 Attribute cards
Dice
Meeples
Cubes
Folding Board
Farming
Has Expansion
Hand of Cards



May 2023
2 Attribute cards
Named for Location
Plays 3+


Jun 2023
2 Attribute cards
Based on IP
Single Word Title


Jul 2023
2 Attribute cards
Set in the Future
Fictional Location


Aug 2023
2 Attribute cards
From the Last 5 Years
European Designer


Sep 2023
1 Attribute card
Has an App
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play, Trivia

name: Rescue Mac
description:
Your friend and one time rescuer has finally gotten himself into a situation that he can’t get out of. Drawing on skills gained from your previous adventures and using only the items you find along the way you must now team up with others like yourself. Get your duct tape, bubble gum, and paper clip ready with only 10 minutes before the whole place goes up in flames, it's your turn to Rescue Mac.

In each game of Rescue Mac you will be placed in a highly intense situation in which you will be required to complete six unique skills within 10 stressful minutes for 2-5 players ages 6 and up.

What Is Included:
The basic game includes 12 skills, 6 fixes, 6 characters, 30 items, 12 fails, 5 special fails, and 1 extra signed card based on support level.

The deluxe edition includes 24 skills, 12 fixes, 12 characters, 60 items, 24 fails, 10 special fails, and 1 extra signed card based on support level along with additional rules and cards for both a cooperative and vs mode.

name: Notre Dame Express
description:
Notre Dame Express is a PnP dice game based on the Notre Dame Boardgame by Stefan Feld.

I wanted to give something back to the PnP Express community in here because I have had fun building versions of everyone's great games. My goal for this express version design was to condense set up and playtime while distilling all the things i really liked about Notre Dame down and still providing some good strategic decisions and player choices.

Goal:
The goal of the game is the same as in Notre Dame, to have as many prestige points after the end of six rounds. This game can be played with 2-5 players. I think 3 is optimal for playtime.

Play:
Each of the six rounds is divided into 4 phases, and is played by rolling dice.

Phase 1: the Plague die is rolled to determine the plague count

Phase 2: three Action dice are rolled to determine actions for the phase (similar to the choosing and passing of cards in the boardgame version). Actions performed are similar to the boardgame and marked on a player card. Of the three dice rolled, one is chosen, one is passed to the next player and one is discarded.

Phase 3: one of three Person dice (depending on the period) is rolled and the player may choose to hire that person for the round performing that ability.

Phase 4: the plague check is determined for all players and the Notre Dame bonus is taken.

Files:
Downloadable files include artwork for all dice faces, player cards and instructions for play. Everything is sized for 8.5" x 11" paper. You will need nine 1" wooden cubes for the dice which can be readily found at craft stores.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: AVGhost:  Paranormal Investigation – Case: Grace
description:
In the Grace Case, our investigators will have to discover the truth of what happened in this strange case where secret services, spies, bizarre experiments, grotesque surgical practices, relics and occultism are involved. This expansion for AVGhost brings 10 more hours of gameplay. Aside from the 3 folders from each of the cases in this campaign, you will also get the miniature of the ghost Grace.

Kickstarter exclusive expansion.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Edición Familia
description: An edition of Trivial pursuit that is Age 8 and up. The game has 4.800 questions.

name: Prairie Aflame!
description:
Prairie Aflame!
The Northwest Rebellion of 1885

This game is an operational treatment of Canada's Northwest Rebellion of 1885. The Metis (half Native and half European) set up a provisional government to try and get recognition of their concerns with the federal government in Ottawa.

The federal government orders a detachment of Mounties to confiscate any weapons located at the Metis settlement of Duck Lake. The Mounties were met by a force of Metis and Natives and initially there was just talk. However, during the course of the discussion a gun was discharged and within minutes, the battle was on! The Mounties retreated, having taken 25% casualties - the rebellion was on.

To prevent the rebellion from spreading, the government in Ottawa quickly dispatches a military force which would grow to 5,000 troops, most transported by the nearly complete Canadian Pacific Railway. After 4 months and several battles later, the government had successfully suppressed the rebellion - if they had not, and this was their worst fear, the whole Northwest might have erupted in rebellion, keeping the government busy for years.

The basic military unit in the game is the battalion. All the battalions that participated in the campaign are represented, as are the various Northwest Mounted Police detachments, local militias, artillery, and Gatling guns. They are faced by the Metis, the Woods Cree, and the Plains Cree. Units can remain together as battalions, or they can break down. Morale is better as a battalion, while mobility is better as a breakdown unit. Each strength point represents 50 men. The main rebel and government leaders are represented and they have an important effect on the game.

The map shows the area of the Prairies in Canada from Edmonton and Calgary in the west to QuíAppelle in the east. Map scale is 11 miles to the hex, and each turn represents one week. The map is 22 x 34. There is also a 24 page rulebook, and a number of charts, tables, and organizational sheets as well.
Game scale
Unit sizes:
Battalion
1 Strength Point = 50 men
Each hex equals 11 Miles across.
Each game turn represents one week.
publishers: Khyber Pass Games, Legion Wargames LLC

name: Catan: Catakatoa
description:
A scenario that appeared in Game Trader Magazine, Issue 61 (March 2005) which contained a variant volcano tile with which to replace the desert in classic Settlers of Catan.

Settlements can be built along the volcano tile, and if a d6 rolls the number of that corner, the lava will wash away the settlements built there. But if you aren't destroyed, you receive more resources for your bravery.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Trading

name: Trumped Up Cards
description:
Description from the publisher:

Trumped Up Cards exist to document the insanity of the 2016 campaign season. It's a fast-paced, satirical game where reality collides with absurdity.

The goal of the game is to be the first person to be able to be able to spell V-O-T-E from the lettered quote cards they collected during the game.

Each player has a hand of ten phrase cards and will draw back up to ten after each round. A player is selected to be the CEO for the round and they draw a quote card and read it to the players. The quote is missing a phrase that will be filled in with a phrase card from each player. Players select the "best" phrase card from their hands for the current quote card and place the chosen phrase cards face down in a pile. The CEO shuffles the submitted phrase cards and then reads the quote filled in with each phrase. The CEO then decides which phrase "won" the round and the player that played the winning phrase collects the quote card. Rotate the CEO position after each round.

There are special phrase cards called Trump cards that give a player special powers and are usually played in combination with a phrase card.

A "lightweight" ending is optional and occurs when a majority of the players grow so depressed at the prospect of a real Trump presidency that they just start quietly sobbing. When this happens, the player with the most quote cards wins.

name: Guesstimates
description:
Overview

Guesstimates is a strategic guessing game for 2-4 players or teams, which focuses on making intelligent estimates. Your goal is to occupy as large an area as possible on the game board using the blocks that you receive as rewards for making accurate guesses. Blocks are available in three different lengths and the better your guess, the longer the block you receive. Questions belong to three categories: Market, Technology and Brainteaser.

Playing the Game
Each round starts with the question category being determined by a roll of the die.

One of the players reads the question aloud and when all players understand the question, the timer is started and all players have 90 seconds to make educated guesses and estimate as good a guess as possible. The players’ answers must be recorded in the block before the 90 seconds is out.

0, 1, 2 or 3 points then are distributed

The players put their points out on the board according to the rules below. The player with the least number of playing squares covered with points places theirs first, followed by the player with the second smallest number of covered playing squares, and so on. If two players have the same number of covered playing squares, then the player who is next to read a question places their points first.

The turn then goes to the next player and a new round begins.

Distributing the points

A correct answer within ± 25% gives 2 points.

If the answer is further away than ± 25% but within the range (10 x correct answer) to (1 / 10 x correct answer), the player receives 1 point.

The player who comes closest to the correct answer receives +1 point regardless of whether any points are obtained as described above.

Placing the points and winning the game

When new points are placed on the game board, they must be positioned adjacent to a previously played point of the same color.

In addition to the points themselves, players also get points for empty playing squares contained within a border of their lines of points, so it is tactically advantageous to build outwards to the edge of the game board.

When any player has a point that cannot be placed on the board, the game is over. The number of playing squares contained within each players’ delimited fields is calculated and added to their number of covered playing fields – the player with the highest score wins.

name: Ostle
description:
Ostle is an abstract strategy game for 2 or 4 players, played on a 5x5 square grid.

Each player starts with five identical pawns placed each on a space on their side of the board. A "hole" pawn is placed in the center space.

The aim of the game is to push two of the opponent's pawns either off the board or in the hole.

On their turn, each player pushed one of their pawns by one space in any orthogonal direction. They can push as many of their own pawns as they want, but only one of the opponent's pawns can be pushed. Alternatively, a player can move the hole by one space, to a free space.

name: WWE Cage Battle
description:
WWE Cage Battle is dice-flicking family fun featuring awesome WWE Superstars!

Welcome to the cage! When the steel cage descends onto the ring, you know that the match you're about to witness will be intense, exciting, and unforgettable. Now it's your turn to pick who will go toe to toe in the WWE's most infamous setting. WWE Cage Battle is a dice-flicking dexterity game. Players make a team out of custom dice representing their favorite superstars, then take turns flicking them at their opponent's superstars, trying to beat them into submission, or knock them out of the ring! Stage a rematch like Roman Reigns vs. John Cena or Charlotte Flair vs. Sasha Banks, or try completely new combinations!

WWE Cage Battle includes two game modes; you can play to collect points, or keep going to be the last one standing!

—description from publisher

name: Muskogee Mayhem, a Car Wars adventure pack
description:
They're not just clowning around!

"Pistol" Pete Hendricks welcomes you to the Muskogee Fairground and Family Emporium, eastern Oklahoma's premier tourist attraction!

There's something for everyone here:

Racing and dueling fans come to the fairground racetrack, the largest independent track in North America. You've seen them on Muskogee Vision -- now experience the power of gas-engine racing for yourself!

You're into obstacle racing? You're in luck -- the fairground has the world's first themed ob-race, "Great Moments in Oklahoma History."

Want a place to bring the family? The family emporium has everything from twin ferris wheels and a carousel to the Big Green Monster roller coaster to the Virtual Arena, where autoduellists can face hazards beyond anything the real world can offer. "Pistol" Pete's restaurants are the best in the state, and the dance floor is open every night.

Of course, you may also find bandits, thieves, screaming mothers-in-law, homicidal hitchhikers, cycle gangs, ARFs and killer clowns...but we did say Muskogee had something for everyone!

Muskogee Mayhem is a Car Wars adventure pack, consisting of a 24 page rulebook, 88 full color vehicle counters and four 21" x 32" maps which fit together to form a giant 42" x 64" racetrack / dueling arena. It is not a stand-alone game -- you will need either Car Wars Compendium and some pedestrian counters or Car Wars Deluxe to play.

Part of the Car Wars Series.

name: Clumsy Thief: Junior
description:
The Clumsy Thief snuck onto the farm and mixed up our stacks of food. Players stack food cards by adding numbers to 10. But watch out! The Clumsy Thief can snatch your stack! Use Trap cards to stop the Thief. Cards are constantly switching hands for exciting, game-changing fun! Master easy addition in this crazy game of stacking and snatching. The player with the most cards wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Robert the Bruce
description: This game deals with the Scots Wars of Independence in the thirteenth and fourteenth centuries, on land and sea. The general objective is to be crowned King of the Scots. There are five basic scenarios. {Description and information from The Complete Book of Wargames, by the Editors of Consumer Guide, 1980}

name: Brag
description: Brag is a popular British gambling game. It is one of the ancestors of Poker. A number of cards is dealt, depending on the version played, and players either discard to three cards, or make more hands, each containing three cards. One round of betting is follows. Every player has to bet at least as much, as the previous player, or fold. This continues until only one player remains, or two players are left, and one of them decides to "see". He has to pay twice as much as the previous bet, and the opponent shows his cards. The player who paid can (but does not have to) show his cards now; if they are better, he wins, with worse cards or in case of equality he loses.

name: Drop It: Scoring Variant Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 5 cards - 4 rule cards + 1 overview card.

At the end of standard set up, shuffle the 4 cards. Reveal 2 of them and place them face up next to the scoreboard. Then read the cards out loud to everyone. These two rules apply in addition to the regular rules during this game (card rules supersede manual rules).

name: Munchkin: Unicorns
description:
Unicorns are beloved, beautiful beasts who will stab you the moment you turn your back. Time to return the favor.

This set contains 15 unicorn-themed cards originally found in Munchkin Unicorns and Friends, now available on their own for people who like unicorns but not friends.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Wok'up
description:
Welcome to the Kung Food World Championships! You, the crème de la crème of Ninja chefs,will need to prepare the best recipes in the fastest time, since only one can be crowned Grand Master of the Wok. Wok’up!

On the signal, all players simultaneously throw an Ingredient token so that it spins a couple of times and falls in the Wok.

If no Recipe card is completed, the players must simultaneously throw in another token. A Recipe card is complete when its conditions are met using one or more of the Ingredient tokens inside the Wok.
Once a Recipe has been completed, the first player to cover the card with their hand wins it, and then places it in front of themselves. Next, the player turns over a new card from a different stack so that there are always 3 cards visible on the 5 decks. The players all take back an equal number of tokens (it doesn’t matter which ones), placing them at the bottom of their respective piles, and then the next round begins. It is possible to complete several Recipes with the same throw. If players cover different Recipe cards simultaneously, they each win their respective card. It is also possible for a player to win two completed Recipe cards at once, by covering them simultaneously.


3. If a player mistakenly covers an incomplete Recipe card, they won’t be able to play for the rest of that round. The Ingredient tokens and Recipe cards stay where they are, and the other players continue to play the round, by throwing their next token.

name: MEGAcquire
description:
In MEGAcquire, a re-envisioning of Sid Sackson's classic game Acquire, players create and grow companies by playing tiles from their hand on the hexagonal grid on the board.

MEGAcquire is an exciting journey of strategy and luck, for three to six players, through the corporate world. Live in the world of fun and fortune as you maneuver to outwit your opponents. Build and merge companies while shrewdly buying, trading, and selling stocks to become the wealthiest player.

Each player builds companies by adding tiles as they increase wealth by purchasing stocks in these companies. Cash flow is obtained by selling majority and minority shares through mergers. It is not always prudent to have the most stock in the biggest company, if you can build and sell enough smaller companies to generate a large income. Many different strategies can be used to reach the pinnacle of the corporate world, but you will always need the “luck of the draw”.

MEGAcquire includes 182 tiles and 350 stock certifications in 14 colors (seven hotel chains and seven companies).
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Memory, Ownership, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Charty Party: All Ages Edition
description:
The absurdly funny game of ridiculous charts!

If you like bizarre charts, goofy card games, and want a fresh game for your next party night, give Charty Party a try!

How to play?

Every player draw 7 cards
All the players choose a judge from themselves, who will draw a chart card.
Everyone play a card by passing it face-down to the judge. Choose the funniest card which fits with the chart card.
The judge chooses the funniest card related to the chart card, giving one point to the owner of the card.
You can play the number of rounds you want. At the end, the player with the most points win the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dino Business
description:
In not too distant future a graveyard filled with dinosaur bones is found. A scientific breakthrough allows researchers, to restore the full DNA map of 30 different dinosaurs. In Dino Business players are investors building a dinosaur theme park on an island.

The island is divided by rivers into three parts, each part consists of nine or seven areas, that can hold one type of dinosaur. Only one part of the island is available at a time. The game has three phases, after each of which a scoring takes place. Each phase consists of a variable number of turns, until every area on the island part is occupied. Each turn begins by randomly setting up the market for the turn. On the market players take turns purchasing three different DNA that is coloured glass beads and dinosaur tiles, which show the type and amount of DNA needed to rescurrect the dinosaur. Anytime a player has everything he needs for resurrection he pays the DNA and places a dinosaur of his colour on an empty area.

Players score points for not only the dinosaurs they rescurrected, but also by having their dinosaurs on adjacent areas. The player with most points wins the game.

name: The Three Towers
description:
Middle age. War is coming to the city Pamplona. The growing tension between burgs had pushed them to build a defense. But there is not enough stone available to stand it. Be the first to build three towers and victory will be yours.

You have to build 3 towers each of them using 3 dices stacked and sorted from minor to major values. You can't repeat the same value in one tower.

Each player roll one dice in turn and tries to start new tower, stack the dice or pass. Stacked dice cannot be altered unless you roll a 6.

If a player gets a 6, he has these options:

* Roll again
* Finish and secure a tower. A tower finished in 6 can't be altered by any player (even himself)
* Swap his top stacked dices with other top stacked ones or with the newly rolled 6 (discard leftover dice)
* Blow up 1 top dice from enemies towers.
* 666: when a player gets a 6 three times followed (in the same turn or not) he destroys one enemy tower even if it is secured

The game ends when one player builds three towers. The other player has a last chance to roll a dice, but unless he gets a 6 he loses.

name: Sapa Inka
description:
Become Sapa Inca!

It is time for the Sapa Inca to choose among his children to choose the future successor. To decide the election in your favor, gain cultural influence and build great structures.

Skillfully use the abilities of your followers and, at the right time, attract the other tribes to your side to obtain important building materials. Construct the most impressive buildings and get mystical trophies.

1. Choose one of the characters on display and use their advantage to get building materials. Do you rely only on the people of your own tribe? Or do you take advantage of the greater variety and also use the abilities of the characters of other tribes? But then your teammates will also benefit from it.
2. Use the building materials and construct magnificent buildings for your Inca empire. Pay attention to the costs and the advantages of the buildings. They not only bring you victory points, but also more building material and opportunities in subsequent turns.
3. Become Sapa Inca by being the first to reach 20 victory points. To win you will not only need your buildings but also trophies you attain by being the most advanced in one area of expertise. But be careful, your teammates can also take the trophies away from you!

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Civilization, Mythology

name: Dinoland
description:
After the success of "Atmosfear", Clementoni commissioned this game asking for the presence of a VHS tape and published it just in time for the exit of "Jurassic Park" in Italian cinemas.
Each player leads an expedition on an island that is going to be destroyed soon by a volcanic explosion, to save dinosaurs with their eggs, fossils and cubs.
Everything happening is determined by the videotape: Professor Darmin is at the screen of your tv as if he was at his spaceship window. The succession of events is known, after a few games: but the trick is that what the professor describes happens in the same area where the spaceship pawn is at the moment, so the strategy is to get near to it (or to move it in the most advantageous spot).
The game sold about 32.000 copies in the first year. Authors are Andrea Angiolino, Fabrizio Casa, Luca Giuliano, Massimo Casa, Stefano Giusti and Marco Bardella of the C.UnS.A., or Cooperativa Un Sacco Alternativa: a Roman group of designers. When the game went into print, the publisher cut the names to three since he thought they were too many and erased the name of the team because a company could not be considered an author under its standards.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pig Tickler
description: Pig Tickler is a game for any number of enthusiastic players, the more the merrier. Lancers on unicycles ride around a field attempting to score points or gold rumps by stabbing a mechanical pig, whilst avoiding being knocked over and trampled by the pig.

name: Melimagic
description:
Memory and strategy game: Abracadabra! To emerge as the big winner of this magic competition you have to pull out the most pairs of rabbits! And to so that, you need to have thememory of an elephant and be as cunning as a fox!

Gameplay:
Each player has three rabbit cards facing him, in a stand in front of him. Visible to everyone each player also have a target pair card.
The object of the game is to collect the most of the target cards while making it harder for others to collect them.
The rolling of the dice allow the player to turn rabbit cards away from the owner, to change the target card or to exchange rabbit cards with other players

name: Daimyo's Fall: Dice Tuners
description:
Daimyo's Fall - Dice Tuners is a fast-paced anime combat game for 2-4 players. Recruit the best warriors and fight in close quarter battles against multiple opponents.

Choose your guard and counter the attacks that will come from each direction. The position of players around the table actually matters, like in a real melee fight you have to raise your guard against your fearful opponents, choosing a parry maneuver for each incoming attack.

A round is divided in 3 turns, in each turn dice are rolled by the first player. There are 3 types of dice, each type representing a guard (high>mid>low>high) and a type of action (attack, defense, sheathe).

Players can choose only one die per turn and they place it in one of the three directions, determining how they will parry the incoming attacks and strike back from each direction that turn.

The leftover die determines the type of card that can be played that turn, but be careful: you'll need those cards to recruit new heroes in the next round, so carefully choose which ones to keep in your hand and which to play.

When a hero suffers a wound, the player who inflicted it gains a point. The game ends in 3 rounds. At the end of the game, the highest score wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Deep Dive
description:
Take a deep breath and dive into the depths of the sea. Collect the seashells that hide white shiny pearls. The longer you stay underwater, the more seashells you can collect. But beware! If you see a shark, you will have to drop all your seashells and swim for your life.

On their turn, each player does the following:
• Rolls the color dice
• Dives into the water of the same color as the rolled out color
of the dice, i.e. the player puts his/her diver into the section of water that has the same color as the rolled out color.
• Takes as many seashells as depicted on the water section he/she has just dived in, and places the tokens in front of him/her shell side up (leave closed, no peeking inside the shell!).

Once all the players have dived into the water and collected their seashells, it’s the starting player’s turn again. This time, the starting player rolls the shark dice. All the players keep an eye out for the shark. The shark swims into the water section of the same color as the rolled out color on the shark dice, and scares away all the divers from that section. The players who had their divers in the water section to which the shark came lose all the seashells they had collected (which are closed).The game ends when four seashells with black pearls are found and opened.

-description from publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Exploration

name: Foodfighters: the S'Mores Expansion
description: Your fingers are going to get a bit sticky with this one! The S'mores Faction also includes nine new fighters tiles, three S'mores-only power cards (Sticky Fingers, Gimme S'More, and Fired Up), and a sheet of nine thought bubble clingers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Aviones y Dragones
description:
The fearsome Dragons are coming to destroy our world!

Become the hero of humanity. Maneuver at high speed, aim and fire the rockets while controlling the ship's resources, show your skill and defeat the most beasts to achieve victory.

The goal of the game is to get the highest score to get the best combat nickname.

Depending on the roll of both dice, all the pilots will perform a maneuver on their sheet tracing a path in order to aim and fire the missiles at the fearsome dragons, avoiding being damaged by them.

At the same time they must manage the ship's resources, on several occasions returning to bases to recharge.

Each pilot's game ends when he returns to any base for the fourth time or his ship is destroyed.

Game modes

Solo
Competitive up to 50 players
Cooperative 2 players
4 player hardcore co-op
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Thrive: Pond Life
description:
With nightfall, the lotus sinks underwater to rest until the new day. However, the pond does not rest and new creatures begin to emerge.

Thrive: Pond Life offers players new ways to play Thrive. More colored pegs allow a 3rd and 4th player to the pond, variable power cards "bend" the normal rules of play, and variable setups keep your pond fresh. The Pond Life also includes a brand new variant to discover a completely new way to play inside.

—description from the publisher

name: Rainbow
description:
El cielo se ha nublado, se avecina tormenta. ¿Serás capaz de conseguir formar el arcoíris?
RAINBOW es un divertido juego para toda la familia donde deberás de forma ordenada conseguir formar tu arcoíris. Pero no será fácil, si bien el sol y la lluvia te ayudarán, las nubes, viento y tormentas te lo impedirán.
RAINBOW es un juego de 2 a 4 jugadores, a partir de 5 años de edad, con mecánica sencilla de conseguir cartas y evitar que tu rival lo consiga.
La mecánica de juego es muy fácil. Muestra una carta del mazo de arcoiris y otra del mazo de clima, y debes ir colocandola en tu zona de juego o "cielo", considerando que si ya tienes una carta similar estarás obligado a colocarla en otro cielo que no sea el tuyo. El primer jugador en conseguir los siete colores del arcoiris ganará.
El juego contiene un total de 4 arcoíris completos (28 cartas), y 50 cartas de clima que permite la interacción.

The sky is cloudy, storm is coming. Will you be able to make the rainbow?

RAINBOW is a fun game for the whole family where you must neatly arrange your rainbow. However, it will not be easy. The sun and the rain will help you while clouds, winds, and storms will prevent it.

RAINBOW is a game of 2 to 4 players, from 5 years of age, with simple mechanics to get cards and prevent your opponent from getting it.

The mechanics of the game are very easy. It shows a card from the rainbow deck and another from the climate deck, and you must place it in your game zone or "sky", considering that if you already have a similar card you will be forced to place it in another sky that is not yours. The first player to get the seven colors of the rainbow will win.

The game contains a total of 4 complete rainbows (28 cards), and 50 weather cards that allow interaction.

name: NFL Quarterback
description: American Football game. Play results are detemined by an arrow on a colorcoded display and holes in the Defense formation card once placed over the Offense Play card.

name: Alakazam!: The Game of Dueling Wizards
description:
In this fast-paced and magical game for two, players choose the best spell to take down their opponent using game cards with built-in spinners and tabs, casting damaging spells against their opponent, defending with counter-spells, and even summoning monsters to battle with a mighty cry: Alakazam! Gameplay is like a complex rock-paper-scissors, with defensive and offensive strategies, and even a set of MASTERIES for advanced rules when players become experienced with the game. Take down your opponent as quickly as possible—before their spells hit their mark!

These two fully contained game cards are travel-ready, spellbinding entertainment for aspiring wizards of all ages.

—description from the publisher

name: Tulum
description:
A “STICK OR TWIST” GAME
OBJECT: to be the first to fill your pyramid with coloured blocks.
On your turn, you roll the dice. Depending on the colours showing on the dice, you can take (if you can place them) the corresponding coloured blocks and place them on your board. You can decide to stop there and then you will have definitively won the coloured blocks you picked up on your turn. OR, you can also decide to roll the unused dice again and try to collect more blocks. In this case, you roll again, and so on. BUT BEWARE, if on one of these subsequent dice rolls you cannot place a new block on your board, you lose ALL the blocks you collected during that turn. You win the game by being the first player to complete your pyramid.

+++ It is important to learn to stop in time.

—description from the publisher

name: Libertad o Muerte!
description:
Libertad o Muerte! represents the wars of independence of the Spanish Colonies in America. A turn-based board game covering the whole Spanish American Empire and its vicinity. Discover in the game the most famous units and leaders of the war.

In Libertad o Muerte players can take the role of the Patriots, fighting for their freedom, or that of the Royalists, trying to change history and hold that great empire under Spanish control.

Game features:


A huge map divided into areas covering all of South America, Central America and the Caribbean, as well as remote locations such as, Cádiz,California, Texas and part of USA South Coast.
Hundreds of land and naval units depicting historical leaders and forces.
Most important cities and forts in the represented regions.
Military resources production and management.
Two decks of cards, one for each player, cards represent historical events and also bring into play various types of assets and tricks (economics, combat, new troops, fate, etc...). Cunning play of the event cards received each turn will be critical to final success.


Libertad o Muerte provides three challenging scenarios that will give you many hours of enjoyment.


La Plata 1810. Covers the rebellion in the Viceroyalty of Peru and the Viceroyalty of La Plata.
Bolivar. Covers the rebellion in the Viceroyalty of Nueva Granada.
Early Years. The full campaign covering the whole rebellion joining the scenarios of Bolivar and La Plata. Limited to the first five years of the war.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Legends of the Mist
description:
Description from the publisher:

Amallian was an amazing kingdom, with lush forests, amazing coasts, cuddly martial artists, and the best Emperor known. The one downside of living there was the constant infighting of the clans. They not only disagreed about the way the empire was built, but the way they traded with their neighbors, too.

The clans didn't agree on much, but the Emperor decreed that there was to be no open fighting amongst them. This "peace" lasted for many years. Then came the storm of all storms. Sweeping many clans away, the Emperor was lost for solutions — but then in the Osae Valley, a mist had appeared, and those who entered it were transported to a new land. The Emperor decreed that all clans should venture forth and settle their new empire.

As they did, the oversight was little to none...which lead to the clans competing for the favor of the Emperor by any means necessary. Now the clans of Amallian race to win the favor of the Emperor by building her Empire, trading goods, and showing the most strength on the other side!

In Legends of the Mist, you take on the role of a legend from one of the four clans. By rolling dice from your pool, you can work to build the Emperor's new kingdom with new plots, fight to control them, produce goods from them, and gain wealth for your clan and the kingdom. Each die type has a different frequency of letting you perform these actions. The other clans will work to undermine you every now and again and since dice are assigned in secret, your planning and foresight are important.

Should you complete the objectives that the Empress gave you better than anyone else, you will be rewarded as the winner of her favor!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Triple Play Baseball
description:
TP Baseball gives you the opportunity to step into the shoes of your favorite team's manager and general manager and guide your team into the post-season and beyond. Not only do you handle the on-field duties as the manager, using TP Baseball league rules lets you sign major league free agents, draft promising prospects, and make late season trades.

TP Baseball uses three ten-sided dice, and will be quickly picked up by the experienced tabletop manager. For those of you new to the experience, the game can be easily understood by just sitting down and playing a few games. Nothing beats the hands-on experience. The dice create a three digit number from 000 to 999. Review the two players cards after the roll. Results of 000-499 are read on the hitter's card and 500-999 are read on the pitcher's card. Most results are explained easily right on the card. A few may need the use of an outside chart, but after playing the game a couple times, most of the results should become second nature.

name: 40 Overs
description:
40 Overs is a simple card game that pits two players against each other as Sunday League cricket teams.

First one player bats for 40 overs, or until 10 wickets are lost, trying to score as many runs as possible. The opponent attempts to take those 10 wickets and otherwise limit the scoring. Players then switch roles and the player with the higher score wins.

Each over consists of the bowling team selecting a card (from a hand of 4) then the batting team responding with a card (initially from a hand of 5, but decreasing as wickets fall). Each card can be read either as a Batting or Bowling card, but can often only be used in a certain range of overs.

Bowling cards are either Fielding (cards which reduce the number of runs scored this over) or Special (cards which, for example, produce wickets or allow a player to discard and replace a hand).

Batting cards are similarly Runs Scored (which add runs, minus any Feilding card) or Special (which, for example, defeat wicket appeals).

Card distribution (44 cards total):

Fielding cards: 15
Special Bowling cards: 29

Runs Scored cards: 25
Special Batting cards: 19

name: Hoppin' Poppin' Spaceballs
description: The object of the game is to be the first player to capture four Hoppin' Poppin" Spaceballs of the same color while flipping out any balls of another color. Players hit levers to knock out other-colored balls, while trying to retain balls of their color.

name: Pixel Tactics: Game Instructor / Rodney Smith
description:
Pixel Tactics promo card from Watch It Played! Season 4 Indiegogo campaign

Card text: You can choose to take up to 2 extra actions each turn. Each time you take an extra action, your opponent takes an extra action o their next turn as well.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Banishment
description:
Banishment is an asymmetrical, semi-cooperative card game about exorcism. It runs for 15-20 minutes and suits 2-5 players. Embrace your dark side and play the part of a monstrous Demon or join a desperate band of Exorcists attempting to banish it. Either side can win.

The Exorcists must resolve all Ritual cards in play to banish the Demon. This is done by playing cards to match Ritual components. They may alternatively choose to use their cards for effects to buy time and protection, but this sacrifices their action in the process.

They must manage their resources carefully, as their cards can be played to satisfy the requirements of Rituals, but are also needed to defend themselves against Demonic attack.

The Demon wins when their Demon Dice reaches 10, and each turn that passes brings them closer to their moment of victory. The Demon is more powerful than the Exorcists, taking more actions and disrupting the Exorcists on multiple fronts.

Banishment is highly interactive and almost every aspect of the game can be manipulated with the right cards.

The Cult War expansion set adds powerful new relics to the Exorcists' arsenal, as well as foul magicks that favour the Demon.

If you have two copies of the Banishment base game as well as the expansion cards, you can play the Cult War variant, a 6-player game where two teams called Cults attempt to be the first to summon the dreaded Dark One.

—description from the publisher

name: Weltpolitik
description:
In 1871, the Treaty of Versailles was signed between France and the newly established German Empire, badly shaking the balance of power which had kept Europe relatively stable since Napoleon’s defeat in 1815. France longed for revenge against Germany. So did Austria-Hungary; yet the weakening Ottoman Empire seemed a much easier target for recovering the honour which she had so recently lost to the ascendant Germans. But Russia, too, longed to see the subject peoples of the Balkans take refuge under her own wings; and every attempt by a European power to spread her influence into the Sick Man of Europe was watched with grave concern by all. Russia, with its huge army, was also being closely monitored by Britain in central Asia, where the latter wondered what schemes this eastern giant might have planned. Had Russia intentions towards Britain’s treasure of India? And was this new German Empire friend or foe? Would she attempt the herculean task of building a large navy to rival Britain’s? Ultimately, Germany would abandon the less expansionist and more diplomatic realpolitik of Chancellor Otto von Bismarck, and chose instead to follow the path of Bernhard von Bülow’s weltpolitik, a policy intended to establish the national honour of the German Empire across the globe. As von Bülow said a quarter-century later, “We wish to throw no one into the shade, but we demand our own place in the sun.” This struggle for a place in the sun would ultimately lead to the catastrophe of World War One, drawing all five powers into its maelstrom and destroying three of them in the process.

Weltpolitik portrays the rising tensions and dwindling war-fuse which burned among the European powers from 1871 until the time of the First World War. However, a world war is not necessarily your objective. Your goal is simple: outrank your rivals in national honour with or without the Great War breaking out. To do so, you must spread your influence into the four areas over which the European powers were quarreling during this time: the declining Ottoman Empire, central Asia, the Far East, and Africa. You must also build sizeable armies and navies in the event that war does break out. If you are leading in national honour, then this might be the right opportunity for you to initiate the catastrophic conflagration. But if your ambitious schemes isolate you diplomatically, you just might find yourself friendless when war begins, and subsequently witness the collapse of your empire. Perhaps you should play the honest broker, and try to prevent the Great War. Have you the wisdom of a Bismarck, or the incompetence of a Kaiser Wilhelm II?

Weltpolitik is a card-driven game inspired by the award-winning two-player game Twilight Struggle, but playable with up to five players. Given the radically different settings of the two games, you will find familiar mechanics considerably transformed, as well as some completely new ones. Naturally, the events portrayed on the cards are very different: the German Fleet Acts, the Boer War, the Boxer Rebellion, the founding of the Indian National Congress and the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand are all here, as well as many, many more. Players can even form alliances and host European Congresses to both lessen tensions and deal with matters they’d very much like to avoid.

Weltpolitik can be played in a variety of ways. Given that new players will have no familiarity with the cards, each Decade can be played as a One-Decade mini-game simply to learn about the cards available for that Decade (for novices, such a game might take a little more than an hour). Once players are comfortable with the cards for the first two Decades, they may want to try a two-Decade game consisting of Decades One and Two; and when Decade Three is mastered, a three Decade game, and so on.
