In Hello! Taiwan players are traveling around Taiwan by playing cards in 4 directions starting from the centered card number 8). Each card shows a destination and a serial number (from 1 to 15), which is to be placed following the ascending or descending orders. If you can't play a card with an appropriate number, then you must collect all cards in that direction and pay for the bills shown on each card. The one who spends the least travel expenses is the winner of this fruitful trip.

This game is inspired by the dazzling sights the designer has observed during his bicycle trip around Taiwan. The graphics on the cards are developed from his hand-drawn postcards which shows the beauty of Taiwan in a variety of perspectives.

----------Description in Chinese----------

"禮賀臺灣"這是一套108張紙牌，包含了40種臺灣特色主題的紙牌，每張紙牌都有臺灣特色圖片與文字解說，更可以經由遊戲方式旅遊臺灣，不是單調的紙牌而已。更是一款臺灣旅遊的紀念商品。
臺灣是一個豐富奇趣的島嶼，因不同的氣候、地理位置與人文風土，在四季節慶的交互掩映下，更衍生出五花八門、精彩繽紛的臺灣特色，不論是民俗廟會、原住民祭典、夜市美食、檳榔文化等，在一座小島裡包羅萬象，豐富多元;讓我們藉由「禮賀台灣」遊戲紀念卡，一起從臺灣頭完到臺灣尾，體驗臺灣的旅遊樂趣。

----------Description in Germany----------

"Hallo, Taiwan!" ist ein Kartenspiel mit 108 Spielkarten, erfunden und gestaltet vom taiwanischen Zeichner AZA. Auf den Karten abgebildet sehen wir 40 verschiedene Motive, die kulturelle Eigenheiten Taiwans widerspiegeln. Jedes Motiv wird durch kurze Texte anschaulich erklärt. Der Spielmechanismus ist weit interessanter als der von herkömmlichen Kartenspielen wie z.B. Maumau und lässt die Spieler auf lustig-leichte, schnelle und doch informative Art die kulturelle Vielfalt Taiwans kennenlernen. Fuer Taiwan-Souvenir-Jäger gilt: Diese Kreation AZA's darf nicht in der Taiwan-Kollektion fehlen!

Integrates with


Indigenous people of Taiwan
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Racial Wars: Flight over the desert
description:
Racial Wars is the first Polish fantasy card game, designed by Łukasz Kozak. Currently, the game is designed for 2-4 players. However, in the second edition the rules and game sets for 1 player will be presented.

The War of Races takes place in Ithilion world and 12 different races and 1 neutral race take part in it. The goal is to conquer the opponent’s residence or to eliminate his leader from the battlefield. The game also becomes more strategic as you play on two fronts.

Racial Wars in not a collectible card game but thanks to random additions, the player can make his own, exclusive card deck. Each card has its own unique abilities and unrepeatable pictures.

Players start with only leader in front of them and build plateau of cards in front of them - some cards generate resources - different for different races - which are then used to put more powerful creatures into the table. Then, each turn the battle takes place - player who is currently attacking chooses units to attack and defending blocks their attacks with his own to protect his leader. The purpose of the game is to kill enemy leader.

The game is based on a fantasy world of Ithilion, which arose in author’s and his coworkers’ minds. If you want to know the new world and characters living in it, or make a new era in Ithilion world and fight at one of the races’ side, join the Racial Wars community and create with us new days of Ithilion world.

"Flight over the desert" is a battle set for Racial Wars game, in which there are two 55-card decks of Savands and Dragons races. This kit is a full self-contained game.

Box content
An expanded version of the manual
Two game mats
Two posters
Two 55-card decks of leaders: Or'grakrun (Dragons) and Petronus (Savands)

name: Fruitcake Fun Pack
description:
Contents:

Fluxx Fruitcake Creeper card
Chrononauts Great Cake card
Choose One! Fruitcake or Egg Nog card
Loonacy Fruitcake cards (x5)


This was sent free to Looney Labs subscribers as their 2014 Holiday Gift. Retail price USD$3.00

name: Napoleon 1813
description:
Napoleon 1813 is a solitaire deduction game.

What happened on the Leipzig plain from October 16 to 19? Find out what happened back then.

name: Airpoly
description:
Airpoly is not a Monopoly variation as the name could suggest, although some elements resemble it.

It is played on a round course showing 31 airports and 15 other spaces. Airports can be purchased and landing fees can be collected there.

The players travel around the course with one of 3 airplane types (DC-9, Airbus or Jumbo Jet) carrying 1-3 freights, which are drawn from 36 freight cards. To minimize the luck factor, such freight must not be delivered at a single airport, but at specified airport groups of 2-6 airports.

The game ends after a certain time is over - the rules propose a time of 2-3 hours! Winner is the player with the most wealth.

The entire game is in ENGLISH, FRENCH, GERMAN, and ITALIAN---1987
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Spinnaker Yacht Race Game
description:
This racing game involves the use of yachts that move at a set movement rate (no dice) according to the wind direction. Wind direction is determined by a stack of cards that can be drawn before moving.
The course is a game board which has a grid on it with a start position and three buoys making an oval shape course.
Yachts move in a straight or diagonal direction and can change course at the end of their movement.
This game is made realistic by the strength of the wind, being able to raise or lower the spinnaker to increase movement and seeing who can get to the finish line first.

name: Zombies!!!: You're Not a Zombie! Promo Card
description:
When you are in the same square as a zombie, place it in the zombie pool and place this card in front of you (you take the false zombie as an ally). Now you fight with a +1. Discard this card when you lose a life, instead of losing that life.

Card idea by Jordi Gomez Acosta

name: Ultra Deluxe 2D Arcade Mega Fighter
description:
Relive classic arcade action with Ultra Deluxe 2D Arcade Mega Fighter, a two-player dueling card game based on 3-vs-3 tag-team arcade fighters such as Sharkfist, Slumberjack, and Tyranosorcerer. Draft from a group of fifteen fighters, each with their own abilities and evocative pixel art. Play "Button cards" to execute different attacks, and chain cards together to create insanely powerful combos — or mash buttons and hope for the best!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Video Game Theme

name: 九九ジャン (KUKUJAN)
description:
Incorporating elements of multiplication and mahjong, the easy-to-understand rules of Ku-Ku-Jan involve collecting the 99 numbers that exist in the same row or column.
You can study multiplication while having fun. Can you figure out which row or column a number is in just by looking at the numbers? There may be numbers that exist in more than one row!
While there is an educational element to the game, the strategic nature of the game, in which players aim for a tier that does not cover the other player's discarded cards while considering the opponent's discarded cards, makes it an interesting strategy that adults can enjoy as well!
publishers: Geo Games, MTS Games, Popcorn Games

name: Squares: The Civil War Battle Game
description:
http://www.dvgc.com/

The Civil War Battle Game represents a major departure from conventional wargame design. There are no complicated rules to memorize; no plethora of numbers, tables and charts to study, analyze and confuse the players. Instead, players must concentrate their energies on implementing the sound military principles of maneuver and attack to defeat their opponent. Emphasis is placed on decision making ability and on the players' skill in properly coordinating the actions of their various units. There are no "tricks" to be learned in this game.

SQUARES - The Civil War Battle Game contains no luck or chance element s; no dice, no spinners, no chance cards. All results are based purely on the individual player's decisions made throughout the course of the game. Players will win or lose based on their ability to outwit their opponent. You won't get lucky in this game; unless your opponent makes a mistake.......(first).
categories: Abstract Strategy, American Civil War, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Monster Clashhh!
description:
Monster Clashhh! is a fast and fun ROLL & FIGHT game. You have to be first friends with all 5 monsters! When you be a friends with monsters, attack another player! Also you have to keeping the most life points at the same time. Risk management, tactical choices and luck are the keys which will lead you to the victory.

Gameplay

1. Every player receives one summoner’s sheet.
2. Players play clockwise.
3. First player rolls the four dice, trying to get a combo allowing you to fill the spaces of Monster or the spaces of Special Ability. You can roll 3 times the dices (choosing the one(s) you wanna roll again).
4. When you decide to stop (usually after the 3rd roll), trigger the effect of your final combos according to the rules.
5. When you finish, the player at your left can play his turn (by rolling his dice and completing his summoner’s sheet).
6. The game is over when a player succeeds in summoning the five different monsters while having the most HP or if all of his opponents lose all of their HP.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: R.U.M.B.L.
description:
Gameplay:

A two player game in which each player commands a group of robots with special abilities. Some robots fly, some explode, some push, some create clones, etc. For three rounds each player will simultaneously select up to three robots to charge onto the game board from a dock that attaches to one edge of a game board. The robots are given a power token which specifies how many spaces it can move and a priority token which specifies when a robot will move. If you've successfully outguessed your opponent, you'll be able to claim the center of the board and score more points. The team that has scored the most points at the end of three rounds is the winner.

From the rules:

By the year 2534, inefficient, unreliable human players of team sports have been replaced by machines, maximizing enjoyment for all. To take advantage of the machines’ capabilities, new Robosports have been invented.

The third most popular sport on planet Earth after SPACECAR racing and Clone Professional Wrestling is RoboUltimateMechaBattleLeague, where the controllers try to program their team of robots to seize the middle of the playing field in three rounds of exciting robotic combat. To win a RUMBL, you must carefully choose among the special abilities of your robots, place them for maximum impact, anticipate your opponent’s moves, and ration your team’s power strategically. If you can do all this, you can rule the RUMBL!

name: The Brigade: Firewatch
description:
FIREWATCH mini expansion for The Brigade.
Includes 8 new Location Tiles and 6 new Crew Member Cards featuring characters and locations from the new Tinderbox Tales games.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Deluxe Edition
description:
Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Deluxe Edition was available only by the Kickstarter campaign. It included inside the box the base game and Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Deluxe Promo Pack.

Note: It was not until the second edition that the exploration tiles became part of the base game. For the first deluxe edition, it was part of the deluxe content. The second deluxe edition entry is here: Tiny Epic Kingdoms: 2nd Edition – Deluxe Edition

About the game:
You are a tiny kingdom with big ambition. You want to expand your population throughout the realms, learn powerful magic, build grand towers, and have your neighbors quiver at the mention of your name. The conflict? All of the other kingdoms want the same thing and there's not enough room for everyone to succeed...

In Tiny Epic Kingdoms, a 4x fantasy game in a pocket-size package, each player starts with a unique faction (which has a unique technology tree) and a small territory. Throughout the game, players collect resources, explore other territories, battle each other, research magic, and work to build a great tower to protect their realm.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Follow, Take That, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Li-La-Laut
description: In La-La-Laut, a.k.a. Li-La-Loud, you have the find the balance between being too loud and too quiet, with the fox moving to the right target only if you're making sound at the right volume.

name: Countdown: Action Edition
description:
Dog Might Games is back with its newest title Countdown: Action Edition! With a short play time, tons of player options, built-in moderator, and unique role-playing mechanics, Countdown: Action Edition delivers a totally new hidden role experience.

One reckless Action Hero.
An out of control hostage situation.
Who will you trust?

In Countdown: Action Edition players become characters within a 1980’s action flick. Villains have taken hostages and rigged the whole place to blow, but they didn’t count on the timely arrival of the Action Hero. Thinking fast they’ve hidden themselves among the hostages waiting to be released. There’s not enough time to save everyone. Get the innocent hostages out while leaving the bad guys behind to fall victim to their own plots. Unfortunately for our Hero, many of the hostages also have their own plans to use this situation to their advantage.

The new Countdown Deck system creates exciting tension by randomly triggering the end of the game. Since no one knows which card will be the bomb every decision is critical, and games stay fast and fun.

A moderator is built directly into gamplay through the Action Hero. Making sure that everyone gets in on the fun while still keeping the game organized and flowing.

Action Scene Cards make sure that every player gets an opportunity to take center stage and can redirect the movie scene with unexpected plot twists.    
Role Playing is a core part of gameplay making each game a hilarious and different experience. Watch your friends drop epic one liners and do their best 80’s movie impressions. The amazing art from Andrew Thompson is designed to help everyone, from new role players to experienced actors, get into character.

Jam packed with nostalgia and humor, Countdown: Action Edition offers many new twists on the beloved hidden role genre.

—description from the publisher

name: Ni fu ni fa
description:
This is the funniest cooperative game in recent years!
It’s very simple: just pick the foam piece and pass it to
the next player with the right words... Try to achieve
the challenge, it wouldn’t be difficult if it were not for
your laughs that will make you screw up and lose the
game...

You will play it again and again, either for what you
laughed at or for trying to complete the challenge...
Are you ready?

—description from the publisher

name: The Art of Batik
description:
Welcome to a Batik workshop in Surakarta, Indonesia in the late 1970s. You and your friends play the role of assistants to Mbok Mase (a woman who manage Batik Workshop). As a good assistant, you must manage the workers to make a beautifully crafted Batik with the right skills and ingredients. Now, can you prove your management skill to your Mbok Mase and be thrived among other assistants?

The objective of The Art of Batik is to complete each process of Batik cards so that it can be sent to the customers. At their turn, player has option either to draw an ingredient card or to fill in the spot on a Batik process card with talented worker and ingredients. Then when a Batik card is finished, each player who participate in finishing that Batik will get a various rewards based on their amount of participation. When five Batik cards has been finished, the game end immediately and the player with the most victory points will be named as the best assistant.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Take That

name: Fairy Meat: Clockwork Stomp
description:
Clockwork Stomp is the first supplement for Kenzer & Company's acclaimed actual-size miniatures wargame, Fairy Meat.

Gnomes: Clockwork Stomp contains background information and rules for gnomes, all-new gnome and fairy weapons, special gnomic equipment, status cards and counters, and battle scenarios. Fully compatible with Fairy Meat, Clockwork Stomp is also self-standing game in itself, complete with all the gameplay rules you'll need to load up and march into battle against other wee folk!

Slow, weak, and plodding, gnomes make up for their physical shortcomings with deadly ordnance, sinister gizmos and swift trigger fingers. With weapons ranging from the simple Iron Pistol to the horrifying Chainkiller Autocannon, these bearded brains are certainly nothing to laugh at! And with the addition of a mechanical limb or two, even hand-to-hand problems can be overcome- with some small sacrifices...

The gnomes are joined in battle by their mechanical minions, the clockwork fairies. With a mechanical, propeller-driven body and a living fairy head, the gun-toting clock-fairies provide speedy support for their gnomic masters' field operations. Rules are also provided for Rogue Clocks, liberated Clockwork Fairies for use in your own Fairy warband!

Also included are rules for the magic-wrench-wielding gremlins (foes of anything with moving parts) and an array of gnomic equipment, including toxic Faecide Foggers, Pipe Bombs, and the short-lived Hatbots.

Expands:

Fairy Meat

name: Pirmais Piecinieks
description: Become a hockey team manager. Your goal is to create a strong team roster. To accomplish this, You have been given a specific amount of money. Think carefully about every bid You make. How much really is every player worth? Bid too much and You risk losing everything, bid too little and someone else will get this player. Because there are other managers biding for the best players.

name: Alias: Travel
description:
Travel / pocket version of the "Alias" board game.

Contents:
- stack of papers with portable gameboards
- 50 double-sided cards
- pencil
- hourglass
- rules

Alias consists of many cards, each card has 6 words written on it. Each word has a number, from 1 to 6. Words are various - from very easy to very hard. Some are made of several words defining one thing (example: "Silver Medal").

Alias is played in teams, usually in teams of 2, but more people are also allowed. The "explainer" must change every turn. The hourglass (also included) is set just before the team member starts explaining the word. (Looking at the first card and thinking about how to explain the word before the time is set is allowed.) The Player must get the other team member to say the word that is written on card by using sentences to describe the word. For example, if the word is "Silver Medal", a player can say "something that a sportsman wins at the Olympic games". But if other team member says just "Medal", it isn't correct. Then the first player must further define what the hint might be. Second player can answer as often as he/she wants until the time runs out. If time runs out or first player accidentally uses the word which is written in card, the team loses a turn.

name: Mandale Fruta
description:
There is a great demand for fruit bags!
To earn points you have to fill the bags with as much weight as possible.
To achieve this goal you can mix the content and even add some stone.
It is a game where you can be honest or deceive others at the risk of being found out.

Each player has different fruit cards in his hand. These fruits have a weight from 1 to 10, there are also stones that weigh 11.
In the first phase, all players secretly use their fruit cards at the same time to fill the different bags on the table with the greatest possible weight.
In the second phase, using rings, all players can distrust the fruits that other players have placed.
In the third phase, the cards are revealed and it is defined who takes the bag according to what they put.

The bags add points at the end of the game. The more bags of the same type, the more points that player will get.

—description from the publisher

name: Road To Lord
description:
-- Story --
Local lords competed to send more things to the king to receive more lands.
When someone sends an offering, other lords will do the same.
Swear greater loyalty by many swords? Pay more wheat as a tribute? Pay better wine as a luxury item?
Finally, the lord who sends most many things to the king receives the new lands.
Gold coins and jewelry are great gifts for more appeal.
The king loves both gold coins and jewelry.
But what the king wants most is different each time.
You will gain greater trust from the king if you outwit other lords to send what the king wants most.
Get the king's trust and receive the new lands in 8 seasons, that is, 2 years.

-- Overview --
This game is simple standard 3 suits mulst-follow trick-taking game.
However, there is a characteristic difference that multiple cards can be used at once.
But be careful to get penalty points when your all cards are gone before the game ends.

The player who gains the most points in 8 times "Gift to King" (as mini-game) wins.

-- Rule Overview --

3 suits + 2 special suits
Must-follow
8 tricks
Foretold trump suit
May create a huge number by using multiple cards


The "Number" is made from any number of cards of the same symbol.
Line up cards in ascending order.
Read as a number as it is, not as an addition.
"0" and "00" require cards one of "Sword(LOYALTY)" or "Wheat(TRIBUTE)" or "Wine(LUXURY)".

name: Madam X
description:
MADAM X
is defined by the publisher as "An earthquake hitting checkers", a game in which also the playing board is modified after each move ..... a revolutionary interpretation of the game of checkers in which the player can move not just the men, but also the black squares : it is the X move, which gives an always different and unpredictable appearance to the board.

name: Rally 'Round the Flag
description:
Miniature Rules for the American Civil War.

Rally 'round the Flag puts the individual player into the role of a brigade commander, and simulates the problems that would face such an officer during the American Civil War. Thus, although the rules are tactical in nature, they are designed to be tactical on a brigade level.

Scale: 1" = 25 yards (25mm scale) or 1" = 50 yards (15mm scale). 1 move = 2 to 20 minutes. 1 figure = 20-25 men, except 1 gunner figure = 5-6 men.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Alert Force
description:
A hypothetical wargame involving a terrorist attack on a Strategic Air Command airbase.

"ALERT FORCE is a man-to-man tactical game of terrorist warfare. Rules include the use of fragmentation and gas grenades, light anti-tank weapons, satchel charges, vehicular movement and ramming, the effects of exploding aircraft, bunkers and even the theft of nuclear weapons. A system of variable forces always keeps the other player guessing."

Scale: Single man units, 30 second turns, 50 meter hexes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Age of Heroes
description:
From the rules:
Welcome to the world of Drakyre!

Drakyre is a world of Heroes, Monsters, Treasures and a whole lot more. Each deck of Age of Heroes will be a full set of collectible cards which can be used to play a solitaire or multi-player card game.

The cards are divided into Heroes, Treasure and Monsters. Treasure is broken into Weapons and Armor and Spells and Items. Players receive a party of heroes and attempt to defeat the monsters, gaining treasure each time you defeat a monster. The game is essentially solitaire; you score based on how many defense points of monsters you beat divided by how many heroes you lost. In multi-player, you are fighting the same set of monsters and are competing to see who can score highest.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Advanced Tobruk System: Tank Tactics Guide – Includes Complete Armor Basic Game
description:
(from Critical Hit website:)

Our Goal: Here come the TACTICS GUIDES—each aimed at enlightening ATS enthusiasts about a portion of the game system.

ATS TACTICS GUIDES are for you. Perhaps we should clarify. These publications are for you if you are interested in playing the game the way it was meant to be played—and becoming an expert.

We feel confident you will read these TACTICS GUIDES from cover-to-cover the first time you crack one open.

The TOBRUK TANK TACTICS GUIDE covers tank vs tank warfare in the ATS in a brief, readable format. Chock full of examples, it should have you 'getting' the way tanks are to be handled in 15-20 minutes of review.

Cupola ring not included.

WHAT YOU GET:
A 24-page publication with heavyweight 4-color cover and pages printed on durable 70-lb stock for longevity on your bookshelf;
An Armor Basic Game rulebook;
A sheet of tanks to use with the Armor Basic Game;
An 11x17 4-color Basic Game mapsheet.


(BGG description:)

An analysis of utilizing tank tactics in the Advanced Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1940-43 (by Critical Hit) - 20 pages and includes mapsheet #2, a counter sheet with German IVF2s and American M4A1s, M4A2s, Valentine IIs, Crusader IIIs, and Deacons - although the rules and charts are more limited.

There is a 4 page insert with the ATS basic rules and player aid card. Could be an interesting tank platoon vs tank platoon wargame, playable on a small 11x17 map and playable very quickly. Might be a good introductory tactical wargame.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Canadian Armchair Football
description:
From the Rule book:

Canadian Armchair Football is a game designed to test the football enthusiast while at the same time teach the novice the intricacies and strategy of Canadian football.

Each player becomes the quarterback. By referring to the play book, he calls the plays using his own strategy to score points by moving the ball down the field.

Although designed for two players, the game lends itself well to a solitary player or several divided into teams.

Comments:

The game seems to consist of calling an offensive play (short run, long run, pass) and then rolling the dice to determine the outcome of the play.

Contents:
One gameboard, two dice, two tokens, yardsticks (used to measure the 10 yards for a first down and record the downs), a play book, instructions, and one statistics score pad.

name: Würfelwurm
description:
"The aim of the game is to be the first to collect three shamrocks. When the caterpillar die is rolled, many different colors appear. If you have a good memory and uncover the cards in the right order, you receive a shamrock as a reward."

Contents: 1 caterpillar die, 11 shamrocks, 16 cards

name: Sea Command
description: Subtitled: Present Day Naval-Air and Anti-Submarine Warfare. Labeled as "The supplement to Warship Commander", this 62 page rulebook states that this volume is actually part 2 of the complete rules, covering all aspects of naval-air and anti-submarine warfare. It also includes updates to the Warship Commander rules and optional rules for a three player game, long distance aircraft operations, and a dozen other minor optional rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Das Dings
description: Quiz game. There are 120 cards with 240 tasks. Each consists of six sentences describing a word. Sentences are read out one after another, with the other players guessing what it might be. The first player to guess correctly gets the card. Whoever holds most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Hermit
description:
In this Decktet trick-taking game, you're a hermit who tries to avoid having people follow you home. So are all of your opponents.

The daily life of the hermits is represented by tricks of cards, and there will typically be more than one trick in play at a time. The goal is to avoid taking tricks with personality cards in them. Tricks that don't have personalities in them don't matter one way or the other.

The above description is from the Decktet Book, where the game first appeared.

Hermit is a game akin to Hearts where players are attempting to avoid taking cards that are worth points. Rather than a single suit being avoided, Hermit requires that you do not win tricks which contain "personality" cards, one of the three sub-types of cards in the Decktet, which represent a person following you home and thus ruining your perfect life of solitude.

Regardless of the number of players, tricks are played open to the table. On a player's turn they must add a card from their hand to a trick with the requirement that the card being played shares at least one suit with the last played card on that trick. If they cannot meet that requirement they must use a card to start a new trick. If the card they play is the highest rank in the trick the entire trick moves in front of them. Thus any new tricks always start in front of the player opening them.

When a fourth card is added to a trick it is "closed" and the cards are captured by whomever the trick is in front of. If on a player's turn there are no available tricks, including the first turn of the game, each player simultaneously starts a new trick and that player then takes their turn, in effect allowing them to play two cards in a row. When the last player places their last card any unclosed tricks are discarded and each personality card taken counts its rank for scoring with Crowns being rank 10.

When one player reaches a predetermined score, typically 66 or 100, or a certain number of deals are completed the game is over and the player with the fewest points is the loneliest and thus the winner.

Special rules exist regarding Aces and Crowns as well as a Shoot the Moons/Suns variant, a "House Party" variant, and rules for 2-player Hermit games which incorporates a "Cottage" and laying off throughout the game.

name: Agordat 1893
description:
Agordat 21st December 1893
The first victory of the Italian Army in Eritrea.
Game in No Turkeys! n.6 2010

2200 native Askari and some Italian national soldiers, led by Lt. Colonel Arimondi, encounters in the plain of Agordat around 12,000 Mahdists, led by the Amir of Ghedaref, attempting to invade the Italian Colony of Eritrea. An asthonishing Italian victory and the very first one of the young nation.
Company level wargame of a forgotten battle, with the flavour of the colonial clashes.

Agordat 1893 contains the following components:
- One A3 DIN shape map
- One Rulebook
- One sheet of playing pieces

name: Batman: Arkham City Escape – Hotline to Oracle Promo card
description:
"Hotline to Oracle" was a limited supply promo card contained with the game if purchased from a Brick and Mortar store.

It is a Utility Belt item the player can swap out for variety that allows for Batman player to draw additional combat cards if they're low on them.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Masters of Football
description:
Masters of Football is a unique board game in which you are a club manager who needs to deal with all aspects of “the beautiful game”, inside and outside the pitch. Your objective is to win the championship !

You will have to manage your budget and build your team from scratch, as well as fight for the 3 points in each match by taking control of the team for attack and defence, picking the best tactics and using every trick in the book to win the championship.

Multiple different managers, unique players and versatile action cards (strategy, evolution, anti-football and the dreaded corruption cards) make every game different.

Masters of Football uses a match mechanism based on a custom dice algorithm that keeps the results realistic according to the teams strengths with just the right amount of unpredictability, also designed to allow a fast pace during matches.
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: LOOP: The Elevated Card Game
description:
Gather your friends and sit down to play LOOP: The Elevated Card Game. Ride the rails of the elevated trains in Chicago's famous Loop! Match the line colors and stations to make your way around town, but beware the everyday perils of rush hour crowds, forgotten farecards, and mysterious puddles as you get where you're going!
—description from the publisher

Gameplay is similar to UNO or Crazy Eights, but instead of matching numbers, suites, or colors, players match the L line or station. For example, if the top of the pile is a Brown Line card for the Washington/Wells station, you can play any other Brown Line, or one or more non-Brown Washington/Wells cards (as if you’re transferring lines in real life). The object of the game is to get rid of all of your cards first. The player who most recently used public transportation gets to deal.
—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Take That

name: Miraris: Fallen Soul
description:
Fallen Soul (落ちた魂) is a promo card for Miraris distributed starting at some events in 2018, such as "Domina Collection" held on 12/23 at Yellow Submarine in Akihabara.

This role card has the number zero, meaning it acts before the cards in the main set. It is worth ten points on its own, and has you pick another role card at random and follow the rules for that card.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: YOU: SUPERPOWERED
description:
A mysterious meteorite has given YOU and your closest friends and family members amazing new gifts: SUPERPOWERS!
Together, you have all agreed to move to Superb City to fight crime and protect its citizens under the new Superhero Code. Using your newfound superpowers, nearby objects, and your real-life knowledge and creativity, you and your team of aspiring superheroes must work together to avert crises and keep Superb City safe!

But beware...with super powers come super corruptibility. Some on your team may just be biding their time before they reveal their true sinister selves. Be mindful of those closest to you who know all your deepest fears and weaknesses; they just might use those secrets against you…

Objective:
Heroes: Avert Crises during the Missions Phase, and identify hidden Villains AND their Secret Weaknesses during the Endgame Phase.

Villains: Sabotage and prevent Heroes from averting Crises during the Missions Phase, and determine the identity of the Undercover Hero and reveal all the Heroes' Secret Weaknesses during the Endgame Phase.

The Rogue: Help the Heroes win the game but do WHATEVER IT TAKES to be the Hero with the most Popularity Points at the end.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Memory, Role Playing, Storytelling, Take That, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Das Rätsel der blutigen Schere
description:
Paris, 1965. The glamorous world of fashion also has its downsides. Henri Flanelle, the world-famous fashion designer and inventor of the short sheath dress, is found dead - stabbed to death with heavy tailor's scissors. And this one day before the presentation of his latest collection!

Only eight people from his inner circle can be considered suspects. And they all have something to hide. It quickly becomes apparent that behind the dazzling façade of the fashion empire by no means everything is as it seems ...

name: The Pooper Heroes Card Game
description:
The Pooper Heroes card game is the only game where you can play with a pile of cards that turn into poop in your hand. This can happen to any card if you draw them at the wrong time or if the other players use their Pooper Powers against you. Don’t turn your head away from those smelly cards because you can only win this game if you have the fewest cards in your poop pile at the end.

—description from the designer

name: 1852: Juego Histórico sobre la Batalla de Caseros
description:
Historic wargame about the Argentinian Caseros battle.

Relive the deed of Urquiza or change history with the triumph of Rosas.


With the registered trademark 1852, a game of the same name came out in 1977 dedicated to remembering the Battle of Caseros, whose value undoubtedly derives from its rarity. It is, if not the first, at least one of the few board games that refer to a real historical event. It reproduced the conditions of the real battle on a board while the strategy was settled with dice and fifty-two plastic pieces.

— from the Dictionary of Argentine Toys, by Daniela Pellegrino
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Sorry
description:
You parked your drakkar at the beach as best you could. Now you need to hurry up, find the ring you lost, and take it to your significant other waiting for you at the top of the mountain.
Along the way you may meet a dragon, which you love cooked in the oven with asparagus, and decide to kill it.

To play, you will need a pencil and three 6-sided dice.
Explore the map and collect power-ups to become stronger and defeat the enemies you encounter.
You can use these upgrades to increase your Fighting skill or increase your Hit points.
Keep track of your characteristics by checking the boxes on your character sheet.
When you encounter enemies and have to fight, roll the dice, modify the result thanks to your special Fighting ability and compare the result with the values indicated next to the enemy; if the result is equal or greater you have won and can continue the mission.

To win you must find the ring and take it to the top of the mountain.

name: Thorgal: Qâ – Le Jeu
description:
Follow Thorgal into the hell of the Qâ country
Thorgal, Aaricia, Kriss of Valnor and their companions face a bloodthirsty demigod and fanatical warriors to liberate the country of Qâ and avoid a war that would set the world ablaze. Cross the Great Ocean and the jungle of Qâ to reach the great pyramid of Mayaxatl and challenge the powerful Ogotaï. Show courage and cunning to defeat the Chaams who are tracking you, while progressing as quickly as possible towards the city of Mayaxatl. Use your heroes' specific skills. Only by acting together can you hope to achieve victory!

—description from the publisher

name: Lesnaja: 'The Mother of Poltava' September 29, 1708
description:
Sub-title:"the Mother of Poltava" in The Wargamer Magazine #30 and is a supplement to the "Peter the Great" game in Wargamer #27 although this is a complete & separate game in itself requiring SOME of the components from the previous game, namely the RULES section.

The components for Lesnaja are: a small 8-1/2" by 11", 6-Color Mapsheet; 60-cardboard counters- (die-cut); a RULES sheet; and players must provide their OWN [6]-sided DIE prior to play.

The Mapsheet has a very Light YELLOW color overall with Light BLUE (Swamps), Dark BLUE (River), Light GREEN (Groves), Dark GREEN (Woods), RED (Objective & Supply Hexes), & BLACK (Roads, Town, Bridge, Ford, Set-up Letter Hexes). The Game counters are BLUE (Swedish) & GREEN (Russian) with BLACK print on both Front & Back. The RULES sheet is just over a page in length with a Historical commentary, with NEW Terrain, Optional Rules, Victory Conditions, and any Special Rules to be used pertaining to this particular battle.
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Axis & Allies Enhanced Realism Rules
description:
This is an expansion for Axis & Allies. It contains revisions to the game rules to make it more realistic in areas such as aircraft range, income, retreats, making new units, etc. Introduces artillery rules, new rules for choosing combat losses, and advanced weapons development. To better match the history and politics of the era, the game also introduces air transports, airborne assaults, sub economic warfare, the Russian-Japanese Non-Aggression Pact, and more.

Expands:

Axis & Allies
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: Fortress Malta
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Sitting astride the Mediterranean sea lanes, Malta stood in the way of Axis dreams of world dominion. To conquer North Africa, Italian and German troops would have to take the island. To hold on in Africa and turn back the rising tide of evil, the British-Maltese garrison would have to hold out against overwhelming odds.

Island of Death is a game based on German and Italian plans to capture the strategic island, a battle that never actually took place. Now Fortress Malta extends the game to look at other alternative plans and defenses. It is not playable by itself; Island of Death is required to enjoy the scenarios presented in Fortress Malta.

New variations include:

The 1940 Italian plan to invade Malta. With a single division and a handful of Libyan paratroopers, Air Marshal Italo Balbo proposed a radical strike at the outbreak of war. While the invading force was slender, so was the defense.

Mercury over Malta. The German plan to strike Malta instead of Crete in May 1941, with 7th Flieger Division.

Alternate Defenders. The attackers did not have a complete idea of the defenders awaiting them on Malta; we give you variable defenses to re-create this uncertainty.

Alternate Attackers. Axis planners had numerous options available to them, and you get to try them out: additional German paratroopers, another Italian division, captured Soviet tanks in German service, and more.

Plus the book includes looks at Italian and German planning for the Malta invasion, the British garrison and Malta's place in World War II history as well as historical background and design notes. With 420 (!) new laser-cut playing pieces, this turns a small game into a major study of the invasion of Malta, with vast re-play opportunities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: 300 Spartans: The 9 Card Thermopylae Game
description:
300 Spartans: The 9 Card Thermopylae Game is a solitaire micro wargame. In the game, you will control the Persian forces and must fight the small band of Spartans warriors who are blocking your path at the Thermopylae pass in 480 BC. All units on the board are represented by dice which are rotated to show their current strength. You goal is to eliminate all the Spartan units so that Xerxes army can use the pass and continue their invasion of Greece.

The game uses a simplified Command and Colors system similar to C&C Ancients or The Great War. Each turn you will draw two cards and choose one to use to command certain troops on the board and one to use for its tactical event. Each card also has a Spartan Event, which will modify the way they fight and give them advantages against your troops.

The game is played using a total of 9 cards, 16 dice, and 2 cubes. One card contains the map for the game, another the turn and status tracks, and the other seven cards contain the game's activations and events. Each of those card has three sections on it 1.) Persian Command 2.) Persian Tactics and 3.) Spartan Event. You will only need to look at the relevant event for the current phase of the game.

Each turn is played out in a series of phases.
1. Card Draw Phase
2. Spartan Event Phase
3. Tactics Phase
4. Command Phase
5. Spartan Attack Phase
6. Victory or Loss Check Phase
7. End of Day Phase

Despite the small number of components and short playing time, the game presents a challenging experience and interesting historical narrative for this famous battle. Can you beat the historical result and lead your Persian soldiers to victory over the Greeks with minimal Persian casualties? Or will your soldiers get massacred by the Spartan war machine?
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wildflowers
description:
The meadows are a riot of color, alive with the buzzing of insects, and it’s the best time to collect a beautiful summer bouquet. Can you gather the most stylish flowers? Wildflowers is a 3- to 8-player card game of drafting and set collection played over three rounds.

Each round, players will simultaneously keep a growing portion of their hand, passing the rest along, constructing the most valuable bouquet. In addition to scoring for the composition of their final bouquet, players also compete to be the most stylish, with bonus points awarded for key traits and combinations. 9 different types of flower cards may be mixed and matched, allowing for variety in gameplay.

Rules variants allow for a competitive 2-player version of the game, without the need for drafting, as well as a solitaire puzzle game using the same cards and scoring.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Domitrio
description:
From the catalog: Settrio is a game of visual perception and deduction where both luck and skill add to the fun. Easy to learn and fairly quick to play, Settrio will help build up your powers of observation as you try to find places to play.

The game is comprised of 36 distinctive, "double hexagon" shaped pieces. Each game piece is decorated with a unique pair of symbols made up one one of three shapes (circle, hexagon, star) painted either in red, blue or yellow. No two pieces are alike. Players take turns rolling the custom die, then finding a place to position one of the five tiles in his hand among those which have been played so far. The object is to form sets of three tiles in a row in which the two attributes (shape and color) on each tile in the set are either all the the same or all different. A player draws a tile if he cannot play one of his. The first player to play all his tiles wins.

name: Pigskin
description:
Pigskin is a game of card drafting and color combos. In each round, players will draft their team and play out four quarters in an attempt to score the most touchdowns. At the end of the fourth quarter, the coach with the higher score wins the championship!

Using quarterbacks, offensive players, and defensive players, you will either score or prevent touchdowns; how these players interact with each other is why it's all about the draft!

Draft five players each round and play four of them for your lineup. The color combo system gives you multiple ways to link cards together in order to pull off special plays and out-think your opponent.

BLUE 42! HUT, HUT, HIKE!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Farmageddon: Farm Fresh Edition
description:
Farm fresh produce is in higher demand than ever! There’s just one problem. Well, several. Higher demand means more yay-hoos trying their hand at the soiled science. There are also rampant dust storms, errant robotic threshers, and...FrankenCrops? No worry. As they say, the early bird gets the worm, and any taters attached to that worm.

Farmageddon is a game of skillful hand management for 2-4 players that takes 30 minutes to play. Choose when to plant, what to fertilize, and with a little luck, you'll be the master of the farmers' markets when the dust settles.

The Farm Fresh Edition of Farmageddon brings several changes to the farm and is the best way yet to get your hands dirty. In addition to beautiful new illustrations and a brand-new layout for the cards, we've used our years of experience to make this the best looking and playing version of Farmageddon ever. For veteran Farmageddon players, the gameplay updates include removing fields, which allows players to stay involved in every turn, and allows for more planting strategies. The FrankenCrops and Farmer cards have been revised or completely re-imagined to be more to be more balanced, more interesting, and to allow for more creative play.

There's never been a better time to have a weird day at the farm.

-Publisher’s Description

name: Pentaquark: QCD Pack 3 – Gluons
description: Gluons is a 3-card micro-expansion for Pentaquark that brings a new level of complexity to the game. Played like event cards, when a Gluon card is drawn it is used to change the color of a quark in play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Chain Reaction
description:
This pure abstract strategy game is a relatively unknown work by Sid Sackson. Similar in some ways to his 1981 Spiel des Jahres winner, Focus, it is available commercially in a German edition, but can be played with materials improvised from a chessboard and checkers.

From the translation: The players take alternate turns of up to five segments, trying to move game pieces from their home squares over the opposing goal line, in order to score points. After the first segment of a turn, only towers made of two game pieces may be moved. Each tower is broken down during its move, and one of its pieces may be used to build a new tower on another square. Intelligent use of this move technique can lead to "nuclear chain reactions", in which up to five towers are involved. There must never be more than one tower on the board at one time. Any tower on the board must be moved during the following turn segment by the player whose piece is on top. The game ends with the achievement of an agreed-upon number of points.

The game was originally published in 1989 in a tiny cardboard box by Ferdinand de Cassan. In 1990 it was published by Hexagames in their "Exklusiv" series, and later (1993?) by Abacus in their very similar Abacus wood box series.
publishers: ABACUSSPIELE, Europäische Spielesammler Gilde e.V., Hexagames (I)

name: Stalag 18
description:
Stalag 18 is the expansion of Stalag 17. This new version takes the basic game, focused in a familiar public, to become it to a more tactic game, deeper, for a more demanding players.
The expansion is ready to play with all or just few of the new rules, so the complex grade is decided by the players.
New actions are added to the basic ones. Now all the cards, even the no useful for the jailbreak plan in a turn, can help with the tactics.
The new warehouse cards can be taken during the game to help, in a critic moment, to the players to get all the objects. But the guardians will keep an eye on them, if they realize who is dealing with these new cards.
And finally, now the player can choose among 6 prisoner tokens which prisoners will attempt to escape in each jailbreak phase. Each prisoner has two special skills and different prisoner values, what gives to the game a deeper theme.
And finally the expansion bring all components for a six player game.


Stalag 18 es la ampliación para el juego Stalag 17 que transforma el juego básico, enfocado a un público familiar, en un juego más táctico y mucho más profundo para jugadores más exigentes.
La ampliación está preparada para que los jugadores puedan añadir al juego básico todas o algunas de las nuevas reglas, por lo que el grado de complejidad lo ajustan los jugadores a su gusto.
Se añaden nuevas acciones a las básicas, que harán que todas las cartas, incluso los objetos que no sean útiles para el plan de fuga de ese turno, sean útiles para las tácticas de los jugadores.
Las nuevas cartas de almacén pueden ser elegidas en medio de la partida para ayudar a los jugadores a tener el objeto necesario en el momento crítico, aunque los guardias los vigilarán más al verlos negociar con ellos.
Finalmente los jugadores podran, cada turno de fuga, elegir los prisioneros que serán los que intenten escapar entre su grupo de soldados, cada uno con sus habilidades especiales y sus puntuaciones de prisioneros diferente, lo que da una profundidad temática muy grande.
Finalmente se añaden componentes para un sexto jugador.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Count Leery
description:
You want to collect as few cards as possible in Count Leery, but the rules for what to do when a cards appears will differ each game, so practice won't always make perfect.

Before the game begins, decide which rule cards to use for how to indicate numbers in the game: speaking in Japanese or English, using your fingers, clapping, etc. Lay these rule cards out, then reveal colored cards from the deck until each rule has two colored cards associated with it.

On a turn, reveal the top card of the deck, then indicate its number quickly in the proper way depending on the color of the card. If you do so, the next player immediately goes; if not, then you collect the card and all other face-up cards in the pile as well as a small amount of shame. Alternatively, when the cat card is revealed, everyone must race to place their hand on the deck, and whoever is slowest takes the pile of face-up cards.

Once the deck runs out — and you use only half the deck each game to keep some mystery as to which cards await — whoever has collected the fewest cards wins.

name: Speed Colors: Booster Pack №1
description:
Can’t get enough of Speed Colors? Are you tempted to color everything around you? There’s a fix for you! Introducing Speed Colors Booster Pack, a Speed Colors extension containing 12 never-before-seen image cards and 6 rainbow-colored markers for even more colorful entertainment.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
publishers: Hobby Japan, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Mercurio, Rebel Sp. z o.o., Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Maus van Klecks
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Little Mouse van Klecks is a world-renowned artist. She has invited her best friends to come over to her studio today to paint with her. Each one of them enthusiastically grabs a paintbrush, paint colors and a canvas and is ready to go! But what's this? The small mouse's artist's palettes are tiny and can hold only three paint colors! How are you going to paint a car this way? Or a house? What about a butterfly?

During each round in Maus van Klecks, the players each secretly pick three colors and dab them on their palettes. The palettes are then compared at the end of the round. For every matching color, the animal artists receive a small tasty tart as their reward. The first player to collect three small cake slices wins.

name: iTrax
description:
A card is displayed showing a maze type layout with multiple colored squares. ONLY two of the squares are connected by the maze lines.

Players determine which two squares are connected, then race to duplicate the layout in front of them using various length 4-sided sticks and multicolored cubes.

Players must use the correct color side of the stick and the correct length of stick, plus place them in the right configuration. The cube must be placed in the right location and showing the right color.

First to do so correctly wins the card.

Collect 10 cards and win!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Maze, Memory

name: Really?! Think you know me? Guess again!
description:
Really?! Think you know me? Guess again! is a family-friendly party game that is all about you, your friends, and your family.
How well do you really know your family and friends? Will your friends & family be able to guess your answers?

EASY TO PLAY: Simply read the question card and choose your answer from a list of potential answers on the card. Mark your answer on your number dial while other players guess your answer marking their number dials. For each correct guess – return one ice piece to the tumbler. When all your ice is in—you win!

All components fit inside a 24oz tumbler - 6 number dials to mark your chosen answer, 60 sparkling play ice pieces for scoring, 100 conversation starter cards with over 500 answers and simple instruction sheet.

AWARDS & HONORS
Creative Child – 2022 Game of the Year Award
Tillywig Toy Awards - Best Family Fun
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Red Sun Black Cross
description:
SGB-11 Red Sun/Black Cross (1985) (JPY 6800)

RS/BC has two mapsheets, 1008 counters, six PACs, one 30-pg history booklet, a 32-pg scenarios booklet and a 48-pg rulebook. Also included in many copies of RSBC are 49-pg copies of English rules, including all PACs, plus charts and tables (the rules themselves are only 23 pages long).

The setting for the game is that Germany won WW2 (conquered Europe) due to Japan not attacking the USA and we both stayed neutral while Japan picked up territorial concessions. Now it is 1948 and Germany and Japan are about to fight it out for control of the Indian subcontinent. The USA is on Japan’s side in the conflict.

The maps go from Turkey and Egypt to Burma. Ground units are divisions, capital ships are shown individually, and air units are about 30 planes each. The rules state that all three types of combat (air, land, naval) are represented equally and there is a form of programmed instruction here in that there is a separate naval and ground game, with the relevant air rules being included in each.

One of the more innovative rules that I remember reading was that combat was preformed in-hex. Supply points play a key role in the game, as they determine who is allowed to do what on any given turn.

Game designer: Shunichi Takanashi
System designer: Daisuke Satou & Makoto Fukuda
categories: Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: Kharkov 1941-1943
description:
Japanese wargame on Battle of Kharkov.
First edition was published as the last game of Series: SS (Sho-Kikaku) in 1991 and dealt with the 3rd battle only.
Second edition was published as "Six Angles" #8 in 2003 and dealt with all of four battles.

Components include:

22x24 map
300 counters
12 Pages of translated rules

name: Colpo grosso a Topolinia
description:
This game was published in Italy in early '70.
Each player is a Disney character. Players are divided in 2 teams: "good guys" and "bad ones".
At the beginning "Bad ones" secretly choose a location where they will try a great robbery. "Good guys" try to find what is the target of the other team.
If "Bad ones" successfully rob their target, the player with the loot tries to reach one board edge to escape and win.
categories: Bluffing, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Diplomacy Games and Variants
description:
From the Inside Cover:

this is a set of variants and games based on Diplomacy, the popular game of international negotiation, intrigue, and warfare (voted Game of the Year in 1976 and 1977 by Games & Puzzles readers). It is necessary to know how to play Diplomacy in order to use this booklet. Many of the games also require use of a Diplomacy board and pieces. Mapsheets are provided for others, but a set of pieces is still required. In all cases all additional rules needed are included. The games range from the abstract to World War II to "swords and sorcery", some for fewer than seven players. They are arranged in a progressive instructive format to enable inexperienced players to learn simple variants first and more complex ones later. There are also special sections on two - and three - player Diplomacy.

Table of Contents :

Part I Simple Variants
Simple Variants using the Boxed Game Board
1939 (World War II)*
Colonization

Part II Moderate Variants
Holy Roman Empire
The Struggle for Hegemony in Europe, 1689-1815*

Part III Complex Variants
1939 II*
Realistic Variants
The Song of the Night: Swords and Sorcery Diplomacy*

Part IV Miscellaneous
Two-Player Diplomacy
Three-Player Diplomacy
Compilation of Simple Variants

3 11x17 mapsheets are included


uses separate Mapsheet
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Faux•Cabulary: Expansion 1
description:
Faux•Cabulary: Expansion 1 includes fifteen new word cubes and sixty new cards (with 120 definitions) for use with the Faux•Cabulary base game.

For those not familiar with the game, in Faux•Cabulary, players create new words for descriptions that lack appropriate nomenclature by using randomly drawn "word segment" dice included in the game.

Each round, one player is the Wordmeister while the other players draw three word cubes at random from the box. The Wordmeister reads a Faux•Cabulary card out loud, e.g., "The compulsion to pop bubblewrap", then each player creates a word using 1-3 of his cubes – perhaps "Bust-O-Ific" – and conceals the word in a plastic holder. The Wordmeister mixes the words in their plastic holders (so that she doesn't know who created which word), reveals them one-by-one, then awards the card to whoever submitted the word that (in her mind) best matches the definition. Players then return all the dice, and the Wordmeister position rotates clockwise. Whoever claims the required number of Faux•Cabulary cards first wins!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: The Writer: Lovecraft Playing Cards
description:
In The Writer: Lovecraft Playing Cards, only one player will prove worthy of the title "The Writer" by publishing the Cthulhu Mythos books using cards.

Each game card represents an idea for a story: a creature, a character, a place, an event... The game has eight unique stories, and you must use the card abilities to "write" these accounts to show that you are the authentic Lovecraft. The first player who completes the eight stories on their board is declared the true Lovecraft and wins!

name: Pixel Tactics: Sound Guy / Chaz Charlton
description:
Pixel Tactics promo card from Watch It Played! Season 4 Indiegogo campaign

Card text: As an action, you do 1 damage to each enemy hero. As an action, you can remove 1 damage from each one of your heroes.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Chrononauts: Carl Sagan's Joint
description:
This is a one-card expansion. From the Looney Labs website:

This special Artifact works in either type of Chrononauts deck.

It debuted as a promo card for the Summer Festivals of 2004.

The text on the card says, "At any time during your normal turn, if you have this Artifact in play, you may (as an extra action) swap it with any Artifact or Gadget another player has on the table."
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: OrgasMe! Bonus Cards
description: A set of 30 additional cards for OrgasMe! This expansion is exclusive to backers of the Kickstarter project.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Sangoku!
description:
"Sangoku!" is a card game for two people in which the players become monarchs of one country, led by warlords, aiming at unification of the three countries, set in the world of the Chinese Three Kingdoms period.

Each player draws cards from the deck alternately one card at a time and place cards in his hand next to one of the 5 castle cards placed in the field. You can declare "Siege" by arranging 5 cards next to the castle. You can earn a castle if your opponent does not have five cards at his next turn in the siege declaration. However, in case he managed to place five cards in his side of the castle sieged, a decisive battle will be held to win the castle by the stronger combination of cards. A player who wins 3 castles first wins the game.
publishers: Little Future (リトルフューチャー)

name: Smok Wawelski
description:
Smok Wawelski is a dexterity game for children (with a light tactical element) based on the Polish fable of the Wawel Dragon (in Polish: Smok Wawelski), one of the legendary stories that describes the beginnings of the Polish state.

The Wawel Dragon persecutes the castle of King Krak. Many brave warriors and the heroic knights are trying to dash out the terrifying beast, alas, with no result! A clever plan is needed for such a monster. Shoemaker Skub just came up with this one.

Place the cardboard dragon in the middle of the table, then place the cardboard knights on his tail. Now, the goal of the game is to tilt the figurine to the surface the game is played on. The model works like a two-arm lever. Under certain load on the head side it plummets to the table.

Go on and help the artful craftsman to implement his plan! On your turn:

1. Roll the dice.
2. The result of the roll allows you to take off one knight from the dragon’s tail or to put an artificial domestic animal (like cow or sheep stuffed with tar and sulfur) into the dragon’s mouth.
3. By adding or removing figurines, you attempt to plummet the dragon to the table. If you managed to do so, you win! You may imagine that the monster — like in the legend — begins to drink water from the Vistula river…

name: Motley West
description:
Welcome to Motley West, fellas! I’m the sheriff, but gosh, I think I’m getting old for this job. I need a deputy to help me fetch the desperados. You need to be quick and good, and ready to face many a trigger-happy bandit. Only the best of you will replace me as a new sheriff.

Motley West is a speed action and short-term memory game with a mix of two shapes and three colors. The deck includes two types of cards:

• Bounty cards: Showing Cowboy hat with certain color or Scarf with certain color.
• Outlaw cards: Every outlaw wears cowboy hat and scarf. Some of them have shotgun.


Shuffle all cards and distribute evenly to all players. All players hold their deck face down in front of them. Distribute 3 life tokens to everybody.
Place the Sheriff badge on the middle of the table.
Each player reveals their card and hide the revealed card with their hand turn by turn.
When a player thinks there are Bounty card and Corresponding Outlaw card among the top of each player's revealed card, hit the Sheriff badge. If they find the right 2 persons who have the matching cards, take those 2 cards as points.
Some outlaws have a gun, and catching them won’t be that easy. You cannot arrest an armed Outlaw even if their hat or scarf matches the Bounty Card. To arrest an armed Outlaw, you need to find the Bounty Card that displays a gun. If, by mistake, you point to a normal Bounty Card and an armed Outlaw, then you discard one Fame Token.


Once all players have played all of their cards, the game is over.

Tally your points as follows:
Bounty Cards (2 points for a 2,000$ reward ; 3 points for a 3,000$ reward ; etc.)
Outlaw Cards (1 point each)
Fame Tokens (2 points each)

The player with the most points wins and becomes the new Sheriff in town.

—description from the publisher

name: Hot Garbage
description:
Light Fires! Burn Stuff! Mess With Your pals!

Hot Garbage is a strategic, punchy card game for people who like burning stuff and causing mayhem. Ignite your burn pits and torch cards for points, but watch out: your opponent will try to stop you by any means necessary!

The goal in Hot Garbage is to be the first player to score 10 points - primarily by playing wood to your burn slots, lighting fires, and burning cards over a timed countdown until they can be scored. Card abilities also throw chaos into the mix, as players seek to improve their chances of scoring while also hampering their opponents through mischievous counter abilities.

At the start of each turn, during the Fire Upkeep phase, you rotate any active fire cards you control 90 degrees clockwise, reducing their burn time by one. When a fire burns out successfully AND a card has been placed on that fire (following specific rules), that fire burns out and the burning card is discarded and scored.

During the Action Phase, you have 3 action points that can be spent to draw cards, or play cards. Every card can be played in one of four different ways:

To add wood to a burn slot or existing fire.
To ignite a fire in a burn slot containing wood.
To be added to a burning fire to begin burning it for points.
To trigger the card's ability.


At the end of your turn, you'll draw back up to five cards.

The game heats up quickly, however, as opponents play counter abilities to try to stop you (and volleys of interrupts and counters fly back and forth in delightful chaos).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Interrupts, Take That

name: ¡Caninos!
description:
¡Caninos! es un juego de cartas de pizza en el que competirás para robar más pizza que cualquier otra persona. Sé el primero en alcanzar 50 puntos en porciones de pizza y ganarás el juego. Pero, ¿cómo? te preguntarás. ¡No te preocupes, estamos aquí para ayudarte! Contarás con las habilidades asombrosas de perros súper poderosos que están más que ansiosos por robar pizza para ti, ¡y son los mejores en ello! No solo pueden conseguirte pizza, sino que también pueden hacer trucos sorprendentes que dificultarán las cosas para tus oponentes y te pondrán por delante en el juego.

Pero, ten cuidado: otros jugadores intentarán detenerte con trucos y cartas de reacción destinadas a asustar a tus perros. Juega con cuidado y usa los ingredientes a tu favor: podrás añadir ingredientes que aumentarán el valor de tus porciones de pizza, pero otros ingredientes lo reducirán... y si la situación se pone difícil y necesitas ayuda adicional, siempre puedes contar con los trucos especiales de los Sabuesos del Caos y las misteriosas artimañas de los (casi) todopoderosos Mapaches Místicos.

¡Caninos! es un juego familiar moderadamente estratégico en el que deberás evaluar tus posibilidades, tomar decisiones y gestionar tus cartas con sabiduría para convertirte en el mejor ladrón de pizza de todos los tiempos.

—description from the publisher

¡Caninos! is a pizza card game where you will compete to steal more pizza than anybody else. Be the first to score 50 points worth of pizza slices and you'll win the game. But how? You may ask. Don't worry, we got you covered; you'll count on the amazing skills of super powerful dogs that are more than eager to steal pizza for you, and they're the best at it too! Not only can they get you pizza, but they can also do amazing tricks that will make things harder for your opponents and put you ahead of the game.

Be mindful though, other players will try to stop you with tricks and reaction cards meant to scare your dogs away. Tread lightly and use toppings to your advantage: upgrade toppings will increase the value of pizza slices while downgrade toppings will lower it... and if push comes to shove and you need some extra help you can always count on the special tricks of the Hounds of Chaos, and the mysterious ways of the (almost) almighty Mystic Raccoons.

¡Caninos! is a mildly strategic family game where you'll need to evaluate your possibilities, make some decisions, and manage your cards wisely to become the greatest pizza thief ever.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Slappy Camper
description:
Race to pack up your camper! You must think on your toes to slap the right camping gear, but watch out – slap the wrong card and you may find yourself unpacking! Be the first to fill your camper to win this game of quick reflexes and creative problem-solving.

EASY TO PLAY: Flip the cards to see what camping gear you can pack next, then use your marshmallow slappers to smack the matching card on the table! Be the first to fill your camper with no extra spaces.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Real-time

name: Diamant: Treason! Micro-Expansion
description:
Diamant: Treason! is a micro-expansion composed of 12 cards.
All players start with 3 cards in their hands: 2 Decision cards, and now also a Treason card. Unlike other cards, the Treason card can only be played once per player and per game.
During a Decision phase, you can select a Treason card to Continue into the cave, but when you reveal it, you do it in front of another player.
If this player was Exiting the cave, he must give you the value of 10 Rubis in the process, which you add in your Chest.
If this player was NOT Exiting the cave, then nothing happens.
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Solar System Voyager
description:
Turn-based strategy about running a space agency and exploring the solar system in the new space race. Each player takes on the role of one of the 5 space agencies, and in his turn can perform two of the 9 possible actions, such as developing the agency on the technology tree, launching a rocket, conducting research, placing buildings, or sabotage.

The game board is a model of the Solar System, consisting of 5 movable rings. On each ring there are successive objects of the Solar System, and the rings are divided into such numbers of squares, that rotating each of the rings by 1 square per round, the speed of planets and rockets on their orbits around the Sun is maintained according to Kepler's law!

Once all players have made their move, we rotate each ring and the positions of the planets and rockets change. This means that players, in order to optimize their missions and not waste valuable time, must learn to predict the future position of planets and start planning rocket launches in advance, just like real space agencies.

Development tree is divided into three branches: space tourism, base construction and sabotage. Players have to manage their budget on an ongoing basis, so they don't run out of funds at the crucial moment of the space race. In addition, each of the space agencies: USA, Russia, Europe, China and Japan, has its own unique bonus.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hidden Victory Points, Income, Open Drafting, Race, Simulation, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Matching 4U
description:
You are a girl who is very busy preparing for a date that was suddenly decided. You want to be cute and fashionable, but you don't have any of those items! Borrow a lot of fashionable items from other people and aim to go on wonderful dates with as many boys as possible.

In マッチングフォーユー (Matching 4U), players will be dealt 8 cards each. They will draft their hand, 2 cards at a time, until they have 8 cards again. Players will then play tricks and determine the strength of their card from highest to lowest.

Starting with the highest strength, players will acquire one of the played cards and leave it face up in front of themselves for scoring at the end of the round. All cards have various set collection bonuses associated with them. You want the most diamonds, you want pairs of shoes, perfume will make your clothes score more, etc.

The player with the most points after 3 rounds is the winner!

name: Sengoku Domino
description:
In Sengoku Domino (戦国ドミノ), you want to dominate two regions of the battlefield to win. Each region of the battlefield is resolved in turn, so you must fight in them one at a time by placing domino tiles that represent your army's strength.

At the start of the game, each player shuffles their colored domino army tiles face down, then draws a hand of five tiles, keeping them behind their screen. On a turn, each player reveals one domino, with the strength of a domino equalling the summed numbers on it. Whoever played the weakest domino places it into the region first, then the player of the next weakest domino places that, etc. In the case of a tie, the tied dominos are placed after all other dominoes that turn.

The region under question is a 5x5 space on the playing area, with the central square being occupied by a castle. No domino can be placed over the castle. The first domino placed in a region must be placed adjacent to a castle, and each subsequent domino placed can be placed adjacent to the castle or next to any other domino as long as they have the same number in at least one adjacent edge. For example, a 2|5 tile could be placed next to a 4|5 tile, or the tiles could be placed perpendicular to one another as long as the 5s are adjacent.

Once all the dominoes are placed, the next turn begins with players refilling their hands, then playing another domino. A player cannot play outside the 5x5 area unless it's impossible to play all of the domino inside it.

Once the region is filled, you consider the total strength of each player in each row and column in the region, using colored markers to indicate who has the highest total. If two colors are tied for highest, then they're ignored and the next highest color wins the row or column. If the totals are completely tied, then no one wins that row or column. Whoever wins the most rows and columns wins the region, placing a marker of their color on the castle. Again, in the case of a tie, they're ignored and the next highest color wins the region!

Whoever first wins two regions wins the game. If in a four-player game each player wins one region, then the tie is broken by whoever won the most rows and columns.

name: Lost Worlds Adventure Set I: In the Ruins of the Ancients
description:
This is the first boardgame based on the Lost Worlds series of fighting gamebooks. Players would take miniatures into a 3-D plastic molded dungeon room, and maneuver on the board until they came into melee range, at which point they switched to the Lost Worlds books to resolve combat.

Rules were provided for movement, ranged combat and furniture. Several scenarios came with the game.

Part of the Lost Worlds series.
categories: Adventure, Book, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Stop the Train
description:
OBJECTIVE
To get your 3 passengers on board a train and take them for a round trip and back home again.

A nice children's game. After rolling the color-die, a player can move any of the two trains to halt on the color shown. The fun is to jump the pieces into the wagons as trains pass by your start point, and after a round trip to get them off at the home point. Only one passenger per compartment is allowed. There are also bypasses on the board. The unlucky passengers stopping there, must get off the train and wait for the next free wagon available which passes the loading point. Although it is luck-driven, players must decide which of the 2 trains to move in order to get closer to their homes or to hinder opponents. Funny and very entertaining for children.

Virtually the same game as Fuzzi, Heinz und Schlendrian, except that movement is determined by a colored die roll, and players must only move three passengers instead of four.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 1864: Year of Decision
description:
1864 was truly the year of decision in the War of Secession. While the North needed only one more year to break the South's back and end the rebellion, at the time the military situation did not appear to be so promising. After three years of war the Union had not subdued much of the rebellious South.
