The Union held enclaves along the coast, all of Tennessee and some other scattered holdings, and it controlled the Mississippi River. However, the bulk of Southern territory, especially the deep South, was untouched. The principal Southern armies in Georgia and Virginia were as strong as ever. The South had shown its ability to wage war in spite of military reverses and blockade.

1864 - Year of Decision is a board game simulation of the decisive campaigns that brought the American Civil War to its violent conclusion. Players assume the roles of Abraham Lincoln or Jefferson Davis and their senior military advisors. Players operate armies, corps and divisions in military regions that reflect the maneuver limitations experienced by the belligerents. The combat units are rated for troop quality, leaders' tactical abilities, leaders' initiative and command span. The game compels players to focus on the interrelationship between military operations and their political consequences. Victory is determined by political points resulting from military successes and failures.

Each game turn of 1864 - Year of Decision represents five days of the campaign. Move your playing pieces representing Union and Confederate corps and headquarters from region to region accurately recreating maneuver during the Civil War. Each region consists of two districts. Assign missions to your forces by placing the units in the Attack or Defend box in each district. Units which Defend in a district can improve their defensive positions. Send your cavalry forces on raids against enemy targets. Attack to defeat your opponent's forces and capture key objectives. Headquarters can lead attacks or individual corps can attempt to attack on their own. A die roll determines if each unit succeeds in at-tacking. Resolve combat based on the sizes of the attacking and defending forces, the quality of the troops involved, the tactical rating of the commanders, supply and morale conditions, defensive positions and weather. Battle will yield casualties and prisoner losses on each side and may force a withdrawal by the loser.

Trace supply for your forces along rail lines to supply depots or, for the Union, to an occupied port. Units can operate away from their supply lines for short periods, but need to re-establish supply after combat. Break rail lines or devastate regions on the map to cut enemy supply. Both sides also face monthly losses due to attrition. Several optional rules allow players to increase the game's realism. Five scenarios allow players to recreate the struggle in either theater from two different starting points or to play the entire campaign.

Contents

Rules of Play Booklet in our easy-to-read bullet paragraph format
Player Reference Booklet with notes on the historical situation and the game's design
280 Die-Cut Playing Pieces
2 Mapsheets featuring the Eastern and Western Theaters
2 Small Mapsheets covering the approaches to Savannah and Mobile
11 Color Play Aid Cards
1 Die


(description from Omega website)

name: Elves Under Hoof
description:
Overview:
Elves Under Hoof is a light-hearted game of combat at the North Pole. It seems the elves have opened up a crate of ultra-violent video games and played them all night. By morning they had been turned into mindless zombie elves bent on destruction.

Now, it is up to your team of heroic reindeer to gather weapons and battle the crazed elves to save the day!

Key Points:

Very easy to play.
Fun for all ages.
Armed reindeer take on the evil elves.
Just in time for the holidays! (if it is around holiday time when you are reading this)
Just the thing to remind you of Christmas! (if it is not holiday time when you are reading this)
4 Scenarios: An Igloo Too Far, Saving Private Reindeer, E-Day, and The Big Red One


Component List:

Expensive Player Help Sheet
One Sheet of Full Color counters
Very cute full-color Map
Humor-filled rulebook


Target Audience:
This is a great game for both wargamers and non-gamers alike. The game is fast and easy to understand and who doesn’t like throwing hand grenades at elves?

Game Formats:
PDF Download

—description from the publisher

name: Ying Yang
description:
Ying Yang, subtitled: "A Game of Strategy for ages 8 to Adult, Game for Two", produced in Springfield, Oregon.

From the BACK of the box:

Object of the Game:
"To participate in moving the place markers ('pawns') across the board until one player is successful in moving his place marker into his winning corner."

Contents:

The box of which contains the instructions on the back of that.
An illustrative tri-folded half-sheet of examples of plays.
2 Sets consisting with a red or green pawn and matching 4-d6.
A Ying Yang vacuform shallow tray/board to conduct playings upon with this.

name: Loot and Scoot Expansion Kit #1: Loot Harder
description:
HE WHO DIES WITH THE MOST LOOT
NOW PROBABLY FOUND THE STAIRS
DOWN TO THE 2nd LEVEL

The first expansion for Loot and Scoot adds new monsters, new treasures, new adventurers, new buildings and the official solitaire rules.

With this expansion, you can build Fountains of Healing, Statues of Glory (with a value based on how well you can loot the dungeon) and even own a Tavern. Dual-class characters, like Paladins and Rangers, can be hired at the Inn. Secret Rooms are waiting to be discovered, hiding incredible powerful magical weapons (loot a +1 Dagger or Wand of Magic +1!). New traps are available to hinder (or kill) your opponents. Even the undead stir in the dungeons below.

Two additional player mats are included for variety. Now every dungeon master can have their own dungeon type.

Notice: This Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. To use it, you must own a copy of Loot and Scoot

Complexity: 2 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 4 on a 9 scale
Scale: Individual heroes vs. individual or groups of monsters

Game Components:


One illustrated, color 2-page Rules sheet
40 color, die-cut 5/8" square playing pieces
2 Dungeon player mats
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Holland (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
The board for this Edition is based on a map of Holland.
As with other Ticket to Ride games, players are collecting sets of cards to claim routes necessary to complete destination tickets.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Cottingley Fairies
description:
コティングリーフェアリーズ　～妖精の見つけ方～

In this game, players are exploring the forest near Cottingley, looking for the elusive Fairy Circles. Arthur Conan Doyle believed in the famous photographs of the Cottingley Fairies, taken in 1917. Can you find them too?

Forest cards are turned up, and players bid to win a card in a blind auction. Each player hides some Explorer coins in their fist; players bidding most choose their Forest card first.

The Forest card has 6 areas, some have mushrooms in them, red or white or yellow. The player gets to place the card how they want, exploring the forest as they go. When a player completes a Fairy Circle, a ring of mushrooms all of one type, they score points. The larger the space surrounded by the circle, the more points they win. There are bonus points too if one the Fairies is present in the circle.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: MUD
description:
You are a wealthy mogul trying to influence the next presidential election for your own gain. Win by being the first to secure a solid block of voters of either party. You decide how corrupt to be.

Every player is dealt seven cards and can place three voter cards face up in front of them (creating a voter map) each turn. Depending on how many players, you'll need at least three voters in three regions, all of the same political affiliation, on your map to win (undecided voters are wild).

Peppered in the deck are RAT cards, which give you strong advantages. However, every time you play a RAT card, you must also draw a Scandal card, which contains a punishment. This punishment is not enacted immediately — rather, it sits face down in front of you until someone plays a DIG card on you. The DIG card will force you to turn over a scandal and abide by the punishment. Do you risk a scandal, or do you play it safe? The choice is yours in this dirty game of American elections.

-description from designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Ambitions of Space
description:
Ambitions of Space is a space 4X strategy about military, economic, technical and political confrontation in the vastness of an unknown galaxy.

On the way to the victory of their power, players establish colonies on distant planets, develop infrastructure and science, form battle fleets and, at their own peril and risk, explore the anomalies of outer space.

The goal of the game is to bring the player-controlled nation to prosperity and global superiority over its competitors. There will be one winner, but you can win one of four ways:

Military victory: capturing the capital of one of the rivals, you will win, since few can resist its military power.
Political victory: Having received the most Senate seat, the player wins, as he now decides which laws apply in the galaxy.
Economic victory: by increasing the capital turnover to 30 units per move, the player wins, since there is no longer in the galaxy what he could not buy.
Scientific victory: legally gaining fifth-level technology, the player wins, as he is now the engine of progress.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Fall of Siam
description:
The relationship between the two ancient Asian superpowers of Burma (currently Myanmar) and Siam (currently Thailand) was long, bloody and well documented. Burma and Siam clashed constantly, involving at least 17 separate conflicts that in turn resulted in at least six sieges of the Siam’s capital, Ayutthaya, over a 300 year period. Twelve of these conflicts ended in Burmese victory. The 1767 siege of Ayutthaya ended in the great capital’s total destruction. The Fall of Siam attempts to give players the opportunity to face each other with historically similar armies under similar circumstances. The Fall of Siam is a two-player, hex and counter game lasting approximately two hours. It involves elephants, Chinese intervention and siege rules.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Wherewolf: Red Riding Hood
description:
Wherewolf: Red Riding Hood is a 6 player stand-alone game, but can expand Wherewolf too.

In this version of the game there's no moderator, since everyone starts with eyes closed and plays the first round. Then, the first one who dies becomes the moderator.

The 6 pg/cards are:

The Wolf (wins if alive with just another one)
Red Riding Hood (wins if the Wolf dies)
The Grandmother (if eaten by the wolf, she becomes the wolf!)
The Hunter (can kill the Grandma-Wolf)
The Jester (wins when eaten by the Wolf)
The Mad Man (wins when killed by vote)
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery

name: Queen Victoria's Navy
description:
Queen Victoria's Navy is a nautical combat war game for two players which simulates the period from 1880-1906. The game scale is 500 meters per hex and about 5 minutes per turn. Capital ships are modeled individually. Complexity is medium. Time to learn is from 30-45 minutes.

Players take the role of squadron commanders, the principal tactical leaders in the battle fleet. As such, they are in charge of a manageable force of capital ships, generally 3-12. Designed for 2 players, Queen Victoria's Navy is also suitable for solitaire or multiple players, each scenario taking about 1 hour to complete.

This game manages to blend three often contradictory goals together seamlessly: affordability, game-play, and authenticity. The focus of the game is to recreate the conditions of a capital ship battle. Torpedo boats, gunboats and sundry other smaller vessels have been left out of the game as they were not critical components of the Battle Fleet concept, and their inclusion would have added complexity and cost to the game. However, thanks to the simplicity of the rules, it is an easy task to design these craft for your own games.

name: Traber Derby Spiel
description:
From the translated rules:

The players are harness race drivers. Each driver tries to maneuver his team into a good racing position using the colored dice and by the skillful play of 'spurt' cards. The player with the highest total of points after three races over different distances is the "Derby Winner".

name: Generic Racing Game
description:
In the Generic Racing Game, the pawns of the players represent their racers, ready to race down the track.
The rules are exactly this: rules and nothing else. There is no given track to race upon, as you can create your own track just with a pencil and a sheet of common grid paper.
As racing always has been part of mankind's sports culture, there are a couple of themes given on the last sides of the rulebook, so you are free to choose the setting as well as the orientation of the gameplay (tactics, luck, wargame).
As a solitaire option, you can always race a track on your own and try to beat the number of turns you took on every subsequent lap.

name: Assaut sur Suez: Opération Mousquetaire – Novembre 1956
description:
Game published in Vae Victis 92.

Assaut sur Suez is a game covering the French and English attack on Suez during the operation Mousquetaire on 5th an d6th November 1956.

The game has a point to point map divided in 8 sectors (Gameel, Cimetiere, Port-sair, gold, Rasawa, Route Sud, Port-Fouad, Marias salants).
Each point connection represents 400m.
The game last for 6 operation steps representing 4h during the day or 12h at night. Each operation step can have from 1 to 8 turns.
Each counters represent a company (120 men) or equivalent.

The game has an historical scenario to be played solo and and variant to be played with 2 players.

name: Baba Yaga
description:
Baba Yaga is the board game of Russian folklore and heroism. Extensively researched to be true to Russian folklore it is epic in scale, but simple and fun to play with an atmosphere of high adventure. With up to six players, two main play modes (cooperative or competitive), a solo play option and variant multiplayer rules, there is endless replayability.

During the game players take on the role of one of six heroic characters, adventuring in the wilds of a fantastical medieval Russia sculpted by the legends and folklore of the land. As you play the game, you are attempting to complete one of six heroic quests by traveling around the board and having encounters based on Russian myths while also dealing with Baba Yaga's perilous minions. As you have these encounters, you will gather items and allies that will help you by granting you advantages or bonuses to your statistics. You will also gain reputation as you adventure, but be careful, the great witch Baba Yaga doesn’t care for uppity heroes and soon you’ll be fighting her off as well as dealing with your individual quest.

In order to win in competitive play, you must either be the first to complete your quest, or have the most reputation when the game ends. In cooperative play, all of the players must complete their quests or manage to defeat Baba Yaga before time runs out.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Slovensko
description:
Slovensko (Slovakia), questions and answers is an entertaining trivia quiz game for curious Slovaks, where you will find 2400 interesting questions and answers about Slovakia.
Collect a token from each category to begin your winning journey to the center square.

On your turn, roll the die and move your playing piece as many steps as the die shows, to either direction. The space that your playing piece lands on shows from which category you will answer a question.
- If your answer is incorrect, or you don’t answer at all, your turn is over and the turn passes to the next player.
- If your answer is correct, you receive a category counter from the category you just answered.
Once you have answered correctly to one question in both spaces, you can move your playing piece to the Finish space,
answer one more question and if this answer right wint the game.
- If you have to answer a question from a category
for which you already have a puzzle piece, you
don't receive a second puzzle piece of that colour
if you answer correctly. Instead, you can throw the
dice again, move your token normally and answer
a new question. Continue this way until your answer
is incorrect or you receive a new puzzle piece. After
this the turn goes to the next player.
After collecting tokens form every category there is final questions. To win the game You must answer those correctly.

name: Babylon 5 Component Game System: 2258 Edition League of Worlds Starter Kit
description:
In the Babylon 5 Component Game System, you take control of a certain faction which is trying to gain power in the galaxy. You play the role of an ambassador on board Babylon 5. You explore the vast stretches of space, lead huge fleets into battle, and control the economy of your faction. There are several ways to achieve victory ranging from economic growth to all out militaristic control of the universe. Diplomacy is not to be neglected either, as the more powerful game changes are brought up in Babylon 5 council vote to be decided.

You construct your playing 'board' using hexagonal shaped pieces that come with the game. The various pieces are different and can represent a multitude of things so that the game is different every time you play. In addition to the board and the ships that move on it, there are cards. Players may buy cards allowing special actions above and beyond the normal game, like an extra move or more EPs.

Using your faction's wealth and resources you play the game and explore the map. You search for planets to colonize and possibly conquer. Use your fleets to engage in battles and use characters to assist you in reaching your faction's goals. The choices are yours and will decide if your faction is successful.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Robinson Expansion Pack
description: Star Trek: Attack Wing — Robinson Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 21 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Euphoria: Participate In The Game or Watch It Played
description:
A promotional card given out during the 2015 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

This is a specially made ethical dilemma card for the game, to be added to the base game. This card does not replace any of the ethical dilemma that come with the game.

The card is compatible with first and second printing versions of Euphoria.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Ferali
description:
Description from the publisher:

Ferali is a disk-flicking game system that comes with nine different game variants that can be played on a octagonal game board with different disk types that come with the game.
The variants are described in more detail below.


Rainbow: pocket seven disks in the colors of the rainbow in the correct order (violet, indigo, blue, green, yellow, orange, red). The first player to pocket on set of all seven colours wins the game.



Race to 16: this game uses red and black numbered disks. The first player to pocket exactly 16 points wins the game.



Poker: each player gets a set of cards and has to pocket the disks with the same numbers as the cards. The player to do this first wins the game.



Snooker: use to the Ferali game table to play a variant of Snooker using numbered disks.



Zero is hero: similar to Race to 16. But now a score of zero has to be achieved by adding and subtracting the numbers on the disks.



Word builder: this game uses disks with characters. Each player pockets disks, writes down the letters, then returns them to the board. Players compete for a predetermined period of time, then they make as many words as possible with their noted letters. Whoever has created the most words wins.



Cricket: using red and black disks, a cricket game is played on the Ferali board.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Game System, Party Game, Sports, Word Game

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Darnati Warriors – Unit Expansion
description:
The enigmatic swordsmen of the Latari emerge from the deepest reaches of the Deepwood with the Darnati Warriors Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! These elven warriors turn combat into a deadly dance, using their moonstone blades to slice through enemies with a speed unmatched in Terrinoth. Master the blade and defend the Aymhelin!

—description from the publisher

name: Magic: The Gathering – Journey into Nyx
description:
Theros is a Magic: The Gathering block, consisting of the expansion sets Theros (September 27, 2013), Born of the Gods (February 7, 2014) and Journey into Nyx (May 2, 2014). The block is a "top-down" design inspired by Greek mythology.

The third set of the block, Journey into Nyx, was released on May 2, 2014. It is a small set consisting of 165 cards. The set completed the cycle of ten dual-colored "demigod" cards that debuted in Born of the Gods, as well as the cycle of ten "scry lands" that premiered in the first set of Theros. The set also includes the first green/white Planeswalker, "Ajani, Mentor of Heroes."

In addition to the block-wide mechanics, Journey Into Nyx features two new mechanics.

Constellation: This ability triggers whenever an enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, providing whatever bonus is specified on the card. To make room for it, Bestow and Devotion have both been scaled back, appearing on only five cards each; per Mark Rosewater, the dilution of those mechanics also represents the storyline's conflict between gods and mortals, and the latter's disillusionment with the former.[13]
Strive: this ability only appears on Instant and Sorcery spells that have targeting effects. Strive cards can have "any number" of targets, but the caster must pay an additional specified cost for each target beyond the first.
The Monstrous ability returns, last seen in the first set of Theros, replacing Born of the Gods' Tribute.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Evangelion Card Game
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





The Evangelion Card Game is the third series expansion for the Chrono Clash System. Years ago, the Earth was attacked by unnatural creatures called Angels. To defend the people against the next Angel attacks, the world's governments and Nerv built the Evas, giant mechs of unknown power.

Currently featuring Naruto/Boruto and Godzilla, the Chrono Clash System is a fast paced, living card game in which players alternate back and forth making big attacks and summoning even larger creatures. The bigger the attack or creature a player plays during their turn, the more resources they give their opponent for their next turn.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: DATTO!
description:
DATTO! is a trick-taking game based on the fable of the Hare & the Tortoise. It is ostensibly a race game, in which the player to advance the farthest will win.

Turn order for each trick is based upon the players' position in the race, with the players who have advanced the least playing cards to each trick first. Players must follow suit if possible, and the winner will advance a number of spaces equal to the lowest value played in the lead suit. If only one card of the lead suit is played, the player advances a number of spaces equal to the number of cards left in their hand.

Each player also receives a "nap" card, which allows them to sit out of one trick.

name: Friends: The One With the Apartment Bet Game
description:
Show off your Friends trivia with the Friends: The One with the Apartment Bet Game. This hilarious party game makes the perfect night in for fans of the classic sitcom. The Friends board game is based on the game played in "The One with the Embryos," when Monica and Rachel wager their apartment in a trivia game against Chandler and Joey.

Take on show trivia in 4 categories: Fears & Peeves, Ancient History, Literature and It’s All Relative. The super speedy lightening round, with even more show trivia, can put it all on the line.

Choose your wager, whether it’s cooking the other team a meal or cleaning the bathroom for a month. But don’t worry – in this Friends board game, you can keep your apartment!

Contents: Friends Bet Game board, 250 cards, timer, 2 dry erase cards and 2 dry erase markers.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Department Store Builder
description:
Department Store Builder, a.k.a. デパートビルダー, is a tableau-building game from Japan. Each player is a department store manager who competes to build an attractive department store on their individual player board, using cards to build up the business. You can open seven types of stores in the four stories and the basement of your building. You can gain popularity by meeting customer requests, establishing the largest section in the region, and opening early.

Your popularity counts as victory points, and the player with the most victory points wins.

•••

プレイヤーはデパートの店長となり、素敵なデパートを創ります。
地下1階、地上4階建てのデパートに7つのジャンルのお店を開いていきます。
お客様のリクエストに応えたり、地域で一番大きな売り場にしたり、早く開店すると人気が上がります。
人気が勝利点となります。もっとも勝利点が高かったプレイヤーが勝ちとなります。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: 18 Hiawatha
description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, 18 Hiawatha is an 18xx game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven 1817 game system, this variant encourages active use of the shorting mechanism, includes new private companies, and comes with a few game-specific tiles. You’ll need a copy of 1817 to play this game.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Connections, Market, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Otaru 1899
description:
Otaru 1899 is a stand-alone expansion to Sapporo 1876, set in Hokkaido in the late 19th century.

You play as a local feudal retainer developing Otaru. For the sake of your clan's reputation, you will hire talented private school students, cultivate farmland, and expand your business.

On your turn, you perform one of four actions by moving the action pawn to a different action than the one previously taken.
Keep in mind though that your opponent will also perform that action, so deciding when to do what in order to only benefit yourself is key.

There are four types of resources in the game; Wheat, Rice, Sheep and Cows. The value of each resource varies depending on the action so resource management is important.

Otaru 1899 can be combined with Sapporo 1876 to play up to 4 players.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Dragon Inferno
description:
Each player has 7 kingdom tiles (all one sided tetrominoes) in his colour (light or dark green), each containing a castle and a hole.
5 dragon tiles (pentominoes) are placed alongside the board and 8 dragon eggs are scattered on the board.

Players take turn placing one kingdom tile on the board, either placed over a vacant corner or adjacent to an already placed kingdom tile of the same color. If a player places its kingdom tile in such a way that the hole in it surrounds a dragon egg, then he summons a Dragon and places a Dragon tile (pentominoes) over the already placed kingdom tiles, the aim being to burn opponent's kingdom, ie place it over the opponent's squares.

When all kingdom tiles have been played or no more can be placed on the board, we count points: a visible square in a colour counts one point for its owner, a castle counts one point more. Squares that are below a dragon tile does not count points at all.

Short games, around 10-20 minutes, requiring combinatorial and geometrical thinking.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Tile Placement
publishers: IUVI Games, Smart Toys and Games, Inc.

name: Ninja All-Stars: Clan Yamazaru
description:
Description from the publisher:

Clan Yamazaru is a clan expansion for Ninja All-Stars which contains enough miniatures to build a complete Yamazaru-themed team. Clan boxes feature dynamic and unique sculpts for players’ favorite teams. They also introduce two powerful new troop types to players’ existing collections: large-sized Oni and a fearsome clan Hero.

Clan Yamazaru are powerful, yet playful warriors that employ a diverse array of weapons and tactics in their quest for the Moon Throne. Capable of enduring great feats of strength, Clan Yamazaru are resilient, nimble and composed, much like the great earth they champion. This earth affinity clan is an enticing option for lovers of practical jokes, fierce monkey warriors, and burying their enemies in the dust of the defeat!

name: Red Scare Redux
description:
A spy-themed, team-focused, competitive card game where you race to complete high value objectives and conquer your ideological foes.

Red Scare Redux is a 2-6 player competitive card game that takes 30-60 minutes to play. It is referred to as "team focused" as it was designed for 2-3 person teams, but it also functions for two or three individual players.

The goal is to complete Objectives by collecting and using Resources. The first team to complete five Objectives ends the game, but it is the team with the most points that wins.

Wrecking even the best laid plans are Black Ops. Some Black Ops cards attack the opponent, some help further your own goals and Sanitize stops any Black Ops card from being played.
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Tripods!
description:
Tripods! is a competitive, strategy survival game set during a Martian invasion of Victorian London. Two to four players take control of a number of playing pieces representing the populace of the city and are trying to score as many points as possible by the end of the game. Points are awarded for helping citizens escape, keeping them alive until the Martians are destroyed and killing the Martian war machines.

The inhabitants of London have no say over the greater workings of the Martian invasion or the government's response to it, relying on garbled rumours and reports to keep them informed. Game plays out over a fixed narrative of eight 'Headlines', which reveal the next stage of the invasion and events within the narrative are controlled by a 'Tidings' deck which instructs the players how to manipulate the invaders and the military who are trying to counter the threat. The Tidings deck also contains the Red Creeper, which spread across the board as the game progresses. Once consumed by the alien plant a space is no longer safe from the Martian's terrible Death Ray. These Tidings can be manipulated by players through the use of five Character cards, each of which has a special ability and each of which can be used only once per game so timing must be chosen carefully.

Escape from London is achieved by leaving the board from one of five stations or the docks. As Headlines are revealed these escape routes begin closing and as the Martians grow more prolific, the Red Creeper spreads, the available military units dwindle and escape routes shut so the tensions build and players begin to turn on each other to compete for the few remaining avenues of exodus.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management
publishers: Oakbound Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Snack Wars
description:
Snack on the go!

Players take on the role of gluttonous globe-trotting raccoons who are a little prone to thieving!
During your turn, you must draw several cards and choose the ones you want to keep in your 9-card collection. Choose wisely in order to assemble the culinary specialties that will allow you to score the most points at the end of the game, but be careful, as opponents might come to loot your hoard!

—description from the publisher

name: Oh Quay
description:
adapted from The Decktet Book

In a river town, east of the Sapphire ports, you manage a canal where rafts of cargo are lashed together before being launched into the current and sent downstream. Your opponent manages a parallel canal. If your luck and skill are enough, you can clear your canal and get to the pub while he is still sorting boxes.

Oh Quay can be played without any table space, with the players holding all of the cards in their hands. So it's a game you can play while standing in line, sitting in the back of a car, or with your feet dangling off a pier.

name: Madam, Watchdog & Burglar
description:
Madam, Watchdog & Burglar is a trick-taking game for 3 to 5 people. It is a "may follow" game, where following suit is not required, and there is no single trump suit. Instead, the suits form a rock-paper-scissors type relationship, with Madams winning over Watchdogs, Watchdogs winning over Burglars, and Burglars winning over Madams.

The Madam cards contain a number of diamonds shown on the cards which represent the victory points in the game. The player who collects the most diamonds wins. However, players must manage their trick-earnings well, as they have to discard a Madam card for each Burglar card they've acquired unless they have enough Watchdog cards to negate their Burglar cards.

name: Little Mémo
description: A memorization game for kids aged 2.5 to 5, the game comes with 9 cute soft plastic animals & insects, flower tokens, and a little box. The players are shown all the animals, then while they close their eyes one animal is hidden inside the box. The players then have to take a guess which animal was hidden in the box. The one who's right gets a flower token. First player to earn five tokens wins!

name: Danger Island
description:
A Clue like game where players take on the role of explorers trying to find Blackbeard's treasure on Danger Island. The game uses three pieces of information that you need to deduce to find the treasure; the nearest landmark, the direction from that landmark, and the # of paces from that landmark. To hinder the players, killer apes inhabit the island. The game also makes use of an card driven event system to add flavor. The Games Journal has a brief tidbit of the game where it is described as follows; "DANGER ISLAND is from a one-shot publisher which is Clue crossed with Talisman (and not very well, frankly.) ".
(http://www.thegamesjournal.com/articles/DeductionGames.shtml)
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Events, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Sports Dynasty
description:
In this mechanically simple game, each player is the owner of four sports teams (baseball, American football, hockey, and basketball).

Each player starts with money, and cards representing (generic) "superstars" in the four sports. As players move around the board, they pay payrolls, collect gate receipts, and can get new "superstars" from the bank, through auction, or by acquiring them from other players.

Certain board spaces (or a roll of doubles) trigger a "championship" round in the currently-active sports season. Championships are resolved by each player rolling as many dice as they have "superstars" in the currently-active sport (which of course also moves the game into the next "season"). The championship victor gets a 2-D plastic trophy, and a monetary bonus.

The winner is the first to win 3 championships in any one sport, or 2 championships in each of 2 sports.

name: One Tub Bilge
description:
A parody game intended as a lampoon of (or pot-shot at) Steve Jackson Games by Howard Thompson. The U.S. ship tries to sink the "Commies." Published in Interplay number 2, Metagaming's house organ.

The title of the game is based on the Steve Jackson game One-Page Bulge.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Fairy Meat: Sugar and Vice
description:
Sugar and Vice is the second supplement for Fairy Meat, Kenzer & Co.'s acclaimed 1:1 miniature game of cannibal fairy combat. Sugar & Vice introduces two new breeds of Wee Folk: the decadent Moon-Fairies and the vulgar Pixies!

Lunar descendants of the old Fae royalty, the Moon-Fairies share a common ancestry with the Glitters of Earth. Unlike their earthly cousins, they've progressed (or perhaps degenerated) into a glamorous Rock & Roll-loving fairy kingdom. All goes well until they decide to check up on the Earth they left behind so long ago, only to find their former subjects have become murderous, barbaric, and frighteningly powerful.

To cope with the power Fairy Meat gives the insubordinate "natives", the meat-intolerant Moons have developed a magical lip gloss known as Pink. Pink allows them to kiss dead fairies rather than eat them, vampirically soaking up the corpse's powerful fairy essences. This addictive cosmetic gives them a much-needed edge on the battlefield, but it carries a terrible price; with the deadly risk of Overkiss, every kiss might be your last...

Sugar and Vice includes:
Rules and background for musical Moon-Fairy bands, Pixie mercenaries & gangs, and reality-warping Glamour Chunks!
More weapons, Twinkle spells, wands , and (yes) magic items!
Tasty new full-color counters!

Sugar & Vice provides more equipment, troops, spells and game options to all Fairy Meat players, expanding the game while keeping gameplay as swift and bloody as you've come to expect.

Expands:

Fairy Meat

name: Speed Circuit: Detroit Grand Prix
description:
Expansion track for the Speed Circuit racing game. Stand-alone track modeling the Detroit Grand Prix. This city-street circuit is very different from all the other Speed Circuit tracks, with LOTS of 60 and 80 mph turns.

This is an expansion for Speed Circuit.

name: Say Anything!
description:
From the box:

Say Anything! the more you say, the more you play

Shout Out Some Categories!

Animal, Vegetable, Mineral!

Watch your prompter point to the Say Anything! Playcard. Find out if you are "Hot" or "Cold". Should you go back to a previous word? or Say Anything!? Stuck? Spew more words. Try to get a "Hot" response from your prompter. Keep those categories, ideas and words coming until your team is the first to identify the secret word or time runs out. This fast action twenty questions game with a twist will keep you entertained for hours.

name: Classic BattleTech: Dawn of the Jihad
description:
Unlike the Classic Battle Tech: Starter Books, the Jihad series of scenario books is for players with experience with the Battle Tech system.

Each book includes the historical background and fiction that describes the sitiuations described in the book. The series of events presented in these books unfold in a rolling format, allowing readers to immerse themselves more directly into the action than ever before. Each book includes scenarios to cover each of these situations. Additionally the books include a campaign system that can be used for the Battletech Boardgame or Roleplaying game to tie each of the individual situations together.

The situations are designed to be easily scalable, which allows them to be used for any sized group of players, regardless of what type of equipment used (since not all units are created equal).

The Books in this series

Classic Battletech: Blake Ascending: A Jihad Compilation. This was originally two seperate books:
Battletech: Dawn of the Jihad, covers the period when the Jihad began (Nov 3067) through approximately 3069
Battletech: Jihad Hot Spots covers the period of 3070 and 3071.




Classic Battletech: Jihad Hot Spots - 3072 covers the period of 3072 and 3073 and includes new technical readouts of new units, including 6 Word of Blake Mechs.
Classic Battletech: Jihad Hot Spots - 3076 is listed as "coming soon" (as of 1/09).


More books in this series are planned, since the storyline is planned to cover two decades of 'history' in the Battletech universe.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: It Fits
description:
From the back of the box:

ANYONE can come up with something that FITS. But, can you come up with something that fits the criteria of the most cards, and that EVERYONE can agree upon? Can you convince them? Can you talk them into it? It Fits is the hilariously fun game ideal for families and friends. It's laugh-out-loud fun!

It's this easy...
1. Each player is given a card and six cards are placed face-up on the game board.
2. Think of something that 'fits' the criteria of the card in your hand and as many of the face-up cards as possible.
3. When time's up, each player reveals their answer and makes their case as to why "It Fits" each card.
4. If everyone agrees, move forward. If they disagree, move back. First player to the end of the game board wins!

name: Caravaneers
description:
A desert themed abstract played on a 7x7 board. Players try to move the pieces (Caravaneers) using two types of movement choices from their start position on the "North" and "West" edges of the board through the desert and safely to their Caravanserai located on either the "East" edge of the board or the "South" edge of the board. The player who has captured (collected) more Caravaneers by the end of play is the winner.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Combined Arms: Rules for WWII Infantry-Armour Actions
description:
World War II company and battalion level infantry and armour miniature wargame.

Intended for micro scale gaming. Your basic infantry stand has four figures on it and each vehicle represents one tank or truck. The turn has several phases in it typical of the "old school" gaming of the early 80s. The rules include air power, engineering tasks and weather to name a few features.

name: Turi-Tour
description:
The farm animals are going on holiday! But alas, the farmer has messed up everyone's tickets and it's not clear to him who's going where. Thankfully you and your fellow players can lend a hand, but the sorting challenge won't be easy. When you're the active player, you must wear glasses that cover your eyes; the player to your left then draws a task card and places the animal pictured on it in your hand. You try to identify the animal by touch and announce what animal you think you hold. The player then explains your task and you try to perform it, such as placing the animal in the correct location (as marked on the gameboard that game). You can feel the gameboard and other animals already in place, but knock any of them over and your turn ends immediately.

Other tasks include removing the proper animal from the gameboard and stating how many are currently on the board. The animals on parade change nearly every turn, so you'll need sensitive fingers and a good memory if you want to help them see the world...

Available in English, German, French, Dutch, Spanish, Italian.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Memory

name: Extrem Memo
description: Players turn over two tiles in a grid, and if the pictures match, they claim the tiles. What’s different from previous Memo editions is that each tile has two pictures on it and a player can choose to match either of the pictures in order to claim the tile. Furthermore, a player can search for a match from among the tiles already captured; even tiles held by an oponent. Whoever holds the most tiles at the end of the game wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Memory

name: Chicken Caesar: The Eggsclusive
description:
The Eggsclusive is a set of limited edition Rooster cards you can use in the Chicken Caesar game! Players can replace some of their own roosters with these eager chickens during game setup. The following roosters are included in this expansion:


Abus I - A somewhat familiar looking rooster for you history buffs.
Baro I - This is another one for the history buffs and Peanuts. The most famous fighter pilot of all time.
Plusho I - Plusho isn't exactly what you would expect from a Roman chicken politician, but sometimes just the "appearance" of leadership will do the trick.
Cucullo I - "Hood" in Latin; this particular chap might remind you of a certain vigilante who steals from the rich to give to the poor.
Magus I - This Rooster resembles a certain magic peddler who was once a little grey-er.


Note: Stevus I was removed from The Eggsclusive due to legal concerns.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation, Political

name: Freeze Tag
description:
Pyramids race to the other side, trying not to get frozen along the way.

Freeze Tag is a Looney Pyramids game that uses the pyramids and a die from IceDice along with a 5x5 board. Each turn, a player rolls the pyramid die and moves the piece(s) shown on the die. They can land on larger pieces to freeze them or smaller pieces to teleport them. The first person to cross the board with three pieces wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Black Powder: Zulu!
description:
From the publisher's website:

Zulu! is our latest Black Powder supplement and covers the Anglo-Zulu War of 1879.

This lavish 92 page supplement chronicles such legendary battles as Isandlwana, Rorke's Drift and Ulundi. Zulu! brings you not only the background for these momentous battles but other, less well known conflicts as well as rules and force listings - all wrapped up with the usual photographs of beautifully painted miniature and armies!

You've seen the silver screen version of events in Zulu and Zulu Dawn - now you can refight these classic engagements on the tabletop...
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Myth: Agents of Darkness
description:
From the publisher's website:

As the Darkness grows in the land its influence spreads into more than just the weaker willed creatures. Agents were once people, perhaps even Heroes, until the Darkness invaded their minds and slowly corrupted them. With this corruption came great power at the cost of freedom. Agents are a deadly boss-type monster that the Heroes can encounter in their adventures at their own peril. If an Agent is defeated, one of the Heroes is granted that Agent’s ability card, bestowing them with a unique power.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Crime Story: Detectives Without License
description:
Crime Story is a fast-paced story-telling game where players together build fascinating criminal stories.

During the game players use cards depicting items, characters, places and actions. One after another, they build sentences to create the most consistent criminal story they can tell. A player who tells the sentence is called an AUTHOR. If the AUTHOR speaks out loudly sentence containing a word present on a card in other player's hand, the AUTHOR takes that card and puts it face up in front of him. This card gives him 1 point at the end of the game. A player who has the most points at the end of the game is a winner so during the game you should try to lead the story in a way that will protect cards that you have at your hand. Also be careful! There is a murderer among you. He tries to outrun others by getting additional points. Can you tell the best story and meanwhile hunt down the murderer?

name: Clockwork Empire
description:
In Clockwork Empire, players take the role of robots brought back to life many years after the demise of humans, with only the goal of increasing their numbers.

Players use dice to move and gain influence over the different spaces on the circular track, in order to gain resources, draw worker cards, build workers, take control of high-value Deus cards, and gain VP. The game ends when one player reaches 50 VP, and after a final accounting of VP for workers and Deus cards, the player with the most VP wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cruel Seas: Rulebook
description:
Cruel Seas is a fast-paced tabletop game recreating the swirling naval dogfights taking place on the seas during the dark days of the Second World War.

Powerful, well-armed boats manned by skilled crews stalk enemy shipping lanes, lying in wait for an unsuspecting target to present itself. With a roar of engines the motor torpedo boats would surge forward, opening up with tracer fire from an arsenal of machine guns and autocannons. If the enemy vessel was a large enough target, torpedoes would also be loosed to deal a devastating blow to their prey.

The game covers six major nationalities - the British Royal Navy, German Kriegsmarine, US Navy, Imperial Japanese Navy, Soviet Navy, and Italian Regia Marina - each having their own character and play style. This rulebook explains how to organize your chosen fleet and take the fight to your opponent as you seek to rule the waves. The vessels vary in size and shape - from fast, sleek killers to slower but more heavily armed ships. Do you prefer a swarm of small but fast boats, fewer larger ships with heavy weaponry to bring to bear, or a combination of these two categories? Cruel Seas provides a multitude of ship and aircraft options and plenty of options to customize your boats' weaponry, making each game different.

Cruel Seas is scenario-driven providing a strong narrative element to your games. From easy-to-play introductory scenarios to more demanding operations that will provide a test of both your skills and nerves!
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Movement Template, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Hollywood: Director's Cut
description:
It's been 100 years of Hollywood being the heart and symbol of the film making. Every year it attracts many talents, but only a handful of them are destined to become superstars. Will you gather the dream team and make millions?

Hollywood: Director's Cut is an improved version of the original Hollywood game. Players will still compete to get the best crew to make the most money after three production years.

What's new:

all expansions in one box
Updated card design
Re-written rules
Revised auction mechanics


—description from the publisher

Голливуд: Режиссёрская версия

Вот уже сто лет Голливуд остаётся сердцем и символом киноиндустрии. Каждый год Фабрика Грёз привлекает тысячи творцов и художников, но только единицам из них удаётся стать звёздами. Сможете ли вы собрать команду мечты и выпустить фильм, который соберёт миллионы?

«Голливуд: Режиссёрская версия» — это новая редакция популярной настольной игры. В роли боссов крупной киностудии игроки стремятся снять фильмы, которые соберут наибольшую кассу и получат престижную премию «Фильм года».

Преимущества режиссёрской версии "Голливуда":

все дополнения в одной коробке
обновлённый дизайн карт
новые лаконичные правила
переработанная механика аукциона


—description from the publisher (Russian)
categories: Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Blitzkrieg 1939: Guderian
description:
Blitzkrieg 1939: Guderian (or Blitzkrieg 1939 I) is the first game in the "Blitzkrieg 1939" mini-series - the planned series about German Armored Corpses during the invasion of Poland in 1939.

It covers the most important battles fought by the German XIX Armored Corps, led by gen. Heinz Guderian, during 1939 Polish Campaign.

The game uses the B-35 system, the oldest Polish wargames system, made for the battalion-company scale battles. It's a highly complexed system, with lots of rules and tables, dedicated for the division vs division battles.

Available battles:

Chojnice
Bory Tucholskie (Tuchola Forest)
Różan (2 scenarios)
Wizna (3 scenarios)
Brześć (Brest)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Age of Towers: Kickstarter Exclusives
description:
Expansion with Kickstarter exclusives modules:


6 Cthulhu monster sets (4 Deep Ones, 3 Shoggoth, 3 Mi-Go, 1 Cthulhu per player)
6 Devil Pigs monster sets (4 Liners, 3 Cheerleaders, 3 Runners, 1 Ball, 1 Boss per player)
6 OrcQuest monsters
2 Boss Boards (Cthulhu and Devil Pigs boss)
18 cards per language (10 Action, 4 Quests, 2 Events, 2 Game Helps)
1 Plastic Building Miniature (The Red House)
1 Wooden Mercenary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Area Movement, Network and Route Building, Take That

name: The Drums (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
This fan-made scenario for T.I.M.E Stories is a single player expansion. It tells a tale of atmospheric horror in the woods of Kentucky. It is set in 1974.

—description from the designer

name: The King is Fed
description:
The realm has been re-unified. The leaders of its three factions (the English, Scottish, and Welsh) will soon arrive at the royal castle for a celebratory but tense dinner. If the dinner is a failure, the realm will descend into chaos yet again.

You are the royal hosts’ waitstaff, plating dishes and serving guests while following royal protocol. The fate of the realm now rests on your shoulders. Only you can maintain peace in the realm by making sure that all faction leaders are served fairly and that the royal hosts are satisfied.


Components
- 9 double-sided cards
- 18 colored cubes (6 red, 6 blue, 6 yellow)

Objective
Your goal is to serve three meal portions (i.e., cubes) to every guest, with each guest receiving one cube of each color.

Gameplay
You play the game in turns. On each turn, you must take one of the following actions:


Dish a portion - Move a cube from a waiter’s tray to a square on one of the three serving dishes in front of the waiter.
Serve a portion - Move a cube from a serving dish to a guest’s plate.
Perform a royal ceremony - Move a cube from a royal host’s serving trolley to the adjacent waiter that does not have a cube and then perform the associated royal action listed on the trolley.


Game end
The game ends with a win if every guest has one cube of each color on their plate.

The game ends with a loss if any of the following occur:

You are unable to perform any of the allowed actions on a turn.
You are unable to perform the required royal action when you perform a royal ceremony.
A guest has more than one cube in a given color on their plate.

name: Combo Cone Paradise
description:
Welcome to Combo Cone Paradise, where our combos are even sweeter than our ice cream. Congratulations on your first day, rookie! You and up to 4 other newly hired Combo Artisans will be fronting this branch, serving up sweet combolicious ice cream to our customers. Of course, each of you will be evaluated, and the Artisan who brings in the most coin by the end of the day shall be promoted to Head Combo Artisan of this branch!
Now show me what you’ve got, Artisans!

Combo Cone Paradise is a 2 to 5 players game that pits players against each other to build up combos, and serve as many customers as possible. Player takes one of three actions during their turn.


Drafting different flavors of ice creams into their hand
Draw a wild flavored ice cream and reserve a customer order
Place ice-cream on the available cones and serving them to customers


When placing ice-creams on the cone, you will be able to place more ice-creams than you are entitled to, by combining the right brand of ice cream together.

The player who earns the most points based on the types of ice-cream served to customers, wins!

name: Detecteam Kids: Max the Cat аnd Friends
description:
Max the Cat has the best friends in the world! Together they have so much fun, and every day is filled with the most amazing adventures! What will they come up with today? Will they set up an obstacle race, prepare a birthday surprise, or cook up some yummy treats? However, there are so many things that could go wrong... But that’s what friends are for!

Max the Cat and Friends is a co-operative adventure for young detectives. Your goal is to piece the full picture, just like a jigsaw puzzle, and re-create the events. Find out what actually happened in this stand-alone game from the Detecteam Kids range!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction
publishers: Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Mirakulus, Red Cat Games

name: Something Wild! Indiana Jones
description:
Something Wild is a line of card games featuring beloved characters and collectible Pop! pocket figures. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs. The first player to score three powers wins the game.

With Something Wild: Indiana Jones, you can score a set to snag the Indiana Jones figure's special power to help you win!

Combine Character Cards in sets and runs to score points, just like in Rummy. Use Power Cards to add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay.

Combine multiple Something Wild! games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: Spoils of War: Burky's Shield
description:
Artifact Burky's Shield
Vikings may not steal or trade for one of your Treasures. You may reveal this card to cancel an attempted theft or trade in progress.

name: Bismarck Solitaire: Midnight Edition
description:
The Midnight Edition of the Original Bookgame Bismarck Solitaire adds additional game plays of each mission, plus a new scenario and a new map with three missions for the Battle of Denmark Strait.

Command the pride of the German Navy in Bismarck Solitaire, an Original Bookgame by Worthington Publishing. Lead the German ships Bismarck, Prinz Eugen, and U-boat support as they take on the determined Royal Navy with one goal, Sink the Bismarck!

You have 11 missions of varying objectives and difficultly, plus a training cruise. Each mission gives you 4-6 tries to best the Royal Navy. Some missions require you to find convoys, others expect you to sink a few British warships, while some just hope your ships can survive the sortie.

The only thing you must provide is 2 dice, a pen, and a sense of adventure.

Midnight Edition Details:

Bismarck Solitaire Midnight Edition is a Black and White version of the Original Bookgame Bismarck Solitaire with additional game plays of each mission, plus a new scenario with three missions for the Battle of Denmark Strait.

The few differences between the original color version and this black and white version are:

The Colored zones have changed to numbered and shaded zones.
Contrast throughout the bookgame is optimized for black-and-white reproduction.
The original eight mission bookgame had three gameplays in the color version, but now has four gameplays each.
58 pages in the original color version vs. 106 pages in the Midnight Edtion


We added a new game set: The Battle of Denmark Strait.

What's Unique to Denmark Strait

New cruisers were added, HMS Norfolk and HMS Suffolk.
New Map, focusing on the Denmark Strait between Iceland and Greenland. This is the critical pathway for German warships to get out to the open sea and attack the shipping lanes supporting Great Britain.
No convoys in this battle.
Allows for the focus of the sea battles to be fierce fighting between the capital ships of the navies.
Sixteen game plays spread across three missions that vary in difficulty.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Fantahzee: Rogue's Gallery
description:
Description from the publisher:

The town of Devil's Burden is still under attack, and even more monsters are pouring in! Ingenious goblins, led by the mighty troll king and his retinue, are now laying devious traps all over the town to hamper the stalwart defenders. It is time to call for reinforcements — the long-time secret society within Devil's Burden: the Rogues' Guild.

Fantahzee: Rogue's Gallery adds rogues to the Fantahzee base game. Sneaky, clever, thieving heroes that can help you overcome the Horde. Adding rogues also means adding traps, which require rogues to overcome.

name: Talpa
description:
Talpa is a 2-players game that belongs to Connection Games family. While in most connection games players try to make a chain built of their pieces, in Talpa players remove pieces to make a path of empty spaces.

Initially the board is filled with black and white pieces, forming a checkerboard pattern. A player moves by picking up one of his pieces and capturing a horizontally or vertically adjacent opponent's piece. The captured piece is removed from the board and replaced by the capturing piece. The capture is mandatory if possible. When capturing becomes impossible, players remove one of their stones per turn.

The goal is to "dig" a "tunnel" of orthogonally adjacent empty spaces connecting player's sides of the board.

No draws are possible in Talpa.

name: Venns with Benefits: The Hilarious Venn Diagram Game
description:
Learn to play in one minute: Write the funniest fill-in-the blank cards to win!
Endlessly replayable: Never see the same Venn diagram combination twice
Perfect for teens or adults: As clean or inappropriate as the group playing!


How to play
Everyone gets a board. Each round, you'll add yellow and pink cards to create new Venn Diagrams.

Then, compete to fill your friends' boards with the funniest answers to what both sides have in common. Best answers get points!

—description from the designer
publishers: Evan and Josh's Very Special Games Company

name: The Wilderness
description: The Wilderness is a high complexity brigade level study of 2 days in May of 1864. The players are placed in the positions of the leaders of the opposing Armies with leadership and command control systems modeled on the strengths and weaknesses of Civil War era command techniques as well as the influences of the participating individual commanders. Turns represent 2 hours of daylight and 5 hours of darkness. Hexes are scaled to 350 yards.

name: Sold Out!
description:
The premise of Sold Out! is to be the first to complete your shopping list. You'll have to rummage through the stalls (several decks where you want to place on a table, the four corners of your home) to find every clothing that compose it.

Sold Out! includes seven game modes for fast games (10 to 15 minutes) between 2-10 players in solo or team, from six years and up. On your marks, get set, go...

name: Zoom / TriHop
description:
Zoom - 4 marbles in a square.
The shortest route is not always the best.
Which player will be the first to make a square of 4 marbles on the inner part of the board? The game is played from the outer edges (starting position) to the inner parts of the board - every marble can be moved as far as the player wishes but only in straight lines. It is important to know that every empty space on the circumference of the board can be used to access the inner part of the board.

TriHop - a tactical triple jump
In this game the player moves from the inner part outwards, to the circumference of the board - every move requires you to jump at least once around a corner.

The implementation of TriHop is exactly the opposite to Zoom. At the start of the game the board is empty and the players alternately position their pieces on the inner part of the board. The player to place the last marble makes the first move and his first triple jump.

The aim is to reach desired spaces with your own marbles first.

name: Colorado
description:
Settlers arrived in a valley in the desert Colorado, San Luis Valley. They have to fight for everything, but eventually farms, rich grass pastures and pasturing cattles fill the unusual wasteland with life.
Become the most skilled farmer! Get the most pastures for your cattle! With smart tactics, avoiding storms, using your golds well, with the Indians in peace, you will surely be the king of the prairie.

Objective of the game:
With the help of farms occupy areas and all five cows should be placed on occupied pastures. The first player places his fifth cow on the board wins the game.

How to play:
During the game, players must use pasture-shaped triangular cards for the game so that they can build farms in their corners. If one player is in the majority on a pasture - his own farm is in the two corners of the front leg - that player can place one of its cows on this pasture so can take it. The figure remains in the game until the end of the game, regardless of whether the player may have it the majority of the area around the area disappears on the way. Only one cow can be placed on a pasture.

The youngest player starts. From the 4 cards in his hand he can play as much as cards he can or want. There is only one limit: You can only play one card type in one turn (for example, there is a player holding two farm cards, only one of them can be placed in one turn). Exception is possible with golds.

name: Gemblo Red Stone
description: Gemblo Red Stone is a variant version of Gemblo, with red power stones that are placed on the board and can be captured by players when they place their piece on top of them. Each red stone captured deceases the player's end score by a point (this is good) and allows certain cards to be used as well.

name: Paris 1800
description:
Paris 1800 allows players to play as the great figures of the nineteenth century Romantic and Modern, to decide the future planning of the capital. Modern transform the city by expanding its boulevards, creating monuments in iron and glass. Romantics will preserve the old quarters of bourgeois ambitions by using the dissatisfaction of the people of Paris.

One player is the Modern ans plays Haussmann and two police chiefs
Others players are the Romantics (1 Romantic per player)

Turn Sequence :
1 - Rewards : Modern gains money ; Romantics gains "Inspiration". Romantics draw 1 Revolution card when the Time Cube (grey) is on a Revolution dot
2-Move : players can place their tokens on the board
3-Actions : Romantics do their Actions first. They can:
a-Go out of France (Exil)
b-Go in Fontainebleau Forest
c-Pay for deliver a Romantic in the Fortress
d-Raise the angry of the Parisians by put an "Angry token"
Bonus : if there are 5 adjacent Angry tokens , 1 of them can be substituted by a Revolt token
e: Find Haussmann and gain 3 VP
f : If Romantics succeed their Revolution goal, they gain 8 VP

Modern can :
a-Go to the City Hall to obtain a building permit
b-Go to the "Beaux-Arts" Academy to have a Project
c-Renove a district. Haussmann must be in this district., and this district must match with the Project requirements and the building permit. This action also costs some money and Modern gains victory points (VP)
d. Pacification : a Modern token can discard an "Angry token". On a Police token can be in a revolted district and remove the token. It costs 2 millions.
e : Jail a Romantic : can be done by a Police token which is on the same district than a Romantic token, which is placd in the Fortress.

All the players can : Open/Close the Magazine in Montmartre and Go to the Observatory to change the Move Order.

Victory : there's a score track at the left of the board. The winner is the faction which have 20 VP before the end of the game or its depends of the position of the scoring cube on the track at the end of the game (1910).

name: Meeple Heist
description:
Description from the publisher:

Meeple Heist is a game inspired by the so called "Heist Movies", in which something of value has to be stolen by highly skilled individuals, with smart ideas, infiltration and great team work, usually not resorting to guns or violence.

In the game, a brave team of meeple specialists will take the challenge to perform a great robbery in the Meeple Castle, a Casino controlled by the organized crime. Coincidently, though, more than one team is trying to pull this off at the same time - and maybe even with the same specialists!

Yes, the meeples are not trustworthy and might be working for other parties (also know as other players). So, while trying to advance their own plan, players must take the challenge to discover which meeple works for whom, utilizing cunning, deduction and a bit of luck (yes, this is a dice game after all). The idea is to control your team with maximum efficiency, positioning them at the right place at the right time to execute your big plan and get away with as much money as possible from the Casino.

You will lead a charming but unreliable team of specialists: The Brain, The Face, The Muscle, The Eye, The Feet and The Fingers. In the end will you grab just a few coins or can ou pull off the most ambitious heist of all time?

In any case, just remember: don't trust the meeples!

name: Ozark: Money, Influence and Control
description: Like the television series, the board game Ozark is all about money laundering. In this territory-control game, each player's faction must control various locations from the series and try to end up with the most money at the end of the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers

name: Flügelrad
description:
When two players turn the wheel, this can be quite constructive — at least if they play a game of Flügelrad.

The game board consists of seven hexagonal spaces, each of which has a hole in its center for the impeller wheel. The game is played with marbles; each player has their own color. On your turn, you reposition the impeller wheel, then rotate it as far as you like, thus moving up to six marbles at the same time.

The first player to form a contiguous cluster of at least six of their marbles wins. But beware since you can easily move your opponent's marbles as well...

—description for the publisher

name: Era Of Inventions: The Golden Goal
description:
The Golden Goal is a small expansion for the game Era of Inventions. The expansion adds some wealth to the success of those who are ambitious, but also helps those who have bad luck in being a successful inventor!

Materials: a golden token
Preperation: at the beginning of the game, place the golden token on square 5 of the influence track

Rules: the first player who reaches or passes by square 5 gets directly 1 golden coin, and the player (or players) who are lowest on the influence track directly receive 1 cube of free choice (white, purple, grey, black or blank) out of the general reserve.

After these bonuses, the golden token is immediately placed on square 10 of the influence track, after which the same rules as above are applied. At any way, after the golden token has been reached it is moved 5 squares further on the influence track (so, from 5 to 10, from 10 to 15, from 15 to 20, and so on).

source: from the rulebook

name: Pirates of the Isles
description:
Be blown away by the whirl of adventures. Wander to distant seas where sharks, octopuses and floating isles are waiting for you. Spin the helm and go after the merchandise and gold. Your rivals will effectively spice up your trip. Great glory and an admirable sailing ship await the most audacious pirates. The game is full of adventures and unexpected twists and turns.

The goal of the game is to collect 10 gold coins. Each player complete quests, and receive rewards. You move around the board, after spinning the arrow. The players may fight each other, and intercept the cargo. Beware of sharks and octopuses. Even setting up the game is fun – first you need to construct the Pirate Galleon. Every time you attach isles to the main board, you get different setup. In the box you will find lots of different tokens, cards, modular board, and Pirate Galleon. Have fun.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bouvines 1214
description:
A fairly straightforward and simple wargame on the battle of Bouvines 1214 between the French under Philip II Augustus and the Holy Roman Empire under Otto.

The game has a single (small) map and few counters; there is no stacking. Graphics are fairly primitive but effective. The game materials are entirely in French.

name: Crisis in the Ukraine
description:
Crisis in the Ukraine is an operational level simulation of the Soviet spring offensive that resulted in the pocketing of the German First Panzer Army in March, 1944, during which eight Soviet armies, under the direction of Marshal Zhukov, encircled the German First Panzer Army. The Germans, part of von Manstein's Army Group South, executed a daring and brilliant breakout in blizzard conditions.

In this fluid game of attack and counter-attack, both players are challenged with offensive and defensive actions. The game uses the "Panzergruppe Guderian" game system with numerous variations to fit this battle.

Game Inventory:
- One 22 x 34" full color map
- One dual-side printed countersheet (200 1/2" counters)
- One 16-page rulebook
- One 6-sided dice

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2 days
Hex: 3.5 miles / 5.6 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Corps

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points

name: Hundred Kingdoms
description:
The Hundred Kingdoms is a tabletop war game that is simple enough for novice players to learn yet provides enough depth for even the most experienced of gamers. Simple, easy-to-remember rules have been developed so that gamers of all levels can play together.

The Hundred Kingdoms provides a unique combination of elements that set it apart from other tabletop war games. The fast-paced game can be learned in a very short period of time, allowing players to start battling right away.

name: Surrealist Games
description:
"Here collected for the first time is a compendium of Surrealist games, strategies, and procedures. It is for those who wish to employ for themselves the techniques of Surrealist inquiry and discovery; it sets out the rules and directions for playing the games. There has been nothing like it: much of the material gathered here has been previously documented only in obscure journals, or in magazines long since defunct and difficult to come by."

"The Surrealists initiated the most radically liberating critique of reason of the century. Their brilliant investigations were conducted through art and polemic, manifesto and demonstration, love and politics. But most specially and remarkably, it was through games, play, techniques of surprise and methodologies of the fantastic that they subverted academic modes of inquiry, and undermined the complacent certainties of the reasonable and respectable. Playful procedures and systematic stratagems provided keys to unlock the door to the unconscious and to release the visual and verbal poetry of collective creativity."

A small format book details numerous games that involve automatism, simulation, role playing, story creation, randomness, and dadaist poetics. The hardcover version also includes a full-color, fold-out gameboard for a game called "The Goose Game" with nonsensical rules, designed and produced by noted surrealist Andre Breton. A surrealist dictionary and a removable tattoo are also included with the hardcover edition.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Book, Deduction, Humor, Memory, Number, Party Game, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: The Wall Street Game
description:
The object of this stock market game is to be the first player to accumulate $1,000,000.00 in cash. Players make money by buying stocks low and selling them high, and by dividends which are paid to stockholders.

The market goes up when a stock is bought and goes down when a stock is sold. Players also get to influence the stock market when leaving the inside track and when landing on certain squares. Stocks vary in price at different rates, so the game provides a unique slide rule-like Market Level Calculator which players use to figure out how much a stock is worth at any given time.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: The Games We Played
description:
This 159-page book is a pictorial of boards and a few playing pieces from games in the New York Historical Society's collection. Really a coffee table book, there are very short descriptions of the games.

From the back cover:
The Games We Played: The Golden Age of Board and Table Games brings together more than one hundred eye-catching examples of America's most spectacular games. A veritable encyclopedia of late nineteenth- and early twentieth- century games, this playful visual survey provides a revealing look at the social values and preoccupations of the culture that produced them. Organized around themes such as moral education, city life, sports, war, and travel, this book casts its entertaining subject matter in a fascinating new light, for avid and occasional game players alike.

name: Advanced Salvo! 1939-1941
description:
"Advanced Salvo!" is a simple World War II naval wargame consisting of rules, game tables, ship counters and markers. It plays very much the same way as the Salvo! game published by Minden Games, except with further refinements. The game may be played solitaire or by two players and the rules are worded for solitaire play. Advanced Salvo! is fully compatible with the standard Salvo! game.

Published in Panzer Digest #1. Advanced Salvo! is a DTP [DeskTop-Publishing] wargame.

name: Then There Were None...
description:
From the publisher's website: A lot of creatures are disappearing because they are being over-hunted and their natural habitats destroyed. Can we do the needed research to initiate Laws and Conservation Methods to save as many endangered species as we can?

Lots of decision making for each player. The basic game plays quickly, with advanced rules for older players!

Includes: 20 endangered creature cards, 50 research, protection, hunting and habitat tokens, project marker, educational booklet with species information, rules.

Ages 9 and up

name: Quatana
description:
From the publisher's website:

Ingenious square combinations for far-sighted players.

You need an eye here for what’s important. The winner is the person who forms the most squares with his pegs. It sounds easier than it actually is because you so often overlook the most obvious solution. The game for people with strategic skills and a mind for an unusual eye view!
contents
