One gameboard (11 ¾ x 11 ¾ in./30 x 30 cm), 48 playing pegs, 28 winning points (wooden chips), large print instructions

name: Armenian Checkers
description:
It is a variant of checkers played in Armenia, where it is known as Tama.

The rules of Tama are similar to the rules of Turkish Checkers. In Tama, however, players are allowed to move (not to capture) their pieces in diagonal directions:
- ordinary checkers can move one cell sideways, one cell forward or one cell diagonally forward.
- kings can move exactly as chess queens.

The captures are exactly the same as in Turkish Checkers.

name: Flintloque Reloaded
description:
Flintloque Reloaded is a 2nd edition rule book for Flintloque after Deadloque (2nd edition) with some changes to the rules.

As with the previous editions Flintloque is a Fantasy Black powder skirmish war game rules which each fantasy race take the part of one of the nations of Valon.

Flintloque Reloaded is a set of stand alone rules with everything you need to play Flintloque, but it is missing a few of the Undead rules so you will still need a copy of Deadloque (Second Edition) if you want to play them.

The major changes from Deadloque (2nd edition) is that a skills system been added, an additional column for movement (falter), wounds are calculated differently, a points system and artillery rules.

Flintloque Reloaded was available either by it self of with a box set of miniatures.

name: Gummy Bear Factory
description:
Gummy Bear Factory is a card game designed by BGG user ralpher and his wife, Saya Tsong. Gummy Bear Factory is a Euro-style filler card game with elements inspired by great card games such as Bohnanza, Lost Cities, and Great Wall of China.

Description from TheGamecrafter.com:

Life as a worker in a Gummy Bear Factory is tough! Not only do you have to make each gummy bear by hand, you have to watch out that your sneaky coworkers don't try to build off your labors and take credit for your work!

Gummy Bear Factory is a fast-paced card game of trading and set collection for 1-5 players, playable from ages 8 and up.

The game uses unique cards composed of heads, middles or legs gummy bears in different colors. On your turn, you take or trade for gummy bear parts and try to lay down complete gummy bears of three matching cards. Players build new gummy bears or onto existing gummy bears. The game is won by the player who created the most gummy bears and scores the most bonus points for having majority control on a row. The game is easy to learn, but it takes strategy and cunning to win.

The game is inspired from European boardgame design. It emphasizes easy to teach rules, no player elimination, no language, and game mechanics that emphasize strategy and paying attention to the gameplay rather than completely luck.

Gummy Bear Factory is the only game that you can use real gummy bears in place of the included scoring winks and increase your fun! You provide your own. Symbols allow easy play for color blind players. There's also a challenging solitaire variant and special two player rules.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Trading

name: PARSEC Deluxe
description:
After millennia of shifting dominant civilizations, wars and industrialization, Homeworld became a planet that couldn’t sustain its population... Off-world migration was the last hope. When your Homeworld is nearing its demise, it is time to saddle up your rocket ship and explore the neighborhood in nearby space.

PARSEC is a tile placement game of discovery and exploration in outer space for 2 to 4 players. Featuring easy mechanics and a nimble pace, Parsec is a truly teachable game for everyone. It boasts rich, compelling Euro-style competitive gameplay as each player races to improve their positions to garner the most points and technology progress between scoring rounds. Careful placement of drawn tiles featuring sections of planets, nebulae, asteroid fields, and more is half the game, while maneuvering your rocket and carefully assigning its complement of robots for control of these key locations is equally important. Asteroids and a presence on opponent-dominated Planets garner Credits used to purchase additional actions. After the last Planet is completed, a final scoring round takes place and the winner is determined.

This is your chance to save the denizens of Homeworld; explore PARSEC today!

Note: PARSEC DELUXE includes PARSEC and its first two expansions: Moons and Monsters (#1), and Nebulas and Nanotechs (#2).

Game Data:
Complexity: 2.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 3 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each player commands a ship full of robots exploring the space around their declining homeworld

name: Playmobil: Sports & Action
description:
Soccer , Playmobil style. The Game Instructions (a seperate rulebook from the assembly instructions) include rules for handling all normal soccer rules plus games modes such as Kick and Rush and One - Two.
The goal is to score more goals than the other player, and the rulebook allows for a pre-determined number of a set time limit (as in real soccer) to determine the winner.
The game plays well, with the pitch divided into light and dark green stripes. A team is allocated to each colour and when the ball lands in your colour, you can move your two players and kick the ball. No more than two passes area allowed before a shot at goal must be taken. Goalkeepers are controlled via a stick mechanism with a spring, that allows lateral movement but also sideways dives.
The kit includes 4 players (2 per side) with kicking action, 2 balls, and a 97cm x 67cm playing surface with surrounds and a scoreboard. The kicking action is surprisingly good, and by experimenting with positioning your player around the ball, different shot strengths and aerial shots are very possible.
All in all, Playmobil has done a great job converting soccer into a fast and fun game for the whole family.

name: Smoking Gun
description:
Smoking Gun is the winner of the 2015 BGG Microgame Design Contest!

Smoking Gun, a noir tale of crimes, secrets, and investigations. Players take on the role of detectives, piecing together a central case in which their reputations (and even their lives) are at stake. In the end, only one detective will crack the case and become the hero... but at what cost?

This microgame consists of only 18 cards (plus player references), 12 of which are used in a given game. Players can enjoy one game, lasting 5-10 minutes, or a series of games, using the included "The Long Night" mode.

A complete Print & Play file (3 pages of cards, black and white, double-sided), including rules, is available.
mechanics: Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: Momentum Football
description:
From the publisher's website:

Momentum Football is truly unique in that it allows you to quickly play a full game in 15-20 minutes while yielding not only team stats, but also individual player stats. With Momentum Football you'll be able to track the following team and individual stats:Passing Attempts, Passing Completions, Total Passing yardage, Interceptions, Fumbles Lost, Sacks, Rushing Attempts, Rushing Yardage, and all scoring.

Momentum Football uses a drive-by-drive approach to resolve games. But, don’t let the simplicity fool you. Over 254 variables are used to create each team’s chart making them highly accurate for both team performance and individual player performance. And best of all, we’ve designed the game so that there is little to no set-up time involved. As you become comfortable with the rules, you’ll be able to grab two team sheets, a score sheet and four dice and begin play immediately.

Games are resolved drive-by-drive, rather than play-by-play. But, again, don’t let that fool you into thinking that individual contributions aren’t important. You’ll quickly see the impact of great rushers, passers and receivers on offense and pass rushers, cover men and big hitters on defense. So, while the game is resolved by drives, individual player contributions are the difference between winning and losing.
Don’t fret; special teams, penalties, turnovers, home field advantage, and a team’s momentum are all captured within the game. You’ll be amazed as you watch everything unfold on your tabletop just as it does in real life.

As the name of the game implies, capturing the momentum as it swings from one team to the other is a big part of the game. Our system is unique in that it doesn’t overly dominate the game mechanics nor is it over stated. However, just as in real life, a team’s momentum can mean all of the difference between winning and losing.

name: Timeline: Cannes & Cinema
description:
Timeline: Cannes & Cinema is a card game played using 55 cards. Each card depicts a Movie on both sides, with the year in which that movie was selected at the Cannes Film Festival occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Timeline: Cannes & Cinema can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

Contains 55 cards in French and 55 cards (the same) in English.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Luke Ryder
description:
The game setting is some date in the near future, after a nuclear war that destroyed much of civilization as we know it today. You play as Luke Rider who is a quiet stranger that roams the lands looking for fuel and other items to upgrade his car, bolster his defense, and survive. Along the way, Luke encounters many foes, be it a convoy of looters, a gang of hoodlums, or a person selling some upgrade parts. Money is a thing of the past. Gasoline is the now the currency.

Luke Ryder is solo deck builder. It's you against the deck. Contained in the deck are support cards, enemy, attack, defense, and deck manipulation cards.

The game was designed from the ground up to played as a solo game. That means you do not need worry about rule exceptions or solo variants in order to play the game. The game contains a deck of 54 cards. 39 of the cards in the deck are unique and 3 have multiple copies.

Luke Ryder is unique from other card games in that it contains the "The Ultimate Geek DiceDeck" system. This allows for a random enemy attack between 3 and 6 each turn and blends dice with cards without the necessity of custom dice.

name: Super-GAUdi
description:
In Super-GAUdi each player is a boss of an nuclear energy company. Each player starts with 7 barrels full of atomic waste and has to put them to one of the final storages on the playing schedule. The player that gets rid of all his barrels at first, wins the game. The clue is, that the players can either put a barrel to one of the hidden final storages or they can look if a final storage is safe or note safe. During the game each players knows some safe and some unsafe storages. After a player put a barrel with atomic waste to one of the final storage-cards, the other players can say that they don't believe that this final storage is safe. If they are right, the player has to take all the barrels on this card (up to three). If he was honest, he gives one of his barrels to the player that distrusted him.

Flavor text:
"Die Geschäfte laufen wie geschmiert, doch die Chefs der großen Atomkonzerne haben ein Problem: Sie wissen nicht wohin mit dem ganzen Atommüll. Es gilt also endlich ein "Endlager" zu finden, auf Teufel komm raus! Sei es ein gammeliges Bergwerk, ein Naturschutzgebiet oder der Kühlschrank von Mutti - no Risk, no Fun! Bleibt nur zu hoffen, dass der Bluff nicht auffliegt... Gewonnen hat derjenige Atomboss, der seinen ganzen Atommüll als Erster los ist."

name: 眠らぬ金山 (Nemuranu Kinzan)
description:
User summary
眠らぬ金山 (Nemuranu Kinzan) is a 2 player card game with players trying to recover more gold where 'The Goldmine Never Sleeps'. In this game, you will try to get more gold than your opponent by using your 8 cards and deduction skills. The player who earns 7 gold and uses their 'Holiday' before the last day, wins the game.

You can earn gold by 'Mining', or 'Rob' your opponent to sabotage their mining, or use your 'Holiday' to prevent suffering a penalty during the end of the game. Playing your cards at the best timing is crucial to win this game. The rule of this game is very simple and easy to learn even for beginners. It is an easy game to learn but it is a game which is hard to master.

Guess what your opponent would play and try to play what you want without any sabotage!

The second edition was updated and revised as follows:

In the first edition there was one Mining Area, but the second edition added three more Mining Areas and amended "the 7th day" in the standard ruleset to "the last day".
The effect of "Emergency Call" was changed so that when an opponent plays 'Off-Day', you receive 2 Money instead of placing 2 Money on the Mine.
The 7-day ruleset in the first edition has been changed to a 5-day ruleset, so descriptions were amended to change 'the 7th day' to 'the last day' or 'later days' in the rules on Off-Day and on Mine Discovery.


Publisher's summary
眠らぬ金山は、8枚のカードを駆使して相手と金（きん）を奪い合う心理戦カードゲームです
最終日までに金を先に7つ獲得し、休日を使用したプレイヤーの勝利です
金山から金を奪う「採掘」、採掘を妨害する「盗掘」、使わないと罰金がある「休日」など…出すタイミングが重要なカードばかりです
ボードゲーム初心者の方でもすぐに理解できるルールで構成されていますが、
相手が出すカードへの疑惑と、自分が通したいカードの思惑がぶつかりあう
やりごたえ十分のとても奥深いボードゲームです
publishers: Suiri Game Kenkyukai (推理ゲーム研究会)

name: Odissea: I Viaggi di Ulisse
description:
In this game, 3-6 players are Greek Gods that secretly support in a friendly or enemy way the geek hero Ulysses, coming back from the war of troy.

To come back to Itacha, Ulysses will face 7 quests like the encounter with Polyphemos, the journey in the hades, the resistance of the mermaides’ song and the meeting with Circe, the witch. In each of these encounters, each God can Change Ulysses’ main abilities (strenght, guile, oratory, luck and charisma) to make the journey easier or… much harder!

Play your abilities cards in the right moment, use special powers and try to understand who is your friend and who is your enemy as soon as possible to win this game beatiful illustrated by the italian artist “Idras”.

Odyssey is the second game of the Greek series, after Mythomakya designed by Luca Feliciani.

name: Puerto Rico: Festival en Puerto Rico
description:
A Festival is on the works in Puerto Rico, and you need to organize many things!

There are 3 tasks and you get bonus (points, money or settlers) if you are the first one doing any of them.

Promo expansion celebrating Karen & Andreas Seyfarth as special guests at the XIV Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2019.


Puerto Rico prepara un Festival y necesitamos preparativos. Quien consiga completar antes cualquiera de los objetivos será premiado por ello.

Expansión promocional y gratuita celebrando la visita de Karen & Seyfarth como invitados especiales del XIV Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2019.
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Follow, Hidden Victory Points, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Phase Order
publishers: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba, Jugamos Tod@s

name: Dragon Brew: Orctoberfest
description:
Each player is an Orc beer brewer competing in Orctoberfest, an annual beer festival. Orctoberfest culminates with a beer brewing contest judged by the tribal leaders. The winning brewer is the player who receives the most victory points.

The game is played by displaying 3 orc "judges."
On the players turn, they can either draw recipe cards, or present a beer to a judge by displaying any number of recipe cards. Other players have a chance to challenge the current recipe to that judge by offering a recipe of their own.
The recipe that matches most closely what the judge is looking for wins the judge and its blue ribbon points. On a tie, an additional BRAWL! card may be played by a player in an attempt to sway the judge. Recipes can additionally include ingredient groups which yield a gnome bonus.

name: Runes of Zun: Action Packed
description:
With the release of Runes of Zun, house-rules and modifications seem to be a natural direction for many players. Have you ever wanted to play the game without healing? Can you defeat each other if there are no Attack cards? What would happen if you just stuck another dozen and a half more actions into the base deck?

This expansion contains additional copies of action cards to play with. It's like a game mod kit. With it, you can mix in more cards to the game your own.

This Runes of Zun expansion works a bit like a “side deck” in other strategy card games or “house rules” for classic board games. Everyone has favorite cards, but with the Action Packed Expansion, you can test out crazy deck ideas. Mix up and swap out cards from the play deck, or find out just how chaotic the game can get!

-description from publisher's website

Includes the following cards:


4 Attack
2 Daze
2 Expose
2 Scramble
2 Steal
1 Banish
1 Defend
1 Revive
3 Restore
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Events, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Urto
description:
Urto. A competitive dungeon crawler for 2-5 players.

Players will explore a cave to find items and treasures, fight against against creatures and other players but always keeping an eye on other players because when the first one will go out of the cave, there will not be a lot of time to escape too. Urto will finally judge between the players that succeed to go out of the cave which one had been the best hero.

During a turn, player will move one square and will have the possibility to explore, fight, sprint or rest. To perform these actions, he will have to roll dice or to pick cards.

The game ends when there is no more living hero in the cave.

To win, players have to not die in the cave and to be the hero with the biggest score adding honour points, magic points and health points.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Race, Victory Points as a Resource

name: A Day of Infamy, The Attack on Pearl Harbor December 7, 1941
description: A two player game on the Japanese attack on the US Naval base at Pearl Harbor on Oahu, 7 December 1941. It is a two player game, with 32 counters and one 8.5" by 11" map. Rules and a separate sheet with Random Events and the Designer's Notes are included. This game came with the ATO Annual 2019, La Vendee 1793, which was published in 2021. 2 six-sided die and standard card deck (with one Joker card) are also needed to play.

name: Hippocrates: Game Brewer Promo Pack
description:
Adds 3 Goal Cards with no card text. Each offers a reward to the first player who achieves that goal.

Part of a promo pack containing cards for Arkwright TCG, Rulebenders, Stroganov, Hippocrates and Paris.

name: Kashido
description:
Japan, the old capital Kamakura. Here, in this age, you are an apprentice patissier, making traditional japanese pastries.
One day, the master gathered all his apprentices and proclaimed:
"I will employ the one who most beautifully can decorate these pastries"
Will that person be you? Can you line up the pastries prettier than everyone else?
This is an abstract open information strategy game, where you exchange places of pastries of four different colours, in order to line them up orthogonally and diagonally, and score the corresponding points.

Setup
Place the board in the play area.
Give each player a summary.
Place a cake tile on each of the 16 squares on the board, according to colour.
Put the 40 point tiles on the board edge, according to colour, with the point side face up. See to that the 10 chits in each colour are shuffled.
Choose the starting player in any suitable fashion.
Turn goes clockwise around the table; everyone takes their corresponding order chit and places before them. Everyone but the start player flips their order chit so that the special effect is face up (this effect is usable from each player's first turn)

Flow of the game
Turn goes clockwise around the table. Each turn consists of the two steps below, in order.

1: Optional: Exchange places of 2 adjacent cake tiles
Choose two orthogonally adjacent cake tiles, and swap their places.
Cake tiles are not adjacent diagonally.

2: Gain point chit
If the number of icons on a point chit matches the number of cake tiles of the chit's colour, in that row, then you gain that point chit.

You can only gain 1 point chit per turn (unless a special effect allows you otherwise).
The point chit you gain doesn't have to be related to the tiles you moved (if any)
However, if you cannot gain a point chit (or cannot see how you would be able to), regardless of whether you move cake tiles or not, you must pass your turn, without moving any cake tiles and may not take another turn until the game ends.

When you gain a point chit, put it face down to show the special effect. You cannot use a power the very turn you gained it.

Special effects of turn chits and point chits
You may use the effects of turn chits and point chits at any time during your own turn. You may use several on the same turn, but each chit is a one-time use. Once used, flip the chit to face up, so that it shows the number instead.

Explanation of the special effects
You may use the effect up to many times as the number indicates.

Turn order thics, red point chits:
You may do extra move actions

Yellow point chits:
You may gain extra point chits. However, all point chits you gain must be from the same row, and all of them have to fulfill their conditions. You may use several yellow point chits on the same turn, but all chits you gain must come from the same row.

Green point chits:
When you want to gain a point chit, you may lower the number of necessary cake tiles.
Each green point chit can only be valid for gaining one point chit. If you use several green point chits on the same turn, they have to be used for different point chits (i.e. in combination with yellow point chits)

Blue point chits have no special effect. Instead, they are worth double the points of normal point chits. Their full total points are noted on their back sides.


For all point chits, the power of the special effect is higher, the rarer the chit is.


Game and and victor
The game ends when either all point chits have been gained, or when all players have passed their turn due to not being able to gain a point chit.

The player with the highest total points wins the game. Blue point chits have the value printed on their back side (the front side doesn't count).

In case of a tie, the last player to go breaks the tie.


Tricks and tips


If you round the total points to be gained as 100, and try to aim for exceeding your player's share of those points (33 points on 3 players, 25 points on 4 players), you'll have an easier time to judge whether you're doing well or not.

name: Druids
description:
In Druids, members of different tribes compete within the Sacred Forest, with the aim of being named Archdruid. Each player controls a druid and their animal companion (specifically, a wolf) and has to manipulate the forces of nature (i.e., the four elements: water, air, fire, earth), generate magic gems, and activate a series of several druidic runes in order to succeed.

The druid who activates the most powerful series of runes will become the Archdruid of the forest.

—description from the publisher

name: Missão M
description:
In a not-too-distant place, there is a farm where the chicken Marieta and her friends live, along with the dog Matias and the cat Mia.

The chickens of Matinados farm are raised outdoors, breathe pure air and feed on 100% natural cereals, therefore, they are the happiest in Portugal. They lay organic eggs with optimal nutritional properties for our health.

Players take turns rolling the dice and moving back and forth around the farm stopping at its various gates to collect tiles.
Alternatively, players may place tiles in their hands onto their individual boards, trying to complete it.
In the end, players will score their individual boards according to the tiles placed there. Best score wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Dark
description:
A memory and bluffing game featuring monster cards from classic literature (plus some modern ones like "hunk vampire" and "teen wolf") and the neutralizer cards that can destroy them. Each monster has an ability such as triggering the top card of your discard pile. You don't play cards from your hand; you take cards from a 4-card pool and trigger the card as you take it. At the end of the game players discard down to their best 2 cards. Neutralizers then destroy their corresponding monsters, and the player with the best surviving combination of cards wins.

GOAL
End the game with the highest combined point total between your final 2 cards.

SETUP
Shuffle all cards and deal 4 face-up into the center row (the Pool), and one face- down into each player’s personal discard pile. At any time, players may look at (but not rearrange) their discard pile. Choose a random “start player” to begin.

EACH PLAYER’S TURN (proceed clockwise)
Draw a card from the Pool, say its name and number aloud, and trigger/resolve its primary ability. (If another card gets triggered, reveal it and resolve it.) Fill the Pool back to 4 from the face-down deck.

At the end of your turn, if you exceed your hand limit (3 cards), discard excess cards face-down to your discard pile. When the draw deck is empty, continue taking turns until everyone has had an equal number. Then Resolution begins.

NEUTRALIZER CARDS
These do nothing when drawn/triggered; instead they are used during Resolution. Most Neutralizers negate the points granted by 2 specific Monsters (in any players’ hands). Neutralizers are not Monsters; their points can’t be negated.

RESOLUTION (combine / score your 2 cards)
All players discard down to just 2 cards. In turn order, each player dramatically reveals their highest-number card. Then they reveal their other card. Resolve all Neutralizers. The player with the highest total score wins the game. If there is a tie, the tied player with the highest-value surviving Monster is the winner.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting

name: The Black Prince: The Battle of Navarette, 1367
description: The Black Prince: The Battle of Navarette, 1367, is a "Moment in Conflict" series game from the Great Medieval Battles System.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Agricola Ereigniskarten
description:
Agricola Ereigniskarten (Agricola Event Cards) is the collective name for new, unique Agricola cards given to attendees of various game conventions in Germany. One event card can be played at the start of a game, with the rule on the event card affecting all players.

The German text on the cards:

Bremer Spieletage: Jeder Spieler kann im Holzhaus 1 Tier, im Lehmhaus 2 verschiedene Tiere und im Steinhaus 3 verschiedene Tiere halten.
Darmstadt spielt: Alle Spieler brauchen in jeder Ernte 1 NW weniger zu bezahlen.
Spielefest Wien: Das Ausspielen von Ausbildungskarten kostet keine NW, auch wenn man schon Ausbildungen im Spiel hat.
Spielewelt in Bielefeld: Alle Anschaffungen sind für alle Spieler 1 Holz billiger.


An English translation of those cards:

Bremer Spieletage: Each player can keep 1 animal in a wood house, 2 different animals in a clay house, and 3 different animals in a stone house.
Darmstadt spielt: At each Harvest, all players need to pay 1 food less.
Spielefest Wien: The playing of Occupation cards will cost no food, even if you already have Occupations.
Spielewelt in Bielefeld: All Improvements are 1 wood cheaper for all players.

name: Mille Bornes Express
description:
I've seen a couple of express games and I believe that Mille Bornes is one missing from the lot. So, I've made a really fun twist on the game.

It's a 2-4 player game. Each player begins with a set of 7 Dice. Players roll all their remaining dice each on their turn and select only one die. Following the rules applied to each face, players will give hazards and find remedies to the hazards the other players have given them. Once all dice have been selected, players count their points for the round, take their dice back and another round begins. Once a player achieves exactly 1000 points then that player is the winner.

name: La Bataille d'Anthon, 11 juin 1430
description:
A simple tactical wargame covering the battle of Anthon 1430 in France, between the Prince of Orange, ally of the Burgundians, and Bernard de Saluces, allied to the King of France.

The wargame uses the Au fil de l'épée game system published in Vae Victis magazine #45, emphasizing on leaders command.

It includes:
- a 29 x 21 cm map
- 25 counters to be cut out and mounted
- a one-page scenario rules (in French)

name: Costume Party
description:
Costume Party is a quick card game about bluffing, memory, and looking great. The goal is to score the most points among several rounds of play by wearing certain costumes.

Each round, players have a hand of three cards and can play one of five corny costumes -- Vampire, Mummy, Robot, Ghost, Zombie, or one half of a Horse costume -- and each costume works a little differently. For example, you win 6 points if you and another player can coordinate a Horse costume... but lose 3 points if you go as just a Horse's bottom.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game

name: Myth: Tailless Minion Pack
description:
From the publisher's website:

After the Gloaming and the corruption of their King, the Huranii became frenzied tools of the Darkness. With the ritual sacrifice of their tail, they claim complete servitude to the Rat King. Tailless are quick but cowardly, preferring to strike the least threatening and weakest targets until they can swarm over their stronger enemies.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Kingdomino for 2 players
description:
A promotional demo version of Kingdomino, released in the Stadt Land Spielt! Sonderdrucke 2018, a give-away bag for the "Stadt Land Spielt!" event on Sep. 8th and Sep. 9th 2018 in Germany and Austria. It consists of just 24 Dominoes tiles and is therefore only for two players. This version is made of one sheet (DIN A3, folded to DIN A4) of thin cardboard, supposed to be cut out with a pair of scissors. The rules are printed on part of the same sheet.

—user summary
categories: City Building, Fantasy, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement
publishers: Blue Orange (EU), Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Pegasus Spiele

name: Ka Pai: Orokohanga
description:
In Ka Pai – Orokohanga the original rule of writing both symbols if you roll two identical symbols no longer exists. In every roll you must draw one symbol. But when you write a symbol in a space with a colored icon, you must also draw that second symbol in a space with an identical colored border. You don’t need to follow the normal placement rules when drawing in a space with a coloured border - you may choose any matching coloured space on the sheet with a border of that colour.

—description from publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Futari Machi
description:
Futari Machi ("Two people town") is a 2-player game of town development.

You and your partner are assigned to do development planning for two towns that are separated by a river respectively. Let’s build colorful buildings and make a charming town to attract many residents to your own town. For example, students like to have more entertainment areas and marathon runners desire longer roads. A pair of twin babies may turn up in a town with excellent environment.

The player who has gained the most residents is the winner.
publishers: イマジンゲームズ (imagine GAMES)

name: Ninja Dice/Zpocalypse Exclusive Cards
description:
This pack contains four collectible Ninja Dice themed promo cards for Zpocalypse, released exclusively to backers of Ninja Dice on Kickstarter. They add new Armory Cards to the game.
The cards also come packaged with four location cards for Ninja Dice
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Pentaquark: QCD Pack 2 – Bosons
description: Bosons is a 3-card micro-expansion for Pentaquark that brings a new level of complexity to the game. Played like event cards, when a Boson card is drawn it is used to change the flavor of a quark in play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Pope Joan
description:
Pope Joan is a card game of the "Stops" type, named after a legendary female Pope of the 9th century. An ordinary pack is used, from which the eight of diamonds has been removed, and a special round board in the form of eight compartments, named respectively Pope-Joan, Matrimony, Intrigue, Ace, King, Queen, Knave and Game (King, Queen and Knave are sometimes omitted).

Each player – any number can play – contributes a stake, of which one counter is put into the divisions Ace, King, Queen, Knave and Game, two into Matrimony and Intrigue, and the rest into Pope-Joan. This is called "dressing the board." The cards are dealt round, with an extra hand for "stops," i.e. cards which stop, by their absence, the completion of a suit; thus the absence of the nine of spades stops the playing of the ten. The last card is turned up for trumps.

Cards in excess may be dealt to "stops," or an agreed number may be left for the purpose, so that all players may have an equal number of cards. If an honor or "Pope" (nine of diamonds) is turned up, the dealer takes the counters in the compartment so marked. Sometimes the turning-up of Pope settles the hand, the dealer taking the whole pool. The Ace is the lowest card, the King the highest. The player on the dealer's left plays a card and names it, the player who has the next highest then plays it, till a stop is played, i.e. a card of which no one holds the next highest. All Kings are of course stops, also the seven of diamonds; also the cards next below the dealt stops, and the cards next below the played cards. After a stop the played cards are turned over, and the player of the stop (the card last played) leads again.

The player who gets rid of all his cards first takes the counters in "Game," and receives a counter from each player for every card left in his hand, except from the player who may hold Pope but has not played it. The player of Ace, King, Queen or Knave of trumps takes the counters from that compartment. If King and Queen of trumps are in one hand, the holder takes the counters in "Matrimony", if a Queen and Knave, those in "Intrigue", if all three, those in the two compartments; if they are in different hands these counters are sometimes divided. Unclaimed stakes are left for the next pool. Pope is sometimes considered a universal "stop."

Re-implements: Jeu du Nain Jaune
publishers: MacGregor Historic Games, Nothing by Chance, Ltd.

name: Nessie's True Identity
description:
"Could it be what I think it is...!?"

As the only witness to the mythic creature, you are determined to protect Nessie's romance and mystery, while also providing hints to the enthusiasts to promote the creature's popularity. Enthusiasts, get on the search boat to discover Nessie's True Identity! Will the truth be uncovered? Or will the mystery deepen?

To play the game, place the Nessie figure on one end of the table and the ship on the other end, with the five characters W H A T ? lying down between them. If you are the lead player, think of any noun to serve as Nessie's true identity. (Proper nouns are discouraged.) The other players — the Nessie fanatics — now try to guess this identity.

At the start of a round, you give a one-word hint to the hidden identity. Each fanatic then makes one guess about this identity in whatever order they want. If none of the guesses are close to Nessie's identity, move the ship farther away from Nessie and stand up one of the letters; if any guesses are close but not correct, move the ship closer to Nessie, then stand up one of the letters.

If one of the guesses matches the identity, don't reveal this when the player guesses. Instead, at the end of the round after all players have guessed, move the ship adjacent to Nessie. On the count of 3, each fanatic must point to the person who they think gave the correct answer, which might be themselves. If more than half the fanatics identify the correct guess, they win; if not, then you win. If five rounds pass and no one has guessed the correct answer, then you'll all be staring at WHAT? and realizing that the clue giver didn't do a good job.

Nessie's True Identity includes a scoring system in case you want to have everyone be the clue giver once and keep track of points earned over multiple games.

The second edition of Nessie's True Identity features larger components and reorganized rules, along with a new sighting information card, coverage board, and pen.

name: Toxic Potato
description:
You will have to keep your eyes peeled so you know where the Toxic Potatoes are and how to keep them out of your hand.

Using a variety of special spuds at your disposal, you’ll pass, peel, steal, buy, and fry your way to survival. The last yam standing owns bragging rights, at least until the next game.

Toxic Potato is simple enough for younger kids to pick up, and strategic enough for adults to have a blast playing together. Easy to learn and quick to play, this is the game you will reach for again and again… Yes, just like that bag of potato chips on game night…

The rundown:

Everyone except one player is dealt a Toxic Potato.
Use your action cards—and a bit of luck—to pass Toxic Potatoes to others.
When a Radioactive or Hazmat card is played, anyone holding a Toxic Potato gets mashed!
But hold on, you've got a Detox or No Way card to save your Buttato!
Last spud standing is the Championchip… at least until the next round.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Take That

name: VI Caesars
description: The ancestor to Milton-Bradley's Conquest of the Empire (CotE), except this game uses flat cardboard pieces rather than plastic figurines. The rules are of interest as CotE variants. It also seems the map changed somewhat between VI Caesars and CotE.

name: Dragon Rush: The Card Game
description:
Mama dragon had cute little dragons, and now the gem rush has begun!

Dragon Rush: The Card Game is based on mus and poker, with players using combinations of coins (copper, silver and gold) and gems (onyx, sapphire, ruby, topaz, emerald and diamond) in order to achieve the better hand. Some cards (stone, sulphur and dragon eggs) can be used to spoil the game of the opponents when discarded.

•••

Mamá dragón ha tenido lindos bébé dragón... ¡la lluvia de gemas ha comenzado!.

Un juego de cartas basado en el mus y el poker, donde los jugadores obtienen combinaciones de monedas (cobre, plate y oro) y gemas (Ónice, zafiro, rubí, topacio, esmeralda y diamande) para conseguir la mejor mano. Algunas cartas (piedra, azufre y huevos de dragón) pueden ser utilizados para fastidiar el juego de los rivales cuando son descartados.

name: Zategy
description: It seems simple: Lay 4 squares in a row while preventing the others to lay their 4 squares in a row before you.

name: 3House
description:
From the makers of Icehouse comes a new collection of games designed for their hit game Treehouse!

3House contains three games that can be played using three copies of Treehouse.

Black Ice: You need a three-digit password to hack into the computer system, but the Intrusion Countermeasure System (ICE) is waiting to get you if you have the wrong code!

Martian Chess: Using your pieces in a corner of the board, position your pieces to attack and capture pieces from other players. Lose all your pieces and it's game over!

Binary Homeworlds: In this two-player adaptation of the popular Homeworlds game, your pieces become a space fleet trying to control your sector of space. Build new ships, explore the galaxy, and attack your opponents! Protect your home world at all costs or it's game over!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Pattern Building, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Move & Groove
description: Move & Groove is the perfect first game for toddlers! Designed to inspire movement, creativity, laughter and learning, it’s a fun way to introduce the basics of game play and the joy of movement without the pressure of competition. The rules are simple—toss the plush cube to determine color, choose a matching colored card and perform the given move. There’s no right or wrong way to boogie—it’s all up to interpretation—so players can use their imagination while improving balance, coordination and flexibility. The perfect game to build confidence and celebrate all the things your little one does so well!

name: Städtetour
description:
From the publisher's Web site:

Paris, Berlin, London - you are off on an exciting city tour! However, rather quickly it becomes evident that everyone wishes to visit a different city! So everyone attempts to direct the journey so that the next bus stop will be at one's planned destination. In the end, who will have visited the most of their favorite cities? An exciting competitive game for 2-4 globetrotters ages 6-99.

name: Time's Up! Oranje Editie
description:
Time's Up! Oranje Editie (Orange edition) is a new edition of popular Time's Up! game especially suited for the Dutch market.

In this party game two teams of two or more players compete to guess as many famous persons or personalities as possible.

In each of the three rounds, the members of a team try to let their teammates guess as many names as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed to describe the person or personality. In round 2 and 3 the same set of personalities is used again, but in round 2 only one word can be used and in round 3 only sounds and gestures are allowed.

name: Bloody Mary:  Further Intrigue in the Tudor Court
description:
In this game you get to relive the politics of middle Tudor England as you plot to secure your candidate for the Throne...and keep your own head.

The game starts at the coronation of Henry VIII's son Edward. It follows the history of mid-Tudor England for a further 25 years. You play the part of a faction of courtiers trying to preserve your power and influence.
categories: Card Game, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play, Renaissance

name: Brainstrain
description:
Quick! Put on your brain strain strap (but don't look!) You've got 60 seconds to ask as many questions as you possibly can to discover who you are, where you are, or what you are! The players choose the words for Brainstrain!

One little catch...the answers to the questions can only be "yes", "no", "kinda", or "could be."

Be the first person to finish in all three categories, person, place and thing to be the winner!

2001 Mensa Select

name: Die Naschbären
description:
From the box:
From the tree cabin the smart raccoons see exactly where the delicious tidbits are. As soon as they spot the apples, lollipops, carrots or fish, they are off. As the little fellows all have a sweet tooth, they even chase each other sometimes in order to get the biggest bounty for themselves. A turbulent dice game played inside the game box.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Flummoxed
description:
The Foreign Language Bluffer’s Game

Don’t worry if you are completely floored by Finnish or totally baffled by Bulgarian. It doesn’t matter a jot if Japanese is all Greek to you and Swahili sounds like Double Dutch. Nothing’s lost if you’re ineffective in Efik and totally hopeless in Hopi. Anyone who can bluff in English, can certainly flummox in Flummoxed and thoroughly enjoy this marvellous play on words.

At the beginning of each round, one player, The Reader, picks up a card. Printed on one side of the card are background notes on a foreign language. On the other side are six words in that language, plus an English definition of each word.

The Reader reads one word aloud, revealing the language from which the word comes, but not the meaning of the word. Each other player has to ‘translate’ the given word and write a fake but plausible definition for it in an attempt to bluff fellow players into believing the definition is correct.

Age 8+

For 4+ Players

Product Contents
120 x Cards representing different languages
1 x Writing Pad
1 x Die
1 x Set of Rules

Product Safety
Not suitable for children under 36 months

name: Strategic Sekigahara
description:
Strategic Sekigahara consists of 198 pieces,84 cards, a 58 x 82 cm map (printed in Japanese) and 7 pages of rules (in Japanese).

The map area is Osaka to Yamagata. An unit is nearly two thousands soldiers. Player numbers are from two to four and playing time is about six hours.

Strategic Sekigahara covers battles of Uesugi to the battle of Sekigahara in 1600. Players become Ieyasu Tokugawa who is the first shogun in edo age and Anti-Tokugawa Allies. Anti-Tokugawa Allies have mightily strength. But they are separated in West and East Japan. And some lords' morale are very low. One or some lord(s) will be betrayed by Ieyasu Tokugawa in playing a game. Anti-Tokugawa Allies are demanded tenacious battles.

Solitaire Suitabilty: Low (Low-Medium-High)
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Battalions In Crisis!
description: "Battalions In Crisis" is a World War II tactical miniatures game based on the old TSR "Tractics" rules.

name: Pocket Geni: Militärhistoria
description:
Swedish trivia game in the Geni series. This one is co-published by a military history book club/association. Questions on Swedish and international military history written by colonel Einar Lyth.

Contents:
75 cards with 450 questions on military history
One pad of score sheets
2 special dice
1 pencil

12 years and up. Playable in teams, so in theory it accommodates 24 people or even more.

From the summary of other Geni titles:
Players roll a die to determine what category of question to answer. If they answer it correctly, they get to mark one such symbol on a score sheet. The goal is to score a complete line across the score sheet. There is also a twelve-sided die with "GENI" on some of the faces. If a player rolls that and gets "GENI", he gets to choose what category question to answer. If he gets a blank face, he doesn't get any question at all this turn.

name: California: Bonuskarten Katalogedition 7
description:
This is an expansion to California that is found on the back of Abacus Spiele's catalogs.

Three new scoring cards are added to the game. They are:


The first player to fulfill the conditions matching a bonus card already claimed by another player, takes this new wild bonus card instead. (1 point)
The first player who obtains a gift takes this bonus card. (2 points)
The first player who obtains two value 2 bonus cards takes this bonus card. (2 points).


Unlike the postcard expansion, where you use only 1 out of the 3 new cards in each game, you use all the cards provided in this game.

Also part of the expansion NEUE BONUSKARTEN.

name: Zombie Office
description:
'Zombie Office' begins with players attending another boring birthday party at the office. The boss is leading them in a verse of 'happy birthday' when an accumulation of chemicals finally take their hold on his squishy brain, turning him into an enraged, flesh-craving zombie. Run for your LIVES!!!

Run into nearby rooms, search for office supplies to use as weapons and other useful items, screw over your coworkers or work together to survive; but remember, there's only one first-place!

One player starts as the original zombie and chases down the human players, attacking and changing them into fellow zombies whom join in the frenzy, hopefully infecting everyone before the police arrive.

"This job really bites!"
categories: Fighting, Horror, Humor, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Square Grid

name: Kleurenkapers!
description:
Kleurenkapers! is a tactical board game for 2 to 4 players, in which the arrangement of the game board will be different each time the game is played.
The aim of the game is to collect as many coins as possible by placing your pawn directly on or next to a triangle of a certain colour.
Throw, steal or mix die colours to find out who wins or loses any coins.
With coins you can buy or conquer tokens and move your pawn.
The first player placing his pawn on the grey triangle while owning six different tokens, wins the game.

name: Trade and Treachery: Western Europe 1494-1610 – Field of Glory Renaissance Gaming Companion
description:
While the Renaissance was a time of innovation and inspiration in art, literature and science, so too was it a period of military progress. From the rise of gunpowder as a battlefield-dominating weapon to the tactical genius of Machiavelli, the Italian Wars were the first step on this journey. With detailed army lists, historical overviews, maps and artwork, Trade and Treachery provides aspiring condottieri with everything they need to take over the armies of the Italian City States, and of the European powers of the 16th century, and lead them to glory.

Available December 21, 2010.

(taken from Amazon.com product description)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Dune: Variant Cards
description:
A set of 8 new Dune Treachery cards printed on 1 sheet of cardstock with 2 pages of accompanying rules. These names and effects have precedent in the books or movie, primarily the books.

The cards are: Weather Scanner, Smuggler, Troop Carrier, Dust Chasm, Juice of Sapho, Imperial Conditioning, Break Imperial Conditioning, Weirding Way.

These were published in The VIP of Gaming Magazine, Issue #2 Feb/Mar 1986



Summary of EffectsWeather Scanner: Allows a non-Fremen player to examine the next weather token.
Smuggler: Steal spice from another player, stealing more for each desert territory you control.
Troop Carrier: Make a second shipment of troops to Dune, paying the Guild as usual.
Dust Chasm: Destroy all non-Fremen units in the space where a Spice Blow just occurred, and no units may move into or through the space this round. Fremen units which stay in the space will also be destroyed. Can't be played if a worm appears.
Juice of Sapho: After a player has committed their cards to a battle, look at the entirety of their remaining hand before making your own choice.
Imperial Conditioning: For one battle only, before players have committed cards to a battle, your leader cannot turn traitor.
Break Imperial Conditioning: Cancel Imperial Conditioning when it is played in your battle.
Weirding Way: Before any part of a battle occurs, play to double the casualties that battle inflicts on your opponent.



Suggested UseFive cards without effects are included in the base game, and two more 'useless' cards are added in Dune: Spice Harvest and Dune: The Duel. This variant suggests replacing those seven cards with the first seven of the variant cards, and to, once someone has blown the Shield Wall, replace the Family Atomics card with Weirding Way and/or have that card function as Weirding Way.

An alternate method suggested is to buy an additional full set of Treachery cards and overwrite the normal effects with the variant card effects (pasting the new image onto the card, or for a more modern audience, using sleeves and inserts).



Interaction with other ExpansionsThe 'Reviving the Ghola'/Bene Tleilax expansion adds additional uses for the 'useless' Treachery cards. If the variant cards replace useless cards and that variant is also in use, they should be marked to indicate that they also count as 'useless' cards for the Tleilaxu's purposes. The alternate method is probably preferable if these are used together.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Bluff
description: The object of the game is to guess the real description of a word from the actual answer and other players bluffs. Each player takes a Bluff sheet amd writes their initials in the name space. One player is the reader for each round and they take a question card and select a word from it. The other players al write down a Bluff description of the word and the reader writes the true definition. The reader then reads all definitions out and each player has to try and guess the true definition of the word. Each player who correctly guesses the true definition scores a point and at the end of the round the next player becomes the reader. The most points at the end of a specified number of rounds is the winner. The game is presented in a smart tin with a bevelled edge and a plastic insert and is shrink wrapped for further protection.

name: Ultra Starfire
description:
ULTRA STARFIRE is the fifth edition of the Starfire game system. Continuing improvements on the basic Starfire combat system, Ultra Starfire is comprised of two parts: the tactical combat system and the campaign system.

The tactical combat system is a fast-paced fleet-level war game of starship combat, still using the same simple combat system designed back in 1976. The campaign system is an empire-level economic war game where the player starts with an alien race on a single world and attempts to conquer the galaxy. Battles from the campaign system are played-out using the tactical system.

Ultra Starfire is a partial rewrite to Galactic Starfire, Fourth edition. Ultra Starfire was designed for completely balanced game play in a player versus player competitive environment. While it could still be used for story-based games, the appendixes and additional material was designed for shorter competitive campaigns.

Ultra Starfire was the first all-electronic product from the SDS, sold as a set of cross-linked PDF files, but still used the counters and map sets from Galactic Starfire.

Re-implements:

Galactic Starfire

name: DragonClash
description:
DragonClash is a game of strategic combat between mighty dragons of legend and is set in a war-torn, modern-day world. After centuries of abuse from mankind, the dying spirit of Earth has called out to the dragons with hopes they’d help better humanity and reshape the world in elemental harmony. However, the destruction and violence that gave rise to their birth also tainted the dragons, driving them mad with a lust for war. Now the dragons not only battle humanity, but themselves. Ruthlessly hunting for the dragon eggs to satiate their endless hunger for power, the dragons wage an eternal struggle for dominance and the very soul of Earth.

In DragonClash, you are the dragon, hatching your beast from a variety of decks geared towards a specific breed and play style. The core set of DragonClash includes the Red Breather, Blue Adept, Silver Channeler, and Brown Mauler decks. Each deck of 72-cards includes a dragon and a variety of attacks unique to that deck’s theme.

To claim victory, your dragon must win the opponent’s Dragon Egg Card. You can do this by either forcing your opponent to discard his Dragon Egg or by consuming your opponent’s hoard with a Feast card, while a Dragon Egg is hidden there. Players take turns feeding their dragon’s hoard, aging from hatchling to elder wyrm, training a variety of attacks, and engaging in combat. Executing attacks, playing effects, and taking damage depletes your dragon’s Essence (the playing deck) and when a player’s dragon has exhausted all of their Essence, they must flee and lose the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Environmental, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: The Game Crafter, LLC, WarSpider Entertainment, LLC

name: Scandinavia (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Scandinavian map and several new action cards for Ticket to Ride like

Veto: Card owner may stop other players building a route
Public Line: One route is build by a public company. This route is available for all players
Ghost Line: At the end of the game, an unused route can be claimed in exchange for four victory points
Jackpot: The player can pick up all 5 open train / waggon cards


etc.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation, Travel

name: Der Kleine Prinz: Planetenwanderer
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Der Kleine Prinz: Planetenwanderer, the serpent and its evil helpers – the darklings – are darkening one planet after another, bring the residents misfortune. The players must help the little prince find the darkened planets in space and get rid of the evil power of the snake. Whoever has a good memory will find the planet with the help of the gyroscope has a good chance of breaking the power of the serpent and winning the game. Hurry, though, as the snake is already gathering its forces...

name: Battleship Tactics
description:
Battleship Tactics is a customizable game in the style of battleship/salvo, in which players try to locate and sink a hidden enemy naval fleet. Prior to the game, you build a custom fleet and a custom deck of cards from a large available pool. The fleet is then deployed and the cards are used during the game to provide special attacks and other special powers. There are also several pre-constructed fleets that demonstrate diverse strategic paths.

The components can be procured by combining 4 sets of commercial Battleship and/or printing out the necessary materials from the PnP files. There are also templates for building the ships out of Lego bricks.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Black Legion
description:
From the publisher:

Black Legion: A Codex Supplement
For Tens of Thousands of years the Black Legion has fought the armies of the false Emperor, striking out from the Eye of Terror to sow ruin and madness among the stars. In their wake, worlds burn to ash and the screams of the damned echo in the warp.

This supplement to Codex: Chaos Space Marines allows you to turn your Citadel miniatures collection into a mighty host of Black Legion, bringing fire and death to the Imperium.

Within the 72 pages of this book you will find:

- The story of Black Legion's fall from grace and rise to power, including the tale of their infamous Warmaster, Abaddon the Despoiler.

- A showcase of Chaos Space Marine Citadel miniatures, presenting warband colours and icons of the Black Legion

- A set of supplemental rules including Warlord Traits and Chaos Artefacts that, along with Codex: Chaos Space Marines, allow you to assemble your Black Legion models into a force for Warhammer 40,000 battles

- A series of narrative missions that enable you to play through Black Legion's bloody history, alongside a set of Altar of War missions that showcase the Black Legion's deadly tactics.

Black Legion is designed work alongside the rules found in Codex: Chaos Space Marines, which you will need in order to field a Black Legion collection on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Gartenglück
description:
Everything grows and prospers, butterflies and snails crawl happily around the garden. Two funny game ideas where you should remember where all your little garden friends have hidden to collect as many clovers as possible.

Two spring-like memory games for 2-4 players. Contents: 1 die, 9 cloverleaves and 9 round garden friend cards.

You start by rolling a die. The die indicates who are the three garden friends you have to search for now:
On the die appears a color? Search for the snail, the flower and the butterfly of this color.
On the die appears the snail, the flower or the butterfly? Search for the corresponding friend in all three colors (pink, yellow and blue).

If you can locate your three cards you receive a cloverleaf as reward. The game ends as a player has collected three cloverleaves. This player wins the game.

name: Epic Death! Seven Card Bonus Pack
description:
From Epic Death! Kickstarter Page:

The Bonus Pack adds a whole new element to your game: Events! These testing trials will appear early on in your adventures and will need to be dealt with quickly if you're to become truly Epic heroes. The Booster Pack also comes with two exclusive Fate cards: the Nerf Bat and Potion of Imba... perfect if you're looking to really turn the tide!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Pixel Tactics: Smasher / Paul Peterson
description:
Pixel Tactics promo card.

Card text: When the game begins, draw one card, then select two cards from your Hand and remove them from play. This Leader gains both of those cards' Leader Abilities.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies – Movie Buffs Expansion
description:
Adds over 70 influential or otherwise notable movies, actors, and directors to your Cinelinx game.

Includes blank Cinelinx cards to customize your deck even further!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dodgy Dealers
description:
Dodgy Dealers is a collection/deception card game where 2-4 players (up to 12 players with expansions) race to complete their collection and cash in on their contracts. Throughout the game you source your art exclusively on the black market, which is unfortunately full of forgeries and questionable characters. Be the first to reach four genuine contracted artworks to win the game.
​​
Forgeries, Fakes and Fakers! - Work your way through the game by determining which artworks are genuine and which are forgeries. Fake paintings aren't worth anything, but keeping them in your gallery might make opponents think they're authentic!

Multiple paths to victory - Stage heists and steal paintings from opposing players or work through the Black Market to be the first Dodgy Dealer to fulfil their contract.

Completely open trading system - Trades can be struck between any players on a one-for-one basis. Trade face up or face down, be honest or be deceitful, even trade contracts and completely mix up gameplay!

Be secretive - Players must leave their gallery of paintings facedown on the table and may only rearrange them during their own turn.

Be cunning - The pick up and discard systems allow players to develop complex strategies; like removing opponents desired cards out of the game or discarding one of your own contracted paintings temporarily for safety.

Designed with REAL artworks. Dodgy Dealers features paintings of Van Gogh, Claude Monet, Edvard Munch and John Singer Sargent. Eight more artists are available through add-on packs. These include Winslow Homer, James Whistler, Leonardo Da Vinci, Caravaggio, Johannes Vermeer, Rembrandt, William Turner and Eugene Delacroix.

Change the art or invite more to the party - These add-on packs add additional artists of various styles and nationality into the game as well as increasing the game size by two players. Every game comes with enough cards for a four player game but is compatible with up to twelve.

name: Pixel Tactics: Game Informant / Ryan Metzler
description:
Pixel Tactics promo card from Dice Tower 2014 campaign.

Card text: As an action, you may place a chip on a Hero or move it to a new Hero. Each chip has a different effect:
Snail: Hero has Intercept.
Target: Hero has Ranged Attack.
First: Hero's first melee attack is a free action.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Vanagard
description:
Vanagard is a collaborative story telling game that utilizes some role-playing and board-game elements. At its core, it's a game of exploration, teamwork and adventure.

2-6 players will take turns revealing story cards and weaving a continuous story that will take their Vanfolk on an unforgettable adventure. While one player weaves a tale inspired by the story card, the others will play their Vanfolk, overcoming the challenges presented. Each player at the table will get a chance to reveal a story card and will get to spin their portion of the story. If you like the stories of Narnia and Red Wall, this game is for you.

The simple core mechanics ensure that Vanagard is playable by a wide range of player, from age 7 to 77. There are 6 talents in the game, and they appear on both Nature cards and Talent cards. These talents are used to overcome the challenges presented in the scene. Runes are drawn to set type and difficulty of the challenge.

Players may create their Vanfolk characters as they play, ensuring that you can jump right into the action from the moment you open up the box.

EXTEND the game with new card decks. As the Vanfolk increase their level, add-on decks present a natural evolution to the rules. These add-on decks include magic items (relics), spells, profession cards and other goodies that evolve the Vanfolk as they embark on a series of adventures.

Add-on decks will also include new tools for the story-teller, in the form of challenge decks, story plots and many more interesting features. All of these are optional add-ons allowing you to tailor the game experience to your personal taste.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Exploration, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Kethra A'laak – Hero Expansion
description:
The most terrifying witch of the blood coven takes her command with the Kethra A'laak Hero Expansion Pack for Runewars Miniatures Game! This sorceress ruthlessly leads the Uthuk Y'llan's forces either astride her loyal flesh ripper or on the front lines among the howling berserkers. Feed you blood lust and conquer the realm for the locust swarm!

—description from the publisher

name: Jackal Archipelago: Island of Thousands Caves
description: Jackal Archipelago: Island of Thousands Caves is a new island that supplements the four islands included in the Jackal: Archipelago base game, allowing for larger islands to be created. Unique tiles of this set include caves and the wheelbarrow.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Not Your Game
description: A CYOA book with a legacy mechanic that allow many players to play with the same book in order to complete the adventure, this is the first episode of a series that explores how CYOA books can improve and mutate by introducing modern game mechanics in it

name: Bam-Bam Race
description:
Bam-Bam Race is a wacky racing game to see who can get to the finish line and manage to stay there until the end of the round. Follow Bam-Bam and his friends to celebrate Indonesian independence day.

Designed to be a grab-and-play game, Bam-Bam Race is easy to set up. Also, it is easy to learn, so your new friends can jump in and play, but still offer strategies to keep you entertained.
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Hand Management, Modular Board, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Track Movement, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Grand Sumo
description:
Grand Sumo is a 2-player card game based on the 1,500 year old sport of sumo wrestling, in which you will be programming your wrestler’s actions through card play and aim to either push you opponent out of the ring, or wrestle him to the ground.

Like real sumo bouts, you can attempt to attack aggressively in hope of a quick victory, or try to outwit and outlast your opponent.

Each bout in Grand Sumo consists of 3 contacts, where you will simultaneously program your wrestlers' actions by playing cards face down in front of you. When both players are ready, the cards are revealed one at a time, and resolved as pushing, wrestling and defensive actions in the ring.

The player who manages to push or rotate the wrestlers token to meet a winning condition wins the bout, and the first player to win 3 bouts will be crowned the winner of Grand Sumo.

-description from designer

name: Naruto Boruto Card Game: Naruto & Naruto Shippuden Set
description:
The Naruto Boruto Card Game features cards with original illustrations of beloved characters from the animated series Naruto, Naruto Shippuden, and Boruto. Players can assemble teams including the original Team 7’s Naruto, Sasuke, and Sakura; the new generation’s Boruto, Sarada, and Mitsuki; and the Uchiha clan. Create your own legendary ninja team, and see if the power of teamwork and friendship will help you prevail over your opponent!

The Naruto & Naruto Shippuden Set contains characters from those two anime series in two decks of fifty cards, a shared sideboard of eight cards, twelve double-sized cards, two turn-sequence cards, a play manual, and two play sheets. Cards from this set can be mixed and matched with cards from other Chrono Clash titles to create a variety of decks or to introduce multiplayer action.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Gold Beach Landings
description:
Part of Against the Odds Magazine's Pocket Battle Games series, this is the third of their "Five For Fighting" series of linked games covering the D-Day invasion.

LPS Pocket Battle Game #23

name: Catan: Core + China Map
description:
Trade, build and develop in this classic trading game!

Your settlers seek to tame the remote isle of Catan. Guide your settlers to victory by making clever trades and by building up your villages and cities. Your holdings grow and expand by trading with the other players, building roads and villages in prosperous places on the board.

Beside the Catan base game, it includes a China map with new rules and Chinese building miniatures. In the China map version, player can connect their town to the monument and gain a victory point. Other than building towns and cities, players need to sponsor the building of the Great Wall, to please the Emperor which will gain you victory point as well.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Cat Café: Promo Essen Spiel'2019
description: 8 promo cards released on Essen Spiel '19 with additional rules for the base game

name: Qwuzzle
description:
Start by taking a set of nine Qwuzzle cubes and a grid. Now draw six of the ‘basic’ cards. Each card displays an image which needs to feature in the 3x3 grid that you will build with your cubes. The image can be positioned anywhere within the grid, and on any rotation. Your aim is to build all six images in to your grid at the same time, before the time runs out.

Play against the clock or against an opponent, with two sets of cubes and two grids included.

Ready for the challenge to get harder? Introduce the ‘advanced’ cards to make your task even trickier.
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, The Happy Puzzle Company, TWOPLUS Games

name: Horseshoes & Hand Grenades
description:
Horseshoes and Hand Grenades is a card flipping game of skill, strategy and luck. Players flip or drop cards onto a bandanna battlefield, attempting to score more points by grouping their soldiers together, getting soldiers into the double score bunker, and removing their opponent’s key scoring cards.

The game includes high-quality plastic coated playing cards and a camouflage bandana that becomes the field of play. The game’s box innovatively opens into game components, the jeep and the bunker. Whimsical cartoon soldiers illustrated by Monte M. Moore make the game as attractive as it is enjoyable.

Group your soldiers into stacks containing sergeants and generals to increase your stack multiplier. Soldiers landing face down are injured, but can still be scored if you reach them with your medic. Cards that are flipped or dropped into the central bunker score double. Evacuate your high scoring stack before your opponent drops the bomb, get the highest score and win the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Black Party: Ruhe in Frieden, Sherlock
description:
In Black Party the players embody figures who are involved into a spectacular murder case. One of the players is the murderer. But the others also have their dirty secrets or a motive and each of them have an extra task that only they know.
The group decides by guessing and reconstructing the crime who is the murderer and afterwards the players see if the group was on the right track. So it's about getting away with life. Because what good is it to be innocent if the others think you are guilty?

In Black Party - Ruhe in Frieden, Sherlock the world-famous detective Sherlock Holmes was strangled on his way home from his favorite opium den in a cab. Who is the murderer?
publishers: Gen-X Games, Group SNE, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Faction Fighters
description:
A storm of Power Orbs mysteriously rains on the world. Lead a team of creatures in card power combat to claim valuable treasures and powerful Orbs. Activate abilities with perfect timing to crush the competition and become the area champion!

A game of Faction Fighters takes place at one of four unique area deck locations: Starfall Fields, Gem Hollow, Doomsday Bay, or Shard Peak. Compete each round for an event card by having the highest total strength of fighters. Simultaneously play a fighter to scout the field, then either choose to bolster with additional cards or hold back for future rounds. Plan your moves wisely- only one faction can join the fight each round. Obtain the most Victory Points by the end of the area deck to win.

Draft a custom deck from a pool of 15 different factions. Each faction has its own strategic flare, allowing fighters to unleash devastating ability combos. Swarm the field with a squad of snakes or control the future with mind reading koalas! Immerse yourself in the characters and story with the scenario comic book.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: Na jagody!
description: Na jagody! is the first board game for kids, their friends and parents. Forest dwellers have just returned from picking berries. Roll the dice and reach the rabbit's hut with a basket full of berries first. As a reward, a freshly baked blueberry cake awaits the winner.

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Monolity
description:
This mini-add-on introduces Monoliths known from the Monolith Arena game to the world of Neuroshima Hex.

Each player will design and prepare their Monolith before the game, placing their HQ and any two of their Board Tokens on its floors. During gameplay, the Monolith will expand and move repeatedly, and through the skillful use of its hidden tokens, it is capable of tipping the balance of victory in an instant. Thanks to Monoliths your favorite tokens will be available to you from the very beginning of the game, you will be able to plan your strategy more easily and surprise your opponent with your idea of the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: UNO: Pokemon Asia
description:
"Join Pikachu and all his friends when you play this Pokemon edition of UNO! Master the game with the special 'Snorlax Traffic' and 'Battle Bond' rules! And when you're down to your last card, don't yell 'pika pika', yell UNO!"

UNO variation where all of the cards have a pokemon, including some of the original 150 and newer pokemon from Sword & Shield.

The deck is the same as normal UNO, but with 4 extra wild cards:

- Wild Snorlax Traffic Cards: you choose a colour, the next player draws 3 cards and then discard all cards of your chosen colour from their hand (their turn ends).
- Wild Battle Bond Card: you choose a colour and the next player draws a card. If their drawn card does not match the chosen colour, they have to draw another card. You can then choose the colour that continues play.

You can choose to play a normal game of UNO without these extra cards, or keep them in for something a bit different.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Race, Take That

name: Yucatan: Solo Mode
description:
This expansion lets you play Yucatan in Solo Mode.

Components:


Bot board
Solo player board
Cards and event cards (30x)
Marker token
Solo mode rulebook

name: Super Cortex Challenge
description:
In Cortex Challenge, you'll need to be witty and quick to win! Turn over a card, and 1 of 8 types of puzzles will be revealed. The first player to solve it wins that card! With special tactile cards, Cortex Challenge is a unique experience.

This version of Cortex is for super brains only! Tougher challenges and complex tactile cards await players who are up for the challenge.

—description from the publisher

name: Seven Knights Bewitched
description:
ミュルマミウスの虜 (Myurumamiusu no Toriko) (Seven Knights Bewitched) is a co-operative game from Japan. (The Japanese title translates as Prisoner Of Myrmamius).

The publisher says:
This is a 'logic puzzle / asymmetrical / invitation / hidden / cooperative game' where the knights are divided into two camps, Knights and Witches.

The knights line up in order without being fooled by the lies of the witch Myrmamius. When a knight sees a witch's tile, he becomes a 'prisoner of Myrmamius' and turns over to the witch.

「騎士団」と「魔女」の2陣営に分かれて、騎士団が魔女ミュルマミウスの嘘に惑わされることなく、順番に隊列を並べる『論理パズル・非対称型・招待隠匿・協力ゲーム』です。騎士が魔女のタイルを見ると「ミュルマミウスの虜」となって魔女に寝返ります。
description by publisher
categories: Bluffing, Math, Medieval, Memory, Party Game, Puzzle, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: War Plan: Crimson
description:
THE US INVASION OF CANADA

From The Microgame Design Group website:

War Plan Crimson is a simulation game of a hypothetical invasion of Canada by the United States some time between 1935 and 1939.
