Through a series of research and testing, we are finally ready to remake the greatest legacy of civilizations out of the EXACT material, such as Terracotta Army with 100% pottery.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Educational, Prehistoric, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Twin Rotor Combine
description: A game, with its roots in the traditions of Monopoly and its ancestors, produced in cooperation with, if not in direct advertisement of, the Sperry New Holland Division's Twin Rotor Combine.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: H. Alexander Estreicher Associates, J.A.S.P., Inc.

name: Rush N' Crush
description:
In a post-apocalypse future (à la Mad Max), with scarce resources and few individuals, the survivor clans resolve disputes through ritualised racing instead of open warfare. You are one of these mad drivers. Only the first place counts, and no holds are barred.

The print-yourself components include 10 two-sided race track segments, six player cars and control panels (with tokens for shift gear and engine temperature), a 54 card deck (of additional car equipment) and armour, tires, brakes and turbo tokens. Five dice are also needed.

On your turn, you can speed up, slow down or change gears. This is cleverly handled by the control panel, where speed is vertical and gears horizontal - but not all grid points are connected. You can only go so fast in first gear! The gear diagram is also colour-coded to indicate how bad the engine heat test is. In addition, you may spend brake or turbo tokens (to slow down or speed up further).

You manoeuvre your car from lane to lane - but this depends on speed and your driving skill test. The faster you go, the less you can switch lanes. Tire tokens are spent for extra lane changes. If you ram an obstacle or another player, armour tokens are spent. Other cars could end up being pushed. A favourite technique is the Rush N' Crush, where you speed up right behind your opponent so as to crush him forcefully.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Les Croisades
description:
Vae Victis issue 17. This game presents two scenarios set during the "heyday" of the Crusades: Saladin's reconquests and the Third Crusade. The scale is at one turn equals one month, one hexagon is about fifty kilometers, and counters represent about 4-800 men. This is roughly the same system used in "Belisarius" (issue 5), and rules are provided for siege warfare, naval transport and combat, and "strategem chits" such as "Assassination," "Treason," and "Reconnaissance." Army lists and counters are also provided for Crusaders and Ayyubid Egyptians for use in "Champs de Bataille."

As with all Vae Victis games, the counters need to be cut out and mounted. The rules are entirely in French, although translations are available online.

name: Hidden Empires
description:
Hidden Empires is a print-and-play game for 2 to 6 players where each player assumes the role of an ant colony. Players deploy worker ants on an abstracted hex-area map to look for and forage food. Colonies use food to produce more workers to produce more food, etc. Eventually colonies grow large enough to produce reproductive male and female ants. Players score points for each reproductive ant released during a nuptial flight.

A deck of cards provide environmental events and different genetic traits for the various ant species. Conflict between colonies is possible but is not the primary focus of the game. All events, traits, and general game play are based on the natural history of actual ant species.

As of 2012 a new version, Hidden Empires II, is available.
publishers: (Web published), Interformic Games, Print & Play Productions

name: Pro Table Games Co.: Basketball
description: A stat-driven basketball game based on NBA player performances. The actions is driven by both the individual player stats and a team shot card.

name: Task Force
description:
Thomas Salter Ltd appears to have published games and magic sets in the 1950s and 60s. Task Force has a large folding board showing a highly stylised map of Europe and East America, and a small box to hold the pieces and rules. The game does not seem to have a large box to contain both board and bits, and this form of publishing may have been common in the UK post-war.

The game is a simple battle between blue (US) and red (Russia) pieces in which the players moved different forces from town to town, outnumbering and capturing their opponents. Getting into the opponent's heartland wins the game.

A random element is provided by a d6 numbered 1-3. A modern element is provided by two atom bombs. These are large red and blue discs which the players may use once in the game. Placing them on the board, they destroy any pieces the touch and remain in place for two turns, blocking movement there.

I cannot determine a publishing date, but the style of the game and the casual use of of the atom bomb as a strategic piece suggests the game is from the 1950s. It's interesting to see how large Britain is on the map, bigger than France!

Jean Shepherd (best known for the movie "A Christmas Story") mentioned an ad for Task Force on his June 18, 1963 radio show. It's not clear if he is discussing game 2982, 13059 or another version of this game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lords of Alban
description:
Elements of the game are:
building up a civilization and fighting.

The aim of the game is to become king after cultivation and colonization of the country.
Winner of the game is the one who manages to become king two times in a row. Elections take place in a defined intervall.

Game includes:
- 1 board with a map of Britain (Hex-fielded)
- 12 ships (white cardboard)
- 30 wood sticks
- 4 x 30 meeples (four colours)
- 60 grain-fields (hex-fields, cardboard)
- 30 grassland-fields (hex-fields, cardboard)
- 24 village-fields (hex-fields, cardboard)
- 24 city-fields (hex-fields, cardboard)
- 12 castle-fields (hex-fields, cardboard)
- 24 Culture cards
- 24 Earl cards
- 12 Lord cards
- 1 golden crown (cardboard)
- 1 red or black turn marker

name: Le Siège d'Aliciane
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #30.

One player, the Duke of Julive, tries to capture the town and the castle held by the count of Dominor.

name: Condottieri
description:
From the Designer:

"These rules link together my already published rules for the early Middle Ages God's Acre and for the 16th and 17th centuries Musketeer. All three sets are mutually compatible as far as layout and systems are concerned and base sizes are standardized throughout.

Wargames in the Hundred Years War period and the War of the Roses have been marginally popular for some years and my hope in publishing these rules is that this interest can be widened to the more general European and indeed British wars of the period. Wargames armies of Hussites and Burgundians etc. would be welcome newcomers to the wargames tables and the rules readily accommodate the armies of Samurai and Chinese, Russians and Mongols already being built up.

These rules cover only field battles, as sieges during this period were very complex affairs and demand a set of rules all to themselves. However there is no reason why the rules cannot be used to fight actions resulting from sallies or relief attempts or indeed assaults on wagon forts or barricaded towns. They are ideally fitted into a campaign."
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sink the Bismark
description:
From the designer's description: "Sink the Bismark" (sic) allows the player to recreate the actual historical conditions of the BISMARK foray, and includes advanced "what if" situations such as the original Operation Rheinubung as well as the delayed operation including the TIRPITZ. This game can be played in either a tactical or strategic atmosphere, or both. You now have command of the forces in this realistic naval game. See if you can sink the BISMARK!

Includes both a strategic game and a tactical game. The tactical game is played with miniatures; The game includes 1/1200 scale ship counters. The strategic game is played out on the Allied and German Strategic Plot Maps.

4 pages of rules, these include charts for Gunnery Control, Torpedo Firing, Armor Penetration Points and Ranges as well as Heavy Damage tables (critical hits) for each type of weapon hit are on the last two pages of the rules.

The game also included a Ship Statistics sheet and an Order of Battle sheet for the four scenarios.

name: Nookii
description: An adult game. There are 6 packs of cards (3 packs for each gender). Players take a random card from each of the three piles of their set. Players then take turns, proceeding in a set order through the cards ("Mmm", "Ooh" then "Aahs") rolling the dice, setting the timer according to time rolled, and then both players follow the scripted instructions. Timer, dice and blindfold included.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Mature / Adult

name: Bravo Piepino!
description:
The little birds just want to get home to their warm, cozy nest. Move for move, the feather cards show how far the birds can fly in one go. Oops! There's something strange about these cards! Every now and again the bird hop, seemingly on their own, one space forward or one space back. The birds and some cards are magnetic. The first bird to land in its nest is the winner.

Ages 4 and up.

name: Útvegsspilið
description:
Útvegsspilið (The Fishery Game) could probably only be made in Iceland!
Your object is to buy ships to fish, build fish factories, bring the fish to the factories and sell it and thus make as much money as you possibly can.
The further you sail while fishing, the more money you can make, but the risk is more of not making it back to the factories and of losing it all in the process!
The winner is the one who has the most money after a agreed upon time (1 to 3 hours), or when someone gets the last money from the bank!

name: Professor Noggin's  Famous Inventions
description:
The world is made up of famous inventions. Professor Noggin looks throughout history to quiz you on how the most prominent inventions were made, and who made them.

Card.topics.include:
Architecture_&_Construction
Automobiles
Aviation
Bicycles
Clothing Textiles
Computers
Famous Inventors
Food & Cooking
General Topic Card
Glass
Light Bulb
Medical Inventions (part 1)
Medical Inventions (part 2)
Movies & Television
Music & Sound
Optics
Pasteurization
Photography
Plastic
Printing
Radio
Space
Telephone
Telescope
Time
Tools
Trains
Watercraft
Wheel
Writing
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: Heroes of Might and Magic V Collectible Card and Tile Game
description:
The second demon war is at hand! the epic battle between Haven and Inferno reignites with this spectacular translation of Ubisoft's brand new release, Heroes of Might and Magic V. Choose a side in the primary clash or elect a separate path by hoisting the flag of the Necropolis, Academy, Dungeon or Sylvan forces.

This 3rd volume in DGA's Ultimate Fantasy Wargame series will keep you and your friends captivated for hours each time you break open the box!


from DGAGAMES website*


With a similar game system to Heroes of Might and Magic IV CTG, the differences mirror those of the computer game series. See for yourself the immense difference it makes when your armies MUST be lead by Heroes-Heroes who cannot be directly targeted in battle. Fans of the ever popular Heroes of Might and Magic III will be pleasantly surprised with the similarities in both style and content.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Exploration, Fantasy, Mythology

name: Royal Poker Dice Game
description:
Royal Poker Dice Game is a game of Yahtzee using the entire deck of cards.
Five 12-sided dice use all 52 cards of a normal deck plus 8 stars (wild cards). Every possible poker hand can be made.
For one or more players.

Contents: Five 12 sided Dice, Dice Cup, Score Pad, Felt Mat, Convenient Carry Case.

A less expensive "travel" version is available which eliminates the felt mat, changes the shape of the dice cup to oblong, and replaces the carry case with a fabric drawstring bag.

name: Crusader Historical Miniature Rules
description:
From the back cover of the rules:

Crusader is a set of wargames rules that allow you to game some of the greatest battles in history from Biblical times to the Medieval period. Although written with 28mm figures in mind the rules are stand-based and so easily translate to any scale of model. The rules cater for many popular basing methods so there is absolutely no need to re-base your figures to be able to play Crusader.

At the heart of the rules is the concept that you are representing units of troops in battle rather than individual warriors. Dispensing with the traditional phases within a turn the unit-based mechanics allow for a fluid game that simulates the quality and training of troops rather than the abilities of a few super characters.

The rules have been created with the flexibility to allow armies from widely differing time periods to fight against each other through the use of a consistent points system. So if you want to fight William the Conqueror's Norman Army against Alexander's Macedonians feel free!

name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: Dragonsword of Lankhmar
description:
Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser vs. The Thieves' Guild Assassins. The heroes attempt to complete a quest while the guild sends wave after wave of villains to stop them.

Part of the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks.

name: Murder Mystery Party: Champagne Murder
description:
It's the Summer of Love, July 1967, and London still swings like a pendulum do. In the Chelsea home of Lord Michael Jagged, a select group of fashionable young things have spent the weekend drinking champagne and partying.

As the guests gather for dinner on Sunday evening, however, they are met not by their host but by the Scotland Yard detective Austin McClue, who brings them shocking news: Lord Jagged has been murdered! And they are the principal suspects in the policeman's enquiries!

One - or more - of you is a murderer! Your task is to discover who that killer is. Fortunately detective McClue is on hand to assist your investigations.

First the invites, you choose which of your friends play which devious suspect and invite them to come along as that character. Then the shopping list, menu suggestions and recipes. Plus of course...a really tasty murder to solve.
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, University Games

name: Neworld: íslenska viðskiptaspilið
description: Neworld is an economic game where the object is to make as much money as possible, by buying and selling stocks, currency and raw materials. The value of the commodities changes with each turn so the best time for buying and selling varies all the time. The game ends either after a pre-determined time has elapsed or when one player has brought the others to their knees.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: OAF Pack 1
description:
OAF Pack 1
A collection of scenarios reprinted from the On All Fronts newsletter with all errata applied. A second OAF Pack was never printed. These scenarios span the European and Pacific Theatre as well as one scenario from the Korean War. One unusual feature of these scenarios is that rather than usual counter listing they employ TO & E Trees as well as graphical set up and entry charts for set up.

Contents:
10 scenarios
1 Overlay
7 unmounted counters

OAF Pack 1 is not a complete game. Ownership of modules from the ASL game system as well as boards 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 11, 16, 17, 22, 23, 33, 35, 37, 43, e, f and h, are required to play this expansion.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Swordfish at Taranto
description:
Swordfish at Taranto is a solitaire game depicting the British air assault on the Italian port of Taranto in November 1940. It is a "narrative experience" game, where players set up the game and watch the story unfold before them.
The object of the game is for the player--playing the British--to gain as many victory points as possible.
-from the intro to the game in Panzer Digest #2.

The 3rd edition (2021) features a Foreword by Norman Bell, editor of All Guns Blazing of the Naval Wargames Society.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Age of Conquistadors: 1492-1612
description:
A complete remake of the classic SPI and Avalon Hill versions from the 1970's. While the original game featured largely the classic hex and counter movement that was prevalent in the 70's. This new version will use area-movement, action points for movement and a new card deck (that adds random events without driving the game). Players will use cards for both events and action points and at the same time being able to play cards during their opponent's turns to counter their efforts.

Players can play one of four European powers competing for control of the resources of the new world. The game's time line goes from 1495 to 1615 with players trying to establish colonies in the Americas and bring home as much gold and resources as they can back to Europe. Along the way they will have to deal with natural disasters, other European powers and of course the indigenous people of the New World including the Mayans, Incas and Aztecs.

name: La Cosa Nostra
description:
La Cosa Nostra is a "take that" card game where each player take the role of a mafioso. On each turn, the current godfather can be voted down, and a new one is then elected. After this, each player will have the opportunity to draw and play cards. Some of them will increase the family booty. The godfather is in charge of distributing the territories (player's income) and the family's booty amongst the players.

The most important action a player can do is to buy some businesses represented by cards of three different categories: casino, real estate, or nightclub. The first to collect 1 million dollars worth of businesses in one category wins the game.

name: La Grande Armée
description:
Applying the DBx system to French Revolution / 1st Empire, "La Grande Armée" is an easy way to test the Napoleonic era with only few miniatures:
12 units + 1 general by camp, 4 footmen for an infantry unit, 3 for heavy cavalry, 2 for light cavalry or infantry, 1 gun & servants for a battery, no camps

This means an average of 40 miniatures by player.
A good way to recycle your Risk minis !

"La Grande Armée" was published in Vae Victis n°26
http://vaevictis.histoireetcollections.com/publication/1127/...

The "DBA Geeks" of Fanaticus.org translated it in English
http://www.fanaticus.org/DBA/periodadaptations/vaevictisrule...

name: Nine
description:
This trick-taking game is a standard deck playing card game and can be played in teams or not. The deck is dealt and each player is given thirteen cards; if played in partnerships, partners sit across the table from each other.

Players begin the game with 9 points. The goal is to reach 0.

Play begins with a person leading a trick, other players must follow suit if possible. If a player is void in the led suit, the player can play off or cut in with trump.

The trump suits change each round. The order of trump is: heart, diamond, spade, club and no trump. So The first turn the trump suit is heart, the second turn diamond. et c.

Players gain or lose points by number of tricks taken. 5 tricks or more is -1 point, 4 tricks is +0 points, and 3 or fewer is +1 point. The first person to 0 points wins.

name: Stack Control
description: Stack Control is an Icehouse game of stacking shared pieces. Each player is assigned a color, and there is at least one neutral color in play as well. On your turn, you can stack pyramids of any color, either helping score potential points for yourself or to eliminate rival pyramids. If all your pyramids leave play, you lose! Otherwise, when there are no more moves, if you have more pips worth of pyramids in towers you control, you win. Stack Control combines the shared pieces of Volcano with the scoring mechanism of IceTowers, and bears a striking similarity to Sid Sackson's Focus.

name: Classic BattleTech Field Manual: Updates
description:
From the back of the book:

For five long years the Inner Sphere has know war on a scale not seen in centuries, with the militaries of literally every faction involved in combat to one extent or another. Now, as relative peace appears to be settling over the Inner Sphere, a review of the military forces of the BattleTech universe are in order.

Classic BattleTech Field Manual: Updates updates all ten Field Manuals, including a history section that will bridge the gap between where the appropriate Field Manual left off and the current year of 3067, as well as a complete and current TO&E for all factions. Updated random 'Mech assignment tables for all factions are also included.

User comment:

This sourcebook updates all of the ten volumes released by FASA as the Field Manual series, moving the timeline in each up to early 3067. While it doesn't add any new rules, units or equipment to those revealed in the Field Manual series, it does update the unit locations and the tables used for generating different force elements, which is very useful for generating games or campaigns.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Iron Horses
description:
It is the age of iron. Metal behemoths tame the wild frontier, leaving settled communities in their wake. You are a captain of industry, seeking to expand your burgeoning railroad empire. Your tools are the railroad cars produced by you and your fellow magnates. Draw cards and place them wisely to earn big points. Vie for control of public railroads and stock to earn extra bonuses.

In Iron Horses, players compete to build the most lucrative railroad trains using a special deck of cards. Each player starts with one train, consisting of a locomotive engine and a tender full of coal. Players will add cars to these trains. The cars themselves are produced by four manufacturing companies, each owned by a player. Some types of cars (a passenger coach, a cattle card) are more valuable than others (like simple boxcars). And adding cars to your train in the proper color order earns bonus points. Don't forget about the public lines, though, which earn points for the players who have contributed most to their construction. Finally, in multiplayer games you may purchase stock in other players’ train lines, thus capitalizing on their successes.

This game was developed for the Quick Print and Play Design Challenge:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/625604/quick-print-and-p...

The work-in-progress thread may be found here:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/6398031

name: Critical Hit! 1997 Special
description:
A special edition of Critical Hit's ASL magazine featuring articles, scenarios and a new campaign game with a map of the Stalingrad Grain Elevator.

The following articles are included:
- A chat with Mac & Charlie (interview with Bob McNamara and Charlie Kibler)
- Prinses Irene's Warriors (the famous Dutch brigade in ASL terms)
- Converting 15mm Miniatures to ASL (using miniatures in ASL)
- The Russian M1927 Regimental Howitzer (history article about that weapon)

The following 2-player scenarios are included:
TW-A: ZHOLUDEV'S GUARDS; 7 October 1942; Stalingrad, Russia
CH83: JUNGLES OF STONE; 6 March 1945; Near Hill 362B, Iwo Jima
CH84: EVERY MAN A FORTRESS; 14 September 1942; Stalingrad, Russia
CH85: A KICK IN THE PANTS; 22 January 1944; Sant' Angelo, Italy
CH86: THE BROKEN BLADE; 1 December 1942; Chouigui, Tunisia
CH87: ROLLING DOWN ROLLBAHN D; 17 December 1944; Honsfeld, Belgium
CH88: HANGMAN'S HILL; 18 March 1944; Monte Cassino, Italy
CH89: OLD MAN FORWARD; 26 April 1945; Brandenburg, Germany

The following solitaire mission is included:
xTW-1: KNIGHT'S CROSS; 15 October 1942; Dzerhezinsky Tractor Works, Russia

The following Campaign Game with a new ASL map is included:
CG-GE1: THE GRAIN ELEVATOR; 14 September 1942; Stalingrad, Russia
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Ukraine (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Ticket to Ride™: Ukraine is a fan-made expansion to the Days of Wonder, Inc. Ticket to Ride™ series created by Alan R. Moon. This expansion introduces new rules and is designed for players who are already well familiar with Ticket to Ride™’s standard gameplay and mechanics.

NOTE: "Ticket to Ride" and "Days of Wonder" are registered trademarks of Days of Wonder, Inc. This fan-created expansion map is not a Days of Wonder product, but has been created with permission of Days of Wonder, Inc, solely for unpaid, non-commercial use. Some of the text and illustrations used herein may be Copyright © 2004-2013, Days of Wonder, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Mage Wars: Plagued Promo Card
description:
This promo card was given on Gen Con 2013.

Plagued

Enchantment.

Cost 2 Mana. 4 Mana to reveal.

Magebind + 2

Each Upkeep phase, place a point of direct poison damage on each Living creature in this zone (including this creature).

Card Number MWPROMO30
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Board with Life: The Metagame (The Microgame)
description:
Board With Life: The Metagame (The Microgame) is a 2-5 player card game representing a single game being played by the Board With Life crew. Each of the 5 main characters is represented by a suit/color, and each has an identical set of 5 action cards, with corresponding power that will help that character win the (fictional) game in question:

- Eliminate (1) - removes another card from the game
- Defend (2) - protects previously played cards
- Swap (3) - swaps cards between players
- Strategize (4) - adds to the power of any other card
- Gloat (5) - does nothing really, but has the most power

The game begins with a quick draft so each player can develop their own strategy, but each turn of the game consists of a player playing a single card. You execute its action, and the card remains in front of you as power towards winning that character. Players are vying to have the highest total power in each character, but player with the highest only scores points equal to the power his opponents control. And since there are five different characters, there are five opportunities to score, so players want to have the highest strength in each character, but only by a slight margin and in as many characters as you can for maximum points.

Distributed as a free print & play game released to backers of the web series.

name: Kingdoms In Peril
description:
Kingdoms in Peril is a multi-strategy card game set in 700BC that can be played with 2 to 6 players. Players create a Kingdom through selecting City Cards that vary in strength and risk.

Players collect and purchase various cards to build a playing card hand, which will be used during game play to battle opponents over Kingdom cities.

Throughout the game players must balance their army (playing hand), resources (gold), and siege weapons (keys). While strategizing how to use various Battle Strength Cards to fend off attackers and defeat opponents in Battle.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Jogo Caminho da Aventura
description:
A simple children´s game that has 2 phases. In the first, you lay cards from your hand, building a road in the kingdom of Ooo using a mechanic that is similiar to dominoes. In the second phase, the game has a simple roll and move mechanic and landing on spaces that tell you to move forward or backward some spaces, makes you or your opponent lose your turn or require a dice roll to get out of. The first player to make it to the end of the road is the winner.

From the publisher:
"Monte sua própria aventura, construindo o caminho do Reino de Ooo e ajude Finn, Jake, Princesa Jujuba e Rei Gelado a percorrerem todo o percurso. Enfrente vários desafios e descubra quem tem mais sorte."

"Build your own adventure, paving the way of Ooo Kingdom and help Finn, Jake, Ice King and Bubblegum Princess to roam all the route. Face several challenges and see who has better luck."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Papilio
description:
Papilio is a card game that recreates the life of butterflies in a fun and didactic way. It combines the fun of an enjoyable game with the discovery of the world of butterflies and some of the most common species in the Mediterranean area.

The aim of the game, fun apart, is to build the richest habitat, and this is achieved by gaining the maximum number of points: completing butterflies, attracting them with plants, trying to make them breed, or catching them (with final penalisation). You also have to ensure that neither predators nor changes in the weather nor human intervention have a negative influence in the strategy of each player.

The game is designed for 2-5 players of all ages, and especially from 6 years old to an adult public. We have devised three levels of difficulty so that the learning process is gradual until dominating all the aspects of the game.

The game has a total of 66 cards, and 40 of them represent butterflies, 17 are actions by the players and 9 refer to the weather. The butterflies chosen represent more or less the variety of diurnal species in the area and the majority are grouped by colours, an approximation to the different families.

Papilio is a game of simulation yet it is also competitive. This means that the dynamic of the game is agile and with continuous toing and froing, and at the end establishes a score in points that in some way is related to the concept of biodiversity and the biological cycles of these insects.

Thus there are more points for the butterflies that are free than those caught with butterfly nets. The diversity of the butterflies is also rewarded and the number of species of the same group. Finally, points are scored for the combination of plants and reproduction cards (caterpillars). Moreover, given the vulnerability of these insects, the game includes three species of protected butterflies, rare or in danger of extinction, species that in the game cannot be caught with butterfly nets.

name: Abaku
description:
Abaku is a numeric game for 1 to 4 players, who are lovers of numbers, figures, calculations and games! Everyone who knows that one and one gives two can play it. Playing Abaku significantly improves your calculating skills, logical thinking and intuition.

The players are using playing tiles to create numeric operations on the playing board. Addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, squares and cubes of whole numbers and square and cube roots of whole numbers are allowed. The player wins over the other players – calculators thanks to the proper combination of each tile’s value and strategic use of premium squares on the playing board. The aim is to get more points than the others.
Numeric operations are created by adding (horizontally or vertically) one or more tiles to tiles already lying on the board. Newly created numeric operation must contain or adjoin one or more tiles lying on the board. Numeric operations must be legible from left to right and from top to the bottom.

Abaku is an effective supporting instrument for teaching mathematics.

name: Dice Crawl: Forbidden Vaults
description: This is an expansion to Dice Crawl and adds over 120 new cards including new environment, races and classes

name: Tooting Town
description:
Tooting Town is a simple tile laying game for 2 to 4 players. The players are each given 3 buildings to visit. The players then build the town by taking turns to lay tiles, finally selecting where their homes should be. The routes are measured by driving a toy car along them. The winner is the player with the shortest route from their home tile to each of the 3 buildings.

The game contains 17 large format (18cm or about 7.5") square tiles, plus 12 tokens. A download of 9cm tiles is also provided. The game is for 2 to 4 players. Players should provide 1 or more toy cars (not essential). The game plays in about 10 minutes.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Donsol
description:
Donsol is a simple solitaire card game where you are tasked with exploring the rooms of a dungeon using a standard 54-card poker deck. It was designed by John Eternal for Train Jam 2015.

Clubs, Spades, and Jokers serve as monsters, hearts as potions, and diamonds as shields. Red numbered cards possess their face value with royals and aces equaling 11. Black numbered cards also possess their face value with Jack at 11, Queen at 13, King at 15, Ace at 17, and Jokers equal to 21.

The rooms of the dungeon are created by laying out cards in groups of four. Progress is made by playing all four dungeon cards or passing to another room when three of the four dungeon cards have been played. Four more cards are then dealt for the new room. Rooms can be reset in their entirety as many times as needed but never twice in a row.

Shields may be equipped to defend against monsters in descending order of their value with damage being dealt to the player for monster values in excess of the equipped shield. The shield breaks if it is used to attack a monster of equal or greater value than the previous monster. Attacking a monster without a shield depletes the players health for the full attack value of the monster. Health potions may be used to increase life points up to the maximum starting value of 21. Playing a second potion in succession nullifies the effect of the second potion.

The game ends when life points reach zero or the player has successfully slayed all monsters and exited the dungeon alive.

name: Monstrous: Release the Kraken
description:
The Olympians are more wrathful than ever, and Zeus has opened the gates to dread Tartarus itself. Unleash Legendary Monsters from Greek mythology on the faithless mortals in this colossal expansion for Monstrous - the game of mythic mayhem.

The Release the Kraken expansion for Monstrous includes one Location card (Tartarus), as well as 8 Legendary Monster cards and 10 Tentacle cards. Players who hit Tartarus with a monster get to draw a Legendary Monster.

The Kickstarter edition of Monstrous included the Dark Ages edition of this expansion, using public domain art. A Kickstarter for a full art version of the expansion is planned for 2016.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Modular Board
publishers: Good Games Publishing, Secret Base Games

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Auxiliary Power Resource
description:
The Auxiliary Power Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "Battle of Mempa," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Klingon Civil War.

When using this resource, at the start of the game, you place 5 Auxiliary Power Tokens on the resource's card. During the game, one per round, a single ship in your fleet can move one of the Auxiliary Power Tokens from the resource to the ship to gain one of several benefits:

1) Roll 1 extra attack or defense die

2) Place 1 evade token beside the ship

3) Repair 1 Shield

The resource is discarded once all 5 tokens are remove. The resource costs 5 SP.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Going Further
description:
Hurray, your company just got a lucrative job: build a road between two cities.
But the computer managing the production line just went bananas and random building material comes out of the factory.
Do you give up? Well, partly.
Forget about joining the two cities with a wonderful infrastructure, just try to use the material as it is ready and build as much as you can!

Going Further is a very fast solo game, estimated playing time with standard rules is between 1 and 5 minutes (depending on the tiles you have). Its playing speed makes Going Further ideal to be played in group, challenging the score of your mates.

Going Further, in its standard playing mode, is a tile placement puzzle, as all the tiles are visible to the player. However, every game is different because only 32 randomly selected tiles, out of a 72 deck, are used for a single game.
The objective of the game is to built a continuous road by placing tiles picked from a limited number of available ones. As long as tiles are connected to the road, others become available to be chosen and played. The game ends when no more playable tiles are available.
The player shall choose the best strategy to unlock new tiles and prevent the game to end, while scoring as much points as possible.
In fact, each tile grants a different number of points; the total score consists of the sum of each individual tile points.
Additional points can be added or removed from the total, depending on the achieved road final configuration.

The game can be customized making it more or less difficult, or by introducing a luck element.

When more than one person is playing, each player takes his turn as for a solo game. The winner is the player able to score more points, after each one had his chance.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Geomemorix
description:
An abstract game of memory and observation.

Contents: 8 round cards, 42 rectangular cards.

Preparing to play: Lay the 8 round cards out face down in 2 rows in between the players. Place the rectangular cards face down in a pile next to the round cards.

To win cards, you have to memorize the location of shapes and colors.

On your turn, turn up the top card from the draw pile, and place it next to the stack:

• If this card features two colored symbols, then you must find at least one of these two symbols (same color, same shape) on one of the round cards, and to do so you turn over a single card.

• If you turn up a card showing 1, 2 or 3 white symbols: you must then turn up 1, 2 or 3 round cards all featuring that symbol, regardless of color.

If you turn up the correct card(s), you win the rectangular card and play again.

Otherwise leave the card on the discard pile and it is the next player’s turn.

Turn the round cards back face down in the same place.

The next player can decide to try to win the card face up on top of the discard pile (if there is one) or to turn up a new rectangular card.

Only turn the round cards up to see if they feature the symbols you are looking for, and always turn them back face down at once.

All players take advantage of each round of the game to try to memorize the symbols on the round cards.

The game ends when there are no cards left in the draw pile. The player who has won the most cards wins the game.

name: Scrabble Speed
description:
Scrabble Speed is the heart pounding, word making game everyone plays at the same time! The Tile Tower gives you just the right amount of letters to spell as many words as possible within one minute. After the electronic timer buzzes, easy scoring keeps the pace going as players put their tiles back into the dispenser, redraw 12 new tiles, and start fresh each round. The player with the highest score after 7 rounds wins the game! For 2-4 players. Ages 10+. Batteries not included.

Features:
- Race against other players in this quick-spell word game!
- Tile Tower tumbles out tiles!
- Quick! Everyone has one minute to build their words. The timer is counting down!
- Easy scoring keeps the pace going before the next round begins with a fresh set of tiles
- The player with the highest score after 7 rounds wins the game!

name: Die drei ??? Kids: Auf Verbrecherjagd
description: Die drei ??? Kids: Auf Verbrecherjagd requires detective sense and teamwork as the three young investigators — Justus, Peter and Bob — have seven suspects before them in this latest case. Ingenious combinations are required before the players will be able to unmark the true perpetrators and click on the handcuffs...

name: The Abandons: Promo Pack #1
description:
In the Kickstarter campaign backers got an extra promo pack with 5 alternative cards to add to the game and a player tracker token.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Maze

name: Ruship
description:
Two players (one is Human, the other is Alien) face each other and seek to destroy their opponent by dealing 3 damage to their planet.
The planets are separated by 18 spaces. The Human has 5 ships available, spawning from the Mothership (placed adjacent to Earth at the beginning of the game). The Alien has 5 flying saucers at his/her disposal, spawning from the Vortex (placed adjacent to the alien planet at he beginning).

A die roll determines the first player.
Then each turn, the active player rolls 2 six-sided dice.
The dice values can be used to move two space vehicles he/she owns (ships or flying saucers) or only one (by combining the two values). Space vehicles can only go forward, not backward.
A die showing "1" can be used to move the Mothership/Vortex 1 space.

A space can only hold one token:
A space vehicle landing on an enemy vehicle captures it (it is removed from the board and return in the owner's Reserve).
A space vehicle supposed to land on the Mothership/Vortex lands one space farther.
A space vehicle landing on the enemy's planet (or farther) deals one damage and return in the Reserve.

At each damage dealt, the attacked player wins a special power of his choosing (among the special powers still available):

re-roll one die each turn
"+1" to each die
each turn you choose to play with only one die, all the opponent's vehicle you jump over are captured
your tokens can move backward
your vehicles can stack up to two on the same space, protecting them from being captured.


These special powers are permanent power-ups.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Islands of Atlantis
description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

In Islands of Atlantis, raise islands from the depths of the sea and populate them with as diverse a landscape as possible. Each instance of a land type you place will grant you Influence, which unlocks special powers and bonus points. Enclose sets of unique relics to grab extra points. Players will compete in this competitive game to build the best set of islands and score the most points; or play this game as a solitaire game, and try to beat your score.

On your turn:

Roll the dice,
Choose one land die to determine what the size of your next piece of island will be
And choose one power die to determine what the terrain of the next piece of island will be;
Then draw the piece, either adding it to an island that has yet to see that type of terrain, or attach it to a matching section in an island that features the type of terrain.
Each time you complete an island, you gain influence, which could get you some points if you try hard enough. Will you fill your sheet exactly and grab a bonus? At what cost will you raise the elusive perfect islands and collect bonus points?

Islands of Atlantis requires two standard six-sided dice of one color, and three standard six-sided dice of another color. Components include one player sheet per player.

—description from the publisher

name: Paper Pinball: Season 2
description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Clue: Silver Line
description:
The classic detective game! In Clue, players move from room to room in a mansion to solve the mystery of: who done it, with what, and where? Players are dealt character, weapon, and location cards after the top card from each card type is secretly placed in the confidential file in the middle of the board. Players must move to a room and then make an accusation against a character saying they did it in that room with a specific weapon. The player to the left must show one of any cards accused to the accuser if in that player's hand. Through deductive reasoning each player must figure out which character, weapon, and location are in the secret file. To do this, each player must uncover what cards are in other players hands by making more and more accusations. Once a player knows what cards the other players are holding, they will know what cards are in the secret file. A great game for those who enjoy reasoning and thinking things out.


Part of the "Silver Line" edition of Hasbro games. In addition to the distinctive black and silver motif, it includes "invitation" cards and the extra poison weapon from the 50th Anniversary edition. It also has new custom dice that trigger "Clue" event cards, and Dr. Orchid in the place of Ms. White.
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: d6 Pro Football Dynasty
description:
You are an aspiring pro football head coach, and have just signed a 5-year contract with a struggling franchise. They were 3-13 last season and are in re-building mode. You are tasked with improving the roster, using your influence to get the most out of your team, and bringing a championship to your new city.

d6 Pro Football Dynasty is a light, push-your-luck solitaire dice game. A full 20 season game will take about 30 minutes to play. There are many ways to play. Your goal could be winning the “Big Game” in as few seasons as possible, or maybe you want to see how many championships you can win during your tenure as the head coach. The game also includes an easy method to track points during your campaign, inviting you to try to beat your previous best.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: レディファースト (Lady First)
description:
レディファースト (Lady First) is a re-implementing of レディファースト (Lady First), with additional sets of cards to allow 3 or 4 players as well as the original 2 player game. Two sets of male cards have been added, otherwise the gameplay is the same.

The game has a romantic theme, with one set of red cards themed for a woman, and blue sets for a man. Each cards carries various romantic lines (all in Japanese), that the players ought to speak as they play.

Players draw and play out hand cards, with a set of numbers on each card controlling which others may follow it. If the blue player can get the red player to exhaust their cards first, blue wins. Otherwise, blue loses.

The red deck has 12 cards numbered from 1 to 12 (and this player starts), the blue deck has 11 cards from 2 to 12. On their turn, a player may draw one card from their deck, up to a hand limit of five, or play a card to the table.

Along the bottom of each card is a set of numbers, one for blue and one for red. These say what card can be played after this card. For example, the blue 5 can be followed by a blue 2,3,4 and 6 or by a red 4 or red 6-12.

As players go through their deck, they must carefully decide which cards to hold and which to play, in order to push more cards out of their opponent's hand.
user summary

name: Porradaria card game
description: Inspired by the arcade games of the 1980's/1990's, Porradaria features characters with special abilities that battle against each other using weapon, battlefield, "punch" as well special cards and the final goal of the game is the elimination of the other characters. This is a 2 (two) deck card game, with 5 (five) characters in each deck, which can be played by 2 to 5 players with 1 deck, or up to 10 players with 2 decks.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: AEON: The Emergence of Life
description:
It’s round about 4 billion years ago. Earth has just recently cooled off enough to have water on its surface. Impacts of comets and meteorites have almost ceased. The sky is orange and dense with thick clouds, through which a faint Sun barely shines. A vast, greenish, muddy ocean covers almost the entire planet. The little dry land is black volcanic rocks and barren. But deep in the ocean and in a few oases, something is cooking: life is about to emerge.

In AEON, you and your friends represent prebiotic environments where Life might have emerged. Together, you build a network of chemical reactions that transforms simple prebiotic reactants into complex molecules. Eventually, these molecules will allow you to establish the basic mechanisms of life which make the reactions more efficient.
The first player to create all the requirements for the emergence of biological evolution wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: War of the Worlds: The New Wave – German promo cards
description:
Six German promocards for War of the Worlds: The New Wave:

Dog Scout
Spyder (Spinne)
Bombardment (Bombardierung)
Orbital Strike (Angriff aus dem Orbit)
Draw Energy (Energie saugen)
Tesla (Tesla)
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Parsifal: A Game of Tarots
description:
Parsifal - A Game of Tarots is a fierce and engaging game that breaks the mold by reinterpreting Richard Wagner’s opera with a fantasy twist through 30 tarots (23 characters and 7 artifacts).

In Parsifal - A Game of Tarots you will find a high level of strategic interdependence: each player controls multiple characters and, at each turn, they must choose which tarot to play with to win.

Each character has their missions to accomplish: you will only win when one of your characters completes them all.
Artifacts make the game even more exciting and deep: these are precious and dangerous tools, which can turn around the outcome of a game!

Choose your strategy at each turn and tackle the three mandatory imperatives to heed the call: Desire, Despair, Duty.
mechanics: Alliances, Chaining, Command Cards, Hand Management, Induction, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Matching, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Rank and Vile
description:
Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Rank and Vile

Three more mighty armies for your arsenal! The troops and tanks of the innumerable Astra Militarum are ready and willing to fight for the Emperor! The dark and twisted Drukhari are poised to spring out of the warp to loot and plunder across the galaxy. Chaos marches to war with hordes of Daemons from each of the four mighty lords.

Alongside these three forces are new Treasures like the Shadowsword tank and notable monsters like Rotigus to make your Munchkin Warhammer 40,000 game even more massive!

—description from the publisher

name: Combined Arms: The World War II Campaign Game
description:
Bolt Action - Combined Arms is a strategic board game that commands the players to face off, seize the initiative and outwit their foe amidst the fog of war. Each game will see you fighting for control of air, land, and sea in order to claim objectives and hold them against the enemy.

Choose your theatre of war, from the western and eastern fronts to North Africa and the Pacific. Each theatre has its own challenges and opportunities, some rewarding control over the sea, some rewarding control over the skies. How many of your precious resources will you sink into each, and how much will be left to control the land? Will you rely on stealth as you move units secretly, springing up where you are least suspected, or will you attempt to overwhelm your enemy with brutal overkill?

Combined Arms can be played as a stand-alone game or players can incorporate Bolt Action, Blood Red Skies, Cruel Seas, or Victory at Sea for an epic continent-spanning campaign. Unique cards link your campaign with your chosen wargames, meaning your choices in the campaign could mean victory or defeat on the tabletop.

This box contains:

Rules booklet
4 game maps covering Northwest Europe, The Eastern Front, North Africa and The Pacific theatres of operation.
Orders Board
Operations Board
6 Card decks
67 Tokens
Plastic Army markers
Plastic Objectives

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Swan & Supergiant
description:
Thanos' Black Order gains two powerful new members with Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Swan & Supergiant.

A princess of an alternate Earth, Black Swan uses her ability to project eyebeams of energy and superhuman physique to support the Mad Titan's conquest of worlds. Joining her is Supergiant, an omnipath and telepathic parasite. Her powers allow her to read the minds of and control anyone she encounters, which she uses to steal and devour the intellects of her hapless prey. Beyond their own powers, Black Swan and Supergiant also bring three Team Tactic cards that help them synergize with other members of the Black Order, making them an even more formidable fighting force.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dystopia
description:
In Dystopia, zombies, tsunamis, viruses, atomic explosions threaten all continents.
Who among you will succeed in eliminating as many dangers as possible from their continent to save humanity?
Observation, memorization, deduction, cunning and strategy will be your best allies to win the game.
The goal: to have as few dangers as possible on his threatened continent to get out of it!

Each player chooses a continent.
On his turn either he takes the first card from the discard pile, or he takes the first card from the draw pile.

If he chooses a card face up he must swap it with a card from his deck and place it face up.

If he chooses a card from the draw pile, he chooses whether he keeps it or not.

If, at the end of his turn, a player thinks he has a minimum number of danger points, he announces "Dystopia", which triggers the last turn, then the players reveal their cards and count the points.

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Saturn 2101
description:
This is a solo and duo expansion!

Released in July 2022, one more city is becoming black each round!

Tips: Wrap around and use the Wind Action!

Will you be able to deliver all colored cubes before the end of the game ? If you liked on the Moon, you will love on Saturn 2101!

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Catch the Leader, Connections, Dice Rolling, Loans, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Selection Order Bid, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Auction, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Unter Schock
description:
A wild night. A dead writer. And Mrs Schmidt's talkative parrot. So what happened?
The players are the first on the scene of a mysterious crime. They have to find out what happened and different pieces of evidence to reconstruct the course of events and find the murderer. Three exciting cases are waiting to be solved.

name: Iriri
description: A boardless pattern-matching game for 2 players, designed to be played with Looney Pyramids. Players score points by laying “words” gridwise in a crossword-like manner. The possible words are determined by a “dictionary,” which shrinks as the game goes on.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Firebirds: Huey
description:
Firebirds: Huey is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire print and play wargame using a tables-based game engine.

As the pilot of either a US Army UH-1H Huey Medevac helicopter, a US Army UH-1H air cavalry troop transport helicopter, or an L-19 Bird Dog pilot, your ultimate goal is to survive a 1-year Vietnam tour of duty during the year 1968, while at the same time either trying to extract and return as many wounded US Army soldiers as you can from ‘hot’ landing zones (LZs), insert/extract US Army Soldiers or Rangers in hot LZs, or spot enemy Viet Cong units in FAC (Forward Air Controller) zones and later call in air strikes to take them out.

The player will move his helicopter through various travel boxes on a map during each mission on his way to the assigned mission zone, then must successfully return back to home base.

Game components include a crewmen placement mat, strategic map mat, tables book, crewmen status sheet, campaign log sheet, and counter sheet representing individual helicopters, enemy units, etc.

name: Rabbito: A Game for Pushy Rabbits for 2-4 Players
description:
Rabbito is a light strategy carrot-taking board game for 2-4 players.

Each player (on their turn) rolls both dice, places a carrot on the board, from the bag, and then moves the highest dice rolled to push carrots (and other rabbits) down the warren holes which they rake up with their wooden rakes and fill their burrow cards as fast as possible.

The first rabbit to score 7 carrots (for a quick game) or 14 carrots for a full game is the winner. It's a quick, light family game for ages 5 to adult.

On the surface, Rabbito is a simple game of rabbit racing and carrot stealing, but you'll need to use your noggin to plan your best moves, position your rabbit for maximum pushiness and avoid getting shoved down a warren hole and losing your carrots.

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Slide/Push, Square Grid

name: MindMatch
description:
You have the gift! As a MEDIUM, you can enter thoughts into the minds of others and make them name certain terms. But not everyone is born to be a MEDIUM. Maybe you are much more successful as a RECIPIENT? Whoever manages to build mental connections and read minds will win this game. But maybe it's enough to form obvious associations, without any telepathic abilities?

—description from the publisher

name: Flying Sushi Kitchen
description:
Flying Sushi Kitchen is a dexterity game in which players act as sushi chefs attempting to get the most money from the daily orders and tips from customers.

Each turn, a player draws a card(s) from a common deck that will consist of standard or "rush" orders, challenges to apply to the next order, tip bonus card to apply to the next drawn order, or a immediate group challenge.

Once a order or group challenge is drawn, players will activate the sushi bar, which activates small fans under each piece of "sushi" (essentially a foam ball), making them hover mid-air. Players then pick the sushi, side items such as ginger or wasabi from the bar until the timed sushi bar de-activates, shutting off the fans.

Players continue drawing and fulfilling orders until someone hits the target money goal, and wins.

name: Battlecards: World Conflict – North African Campaign: Starter Set
description:
From the Publisher: Battlecards is a card game in which you and your opponent(s) build up forces and conduct battles in many of the
great conflicts in history. This particular starter set deals with the Western European Theater during World War II. The game consists of a Conflict deck of 50 cards, 47 Arsenal cards for the British forces, and 47 Arsenal cards for the German forces. Based upon the draw of Conflict cards, players may build forces, learn about their opponent, gain a secret advantage, or enter into a battle. The objective is to be the player at the end of the game with the most victory points, or to win the battle for your opponent’s homeland. In addition, 20-card expansion packs are available to improve the selection and capabilities of Arsenal cards and Conflict cards for this set. Additionally, this set can be combined with the other World War II Starter Sets so you and your friends may play the entire war as you please.

Africa: Desolate, expansive, and inhospitable. Even in the absence of war, its hostile elements threaten the lives of all who trespass upon it. But war is not absent, as hordes of Italian soldiers and tanks take up arms to establish the New Roman Empire for their leader, Mussolini. Standing in their way is the old established British Empire, and the new up and coming power of America. Reaching out for help from their ally Germany, the Afrika Corps is formed to deal with the Army of the Nile which is now reinforced with fresh American blood and equipment. Thus, the see-saw war across a continent ensues. Can Rommel be victorious at El Alamein? Will the Allies take the fortress at Tobruk? Can Operation Torch penetrate the Italian Navy? Will the French navy be an asset to the Allies, or the Axis? Will Patton's forces be defeated at Kasserine Pass? You decide in this Desert War edition of Battlecards: World Conflict.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Total Attack!! Soccer
description:
From the box description:
Total Attack!! SOCCER is the realistic soccer board game that truly recreates and teaches classic soccer strategy.

An easy BASIC GAME provides a fun, fast and accurate soccer playing experience with simple, checkers-like ease, for players aged 8 to adult. This easy BASIC GAME is both realistic and totally satisfying. It can be played for years.

Optional ADVANCED ELEMENTS may be added one at a time, if older players wish, to create a classic chess-like game of skill by giving different strengths and skills to Strikers, Midfielders, Defenders, Goalies and more...

Play at all levels consists of two teams of eleven player-pieces, moving a ball-piece over a hexagonally-gridded field for an exact simulation of soccer movement. Tackling, Dribbling, Passing, Shooting, Fouling and all other soccer elements are the realistic result of your decisions and gaming skilll, and not the pure luck of spinners, dice and cards.

Total Attack!! SOCCER is easy to learn, accurate, and fun from the start. From there, it can become as challenging as chess, yet always remains totally soccer. Total Attack!! SOCCER is a classic soccer board game for all time!

name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game II – Slimer Sea Fright
description:
From the publisher:

For the first time ever, play as Slimer as he fights against Jack Higgins and his skeleton crew in this campaign containing 4 scenarios, 4 new map tiles, 9 new minis, and more tokens! Slimer is the first playable Ghost character in Ghostbusters: The Board Game II and has new interesting skill sets that come from his vaporous state of being. Slimer gets abilities that allow him to move in ways no other Ghostbuster can. He’s handy with a Slime Blower or Proton Pack, and other Ghosts might not see him as an immediate threat.

Trick shots and sneak attacks are a pirate’s specialty, and with the Gold Doubloon token, you can make shots with your weapon that weren’t possible before.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Bomb Arena
description:
Game description from the designer:

Bomb Arena is a party game. Friends can team up to fight against each other. Players work together to put bombs to rival's field and do their best igniting them. Boom!!

It's fun and exciting to use bomb cards and accumulate explosion power with skill cards and team member's help. On the one side, you have to do your best to deal damage to your opponent's team, on the other side, you have to rack your brains removing the bombs in your field.

Players of Bomb Arena usually love to have one more match, two more matches right after the 1st game because it is really fun.
Players keep mesmerized when they play Bomb Arena because every player's movement would affect each other dramatically. You would be excited during the whole game.

HOw to ignite bombs?

There are 3 ways to ignite bombs devil
1. 11 kings of Bomb Cards : No.2 ~ No. 12
We deal 3 bomb cards and 2 skill cards to each player.
Each player take turns placing one bomb card on enemy's field.
When players work together and put 5 bomb cards in a row on enemy's
field, !!BOOM!! It will deal 2 damage to enemy's team.

for example, when you and your team member put
No.2, No.3, No4, No5, No.6 bomb cards on your enemy's field, it explodes.

2. Skill card: Time Bomb
A player can put a time bomb and attache it on a Bomb on enemy's field.

for example, a player can put time bomb on No.7 Bomb card which is already on the filed. then every next player needs to throw 2 dice to
check if it will explode or not. Every player needs to throw 2 dice during the beginning of his turn until the time bomb explodes.

3. When 3 bomb cards of the same number are piled up.
the 3 bomb cards explode immediately can cause 1 point damage.

Players can use counterattack, remove, provoke, designate or other skill cards to make the game more interesting.

name: Stoplight
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Stoplight, 2 to 6 players race to outwit the stoplights and get out of town the fastest.

On a turn, one player rolls all three plush dice, which are different colors and sizes. All players must race to place a hand on the proper die based to the numbers rolled: the red die if it shows the highest number, the green die if it shows the lowest number, and the yellow die if it shows a number between the numbers on the other two dice. If there are no dice on which to place your hand, raise both your hands and yell "Stop!"

name: Holmes
description:
A card game for 2-4+ players with a Sherlock Holmes Theme.

The cards form 7 mini-decks, or suites, with cards ranked 1 to 13 in each suite. In the set up phase one card from each suite is randomly selected, its identity hidden from all players, and placed it in its corresponding Suite Spot on the board.
The remaining cards of the mini-decks are shuffled together to form the common deck.

The aim of the game is to establish which card of each suite is the one located on the playing board. Players have paper and pencil on hand to keep track of which cards of what rank they have seen for each suite, to deduce the remaining cards in the Suite Spots.

TURN SEQUENCE
Players take turns.
Each turn has 5 Phases:
Investigate Phase (draw cards)
Action Phase (play (discard) one card from your hand to activate its special ability (dependant on suite))
Sleuth Phase (solve a case by playing, all at once, seven cards - one of each of the seven card types)
Deduction Phase (You may guess the rank of a specific card on the Board (one of the 7 Suites)).
Retire Phase (Discard excess cards - hand limit is 9).

Players share a common set of Case Tokens. These are awarded for solving cases in the Sleuth Phase or correctly guessing a card identity in the Deduction Phase. Victory is achieved by being the first player to accumulate 5 Case Tokens.
publishers: Devir, IELLO, KOSMOS, Warp Spawn Games

name: Quint-X
description:
The game board in Quint-X, a.k.a. Katalon, features five interlocking squares, with one central square and one square at each of the board's four corners; each square features within it an X pattern of holes that mimics the layout of the squares on the game board.

On the first turn, a player places a marble in any hole, but from then on a player must place a marble in the square matching the position of the hole in which the previous player placed his marble. Within that square, though, the player can place the marble as he wishes. When no more empty holes lie within a square, then you replace an opponent's marble with one of your own.

To win, you either completely fill a square with your marbles, have a majority of marbles in three of the five squares when all spaces on the board are full, or have all of your marbles on the board at the start of your turn.
publishers: Clemens Gerhards, HiKu Spiele, Mathematikwettbewerb Känguru e.V., W4kangoeroe

description:
Easiest description is likely that this game plays similar to Spades. It uses a regular deck of 52 playing cards, it is about taking tricks to match a 'bid' (assigned in 7-4-1 versus bidding in Spades), with Aces high and a trump suit (declared in 7-4-1 versus always spades in Spades).

In 7-4-1, 12 cards are dealt to each of the 4 players; this leaves a 4-card kitty. The dealer MUST try to take 7 tricks, but she gets to declare which suit is trump AFTER looking at her hand. She then gets to pick up the 4 middle cards, and discard 4 face-down (could be from the kitty, or not). Player 2 must get 4 tricks, player 3 for 1 trick, and player 4 need not take any.

After round 1, figure out how many cards more or less players got. YOu get one point for every trick you make above your required tricks, and lose one for every trick you fail to make. For the next round, a player who had MORE in the previous round can then pass one card per amount more to a player who had less; that lesser player must then pass their HIGHEST card in each requested suit. Some pre-defined ordering for this is necessary; the player needing to make the most tricks has precedence over the player needing less.

For example, in round 1, the players take 6-2-3-1 tricks.
So, the position 2 is now the new dealer. Player in position 3 was +2 in round 1 (took 3, needed 1), and would ask position 1 for 1 suit, and position 2 for 1 suit. Player in position 4 would then ask position 2 for 1 suit. We've played where if the numbers over/under match (position 3&2, 4&1 in this example), then they could simply swap cards too.

Play then proceeds as described above. Trump is declared AFTER the card-swapping is done. And if the player who needed 4 in the previous round took NONE, then they can also look at the kitty too before declaring a trump! However, they'd also have just given up 4 good cards to other players...\
Game ends after either 2 or 3 rounds, with everyone getting a chance at each position an equal number of times.

name: 真打 (Shin-Uchi)
description:
Compete against up to 3 other players for the right to perform the final storytelling of a Rakugo exhibition hall.

User summary
Shin-Uchi is a card game with a theme of Rakugo, a Japanese traditional verbal performance. Players tries to earn fame by taking a role of "tori", the final performer on stage.

There are nine stages in a game. For each stage, players play one or two cards, and the player who played the highest rank scores fame points. But the lowest player is the first to choose a card in the reserve and put it to their hand.

At the end of the game, each player totals the fame points they have scored, and add special bonus depending on cards they have played. The highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
日本の伝統文化である「落語」をテーマにしたカードゲームです。
プレイヤーは落語家になって名声を獲得し、最も名声を獲得したプレイヤーの勝利となります。
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Carthago: Merchants & Guilds – Golden Achievements
description: The Golden Achievement Tiles offer additional ways for players to earn points at the end of the game or, in exchange for the potential to earn extra points, players can take an additional turn during the game.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Trading, Worker Placement

name: 1950: The Forgotten War
description:
1950 is the second game of Conflict Simulation LLC's 2140 series, and the first of their Procedural Combat Series of games, historically accurate, sophisticated, playable within 2 hours and no more than 140 counters.

1950 recreates the Titanic and volatile struggle for the Korean peninsula in the first major land conflict of the post-WW2 world. Over 100 Random variations of combat chits provide a unique experience with each play-through and cut down dramatically on analysis paralysis. Rules are included for multiple interventions, air-power, and UN supply.

Activations go back and forth with a fixed initiative, creating a unique go-like simulation that recreates the ebbs and flows of the front without railroading players into a foregone conclusion.

Players each action phase can choose to move, strategic move, conduct a meeting engagement, amphibious invasions, or prepared attacks. The main scenario covers the mobile part of the war and with the combat chits, no 2 games can be alike.

Players can spend VPs during combat to absorb losses as well as supplies, or deciding to give up ground or rout.

Players win by driving the VP threshold further towards their side by the end of the game or win automatically by reaching their maximums. Win conditions are based on cities, Pusan Perimeter, and performing historic actions like reaching the Yalu river for the UN or Pusan Perimiter for the Communists.

No two games of 1950 will ever be alike and plays just as well solo as it does with an opponent.

Designed by Ray Weiss
Developed by Matt Ward
Box Art by Ivan Caceres
Counter Art by Ray Weiss
Map Art by Ilya Kudriashov

WEIGHT: 6/10
SOLITAIRE: 8/10
PLAYERS: 1-2
categories: Civil War, Korean War, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Roll to Escape
description:
In Roll to Escape, players take on the identities of prisoners in Alcatraz, plotting a daring dash at freedom. Using three dice, players use randomly generated numbers on their sheets showing the time they spend in different parts of the facility, including the yard, storehouse, and mess hall. Due to the rotation of the guards, which rooms are available are random, making it all the harder to assemble the six parts of the escape plan before anybody else does. Privileges are earned through certain choices throughout the game, allowing the ability to sneak into off-limits rooms, use dice multiple times, or score numbers, although these numbers must be shared with other players. The first player to finish their plan wins, although there can be ties.

Roll to Escape is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Prisoner's Dilemma, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Golfing Dead
description:
It's the zombie apocalypse, and you didn't make it. Despite being a zombie, though, you still enjoy a game of golf.

In The Golfing Dead, players try to create a tableau of Stroke cards with the lowest total. During play, they will reveal or replace Stroke cards in their tableau and possibly alter cards in their own or other players' tableau through the use of Action cards.

Players each start with a 3x3 tableau of face down stroke cards and a hand of three action cards. Player turns are played in two phases: a Stroke phase and an Action phase. During the Stroke phase, players will reveal a face down card, or replace one of the cards in their tableau with one from the Stroke deck or Stroke discard pile. During the Action phase, players may play an action, such as Zombie Gophers, Sacrificial Caddy, or Night Vision Goggles, to affect play.

After one of the players reveals his or her last face down Stroke card, the other players have one more turn. Then all cards are revealed and the strokes in each players tableau are totaled. The winner is the player with the lowest total score after two rounds.

—description from the publisher

name: Here, Kitty, Kitty!: Milkshake
description: Here, Kitty, Kitty! Milkshake is a single promotional card for Here, Kitty, Kitty! that allows you to move all of your cats from your neighbors' yards and to move all cats from your porch to your yard.

name: The Falklands War
description:
“The Falklands War is a two player simulation of the conflict fought over the islands of the same name. Play starts on the 1st of May, 1982 and ends by either a diplomatic resolution of the crisis or the defeat of one side by the other. The game is played in a series of game turns in which players alternate moves and combat according to the Sequence of Play ... Victory is determined by victory points awarded for destroying enemy units and capturing military objectives. (nine aircraft) and the Super Etendard (five aircraft). Each sea unit represents a single vessel. Each game turn is equal to two days of real time.”

Components
One bookcase box, 9”x11.5”x2”. Box lid cover has silhouette of troops in foreground (bottom-most quarter), silhouette of ships over a medium mustard-yellow sea background (second quarter from bottom), silhouette of helicopters over a light mustard-yellow sky background One 23.75”x22” hex map. The Falkland Islands are (roughly) in the center of the map, the South Atlantic dominates the map, and the Argentine coast from Comodoro Rivadavia in the north to (approximately) Ushuaia in the south, runs along the Western edge. The map has various charts, tracks, and holding areas along three sides, so the actual play area is closer to 19.5”x16 to 19”.
238 2-sided die-cut counters
One black & white rule book, 8.5”x11”

name: Munchkin Greeting Cards
description:
User Summary

Munchkin greeting cards are periodically released by Steve Jackson Games and have special rules for the various games of the Munchkin series. Here is the current list of cards:

(2008) Merry Munchkin Holiday Card
(2008) Happy 4e Greeting Card
(2009) Munchkin Santa Trap Holiday Card
(2010) Munchkin Monstrous Christmas Card
(2011) Munchkin Birthday Cake Card


Only one card can be used per game. See the board game versions for more details on each card.

Part of the Munchkin series
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Canoe
description:
Selection #8 of The Games Collection by Pin International.

The goal in Canoe is to be the first to form canoes - i.e. patterns of exactly 4 of your pieces in an arc shape that includes two diagonals. Two are needed to win. To count, each canoe must be separated from your other pieces. The other player's pieces can only interfere by blocking positions of play, as there is no capture.

On your turn you may place, remove, or move one piece. But you have only a limited number of them to play.

The novel aspect of the game is that completion of your goal pattern normally requires you to remove your own pieces.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Krull Card Game
description:
Card game based on the movie.
