An adding game, where the players add cards (which represent characters from the movie) to a common pile. If the pile hits exactly 32, you capture all of the good (red) cards. If the pile total exceeds 32, you capture the black (bad) cards. Glaive cards allow removing cards from the pile.

name: Ken il Guerriero: Gioco di Carte Collezionabili
description:
Produced by Alchemia in 1994, the Hokuto No Ken collectible card game has been available only in Italy. The card game contains almost every character found in the original anime series and the cards are illustrated with stills taken from the TV show itself.

It is a one vs one game, each player uses his own deck, just like in Magic The Gathering and most of the others CCGs around. The game is now out of print.

Apart from the base set of 200 cards, the following expansion sets have been released:

Il re del mondo (1994)

Le Cinque Forze (1995)

Le Tecniche (1996)

I Demoni (1997)

La Nuova Era (1998)

Le Nuove Cinque Forze (2000)

Sotto il Segno dell'Orsa (special cards given in various conventions)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Sneaky Snake
description: From the box, "An amusing game in which players compete to make the l-o-n-g-e-s-t snake." Ages 3 and up

name: Speak It Not
description:
Speak It Not is an LDS game in which players attempt to reveal mystery words without using words that are not allowed. It is similar to the games Password and Taboo.

From the publisher: Speak It Not is an exciting, fast-paced card game for Latter-day Saints. Players divide into teams and take turns describing a mystery word without using that word or five other "forbidden" words listed on the drawn card. So if the mystery word is Nephi, the player who drew the card prompts teammates to guess the word without saying Lehi, Brass Plates, Laman, Lemuel, or Brother. Beware: hand gestures, sound effects, abbreviations, or rhyming words are also not allowed! More than 400 cards are included, with mystery words from the Book of Mormon, Bible, Church history, and Church culture. There is no limit on the number of people who can play, which makes Speak It Not the perfect game for family home evenings, parties, or Church activities.

name: Orijinz
description:
From the publisher:

ever wonder why? We're not just happy, we're happy as a clam?

We call something jumbo, instead of just big?

We don't just talk, we chew the fat?

orijinz, the original word and phrase card game. It’s a snap to learn: easy instructions will have you playing in just a few minutes. Game play is simple: one player reads the origin and the others try to guess the word or phrase. You’ll enjoy the guesses as much as the origins themselves.

name: Oitavos
description:
"The Oitavos game rules and play draw their inspiration from the actual history and architecture of the Fort of São Jorge de Oitavos. However they were not intended to replicate them exactly. We have created a version that allows everyone to participate in make believe history, and to learn even more about Cascais. Since this is a game, the main goal always is to have fun. The game celebrates the magnificent heritage of the town of Cascais.

The game is for 2 to 6 players who play the role of pirates trying to land and capture the greatest number of barrels of supplies. For age 8 and up. 40 to 60 minute game time."

name: Meli Cado
description:
MELI CADO is a word card game, in which people will make words but all together playing on the same word to make it evolve.

The goal is to get rid of your cards first.
Each player receives 7 cards at the beginning of a round.
Then the dealer shows up 2 cards representing letters on the center of the table. The first player is designed and to start
can add one of his letter before, after or covering one existing card to make a new correct word

When the first player has played any player can add a card to make the word change
For instance "CR" will become "CRY" then can become "DRY" and then "DIY"

Obviously the new word formed must exist and must be new.
Some cards are different colors, red for example can never be covered, the green can be placed at the ends etc.

Also during your turn You can make a 'Meli' and move the letters of the word to make an anagram.
Along the same lines you can also make a 'Cado' and remove a current letter of the word (which must form a new word) and ... offer it to an opponent.

When a player has no card in his hand the round stops and each p[layer count the remaining cards his has, which is his penalty score.

You also have purple cards which will give a special rule for the round: i.e: reverse(you have to write from the right to the left, insertion: allow players to insert cards in the word...

name: Castilion
description:
The game is easy to play, fast moving with no dice and different each time. 2-4 players can be finished within 50 minutes, It needs thought, strategy and tactics to win.

Castles are placed on a large map marked with squares. Each player has a set of cards containing a Royal, General, Heroes and Heroines, Troops, Items, Formation and Action. The General or Royal marks your positon on the board. When the General and his Troops land on a Castle or square with the opponent's General, a battle is fought. The winner of the battle sends the losers Troops to the Graveyard or can take defence points from the opponent's Castle. Defending with your Troops can be as effective as an attack, it' up to you.

There are cards to collect around the board to aid the campaign which can help win the game. Destroying all the opponent' Castle defences makes you the winner, or you can get them to surrender by annihilating all the Troops!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Eye of Potential Promo Card
description:
Eye of Potential

Enlightened Construct

Cost: 6 Runes

Once per turn, you may banish a card in your hand. If you do, acquire a Mystic or Heavy Infantry without paying its cost and put it in your hand.

Honor: 3
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Der Räuber Hotzenplotz: Die magische Kristallkugel
description: Where did the robber Hotzenplotz hide? The players in this predatory game slip into the roles of Kasperl, Seppl, Grandmother and Sergeant Dimpfelmoser and go on the hunt for the robber Hotzenplotz. In order to find him, players have to remember where the character is in the forest. Only the magical crystal ball of fortune teller Frau Schlotterbeck helps. But when the sun goes down, it's not automatically won by the one who collected the most order cards. In the end, the robber Hotzenplotz must still be found. And that includes a bit of luck.

name: 4 Data Brokers
description:
Five centuries after Francis Bacon said that Scientia est potentia, we know information is power. The more information we have, the more power we get. Wholesale information, Big Data.

The XXI century has witnessed how some new brokers have arisen. Known as the Data Brokers, they are data processors which then distribute among companies, corporations and governments. They know everything about us, even what we imagine.

The game 4 Data Brokers was born among the pages of a novel by Màrius Serra in which Oriol Comas is the main character.. Now, it goes from fiction to reality to let you experience the sense of power that only information can provide you.

During the game, players take cards form the player on their right, save two cards, vote to use special rules or take new scoring goals and finally resolve it trying to make combos or score regarding their goals.

After four rounds, the Data Broker with the most points wins.

name: Black Stories: Tödliche Liebe
description:
How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the riddle by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party. This version of the black stories is about
love that takes someone's life.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Board Royale: The Island – Wild Hunt Expansion Pack
description:
The creatures of K.R.A.K.E.N. Industries escaped from their cages and they are hungry. Fighting side-by-side with other survivors and cooperating with them is your only choice. Hunt or be hunted!

This expansion turns competitive Board Royale gameplay into a cooperative strategic experience. Face against deadly creatures, team up with other survivors and animal companions, strategize your plan, fight for your life, and defeat bosses! If anyone dies, the game is over!

name: Супертанк (Supertank)
description:
Pixel tanks are back! Do you remember how as a child you spent hours on end at an eight-bit console?
One of the most popular video games was "Tanchiki".
This board game will bring you back to the atmosphere of those hot battles.

Each turn you roll the dice and get a set of actions-maneuvers. For example: take a bonus, move your tank or shoot someone else's tank. Your goal is to destroy the opponent's headquarters or knock out his tanks until he runs out of lives.
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Last Penguin
description:
Last Penguin / ラストペンギン is a party game from Japan.

In this Twister-like game using fingers, players take turns drawing a secret gift card, secretly checking what's on it, placing the card anywhere they like on the table, then placing one or more fingers on it and inviting other players to do the same. As more cards are placed on the table, a player might decide to move a finger from one card to another. When only one player has a finger on a card, they claim it and discover what they've won — or sometimes "won".

The cards have values from +7 to -3, or they contain an action, such as discarding an acquired card, releasing a finger, or commanding another player to release a finger. Beauty cards are worth +6 pts, but if you collect a second one, it's worth -3 pts. The top hat is worth +1 pt, but if you place it on your head and keep it there until game's end, you get +5 pts instead.

Players are not allowed to move the draw deck or placed cards, and are meant to use all the fingers of one hand, if possible. A player may also use fingers on their other hand as long as they can still draw on their turn.

The player with the most points wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Real-Time, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Kraqua
description:
An adventurous journey through the depths of the sea begins: in the cooperative family game Kraqua, players must bring the fish safely to the target and at the same time safely get their gems to the hiding place. But danger lurks in the depths of the ocean: the greedy octopus Kraqua has it in for the gems. Will the players manage to escape the thieving tentacles?

The special feature: Due to the foldable game plan changes, the running path becomes gradually visible. In addition, there are three different difficulty levels.

How to play:
Each player in turn places reef tiles on the game board to protect the fish. But the reef tiles have gaps. The players must skilfully move forward so that no fish is placed on a gap. Otherwise Kraqua will steal gems. Can the players hide all the gems in time?

name: Glyphics
description: Each round in Glyphics, the active player chooses a word or phrase from a card, then uses any or all of the forty plastic components to create an image or act out a scene so that another player can guess what you're trying to convey.

name: Cherubim
description:
Translated from the Missio website. This game by Dirk Henn was done by a Christian charitable organization to highlight the plight of AIDS:

The Cherubim supports projects in the fight against AIDS and its consequences in South Africa. On the Philippines they engage themselves against Sextourismus. And in Germany they try to win over, by information and actions, as many supporters as possible for the AIDS projects.

Winner of "Cherubim" is the player who collects the most "points of angel". Gameplay for 3 to 6 players starting Ages 10 and up. 60-90 min. contains 3 boards, 18 maps, 180 project stones, 108 angel stones, 12 bonus panels and a detailed play guide.

name: Turmbau zu Babel
description: The board is made from solid wood and stacked high representing the Tower of Babel. Each player is given a secret color. On your turn you roll the die and move pawns of any color around one of the rings. When rolling the die you choose to use either the top or bottom number of what was rolled and then you give the other number to the next player for them to move a pawn. As pawns are grouped together they get to move up to higher levels of the tower. When you get pawns to the top you score points based on the position of your color.

name: Charge to Glory: The Battle of New Market
description:
"Charge to Glory: The Battle of New Market", is a tactical level wargame simulating the Battle of New Market, May 15, 1864. This battle, which is famous for its charge by the VMI Cadet Corps, prolonged the Civil War by about an additional year as it protected the Confederate bread basket, the Shenandoah Valley in Virginia. The game itself is typical military/wargame fare, but the subject battle is one that is often overlooked.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 6 minutes approximately
Hex: 40 yards
Elevation: 40 feet
Units: Company / Squadron / Section

Contents:
One 22"x34" map
Two countersheets (300 1/2" counters)
One 16 page Rulebook
One 2 page Introductory Game Rulebook
One Union OB Roster sheet
One Confederate OB Roster sheet

name: East Front
description:
East Front is a simulation on a Corps/Army level of the Russo-German war of 1941-1945. The game covers the entire war from the Axis invasion of Russia to the final destruction of the Axis armies four years later. In addition to the campaign game, there are scenarios covering the invasion of Poland, yearly scenarios for Operation Barbarossa, Stalingrad, Kursk and the Destruction of Army Group Center and a smaller, German High Water scenario cover the period from November 1942 - Jan 1943. The game is unique in that it uses hexagonal shaped counters instead of the standard square counters.

800 counters (2 sets of 2 counter sheets)
publishers: Excalibre Games, Inc., The Control Box, Inc.

name: Matching Lions
description:
How to Play:
At the start of the game, deal each player 5 cards. At the start of your turn, draw a card. If at any time you run out of cards, replenish your hand by drawing five more cards from the deck.

On your turn you may place one herd animal face up in front of you, either a zebra or an antelope. When you have 5 of one kind in front of you (5 zebras or 5 antelopes), you win the game.

After you play your herd animal, you may play one action card from your hand. Lions, elephants and giraffes are your action cards.

To play a lion, place it face up in front of you. When you have played a second lion, you now have Matching Lions. Your matching lions can be used to chase away two animals from one other player’s herds. They can chase away 2 zebras, 2 antelopes, or 1 zebra and 1 antelope. The animals all go into the discard pile. You may use your matching lions on the turn you play the 2nd lion, or you may wait and use them on another turn, after playing your action card for your turn. If you gather several pairs of matching lions in front of you, you may use them all on one turn to chase away other players’ herd animals if you choose.

When you play an elephant, everyone, including you, must pick up their lions and put them back in their hand. The elephant then goes to the discard pile.

When you play a giraffe, you may choose any other player and view all the cards in their hand. The giraffe then goes to the discard pile.

Other animals:

The hippopotamus is a defense card. Play the hippopotamus to block a pair of lions from chasing away any of your herd animals. The hippopotamus and the pair of lions all go to the discard pile.

The hyena is automatically played when it is drawn. All herd animals migrate left, meaning your herds go to the player to your left, that person’s herds go to the player to their left, and so on until every herd has migrated. The hyena goes to the discard pile, and you get to draw again and start your turn. (If you choose, you may use the hyena as an action card instead.)

When the last card from the deck is drawn, the discard pile is shuffled and replaced as the deck.

name: Munchkin Journal Pack 3
description: Munchkin Journal Pack 3 is a set of three 48-page pocket journals as well as a new card for use with Munchkin.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Story Time Dice: Scary Tales
description:
From the publisher's website:

Story Time Dice are back! Roll your way into a spooky and supernatural world of storytelling. These seven jumbo polyhedral dice illustrate 72 classic horror concepts and combine to roll over 6 million story combinations. And the best part? They glow in the dark!

Pit twelve intrepid heroes against twelve menacing monsters across eight scary settings. Overcome eight obstacles with the help of twenty tools, but stay wary of the six troublesome twists! Will your heroes survive? The answer is just a roll away!

If you need a little help getting started, every set of Story Time Dice: Scary Tales comes with a handy dice guide with 8 suggested games to play. They range from simple storytelling games for beginners to complex, turn-based party games with lots of rolling. There's even a special crossover game for owners of Story Time Dice and Story Time Dice: Fairy Tale! Are you brave enough to play them all?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Kuflinyomozók
description:
A cooperative children's game using the popular theme of "kuflik" (amorph, more or less bean-shaped creatures in Hungarian kids' books). Each play starts with a story - one of the "kufli"s loses something (there are 16 stories included in the box) and players have to find out which creature of the meadow took it. For this they walk around the meadow, trying to find certain creatures (shown on face-down tiles) that remember something about the animal (like "It didn't have fur... I'm allergic to fur and I wasn't sneezing."). After four main features are known, players find out who the thief is and try to remember where that thief is on the board. If they succeed, they've won!

3 game variants are included in the box:
- from age 3: no memory element - tiles that have been turned up remain face-up
- from age 4: cooperative play
- from age 6: competitive play with players holding certain creatures' cards in hand, sometimes drawing from each other and trying to have the thief in hand in the end.

name: 4 aus Acht
description: Which ingredients belong in a tiramisu? Or which countries have the highest per head cheese consumption? There are eight possible answers to each question, but only four of them are correct. Everyone plays the game as a team. Who has the right knowledge and finds 4 out of eight?

name: La Isla Prohibida: La Expansión Prohibida
description:
Free promo item and special award at the IX Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2014.

Expansion for La Isla Prohibida, with 3 modules:

El Cervatillo de Medina Azahara (Little Deer from Medina Azahara): A new (Cordobesian) treasure, the player must move it together!
Poderes de los Tesoros Mágicos (Powers of the Magic Treasures) - Special thanks to: Jeremy Arcus-Goldberg, Eric Herman, and Marty Kane.
Variantes para la Isla (Variants of the initial board, as included in the German version of the basic game, plus a new "JT@" configuration)
publishers: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba, Jugamos Tod@s

name: Mious 1943
description:
The 30th July 1943, the 2nd SS PZ launched an attack against the Southern Soviet front elements base on the Mious.

This is a mini-game published in VaeVictis #85. It has 50 counters, 2 pages rules and a one page map.

Each turn equals 3 hours.
Each hex equals 1 km.
Units are regiments, battalions and companies.

name: Christmas at White Mountain
description:
Christmas at White Mountain is a small mini-game that shipped to customers who took part in Hollandspiele's 2016 holiday sale. It is also available for download via Wargame Vault for a nominal fee.

It is based on one of the early battles of the Thirty Years War, the Battle of White Mountain. One sheet of rules and one mapsheet is provided; you'll need to provide twelve dice and 50 tokens, coins, or cubes.

Each player has a pool of dice that he rolls each turn, and then he commits dice to a particular unit's box, according to the type and number of dice that can be placed in that box. For example, the Bohemian Right and his opponent's Catholic League Infantry both use sixes, but the latter can gain at most one die per turn. It's not that the Bohemians are more ferocious or better-led (they're not!), but rather that they are fighting (albeit poorly) from a strong defensive position, while mounting an attack on that position takes time and preparation. When a unit is activated, all the stored dice are removed, and losses are inflicted on the enemy depending on the number of dice.

Or not; one of the signal features of this particular design is the ability of cavalry and artillery to screen and discourage enemy attacks. If I have the right number of dice in my cavalry box when you attack an infantry unit under that cavalry's protection, I can expend those dice to cancel your attack. In fact, it's not just that I can do it, but that I'm required to, and so both the attacking unit and the screening unit have their dice cleared out. When I perform that Reaction, it robs me of the ability to make an Attack on my own turn immediately following. This means that there's a definite cat-and-mouse feel, with each side struggling for control of tempo. You don't want to just prevent your enemy from attacking, you also want to get the leverage you need to launch a successful attack yourself. You want to set up your cavalry so as to screen effectively, but if that's all you're doing, you won't have sufficient dice to press your advantage when it appears.

In general, the Imperial/Catholic League position is a more flexible one, representative of the superiority of their commanders and the bifurcated command structure. Not only may they place in two boxes per turn (one per army), but between them there's at least one box that can potentially utilize each die result. The Bohemian Player on the other hand places in only one box per turn, and any ones, twos, or threes are absolutely worthless. Because of his defensive position, he can place more dice for his infantry divisions - if you roll three sixes, you can place three sixes, while the enemy infantry places at most one at a time.

So, each side has its strengths and weaknesses, and while your decisions are driven by your dice, they are still meaningful decisions. The game typically plays out in less than thirty minutes, with the exact time depending on the aggressiveness of the players.

name: Baby Crews
description:
In the Third game in the Baby-series (Baby Cruise) one of the babies fell asleep and dreamt he was a pirate baby ready to embark on a dangerous and adventurous mission...

In the game, the players try to gather the best baby pirate crew. All players start with 2 crew members and recruit additional members in the course of the game. Every round a new fast auction takes place where you have to keep on bidding to stay in the round. The winner selects one of the available crew members and discards the rest. When the deck runs out, the game ends and the players score points based on the set they collected.

This is the fourth game in the Baby-series.

Baby Blues
Baby Clues
Baby Cruise


The game also contains a bonus game that is playable starting from 5 years old. This way the little pirates can also join in if they want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Il Bucato
description:
Il Bucato

It's laundry day! Have you always thought of laundry as just a boring chore? Not anymore! You will face daring challenges armed only with a washing machine and the clothes drying on the line. Beware of the unexpected!

The aim of the game is to collect the most amount of clean clothes, washed and dried but... be careful about rain, pidgeons and mistakes!

On your turn you may do two actions, choosing from:
Wash your dirty clothes
Hang out the laundry
Collect dry clothes

Seems easy? It is but you have to make some decisions about washing mixed clothes (running the risk of color mistake!) and hanging them on the clothesline, facing rain and... pigeons!

Who has the most clean clothes when the bag Is empty wins the game.

Il Bucato it's an easy to play game for kids and families, with some "adults" game mechanics made easier for anyone to play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Sports Illustrated Handicap Golf Game
description: This game provides you with the opportunity of playing 18 of the greatest holes in America using your own personal handicap to reflect how you might actually play these holes. Each game includes 5 playing boards, an exclusively designed Distance and Direction Finder, 8 ply action handicap folders, 4 golf "balls". I believe that the holes are identical to the 18 holes used in a different SI golf game called "Go for the Green" which was produced by Avalon Hill.

name: Pixel Tactics: Game Designer / D. Brad Talton Jr.
description: Pixel Tactics Promo card that is a kickstarter/convention promo
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: D-Day at Saipan
description:
This will be the fight for the island battle made famous in the movie, The Windtalkers. Included would be a campaign scenario, with smaller scenarios for the initial invasion, Death Valley, and the drive north. One mounted map board, two counter sheets (352 counters), 55 cards, full color play aid cards, and a 48-page full color rules booklet.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The March on India, 1944
description:
This is a wargame on the battles of Imphal and Kohima 1944.

Published as a magazine game in JagdPanther #11 which has been rereleased in PDF format by Amarillo Design Bureau.
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., JagdPanther Publications

name: FNAP
description:
Selection #12 of The Games Collection by Pin International.

FNAP is a unique and engaging strategy game. Points are scored for tile placement in three different ways - using the arrows, circles and numbers on the tiles. In 18 rounds, players choose a tile from their set of 24, revealing them simultaneously. The player choosing the lower numbered tile places both tiles. Since numbers score by creating higher line-totals, planning ahead and anticipating your opponent’s moves are essential.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Transposition
description:
Starting with a sequence of numbered cards, arranged in ascending order left-to-right, players take turns to swap two cards but can only swap cards that originally had the lower value on the left.

One player aims to arrange all odd cards in reverse order, the other aims to do the same for all even cards.

At the start of the game, any two cards may be swapped. As the game progresses, fewer moves become available.

name: Korsun 1944
description:
"Korsun 1944" is another wargame of "Great Battles" system (WB-95). It is operation-level wargame presenting clash of arms that started just after new 1944 year came. Game scenario allows 2-5 Players to play all battle or its variants with 5 available scenarios. Battle involved all German mobile reserves on Eastern front which was exhausted and the losses were hardly recovered.

The battle started on January 24th. Red Army’s target was very simple: surround and destroy as many as possible German units in Korsuń pocket. 2 Fronts were to assault concurrently in order to definitely cut off the pocket. It was done after 4 days but it didn’t mean the end of the operation.
On January 28th German forces begin to counterattack which grew in strength every day. Battle of Korsuń pocket was very dynamic, neither side managed to entrench therefore almost every position was advanced and attacked immediately. Every German attack was answered with Soviet counter.
Hitler’s orders denied retreat and shortening the front line so Germans attack constantly, supported by forces in the pocket vitally interested in the success of relief offensive. Russians who had all the aces at the beginning run out of all the reserves and had to switch into defensive positions. Only when reinforcements of 2nd Armored Army arrived the offensive was resumed.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: L.A.M.A.: Drama
description:
L.A.M.A.: Drama is a print-and-play mini-expansion for L.L.A.M.A..

To setup, place the L.A.M.A. DRAMA tile in the middle of the table. When a player plays a L.A.M.A. card, they place one of their lowest chips onto the L.A.M.A. DRAMA tile (If the player does not have any chips, nothing happens).

When a player places the fifth chip onto the tile, the L.A.M.A. DRAMA begins: The next player in turn still in the game must take all the chips from the L.A.M.A. DRAMA tile – unless this player also plays a L.A.M.A. card, possibly placing one more chip onto the tile. In this case, the next player in turn must take all the chips from the L.A.M.A. DRAMA tile – unless this player also plays a L.A.M.A. card, and so on.

If the round ends without any player taking the chips, the chips remain on the L.A.M.A. DRAMA tile for the next round. If the new round starts with five or more chips already on the tile, the L.A.M.A. DRAMA only restarts when a player plays yet another L.A.M.A. card, possibly placing one more chip onto the tile.

name: Taco Ninja Adventure
description:
Taco Ninja Adventure is a card game for 2-6 players created by Turn Sideways Games.

Players are unique Taco Ninjas with special abilities and play on 2 teams. Players land attacks on the opposing team's Taco Ninjas by rolling combinations on 5 dice. Players can power up their attacks by learning new, more powerful attacks in the Dojo. Players may also play tricks in the form of item cards acquired while training in the Dojo. If a Taco Ninja's life points go to 0, they go to the afterlife. In the afterlife Taco Ninjas can heal their friends on the battlefield, and if they are very lucky, they can come back from the afterlife.

One team wins when all opposing Taco Ninja's are sent to the afterlife.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: UNO: BTS
description:
Basically the same as UNO, except with cards that feature the K-pop band BTS.

Cards that are different from traditional UNO:

The Dancing Wild card -- the next player in current order must perform a BTS dance routine in from of everyone OR draw three cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Story Colors
description:
Roll the dice and make up a story! The player who guesses the hidden colors in it will be the winner.

To be the first player to move completely around the Scoring board. You will move forward by winning victory points telling the best stories, when you are narrator, and guessing the correct color sequence during other´s players stories.

With personalize dice, screens, decision boards, scoring board and cards with the beginning of stories, Story Colors is a funny party boardgame for all family.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: 26.2: The Marathon Dice Game
description:
Since 1896, masochists around the world have raced each other in an event that killed its first participant: the Marathon!

In 26.2: The Marathon Dice Game, players simultaneously choose how many dice to roll and roll them for points (with each point representing 1/10th of a mile). The more dice they roll, the more points they may score, but it also increases the chances of busting out and scoring no points that turn. However, rehydrating via water tokens helps mitigate this risk. The first player to reach 262 points wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Trek HeroClix: Away Team
description: From the publisher: Characters from the hit movie, Star Trek, beam down to your HeroClix game! Completely compatible with the core HeroClix Rules system, The Star Trek HeroClix: Tactics Away Team 7-Pack includes pre-painted figures of Kirk, Spock, McCoy, Uhura, Scotty, Sulu, and Chekov, each incorporating a dual-dial design to provide 14 different playable HeroClix dials.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Rapido Bloc
description:
Rapido Bloc is a game from "Le Club des 100 Watts". The goal of the game is to build 3-dimensional structures faster than the other players. Each structure can contain up to three kinds of blocks: white cubes, black cubes, and black quarter-circles.

Each structure is shown on four identical cards in three views: top, front, and right. Players all take the same card and simultaneously try to build the structure on their own boards. The first player to complete a structure gets two points, unless they make a mistake in which case everyone else gets one point.

There are four sets of challenges of increasing difficulty. Each set has twelve different challenges.

The quarter-circle blocks can be tricky to put in place and in harder challenges you need to hide some blocks to get the right view!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Deduction, Maze, Puzzle, Real-time
publishers: Les Entreprises Aubé et Khacho inc.

name: Duelo & CIA.
description:
This is a Party Game were the teams have to be the first ones in completing their “cake” with the 6 colored pieces:

Green – Drawing
Yellow – Forbidden words
Orange – Charades
Purple – Trivia
Pink – Silent words
Light Blue – Words that start with the letter…


Excellent for big reunions!
categories: Deduction, Dice, Educational, Math, Music, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Team-Based Game

name: Magnate: Make Your Mark
description:
Magnate is not for the feint of brain. You need to summon your inner Elon Musk or Warren Buffet to start businesses, flip real-estate, or perform shrewd maneuvers on the stock market to grow cash quickly and mercilessly.

Can you be the first to turn $100,000 into $1,000,000?

WARNING: You may need a calculator to play this game.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Events, Income, Investment, Loans, Open Drafting, Stock Holding

name: DICE Golf
description: Welcome to the DICE Golf complete game. DICE Golf is more like two games in one and even comes complete with rules and charts for creating all of your own golfers and golf courses. DICE Golf can be played shot by shot using over 200 golfers from the 2008 season. You can also use the Quick Play results from each golfer card to play holes quickly and accurately. The game uses 2 10 sided dice.

name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game II – Louis Tully's Plazm Phenomenon
description:
Play as Louis Tully (ear muffs and all) in this campaign containing 4 scenarios, 4 new map tiles, 9 new minis, and more tokens! This campaign culminates in a battle against the dreaded Giga-Plazm, which has taken the Manhattan Museum of Art from its foundation.

Tully gets better at being a Ghostbuster when he can watch others do well at Ghostbusting. He’s also very good at making the most out of his deposits. If you’re tired of running, you can hop onto one of the new vehicle tokens included in this pack.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Espada Negra: Juego de Mesa – Edición Gunear
description:
Expansion for Black Sword the table game that can also be used separately.
This edition incorporates a new element, the berserkers.

Expansión para Espada Negra el juego de mesa que se puede utilizar también por separado.
Esta edición incorpora un nuevo elemento, los berserkers.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: AfterShock: A Tavern Game
description:
AfterShock is a unique and diverse collection of landscape cards that represent Grasslands, Forests, Mountains, and Water.
Cards can be used as a 2 to 6 player or solitaire card game and as a random map generator or tavern game to augment your tabletop role-playing campaign.

Fuddledich ( 2 to 6 players):
Named after the retired cartographer and owner of The AfterShock Tavern, Fuddledich AfterShock. Fuddledich is a 2 to 6 player strategic trick-taking card game that uses terrain features as suits. With special trump cards that can change the active suit at any time, any card can win! Can you best your friends to reach 100 points first?

Cartographer (Solitaire):
A single player puzzle game where you create and remove clusters of matching terrain to create the perfect map.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Print & Play, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement, Trick-taking

name: エルタイルズ (L-tiles)
description:
User summary
エルタイルズ (L-tiles) is a re-working of the earlier game L-Tiles. This new edition plays up to 4 players and introduces team tiles to the game.

The production now includes tiles racks, larger tiles (40mm instead of 30mm), and a switch in artwork to arranging gems on marble floors.

Otherwise, gameplay is the same, with players placing tiles to build up areas of one kind before scoring. Players must try to increase sections with no gaps, but do not want the areas to grow too large.

name: Black Stories: 5 nach 12 Edition
description:
A Black Stories edition with new stories from the "father" of black stories Holger Bösch.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Wine Management
description:
Wine Management is a print-and-play, roll-and-write game in which players run competing vineyards. Using the values of two out of three rolled dice, players select an action, and a multiplier each round. The actions are:


Plant vines
Harvest vines to produce grapes
Process grapes to make wines
Complete wine orders
Hire workers to unlock one-time bonuses
Deliver tours of your vineyard to gain popularity



Players must balance all the possible actions to maximize their points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Murder We Wrote
description:
Get ready for mystery, intrigue, and a bit of morbid fun! Murder We Wrote is a true crime podcast themed adult party game for 3 to 8+ players. As the host of the podcast, reveal the name of the victim for that round. Other players will assume the role of someone close to the victim, playing cards and giving an interview on who they think murdered the victim and how. At the end of the round, the host will decide what the true ending is. With hundreds of different potential witnesses, victims, murders, and deaths, there are infinite stories to tell!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Player Judge, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Party & Co: Iniciales
description: This is a Party game from the same creators of Party & Co, initially sold as a standalone game, but later added to the party & co family, in order to push the sales on the wings of the sucessful brand. The players have to say all the words they can remember of a determined subject, in order to fill their card from A to Z (like a bingo). But in some turns, players can also play to steal the letters from their rivals.
publishers: Diset S. A., Jumbo, Nordic Games GmbH

name: The Butterfly Garden: Event Cards
description:
Randomly choose the Event cards based on player count and add them to the deck per the instructions. They take effect when they are drawn from the top of the draw deck.

These promotional cards will not be available in the retail version of the first edition of the game. It is possible that they will be available during future Kickstarter campaigns for Dr. Finn's Games and, in rare cases, at some special promotional events.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Farmageddon: Livestocked and Loaded
description:
The Farmageddon: Livestocked and Loaded expansion introduces animals (one per player) to add ranching to the farming side of your operations. Whereas Crops are relatively flimsy and easy to destroy, Animals are permanent. Each Animal will provide many points to your farming operation, assuming you're willing to pay!

The goal for this expansion is to create a balance between tactical Crop management and strategic Animals. It also broadens the strategic choices of the game and adds depth without too much complexity. Players will need to make a choice with their Action cards to lean into animals, crops, or both, to squeak out ahead. Along with the animals will come new Action cards, special animal abilities, and a little bidding to top it off.

In addition to animals, Livestocked and Loaded will introduce Weather Events. These will shake things up so that no game is the same.

The best part is that you won't need to relearn the game. Livestocked and Loaded is built upon the simple framework of the original Farmageddon game. On each turn you're going to Draw Crop cards, Farm and Play Action Cards, then Draw Action cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Humor
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: cHTeMeLe
description:
cHTeMeLe the first HTML5 certified boardgame, the nearly collaborative and nearly educational game about HTML language

The aim of this new board game is fairly easy : create THE HTML page with the cards you have to hand... the game is played from 2 to 5 players, each player endorses a web browser (Firefox, Safari, Chrome, Opera, Explorer). Lay out your tag cards, and respect the web standards and rules and accumulate points. Play the "events" cards to step in each others browser's way (crash, bug, etc.) or help you in the race for building the web page.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2015
description:
Magic 2015 was released on July 18, 2014. Magic 2015 made the second major change to the card frame in Magic's history (the first being in Eighth Edition). Changes include a slight font change (Starting with Magic 2015, an in-house font known as Beleren will be used rather than the Matrix Bold font), the addition of a holofoil stamp in the bottom center of all rare and mythic rare cards, a slightly narrower black border, and a redesign of the collector's info at the bottom of each card. The new border will make it easier for machines to read the cards, helping to prevent mispackaging. Advertising for the set featured the planeswalker Garruk Wildspeaker, with a tagline of "Hunt Bigger Game."

Magic 2015 includes the mechanic "Convoke", which originally appeared in Ravnica: City of Guilds. This mechanic allows a player to use their creatures to help cast spells with Convoke. It also includes 15 cards designed by notable non-employee Magic fans, such as Richard Garriott, George Fan, and Notch, some of which also appear in Duels of the Planeswalkers 2015.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: MacGowan & Lombardy's The Great War
description:
MacGowan & Lombardy's The Great War by award-winning game designer Dana Lombardy is a simple, fast-playing stand-alone (non-collectible) 2-player card game built around important weapon systems, commanders, and other historical aspects of this unprecedented industrial-scale war. Two 54-card decks feature colorized historical images and illustrations by game industry Hall of Fame graphic artist Rodger B. MacGowan. Icons, insignias, and game text on each card eliminate the need for complex rules. (Note to collectors: Nearly all of Rodger's exceptional WW1 illustrations appear on the cards.)

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Score-and-Reset Game, Single Loser Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: SticX Games: 4 Pints
description:
In 4 Pints, you will visit a typical English pub for a nice pint of beer. Each turn, one of you will go to the bar, where four pints await you.
To buy them, you must first scratch your pockets looking for a few pounds but you must be careful to control your drunkenness level and avoid elbowing and slipping. The walk to the bar can be quite an adventure!

A game lasts as many rounds as the number of players. Starting with the first player, each round, players play consecutive turns until the deck of Beer cards is exhausted and all players have played the same number of turns. Your turn has 2 steps:


Reveal Purchase cards: you must reveal Purchase cards one by one from the deck and place them at the center of the table. You must draw at least 1 card and you can draw as many as you want until you collect enough money to buy a pint you like from the bar, or until you decide to pass. Each time you draw a card, add its value to your total if it is a Money card, and apply its effect if it is an Event card.
Buy 1 pint or pass: you can only buy 1 Beer per turn and you must pay its full price with the Money cards accumulated during your turn at the center of the table and/or your game area. When you buy a pint, place the card upright (unspilled) in your game area, in full view of the other players. If you don't want to buy anything or don't want to risk it with the Purchase cards, you may pass and end your turn.


—description from the publisher

name: Conquest of the Pacific
description:
Conquest of the Pacific is just that, a naval contest between unit rich, production poor Japan and unit poor, production rich America. The game does not include Asia. It is strictly a series of naval and island hopping maneuvering and battles fought in the Pacific. We always wanted to play with the boats more in A&A, but we also wanted to win. The boats and planes are so expensive that no one can really afford to wage much sea war after the first turn or two in A&A. Enter Conquest of the Pacific. Both sides face daunting tasks. Japan has a huge fleet, but has a lot of islands it needs to conquer to win, and ends up being so far away from its supply lines that it usually can't defend everything while still being able to challenge the growing American fleet. America starts the war far from a state of readiness, but its huge economic advantage helps make up for it. The front is close to the US, so supply lines are short, but the Japanese fleet is usually much larger if it can consolidate. This makes for some interesting cat and mouse maneuvering and epic sea battles.

Planes take a large role in Conquest of the Pacific as they are able to:

1. land and take off from islands without it costing a movement point because the island and the sea zone(s) surrounding/adjacent to the island are considered the same zone.

2. project their defensive power one sea zone away from their island base zone during the opponent's combat phase.

3. defensively scramble to attack anything entering their zones of projected power during the opponent's turn on the combat movement and non-combat movement phases.

4. escort other units to protect them from defensive scramblers.

Battleships and Destroyers may bombard every round during an invasion, or once per turn without a land invasion. Battleships and Carriers take two hits to kill and can be repaired at several ports on the map. And, be on the lookout for the Japanese SuperBattleship, the Yamato. It attacks, defends, and bombards at a 5 and takes 3 hits to kill, ouch! It really is fun to get to play with all the expensive pieces!
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: The Victory of Arminius: Teutoburg Forest, IX AD
description:
The Victory of Arminius is a tactical game for two players that depicts one of the most famous battles of the Roman Empire, the action that stopped the empire’s expansion into Germany in A.D. 9, when three Roman Legions were destroyed in fighting with the German tribes. The players take sides, one commanding the Germans, the other the Romans.

Each hex is about fifty meters across, and game turns represent about forty-five minutes of fighting. Counters in the game represent “units,” the combat formations of both sides, and markers used to denote various game functions or conditions. Unlike many other simulations, The Victory of Arminius has no “Combat Results Table.” Rather, the battle function is adjudicated entirely with dice.

Contains:

Mounted, full-color Board
Rules
~140 counters
Aid Card

name: AstroNavis Merchant Advanced
description:
AstroNavis Merchant Advanced is a solitaire PDF boardgame that you print yourself, which covers the operation of a tramp star-freighter. It includes the original AstroNavis Merchant as the basic rules; the advanced rules define the ship and planets in more detail and add planetary events.

Re-implements:

AstroNavis Merchant

name: Bread Rondo
description:
"In a world where magic rules everything, you are the best baker in town.

But you've accidentally read a forbidden grimoire and are trapped in a dream world.

With the help of the friends in your heart, you can fight the curse of the grimoire!"

Bread Rondo is a bold and detailed redesign of Blade Rondo, by the designer Pawn, in collaboration with MAGI, the creators of the "Magical Bakery" series.

Bread Rondo is even harder than the original - you play with 5 cards instead of 7. With a lower life limit of 10, you're in for one hell of a fight!

However, as a baker, even in the midst of battle, you can't afford to neglect your baking and it's up to you to make sure your bread is delicious and to unleash its hidden powers. Proper temperature control and mindful baking are the keys to success, but don't let your enthusiasm for baking great bread knock you over before you've even opened the oven!

—description from the publisher

name: Die Tour
description:
One of the most interesting bike race games with a "Tour de France" theme made ever, but unfortunately also one of the rarest, because only 300 boxes were produced by the authors in 1981. And that´s a pity, because all the ingredient's of a great game are there.

Die Tour is a card driven game and all players have 15 cards (1 card = 1 turn) at the start, which they have to work with, until only 2 are left and the hand is filled up again to 15 cards. On these cards are four numbers (= number of fields, the drivers are allowed to move), one for each of the drivers, every team has at the beginning and sometimes special moves for special situations. Each number has to be attached to one of your drivers and the decision how to divide them, is yours.

Rules for group splitting, mountain races, single driver time races and slipstreaming are included in the basic game, but there exists an (even more rare !) advanced rules set, which the authors played with their gaming buddies. Besides various modifications to the basic version, this advanced rules set includes additional rules for group slowing, card exchanges, team time races and more.

Die Tour allows single races (about 60 minutes playing time and there are flat, mountain and time race stages) or an entire campaign game, which is a series of connected stages. Since there are various roads to victory (champion, best mountain driver, highest points and best team), the campaign game is of course the most interesting way, to play Die Tour, because it reduces the effects of luck. But the kings way, to play Die Tour, is to race a campaign game over many gaming nights and to give little prices to the winners in the different categories every evening and bigger prices for the final winners.

An extremely hard to find game, but if you see it somewhere (best chance probably : On flee markets in Berlin-Germany, because the authors are from there), grab it immediately, because you will not regret it !
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Maneuver
description:
MANEUVER is a game of skill and strategy for two players. Each player has nine tanks and nine guns to deploy on the board. Each player maneuvers his tanks with the objective of being the first player to get one or more tanks across the board to the opposing side. The guns are deployed along the side of the board and are used to fire at and destroy enemy tanks. Because the guns are deployed secretly to conceal their ranges of fire, playes must maneuver their tanks with skill, seeking to discover the gun placements of their opponent and achieve a breakthrough.

10 to Adult

name: Global Chess
description:
Global Chess is pure chess with 64 squares, traditional pieces and traditional moves. The game of chess was developed when armies fought on open fields in distinct formations and the entire battle could be seen from a single vantage point. As warefare and technology have advanced, battles are fought over the limb of the horizon with no edges to the battlefield. This is the transformational premise of Global Chess. There is no backline and no sideline on the Global Chess board. There is nowhere to hide.

Think of a 64 square chessboard wrapped around a globe. Now you can play chess around a sphere with no edges to the game. The problem is that it's difficult to see all the squares at the same time and understand your options. The Global Chess game separates the globe at the equator and flattens them into hemispheres that are geared together. By turning the game you rotate the hemispheres against each other to examine the crossing point of a piece in it's possible trajectories across the hemisphere or through the poles. Turning the board does not alter the relationship of the game pieces to each other.

The easy to understand rules of chess as they pertain to a global playing surface are explained in text and graphic form. The possible strategy is yet to be written! The board is annotated to record game play.

name: Kolonial Afrika
description: In this African adventure game, 2-5 players can participate by taking the part of "governor". The necessary goods (such as skins and diamonds) must be transported with the help of the natives, from the wild into base camp, and from there by ship to Europe. Whoever is able to first complete a secret mission that each player is given wins.

name: Sashay
description:
An abstract 2 player game in which each player is trying to move a "spy" piece, which he has previously marked with a hidden peg, to the opposite end of the board. The game may also be won by capturing the opponent's "spy".

"Dancer" pieces including the "Spy" move like chess rooks, but capture is by surrounding a piece.

Each player has in addition two "Masters of Masquerade" pieces that have some unique moves: diagonal zig-zag, single space slide, and positional exchange with adjacent friend-or-foe dancers.

The game starts with a screen placed between the players' sides to allow them to place their pieces unseen.

There is some deduction and ruse involved in deciding what piece to try to capture, and also potential for quick endings when one cannot defend every column from advance - but with experience the game focuses on using the "Masters" to break into formations, and also systematically eliminating the dancers.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Castles of Steel
description:
Available as a free download from its Yahoo Group. (http://games.groups.yahoo.com/group/dubious-designs-2.)

Card driven game of the naval campaign between England and Germany in the North Sea in WWI. Cards allow actions to be taken, such as Convoys, Sorties, and Torpedo Attacks. Cards include the fall of Russia and a possible German take-over of the Russian Fleet, and several British offensives that were never undertaken.

Battle is resolved with counters and dice with each counter representing two or more battleships. Battle cards allow for surprise results: Fog and Mist, Night Attacks, Crossing the T.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: The Book Game for Kids
description:
The Book Game for Kids is a game based on The Book and The Book for Children paraphrasing the Bible.

The game itself starts by players picking what level of questions that they want to answer; Easy, Medium, or Hard.

The players have pawns that they move around the board from a Start point to a Finish line. First player to cross the Finish line is the winner. Along the way there are ladders and ropes, chutes, action arrows, and different square spaces that all have the players take certain actions.

The rules are able to be modified for younger players. Older children will find the hard level questions on the Question cards to be a challenge though. A good knowledge of the Bible, or Bible stories is a large plus for this game. Scripture references are given on the cards too.

There are also Action cards that will give the player either rewards to help them along or setbacks that will hinder the journey along the board.

The books the game is based around (The Book and The Book for Children) aren't translated version of the Bible, but are easier to read the paraphrasing of the translations to help make the passages and stories easier to understand.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Impartation Idea, Inc., Tyndale House Publishers, Inc.

name: Choo-choo
description:
This is a 2 player game. Each player has a frame in which 12 disks are placed (3 each of 4 different colors). The disks can slide across an S-shaped track. There are two junctions where some disks can be slid of the main track in order to change the sequence.

There are also chips available in the same colors as the disks (green, red, blue yellow). Chips are drawn until the 3rd chip of the same color is drawn. Players then have to change the sequence of the disks (by sliding across the tracks and using the junctions) in order to match the sequence of the drawn chips.

First one to form the correct order wins the chips. Play continues until all chips are drawn. The player with the most chips wins the game.
publishers: Alga, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Malstrom
description:
Translated and edited from the website of the publisher:

THE GAME
Malstrom is a exciting and artful game for two to four persons. The playing time is about half an hour. At the beginning of the game 49 cards are layed out with their face down. Therewith, the hidden cards take the function of a chessfield. The goal of the game is to collect most of the couples. It is not enough, just to remember the position of each card. It is equally important to cleverly plan ahaed your own moves.

THE CONCEPT
Malstrom is published in several editions. For each edition, a, as far as possible, well thumbed book is been used. The single pages of the book are furnished with motives. Out of these pages fragments are generated, which in pairs result in collages. The motives of the respective edition are inspired by the content, the theme, or the author of the book.

Nerved river-silicics with pores, breaches and twinkling inclusions are used as tokens in the game.

The selection of these stones is determined by respective theme and in a way that an ensemble forms. In the basic version, each Malstrom is stored within a cartridge (ca. 25 cm x 35 cm x 4 cm) of 13mm thick three-corrugated cardboard. It contains 49 cards (34 cards with motives, 15 without), four river-silicics, the rules, a copy of the impressums of the used book, the number of the respective game and a signature.

A single cards measures: ca. 6,5 x 6,5 cm
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: Alcatraz Escape
description: A dice game for 2 players. You have to transport your prisoners from one side to the other. The first one with all his prisoners at the other side is the winner. You have to throw with a black and a white dice. The numbers on the stones represent the escape gate. For instance when you throw 3 with the white stone you put one of your prisoners in the third white gate, with the black stone in the black gate. With six you may choose which gate.

name: HoverTank: Death and Destruction in the fight for Oil in 2022
description:
"With the discoveries of huge Oil and Gas reserves under the Caspian Sea region, the multitude of affected nations realized that this is their golden opportunity for hard currency with and the power it brings. Diplomacy fails as a viable option in 2022..."

Tube game. 4 maps (back to back), 7 six-sided dice, 36 plastic miniature units (hovertanks, tanks, helicopters, etc.).

Simple wargame with 9 types of terrain and 8 types of units.

Object of the game is to destroy opponents airbase, then take the major city on the map.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Panacea
description:
From the back of the box:

The fabled elixir of Panacea. Named after the Greek goddess of healing, its properties were to prolong life indefinitely. Alchemists have sought for this cure-all remedy for ages. Finally the time has come for you and your fellow alchemists to put the final pieces together. But only one can be first to call the Gathering of Alchemists and announce the solution to the greatest riddle of all mankind. Eternal fame and glory will be your reward. It is time for the discovery of Panacea!

Panacea is a self-released game designed by Jeph Stahl and it was distributed at Great Lakes Games IV for free to attendees. There are 50 numbered copies of the game.

name: Magicians
description:
Card game for 2-4+. Players are Rival Stage Magicians at the turn of the Century trying to one-up each other. Whomever accumulates 100 Prestige Points first wins. The Player's Alter Egos build up their acts with increasingly difficult Tricks and supplement them with Lovely Assistants, helpers, props, and other aids. Players can also Sabotage each other by cards that discard or steal their resources. The rules are free and can be found at:
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Magicians.html

name: Trees and Flowers
description:
Flex your brainpower to collect matching sets of trees and flowers in the fast-paced fun of Trees and Flowers. Learn the names of 96 fascinating flowers and trees plus the geographic regions where they grow.

This card game consists of 12 sets of 4 cards each of similar categories of trees and flowers. The object of each game is to secure as many sets as possible. Skill in playing is acquired by remembering.

Ages 6 and up.

name: Shenanigans
description:
This here is the story of the most famous leprechaun of all, Roy G. McBiv. McBiv lives in the rocky hills of Vibgyor and is infatuated with beautiful rainbows. In fact, he dreams of owning his own one day, and is in constant search for all the rainbow colors.

McBiv is growing old though... he no longer has that snap to his stature or that whistle in his stride. His cane is wobbly and his vest is tattered. This being so, he has enlisted the help of young leprechauns, like yourself, to collect these colors and complete his dream.

You can make use of McBiv's magical items along your quest, like his trusty hat or his durable buckets, but don't be irresponsible when it comes to finding those rare colors. In the end, only the first lucky leprechaun to collect these colors will win McBiv’s favor and a portion of his gold!

Shenanigans is a leprechaun themed card game where players try to collect sets of colored cards. Each card is assigned a specific color and action. Using a rainbow color range, the number of cards available for each color diminishes as you go from red to violet (red being the most common and violet being the rarest). Players must play the action of one card on their turn, balancing the need to keep rare colored cards with the need to use the abilities those cards possess when played. The rarer a color is, the more powerful its action will typically be. When a player collects a set of cards, they call “Shenanigans” and score a point. The first player to call “Shenanigans” three times wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Trick-taking

name: Kasjba
description:
A fascinating and interesting labyrinth game with changing game-board for 2-4 players.
The objective of the game is to be the first to gain four princess-cards, through handy manoeuvring.
The modular board consists of four pieces, that can be moved around a quarter turn, changing the maze, to reach the princesses or to block your opponents.

name: Scrabble: The National Parks Edition
description:
The Classic Scrabble Crossword Game is heading to the great outdoors! Includes wood tiles and racks, a unique game board featuring beautiful parks images and an exclusive bonus dictionary.

Created in response to the new Ken Burns documentary The National Parks: America's Best Idea.

name: Magdar: the Second Age
description:
Magdar: the Second Age is an official print-and-play upgrade intended to be glued over specified tiles and counters in the base game. In addition to rule variants, the expansion includes:


Replacement 3-boulder tiles, designed to make the game last longer.
New special feature tiles: Stone of Kings and Well of Souls
Counters for a Dwarven Dodgeball variant
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Twelve Days of Christmas
description:
Twelve Days of Christmas is a press-your-luck game based on the classic English Christmas carol.

A player's turn consists of three phases: a card-drawing phase, a set-playing phase, and a gift-giving phase. First you draw one or more cards, and possibly pass them out to other players. Then you must lay down one set of cards. Finally, you give one card as a gift to the player on your right, ending your turn. When 12 “Days of Christmas” cards are showing, the round is over and you all total your scores.

This is an expanded version of the game Stocking Stuffers. http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/15075
publishers: Dogtown Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Chicken Coop Dominoes
description:
Game uses double nine dominoes and has an electronic Chicken Coop hub. Players start with 7, 9, or 11 dominoes depending on the number playing. The first player who has a double nine plays it in the center hub, and the next six dominoes fill in the spaces around the hub to form the chicken legs (if a player cannot match a nine, they draw and play or pass). After that, players match domino ends until a double is played.

When a double is played, the player presses the hub and normal play is suspended until three chicken "toes" are played. The next three dominoes must match the double and are played under the double, one angled to the left, one in the center and one angled to the right (to form the chicken foot). Players who cannot match can draw and play the match, or they must pass. Play continues until the three toes are completed and normal play resumes either on the chicken toes or any of the chicken legs.

Play ends when a player plays their last domino or the game is blocked (because no plays can be made and the "chicken yard" (spare dominoes) is exhausted. The player who gets rid of their dominoes scores 0. The other players count their pips on their remaining dominoes to get their score. A new round then begins. After 10 rounds, player with the lowest score wins.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Petrol
description:
Magnetic game in which the purpose is to obtain a capital superior to that of the opponents by extracting the most amount of oil.

Players are represented by 4 Disney characters who try to get rich in this Monopoly style game with a cute oil rig miniature which moves due to a magnet secretly located under the board whenever the players choose to dig for oil in the right spot.

Contents: Board with a trigger tied to 3 magnets located underneath, 4 Disney characters, banknotes, 8 building concession cards, 36 right to drill cards, oil deposits plastic pawns in 2 colors, magnetic oil rig miniature, 2 dice, rules.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing

name: ATS TT: Omaha West
description:
ATS TT: Omaha West, is the Table Top(TT) edition recreating the Omaha landings. ATS Table Top games feature smaller counters and map hexes than normal ATS games. Personnel are on 1/2" counters, and vehicles are on 5/8" counters.

Below is the official blurb about the game...

Bam! Below is your first peek at ATS OMAHA EAST ... the massive second part of the series that will result in a record-breaking LARGEST TACTICAL-LEVEL BOARD WARGAME EVER PUBLISHED. The hexes are ATS TT-sized, and you'll need to own ATS TT OMAHA WEST to play OMAHA EAST.

Lots of smaller scenarios are the order of the day ... and of course, a follow on to "Black Day for the 116" ... the ultimate monster, depicting the entire landing across almost TWELVE FEET of map area! You owe it to yourself ... once in this life ... to set it all up and experience something that has never been done ... never been attempted ... in tabletop gaming before.

And before you quibble, whimper, and have your morale plummet into your boots ... four cheap plastic sawhorses here and two 4' × 8' sheets cut down to two 3' × 6' sheets ... easily transported at that size ... and you have the perfect stadium for giant gaming.

name: West Riding Revisited: Hull & Barnsley
description:
Game description from the publisher:

West Riding Revisited: Hull & Barnsley brings an interesting new train line to West Riding Revisited.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das schnelle Kartenspiel – Stadtausbau Kathedrale
description:
Promocard for the Spiel 2012

This promo card allows me for building a road to take 1 wood and/or 1 clay out of the market. Thereafter, the market is replenished.

name: Financier
description:
In Financier (aka A Stock Market Game) players invest in six companies. These companies start with random values (1-6) and on each turn the active player must change the value of one of them by rolling two dice. They must choose one die which represents the company to change, the other die being the amount of the change, and whether the total of the two dice is odd or even determines whether the value goes up or down.

The player can then purchase up to three shares of one of the two companies rolled, using money printed on the gamesheet; no change is given and when it is used up no more purchases can be made.

The object is to have the greatest total share value and capital when the game ends, which happens when a roll can't be used (each company's value can only be changed a fixed number of times).

name: Portraits
description:
Portraits is a solitaire patience style game which was originally called "Peddler" (released in 1992) and redeveloped in 2003. It was released in an Italian gaming magazine and also online via Glastyn Games website. It uses a standard 52-card deck and is playable in 20 minutes.

The goal in Portraits is to collect all the face cards into your personal vault using other, similar suited cards. You can collect a face card if you are able to discard cards of value greater value than a face card and also of the same suit. There are also several ways to manipulate the cards at your disposal in order to better your position and avoid getting locked out or otherwise losing the game.

name: Rogue Trooper: We Gotta Traitor to Find
description:
Nine extra cards with rules for the Rogue Trooper board game, published in White Dwarf, issue 90 to advertise the game.

The cards were printed on the back cover (both sides) so they could be cut out and used straight away.

New Cards with Rules:

Dream Weavers
Bland and Brass
Major Magnam
Swamp Mutants
Colonel Casanova
Filth Column
Jellyfish Mines
Pocket Scanner
G-Rations
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mob Tower Promo Pack
description:
Mob Tower Promo Pack was a Kickstarter cross promotion between Tower and Mob Town. The 10-card promo pack has some Tower-inspired cards in Mob Town, and some Mob Town-inspired cards in Tower.

Specifically, for Tower, two black market cards representing the law, where you can team up with undercover cops in the black market to momentarily have a conscience and thwart crooks!

And then, in Mob Town, an alternate set of cash cards, a camel law card, and a destination card featuring the wonderfully obscure city that Tower takes place in!

name: Pixel Tactics: Video Guy / Diego Melo
description:
Pixel Tactics promo card from Watch It Played! Season 4 Indiegogo campaign

Card text: Whenever any player plays an Order, set that card aside and discard andy existing set-aside card. As an action, you may discard 2 cards from your hand to duplicate that Order and discard it to its owner's discard pile.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: FAKIR
description:
Aim of the game: to be the last to play a stick.

Game of strategy: should you play the sticks vertically or horizontally? Should you use your own sticks or those of your opponent? Taking the risk that they will be used up; should you play them?
Game of observation: which sticks are holding up which others ? You need a good sense of three dimensions.

name: T.E.G. Junior
description:
A version of the classic TEG, adapted for kids.

T.E.G. Jr. is a children's adaptation of traditional T.E.G.. It has a redesigned map with fewer countries, larger pieces and simpler objectives.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Set Collection

name: Dreadball Xtreme: Xpansion
description:
Xtreme’s lack of rules and referees means an infinite amount of variety for the fans, not just in terms of the makeup of the teams, and the scattering of obstacles on the pitch, but the very shape of the playing area itself and even how many teams take part. Xtreme multi-team games make DreadBall Ultimate look like a Zee tea party. Play them out on some of the most infamous layouts ever devised, or come up with your own. Just remember, this isn’t a game, it’s war on a pitch.

This expansion includes:

24 Page Full Colour Xpansion Rulebook, which includes rules for:

Customizable Pitches
Dangerous New Traps
Multi-player Games
Medi-bots

A complete multi-part pitch, made of thick card tiles.

Xpansion Counters

Four Giant Players

1 Plastic Krastavor Giant miniature
1 Plastic Chovar Giant miniature
1 Plastic Sann-Gar Giant miniature
1 Plastic Iron Ancestor Giant miniatures
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Exlibrium
description:
Exlibrium is a magical seal, which helps secret order of mages-bookworms protect the barrier between narrative and objective realities.
The game challenges players in medieval fantasy setting - mages of seven colors will transform into barbarians, bards and assassins. Up to 5 players can fight in a battle, but there is only 1 champion.

Card-drafting game with original twist - all cards are double-sided, and a player must decide, which side he want to use this time. The game took place over three rounds - each round players will simultaneously choose one of cards from the hand to play and then pass remaining cards to the next player. Each card is double-sided and each side provides a player one of 7 characters to add to his tableau. At the end of each round the player activate all of the characters - but the character power is granted only if player has the majority. At the end of the game all characters are scored and the player with most vp earned from majority of characters and their powers through the game wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bug Hunting
description:
All the time tiny bugs were seen whenever we played outdoors in childhood. Sometimes by homework, and sometimes by curiosity, we used to catch bugs with friends. But these days, especially in downtown, we can barely see the bugs. Furthermore, some kinds of bug are very rare. Now let’s meet the bugs evanescent and out of sight from us.
The players need to find various kinds of bug as the bug-hunters. We are not trying to collect bugs stuffed and exhibited. Rather, we study and preserve them for the better ecosystem. The conference will be held that everyone pay attention soon. Collect various bugs and be the best bug-hunter!

[Object]
You have to collect various bugs as a bug-hunter. You can collect the bug when you gather all same kind of it in your hand. But it would be a little hard because other bug-hunters also compete for the collection. If you collect the most bugs until the conference(end of game), you will be called the bug expert.

[Game Play]
On your turn, you do 1 action among the 3 actions - Pick, Call and Collect.
Each player holds the cards of bugs and shows their backs to others during play. The backs notices the color of the bug, so players can deduce the cards needed.
By Pick action, you pick only 1 card from specific player.
By Call cation, you call a kind and a color of the bug to specific player. If you success, you get the card and do Call action again.(Until you fail.)
When all cards of same kind of bug are gathered on your hand, you may collect it and get scores.
At the end of your turn, you have to swap a card in your hand with a card in Forest - the array of 3 cards in hidden on the middle of table.(The illustrations of backs are trees.)

[Scoring]
When 7 kinds of bug are collected during play, the game ends immediately. (There are 10 kinds of bug in the game.)
The period of bug hunting has been over, and the anticipated conference is held now. Score 1 point per a card of the collected bugs. (e.g. The bug with 5 colors(cards) scores 5 points.) Sum whole points including the bug collected by items. And the player who has no item card at the end of the game gets -2 points. (It is basic attitude of the bug-hunter to take care of items!)
The player who scores the most points wins a victory.
